story:
" EY! EY! YOU! Yeah, YOU! EY...I don't mean no harm, I don't mean no harm, I'm a GRCC student, and my car broke down up the road, and ma sick baby's in there, man! C'mon, EY - All I need to get on the bus back to Grand Haven to see my mom in the hospital on her deathbed, is $5,000. Can you help a brotha out? TARP TARP FLOOGE! I USED TO BE FAMOUS GIMME YER MONEY! I ONCE WORKED WITH DANNY ELFMAN'S BROTHER!!! "

-- Sarah Jean Anderson, six years (months?) from now, wearin' a Dishwalla t-shirt on her head, and feet adorned with CROCS...outside Degage' Ministries, telling people about how she used to be famous, & panhandling...because NOBODY DONATED TO HER INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN back in May of 2013.

You guys...You hold in your hands, the future of my future. In other words, my future's future is in the hands of you guys's hands. Won't you give yourselves a hand, for giving me a hand? ("SHE'S ALWAYS ON!" whisper YOU, to yourself!)

Hey guys, it's me, Sarah Jean Anderson! I'm a Grand Rapids, MI artist/performer, and I'm about to turn 29. The last year of my 20's! Somebody get me a xanax smoothie. And take me to Applebees for a "fudgesplosion volcano chocolate death pie" or whatever.

I've been self-employed for 5 years, and it's only been in recent (SINGLE) times that it has become increasingly more difficult to keep up with the amount of work I'm receiving, whether hosting, custom artwork orders, collaborations, out-of-state opportunities, or any other number of artistic/comedic performance situations. I have no manager, no agent, no business phone, no website. I have no rates, no contracts, no employees, no help. I have no car, no computer, and a phone from Family Dollar, out of service for three days now and counting. In my adult life, (18, when I moved out of my dad Bill Anderson's house) I have never made a major purchase, or racked up any substantial debt, meaning I have NO credit with which to rely on. Not bad credit, mind you, just plain NO credit. It's been hard to start my business officially, to commit to any long term plans or projects, as I feel like the money I need is just kinda sorta out of reach.


SO...you look attractive today, by the way...can I have $5,000?

For nearly a decade, I've been entertaining audiences in person and on YouTube -- without ever owning a computer, a reliable phone or phone plan, or even a desk at which to sit and write. In 2011, in the midst of a divorce, I discovered that in the years before, I had been living JUST above the poverty line .Upon discovering just how poor I was, I looked over my calendar and realized that I had worked constantly and desperately, nonstop, without taking a break, almost exclusively at a super-low, bargain-basement-type rate. I've spent a long time consulting with my artist friends, and am learning how to price services, how to produce things faster, basically, how to be a businessbitch, something that never came very easy to me. I have to change stuff before I burn out completely and go back to my first love, pancake-related waitressing & can-collectin'.

I hate asking for money, or telling people about how much money I make or don't make, and it's taken me 1,000 different plans, drafts and approaches to this fundraising campaign. Tonight it occured to me, I should just be honest as I can, cuz that's never failed me.

Awhile ago I read a book I had "published" in 1993, called The Star Of The Show. It was a really compelling and complex tale about a girl who "wanted a chance to sing", and at the end, she gets to go to an audition. SUPER interesting stuff. But the best part is, the About The Author. Looking at the answers I had given as a 9-year-old, I realized that 20 years later, I haven't changed. Under "What I Want To Be When I Grow Up", 9-year-old Sarah Jean said "Artist". I cried, but not from being sad, and not from being happy. Just, because it feels good to be reminded sometimes that you're doing what you're supposed to be doing, what you were meant to do.


When I was 18, I graduated from Forest Hills Northern with a C- in Advanced Placement Art, and 2 credits in Fine Arts at KCTC. While moving into a new apartment for the billionth time this year, I found my sketchbook from Fine Arts 101, and saw, AGAIN, proof I'm being true to past-Sarah Jean. On the page where I was told to illustrate my future after graduating, I saw cartoons and line drawings of me in long dresses singing on a microphone, standing at an easel painting, phrases like HAVE ART PUT UP IN A COFFEESHOP, BE IN A BAND, etc. And just like with The Star Of The Show, I've done, or still continue to do, the things I've always listed I would do, when forced to by authority figures.

(NOTE: Coming soon, video of a dramatic reading of The Star Of The Show by 9-year-old Sarah Jean Anderson, 1993)

 


I want to continue, but I need a little help. Like, I'm trying to hop the fence to the boys camp on the other side of the lake, with my slutty girlfriends. Can you take your muscular hands, cup my rump, and give me the little shove I need to tumble over the fence at last, and SCORE?


(note: in this case, "scoring" is used to mean "buying a computer that isn't held together by paper clips and electrical tape")

I love Grand Rapids, and refuse to believe that the only way I can "make it", is moving to Chicago, LA or Portland. Grand Rapids is where I began to live my dream as an artist, having been guided by the mentors I've been lucky enough to have in my life. I love my friends and family more than anything. Now that I'm taking time off to fund-raise, I am actually getting to hang out with them again! Imagine that!


I'm grateful for everything you guys have done to help me, and please know that I will always be. Your love is so important, you guys! I'll never not show you how much I don't not appreciate it!

Think of this as a birthday present! What'd you get me last year? :) Yeah, that's what I thought.

Or think of it as a GIANT garage sale. Everything must go! That is to say, for the first time, I want something better for myself. Don't you guys want that for me, too? Hmmmmm? HMMMMM?


My IndieGoGo campaign will go for 2 weeks, and will rely almost exclusively on FaceBook for promotion. The part that sucks, is that the very reason for this fundraiser, (to upgrade my crappy work conditions) is what prevents me from further promoting. It's just not possible. If I've gotten this far without this stuff, imagine what would happen if I could suddenly afford to fix all these little problems!


Just like I tell my dad every time I get dumped and ask for a loan to move out of my boyfriends house (NOT THIS TIME!), I promise you guys... I'LL NEVER, EVER ASK YOU AGAIN. :)

Can't afford a donation right now? There are tons of other ways to help me achieve my dream of growing up before the age of 30.

- SHARING IS CARING! Share my event on FaceBook, Twitter, whatever! Write it on a note and throw it at some rich guys, or scrawl it on a bathroom wall while you're crapping at the H&R Block! Tell your gossipy aunt Eunice, and she'll tell everyone at her bridge club! Get the word out about the weird comedian/host/dancer/singer/artist/writer who you know! Write it on the door in blood when as you flee from a crimescene! (and DON'T FORGET: there is an "H" in "SARAH")

- COME TO MY BIRTHDAY SHOW at Diversions, Wednesday, May 29th at 1030Pm, and check out my ALL NEW opening number featuring GR Drag Divas Evelyn Forrest and Jasinya Sanchez! Facebook Powerdiva Productions for more details!

- DONATE your used or broken photo frames to me! Contact sjeanander@gmail.com

 

So much love,

Sarah Jean Anderson

story:
Hello fans and friends of Just Say Uncle!

 

Please help me successfully publish another volume of Just Say Uncle strips. As a kid, I was captivated by the Peanuts anthologies I got when my Mom took me to the bookmobile on Saturday mornings. Who would have thought that someday I'd be publishing my own book of strips? 

As an musician, artist & writer, I earn my living in a variety of ways, including; CD sales, music reviews, video production, comic strips, and the generous support of patrons at www.patreon.com/justsayuncle . Projects like this book release literally keep the rent paid and the lights on. The price of the pre-order isn't going to some huge New York publishing house, most it's going to cover the cost of printing, shipping & handling, and to pay me a few bucks for hundreds of hours of work.

Thanks for dropping by, and thanks for supporting Just Say Uncle!

Dan Pavelich

story:
Our Story

My name is Linda Zimmermann, and I'm the author of over 20 books, many of which are self-published because I am fiercely independent, and believe that writers, artists, and other creators deserve full credit and compensation for their work. Some of my most popular books are in the "Ghost Investigator" 10-volume series which chronicle my personal investigations of haunted sites throughout the northeast. A couple of years ago, writer Don Smith, who wrote for Heske Horror and Bluewater Comics, approached me about turning one of my cases into a comic book. One thing led to another and the inaugural issue of "Ghost Investigator" the comic book, was published in 2011 under our new independent Spirited Comics label.

 

Sticking with the undead and pursuing my love of zombies, my latest book, "HVZA: Hudson Valley Zombie Apocalypse" follows the story of a medical student who fights to find a cure to the zombie infection, while fighting for her life in the streets. There are many minor characters and epsiodes that are briefly mentioned in the book that I wanted to explore in more depth, so Don and I decided to do that in an HVZA graphic novel. There will be several stories in the book, each of which will be written and illustrated by a different set of writers and artists. We are lucky to be joined by Nick Mockoviak as art director, and everyone is onboard and eager to see this project published. Our goal is to have it in print in time to introduce at NY Comic Con in October.   

 

If you know what it's like to need for someone to just give you a chance to show what you can do, or if you simply love zombies, we would appreciate your help with this project! And if you always dreamed of being a zombie, here's your chance to be drawn into one of the stories! 


The Impact

Our main goal is to entertain people while highlighting the work of a lot of good artists and writers who deserve a chance to showcase their talents. What would make us the happiest? That the HVZA graphic novel is a huge hit, and all of the artists and writers get big, fat contracts to work on other projects, and then we have to hire a couple dozen new people to work on the second volume. Everybody with a dream deserves a break, and hopefully this project will open a lot of doors for them.  


What We Need & What You Get

Reward Structure

Â·         $5- Your name will be mentioned in the Supporters List on the website.

Â·         $25- Your name will be mentioned in the Supporters List on the website and you get an autographed copy of the HVZA graphic novel.

Â·         $50- Your name will be mentioned on the Supporters List in the graphic novel, and you get an autographed copy of the first edition.

Â·         $200- All of the previous benefits, plus you will be drawn as one of the zombies in the graphic novel. You must provide at least one good photo of yourself. Limited to first 20 donations.

Â·         $500 personal ghost hunt with Ghost Investigator Linda Zimmermann in the NY tristate area for one night, your house or other location of your choosing. Site permissions are the responsibility of the purchaser. If evidence is obtained, the investigation will be written up in the next volume of the Ghost Investigator series. Limited to first 2 donations. 

 

Â·         Estimated cost for set-up of cover and text files                      $200

Â·         Estimated cost per unit (including shipping), $2.50,                  $1,000

 multiplied by 25 copies for each of the 8 artists and 8 writers.          

Â·     300 copies for first run                                                                   $750

Â·         Postcards, fliers, promotional material, etc.                                  $300

Â·         Exhibitor table at NY Comic Con                                                 $950

Â·         Travel expenses for Comic Con                                                    $300

 

*Any funding received over the requested amount will be distributed equally amongst the artists and writers after all expenses are paid. 

 

 

 

 


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
Hi, Donald McKinney here; You may know me as the Blue Beetle!

Who is the Blue Beetle? The Blue Beetle is Ted Kord, a genius-level inventor much like BATMAN, with the humor of SPIDERMAN, and twice the looks! ;)

 

Thus far, working through Rumblespoon Productions, we have successfully produced several short films as well as a few web series and our very FIRST full length feature film!

 

We couldn't do it without YOU! All of your donations go straight into the project. We use all funding for Sound, camera, promotions and lighting. 

 

What we need: Enough funds to lock-down some great locations. I've been eyeing some offices for filming as well as a comic shop and a few other places including a prison!

 

We'll be giving away some SUPER great THANK YOU GIFTS. We're working on some original prints, New Trading Cards, digital comics, DVD COPIES and MORE!

If you are interested, but low on funds, don't worry, we have a dollar donation for just such a purpose!!!  Or you could always just spread the word about us, share our links, share our site, WWW.RUMBLESPOON.COM, tell the world TED KORD IS BACK!

 

Any donation you give(even a dollar) will help get us one step further to financing this SUPER HEROIC WEB SERIES..Let's Make Some Magic Happen!!!

story:
Funny or Die University of Michigan, University of Michigan's ComCo, and University of Michigan's Midnight Book Club are so excited to present the 1st Annual University of Michigan Improv Festival!

This year on campus the comedy community has grown and found ways to unite all fans of comedy more ways than ever before. To help celebrate, we are uniting some of the largest troupes on campus along with teams from colleges all around the country and professional teams like Upright Citizens Brigade!

We already have been able to raise $7,500, but now we need your help to truly make this event a reality. We need another $1,500. This money helps to house and feed the teams visiting from other colleges, advertising the event and to make the festival free for everyone to attend. 

Please consider donating to launch the 1st Annual University of Michigan Improv Festival, because there's nothing better than laughing with friends!

Below is the information for how the day would look:

WHEN? SATURDAY, MARCH 26TH

WHERE? RACKHAM AUDITORIUM

WHAT...

6:00PM:
Funny or Die University of Michigan
George Wasington University's receSs
University of Iowa's Paperback Rhino
Wet Bus
Alterboyz

9:00PM:
Midnight Book Club
ComCo
Upright Citizens Brigade Touring Company

HOW MUCH? FREE!
REALLY!? YES!

To guarantee a seat, RSVP at... https://1stannualuniversityofmichiganimprovfestival.splashthat.com/

ALSO SPONSORED BY...
U-M Central Student Government
University Activities Center
Arts at Michigan

story:
Summary

It's seven months since the initial introduction of lockdown and my subsequent release from The National. At the time I could say that, since 2012, every weekend without fail I have produced a full-page, satirical comic strip based around Scottish and UK politics. Now, having pledged to continue self-publishing the cartoons without newspaper backing, I can still say the same.

In April, I raised funds for what I thought might be a three-month 'quiet' period and produced 'The Lockdown Chronicles', a 20-page tabloid-size newspaper containing all the cartoons from that spring and summer period. It was a unique record of a unique time. But as we approach the end of this most hideous of years, it's clear that Covid-19 still has some way to go. 

On the plus side, polls are now regularly showing a majority for Scottish independence and this, of course, has simply made me all the more determined to continue cartooning. So once again, I'm asking you to support the creation of the weekly strip.

In return, I will publish a festive stocking filler in the form of 'The Worst Of 2020', a 20-page tabloid collection of cartoons and other Moodie material that will take stock of the events and personalities of the year from hell, in a way that hopefully won't just make you want to weep.

The Deal

What I'm asking for is a basic wage for three months and enough to cover the newspaper's production, along with sturdy packaging and postage costs. In return, you will receive a physical copy of 'The Worst Of 2020' and have access to all of the cartoons online at gregmoodie.com. All contributors, unless they choose anonymity, will be listed in the paper.

Additional perks include signed, hand-painted prints of a new Billy Connolly design, each one unique, and limited edition digital prints of the 'P45 Santa' image. These are ideal Christmas presents and will only be produced to order.

For The Collector

2020 has been a year that most of us would probably sooner forget, but it's important that we document it and still try to find humour as we go. 'The Worst Of 2020', by virtue of its sheer oddness, will be a very special and very collectible record of the year.

Other Help

Please share this campaign widely. Satire and art are both essential for the world's mental health, especially in these trying times. Thank you for your contribution.

story:
Short Summary

 

Someone suggested I make an Indiegogo, take the money and not deliver. So that's exactly what this is.

However, I'm a good sport. It was suggested that if I reach a certain goal to donate it everything to Toys For Tots. So, fuck it! I'll just do that if all 10 of the OVER-RIDE tiers are filled up.

Will this all go into my wallet?
Will this go make some childs X-mas dream come true? (I hate X-mas and kids btw.)
or Will I just take the money and run?
Your money is in my hands!

story:
Hi, this is Vincent Ferrante, creator/writer of Monarch Comics' Witch Hunter comic book. You don't have to nod politely. I can't see you, but I appreciate it. We're in the middle of crowd-funding campaigns for our small, fun line of titles which started with Evil Monkey Man, moved on to Witch Hunter, is at The Last now, and will culminate with the first issue campaigns on Horror Island. Let me tell you how we came to ask you for money for The Last, which won't be the last time we do this, because we have issue 2 campaigns planned. Now you know.

 

Monarch Comics exhibits every year from the front of the publishing section at the New York Comic Con. It's gotten us a lot of fans, attracted some great artists, forged some lasting business relationships, and, I'm most grateful to say, become the start of some amazing friendships. One such friendship is with the creator and writer of The Last, Joe Kitchell. Joe, a lifelong comic book fan raised on the classic comic book storytelling of the 70s and 80s, approached the Monarch Comics booth with some fiction pieces that he wanted to be considered for publication in our anthology magazine, Monarch Comics Chronicles, a little over two years ago. I published one of them, a dystopian-future science fiction story called "Memorial." We kept in touch. Joe would ask me occasionally if I had read any of the other stories he had submitted and asked that I consider publishing them in future issues of Chronicles. One day, I read a short story about Vikings he had written called The Last. As much as I loved it as a short story, it immediately struck me that it could be so much more. 

 

I called Joe and asked him to consider turning The Last into an ongoing comic book series about this small group of Vikings known as The Fenris Wolves, about their adventures in a time when the Vikings were passing into shadow, when the mysterious unknowns of the ancient world were becoming all-too-many knowns, and the magical qualities inherent in ancient mysteries were becoming the mundane, quantifiable facts of an ever-modernizing world. It was a story about coming of age for the youngest Viking in the group, Taldar, making the most of one's prime for the middle Viking, Hogrun, and dealing with middle, and soon, old age, for the oldest Viking, Falgar. But it was even more than that. It was Vikings solving what could be called the first "X-Files," a group of adventurers who knows that their kind is passing from the world and has a hunger to learn about the other whispered mysteries out there before they are all gone, too. This is what The Last has become, and we're so excited to introduce fans to it.

 

We've set up a lot of donation tiers with lots of fun stuff to say thank you for your support. We're very grateful to supporters of previous campaigns and hope you see more of what you love in The Last. If you do, please tell your friends, family, and people on the street to support The Last, and share the campaign on social media. Thanks for reading.

story:
OH YEAH! OH YEAH!

 

Hi, I'm ETHAN VAN SCIVER, and welcome to the SECOND CHANCE CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY CHROMIUM COMIC BOOK CAMPAIGN ft. Gigantic new JAE LEE CYBERFROG REKT PLANET POSTER!

 

This should be good!  I've got a few remainder chromium CyberFrog Bloodhoney editions to offer, as well as the ashcan set, Cyberfrog: 1998: The Diary of Heather Swain and Amphibionix!  

 

Limited numbers, limited time!

 

Also, I'm offering a huge 24 inch by 36 inch poster of master comic book pro JAE LEE's CYBERFROG REKT PLANET artwork, for the FIRST TIME EVER!  You HAVE to see this!

 

There's more!  I'm also offering a super limited BLUE LINE VARIANT of the latest VAMPIRELLA #1 ft. CYBERFROG cover!

 

Oh, and one more thing: UNCUT CHROMIUM COVER SHEETS!  A large chromium poster sheet featuring THREE wraparound CYBERFROG covers and ONE Salamandroid cover!

 

Lots of fun stuff!  Don't miss your final chance to get a CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY Chromium, the VAMPIRELLA #1 BLUE LINE VARIANT!  And definitely don't miss the JAE LEE poster!!

story:
Short Summary:

  • My name is Adam Yeater I have been making and selling my own brand of insane independent comix for over 20 years.
  • I wanna print my next Blood Desert/One Last Day -Crossover comic book in a higher grade  format. It will be printed as trade paperback instead of my normal magazine style. The initial cost is a little more to print so that is why I need your help.
  • If you contribute I promise you will get your books in a timely fashion. Any contribution to printing this book will be greatly rewarded in the after life and by me with a cool sweet comic.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Each book will come with a mini comic, sticker and other random goodies.
  • Every penny from this campaign will be used to print and mail these books to you. I have been shipping art and comic books for over 15 years now. I have a solid system of mail distribution that is pretty impeccable. 

The Impact

This book is gonna knock your socks off!  

This magazine sized fatty is 88-pages of pure underground comic book action. It is filled with extreme splatter gore sci-fi horror. This book ties together my long running independent comic  book series called One Last Day into my current series Blood Desert. This double sized book is like nothing you have ever seen. It is the epic tale of our heroes creation and his creators downfall.

Risks & Challenges

There is no risk of failure. You will receive your book in a  very timely fashion as soon as the campaign closes. The artwork is done and scanned in. I just need to send it to the print and then to mail the books to you. I have a reliable printer ready to dot he job.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to spread the word about my campaign and this comic book be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you to anyone who supports me and my art. I love you all!

story:
My name is Ahmed Alameen, and I am from Iraq. I am also the uncle of the kid who inspired me to create this comic and to help spread awareness about Autism through a unique story. I have published novels under the pen name A. H. Amin and became a national best seller with my fiction thriller, Psychs. As a comic artist I worked on motion comics before I finally decided to create something that represented a neurodiverse character in an Epic story.

My story features a superhero with autism. We decided to create a campaign that help us not to just tell an engaging story, but also to spread awareness and to help people understand more about Autism, which is our main motive to push this campaign. 

     By funding this campaign you are creating a great contribution to the autistic community and to the people surrounding them. You will also going to revive the oldest story ever found in human history; The Epics of Gilgamesh, and make others become more interested in history and ancient stories that withstood the test of time.

     To help this project reach readers we need at first 6000 AUD (that is Australian dollars). The funds will be spent respectively as follow:

1- 2050$ for the artist who sketches and inks the comic. each page costs 50$ and there are 41 pages left.

2- 140$ will go for the editing to make sure the comic is error free.

3- 2500$ for printing 1000 copies for distributions and donations. 

4- 640$ for online marketing (We will be seeking more funds in that regard)

5- 650 $ for the logistics.

6- 300$+174$+40$ for Indiegogo, transaction fee, and transfer fee, respectively. 

This will be a total of 6509$, we might have to cover some expenses from our side, but it will worth it.

We will present a couple of tempting perks ranging from copies that are either digital, hard copies, or signed copies, to bigger perks such as a poster, a very cool T-shirt, and the cherry on top, a chance to have a character named after you... that's right, your name in the sequel to the oldest story found in human history. 

Of course if we weren't able to reach our original goal, we will either use what we have to create the comic and publish it online and on print-on-demand online stores. And if we couldn't have enough to create the comic, then the funds will go into supporting Autism.

If you want to help make a difference in the world, you can contribute in anyway, even your time can be enough to create a big difference; a simple click and share can have a butterfly effect that can lead to bringing a unique story in the hands of an autistic person and make them believe that they are unique too.

story:
8 Month Ago I was Homeless

Now I'm selling my first comic book! Edge of The Galaxy is a story I've been been thinking about for a few years. Then in October 2020, I lost my job in the middle of the Pandemic and I had nowhere to go. So I left the brutal winter in Oregon and arrived in Los Angeles, California in December.Many of you know my story, and some do not. I was discovered in April on Hollywood Blvd; and 160K Instagram followers later, here I am, with the opportunity of a life time to bring you Edge Of The Galaxy. I hope you enjoy it.

The Dust-N-Bones Edition & 1st Edition Runs

  • There are two versions of the 1st Edition!  The Dust-N-Bones Edition & a standard first edition
  • The Standard first edition will only have a 5,000 Print run! and is available for pre-order at $9.99
  • The Dust-N-Bones Edition will be personally signed by me, and will come with a signed print to go along with it.
  • My goal is to make Manhattan Comics the birthplace of beautiful stories. Not just mine, but a home to the diamonds in the rough. The Comic artists that were passed by at the larger houses. I'm working with a lot of talented people who are donating there time to help me build and run a great comic book publishing house.

The Faceless face of every Comic Book Artist that didn't Make It

Many people have asked me why I never show my face, I get it, As someone who is doing a good thing by supporting a homeless artist, not showing my face took away from the humanity of my situation, and not knowing who you were helping. There were practical reasons for that when I lived on the street. Now that I'm off the streets, I still choose to remain anonymous. It's for no other reason that, while I was homeless, I came across so many other talented artist, some with mental disorders or substance abuse issues or just non-functioning creatives who, like me were one paycheck away from losing it all. Those people are still homeless... They are Dust-N-Bones. You could be Dust-N-Bones. Being homeless gave me a new perspective on life, I count my blessings each and every day that I ended up were I am now. Many undeserving people were not; I draw for them.

Where Am I Now? What can go wrong?

 

  • Edge of The Galaxy Issue Number 1 is complete, and I'm working on issue number 2. I'm in the process of securing the intellectual properties of my work.  My character names are being trade marked and my story is being copy written. 
  • So what can go wrong and delay printing and delivery?  I hired lawyers to secure my intellectual property, and my manager loaned me the money to get the best lawyers in the Los Angeles.  I feel confident that things will go smoothly; however, in the last 90 years, a lot of comic books have come and gone, and there is always a chance that in their discovery, there may be overlap with another character that might put me at legal risk.
  • If that;s the case, there may be name I have to change or a page I may have to redraw. I just made it out of homelessness with the help of Devon Rodriguez, my manager and all of you.... so theres no way I could compete with any of these ginormous comic companies should anything come up.  So that would/could delay things. I did the best I could in researching, now it';s time the legal professionals handle it!

story:
Overview

Welcome to the WAR of 2055! 

In this campaign, you’ll find ISSUE ONE in my first self-published series. I have been working on this massive story and adapting it over 10 years in multiple formats and decided to make this story a reality for everyone who loves expansive stories. Imagine an Orwellian tale akin to that of Blade Runner meets Star Wars. This story is meant to be action-packed, fun, and gritty. It explores an alternative reality where history is deleted and nearly forgotten. 

I have teamed up with artist TIRSO LLANETA, who is penciling and inking the pages. A variant cover and print is in work by award-winning artist TONY WASHINGTON. 

You have multiple choices to choose from when you are making your purchase, from one issue to variant covers and the print. If you like the work you see, you may opt for the “ALL-IN” package for everything including any future perks.

This comic is intended for mature readers. I can’t wait to hear from you.

Short Summary

In 2055, the NEW UNITED EMPIRE (NUE) reigns supreme as an elite authoritarian technocracy in the new world. Eight cities are known as UTOPIAS and maintain fifty-foot walls to protect the "UTOPIANS" from the War of Generations where the NUE wages war against the “REVOLUTIONARY GLADIATORS” using soldiers, assassins, and bounty hunters. Beyond the Utopias is No Man’s Land, where the free people are known as the “FORGOTTEN” are rounded up. If you run, you will find yourself in the war between deadly assassins and conflicted bounty hunters vying for your contract. 

The story picks up as the last free city for the Forgotten falls. As the NUE lay siege to the city, two scavengers, JORDAN and TONY, find a lost treasure forgotten by the NUE. Soon after, they are hunted by the deadly General and his squad of soldiers.

STRETCH GOAL 1: At $25,000.00: I will have 10 pages added to the book for a total of 32 pages.

STRETCH GOAL 2: At $75,000.00: All backer issues will be signed by me.

STRETCH GOAL 3: At $100,000.00: Issue 1 will be a limited release to all backers, while the whole series will be upgraded to a graphic novel and shipped to all backers for FREE.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $500 to pay for the initial printing of the book and the print. The book will be a 105lb text gloss cover with a 70lb text gloss interior, Print will be gloss. I am shipping worldwide for all comic/ story lovers.  Art is in work with an expected completion date of June 1, 2020 and a delivery date of September 1, 2020, due to the current world situation. If the timeline changes, I will update you as soon as I know.

Currently, there are 6 perks.

Perk #1 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic Standard Cover.

Perk #2 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1B comic, Tony Washington Variant cover.

Perk #3 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic and one (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.

Perk #4 - Two (2) physical copies of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A and B comic (Standard Cover and Tony Washington Variant) and one (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.

Perk #5 - Retail Package – 10 physical copies of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic and four (4) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.

Perk #6 - ALL IN PACKAGE – One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic (Standard Cover),  One (1)  physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1B comic (Tony Washington Variant cover), and One (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print. Plus any future perks. Further, you will have your name forever immortalized within the covers of the book within the "Thank You" page.

The campaign is for a B&W book with a total page count of 28. 

IMAGES

 

The Impact

I want to tell good stories. I want people to enjoy my stories and good stories in general. Everyone has a story to tell and I don’t think there should be any “gatekeeper” keeping anyone from telling their story. Therefore, the overall impact is to step around the gatekeeping and bring out new talent and new stories.

Risks & Challenges

The future's not written in stone, I can guarantee I will deal with any challenges I may face with this project. You must always be flexible and I have learned to be flexible in my life. This comic is going to print as soon as the art and lettering is completed.

After the campaign ends, there will be NO REFUNDS issued. This is to ensure that items printed will not exceed demand, so to help properly ensure the best product available. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute, but there are many ways that you can still help get the word out about the project. One way is to simply share or spread the word via Youtube, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms. Find me on Twitter @scoxwriter and Patron at https://www.patreon.com/scottcox.

Check out my website www.scoxstudios.com and the official website for the series www.chroniclesofwar.com (coming soon).
story_txt: OverviewWelcome to the WAR of 2055! In this campaign, you’ll find ISSUE ONE in my first self-published series. I have been working on this massive story and adapting it over 10 years in multiple formats and decided to make this story a reality for everyone who loves expansive stories. Imagine an Orwellian tale akin to that of Blade Runner meets Star Wars. This story is meant to be action-packed, fun, and gritty. It explores an alternative reality where history is deleted and nearly forgotten. I have teamed up with artist TIRSO LLANETA, who is penciling and inking the pages. A variant cover and print is in work by award-winning artist TONY WASHINGTON. You have multiple choices to choose from when you are making your purchase, from one issue to variant covers and the print. If you like the work you see, you may opt for the “ALL-IN” package for everything including any future perks.This comic is intended for mature readers. I can’t wait to hear from you.Short SummaryIn 2055, the NEW UNITED EMPIRE (NUE) reigns supreme as an elite authoritarian technocracy in the new world. Eight cities are known as UTOPIAS and maintain fifty-foot walls to protect the "UTOPIANS" from the War of Generations where the NUE wages war against the “REVOLUTIONARY GLADIATORS” using soldiers, assassins, and bounty hunters. Beyond the Utopias is No Man’s Land, where the free people are known as the “FORGOTTEN” are rounded up. If you run, you will find yourself in the war between deadly assassins and conflicted bounty hunters vying for your contract. The story picks up as the last free city for the Forgotten falls. As the NUE lay siege to the city, two scavengers, JORDAN and TONY, find a lost treasure forgotten by the NUE. Soon after, they are hunted by the deadly General and his squad of soldiers.STRETCH GOAL 1: At $25,000.00: I will have 10 pages added to the book for a total of 32 pages.STRETCH GOAL 2: At $75,000.00: All backer issues will be signed by me.STRETCH GOAL 3: At $100,000.00: Issue 1 will be a limited release to all backers, while the whole series will be upgraded to a graphic novel and shipped to all backers for FREE.What We Need & What You GetI'm asking for $500 to pay for the initial printing of the book and the print. The book will be a 105lb text gloss cover with a 70lb text gloss interior, Print will be gloss. I am shipping worldwide for all comic/ story lovers.  Art is in work with an expected completion date of June 1, 2020 and a delivery date of September 1, 2020, due to the current world situation. If the timeline changes, I will update you as soon as I know.Currently, there are 6 perks.Perk #1 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic Standard Cover.Perk #2 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1B comic, Tony Washington Variant cover.Perk #3 - One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic and one (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.Perk #4 - Two (2) physical copies of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A and B comic (Standard Cover and Tony Washington Variant) and one (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.Perk #5 - Retail Package – 10 physical copies of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic and four (4) Tony Washington 11x18 Print.Perk #6 - ALL IN PACKAGE – One (1) physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1A comic (Standard Cover),  One (1)  physical copy of CHRONICLES OF WAR #1B comic (Tony Washington Variant cover), and One (1) Tony Washington 11x18 Print. Plus any future perks. Therefore, the overall impact is to step around the gatekeeping and bring out new talent and new stories.Risks & ChallengesThe future's not written in stone, I can guarantee I will deal with any challenges I may face with this project. story:
Short Summary

Mystery House Comics is a small-press publisher in Boise, Idaho.  Our mission is to bring the tools of self-publishing to potential comics creators and encourage writers and artists to take the first steps in making comics.  6x6 is a great opportunity to give feedback and advice on scripting and layout, to show creators step-by-step how to print and self-publish, and to practice salesmanship and table etiquette at conventions.  MHC also cares about expanding and fostering our local comics community.  The creative teams in each volume have never worked together before and learn to work with someone new while creating a new connection and making a new friend in the community they can count on for advice, recommendations, and future projects.  6x6 is a fun and adventurous project that utilizes the skill and experience of established, published creators, as well as providing a first opportunity for brand new writers and artists.  6x6:FORTUNE is guided by editors Mike Dreher (3-time 6x6 contributor and artist of CAT 5), Elysium Jacks (writer and 3-time 6x6 contributor), Jon Keithley (writer of Shivertown and Editor-in-Chief of Mystery House Comics), and Shanae Lavelle (artist of Shivertown and Art Director of Mystery House Comics)."

What We Need & What You Get

Mystery House Comics will print 200 copies of the comic book to be sold at conventions, events, and in retail locations like Captain Comics of Boise.  Creators are rewarded for their involvement with 10 complimentary issues.  Print costs total around $739 for those 320 copies (includes S&H).  We will be throwing the creators a RELEASE PARTY in October to promote the book, and to thank and reward them for their time and effort.  The event will feature a multimedia reading of each comic with professional actors and a chance to chat with all 12 artists and writers, get their signature, and pick their brains about their work and the experience.  The only costs to the event are actors.  We will be holding the event at West Elm, a HOME furnishings store in Downtown Boise (get it... like our theme).  It means a lot to dedicate an evening to these talented comic book creators.  Please help us make them feel like the VIPs they are for an evening.

Rewards for contributing to the creation of this comic include: a signed copy of 6x6:HOME and original art, prints, and commissions by the creators involved!

In the event we don't reach our goal, what we raise will be put towards printing first and foremost.  This book is an important opportunity for creators of all experience levels to learn and grow, and we think it's one of the projects that really makes our flourishing Idaho comic book scene special.

The Impact

6x6 began in 2014 with our first volume, FERAL, co-published by Corvid Tear Media.  That edition featured work by Erica Crockett, author of Chemicals and The Blood Zodiac series, Albert Asker, Editor-in-Chief of Idaho Comics Group and publisher of Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho, Tarey Potter, whose art has appeared in every volume until this year, and included editorial work by Crockett and Joshua Shapel, co-founder of the Boise Library Comic Con.

The anthology was successful enough it returned in 2015 with MOMENTUM featuring Rob Liefeld-protege Jacob Bear, current 6x6 editors Mike Dreher and Elysium Jacks, and Bop Comics founder Randall Kirby.  Every year we're able to improve the process for the creators and to expand our reach and resources one aspect at a time.  In 2016 we were our most ambitious to date with the release of 6x6:PRETEND.  The book featured an incredible roster of writers and artists including Jacob Bear, Joseph Bradshaw, Mike Dreher, Dan Feldmeier, Elysium Jacks, Steve Willhite, and we pulled off the biggest release party yet with a live band and a slideshow timing each comic, panel-by-panel, to music and live performances by professional actors.  Last year's 6x6:FORTUNE featured Nathan Veibell (AKA Spooky Dinosaur), Arik Grant (creator of the webcomic Bohica Blues), and A Mighty Band of Microbes' Matthew Vorhies, as well as the debut of first-timers like Matthew Dominck, and Adozinda (returning in this year's volume).

Last year we debuted additions to the process we've always wanted.  In addition to a Meet and Greet for creators to get to know one another, we're hosting a Script Workshop and a Layout Workshop for writers and artists to sit down with their editors and work through the creative process face-to-face, overcoming obstacles and clarifying communication to ensure the finished product is more collaborative and detailed than ever before.  Oh, and enjoying donuts.  Many, many donuts.

6x6 is an important part of the Treasure Valley comic book creative culture.  It welcomes new artists and writers and introduces them to the creative partners who can help them make their dreams a reality.  It gives potential creators a chance to take their first drag in the art of making comics, and hopefully they come away addicted and eager for more.  When it's time for their next project they now know two handfuls of artists and writers to lean on for help, advice, and even partnership.  This project is a great chance to get experienced comic book creators who have their own lessons to impart in the room with people who may be able to benefit from their knowledge, and the old dogs can definitely learn a thing or two from new talent with a fresh perspective.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize you have a lot of options when it comes to crowdfunding campaigns.  And comic books.  And crowdfunding campaigns to support comic books.  If you can't help out right now... no worries.  But what you CAN DO is tell everyone you know about this campaign.  This is a passion project for everyone involved and it would mean the world to us if you would TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... greeting cards... WHATEVER!  You can't help 6x6 if you don't know about 6x6, am I right?!  We appreciate the assist.  Thanks.

Other Ways You Can Help
We realize you have a lot of options when it comes to crowdfunding campaigns.  And comic books.  And crowdfunding campaigns to support comic books.  If you can't help out right now... no worries.  But what you CAN DO is tell everyone you know about this campaign.  This is a passion project for everyone involved and it would mean the world to us if you would TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... greeting cards... WHATEVER!  You can't help 6x6 if you don't know about 6x6, am I right?!  We appreciate the assist.  Thanks.

story:
& 




NHC and P13 

Hello, my name is Hillel and I make comics. When I was a kid, I wanted to be a comic book artist but I also had a curiosity about everything. My search for truth never waned. I spent years learning but even in college, I still wanted to create comics. I got a job, and then another job, and then another job, and the whole time I still yearned to make comics. 


I didn't actually consider being a comic book artist until students in my How To Draw Comics class started telling me, “You ought to make comics!”

With the added encouragement of my wife I decided it was time pursue my dream…

 

Now, I’ve started a company called New Hero Comics (NHC); and my comic is called PROGRAM 13. It’s about kids who are given super powers and tasked with protecting the world from...technology! (duh duh duuuuuhhhhhhhh!!!!)

So, I'm working on my comic, drawing the pages and inking them and I realize that if I want to add letters and format the comic I need to get penciled and inked comics from the real world to the digital world. 

Obviously, my work requires a scanner, but I also need a copier and printer—and it should be an all-in-one device!

Listen, I tried taking pictures with my HD camera, but the quality just isn't the same. I need an A3 all-in-one.

Funding and Perks

Why the A3?

Comic book sheets are drawn on over-sized Bristol board measuring at 11" X 17". Standard scanners scan 8.5" X 11", and A4 scanners scan at 8.5" X 14".




What am I going to do with the money we raise?

You’ve probably guessed that the first priority is to purchase an A3 printer. Here in Israel they cost between $250 - $300. They are big machines! That means I'll need a sturdy table to put it on, as well as a dolly to move the printer (remember, it's big!). Of course, paper and ink will also have to be purchased. Since they won’t deliver the A3 printer, I'll need to take a cab to pick it up.  

Any money that is left over will go back into purchasing other supplies such as more comic paper, ink, ink pens, blue pencil lead; basically lots of supplies. If there's enough left over I would like to get an art table. I had one in the states but when my family and I moved to Israel I left most of my supplies and equipment in the states, so I'm building my art materials back up from scratch.

If it should happen that for whatever reason I don't reach my goal; I'll use whatever money is raised to help me purchase the printer. 

The Perks!

For those of you who’d like to support our campaign, we have some great perks such as posters, preview pages, character sketchbook, and t-shirts. 

The Impact

We’ve all seen Super hero comics, right? Someone with a cape flies around and saves the day. That's not Program 13. Okay, so maybe it's an anti-hero blood and gore fest about how if you gave people super powers they would go around and just kill everyone (grrr). That's not Program 13 either. 



Program 13 is about kids who are given an opportunity to live their dreams and become super heroes. Along the way, they learn what it means to be stronger than everyone else. But children are innocent. Innocence mixed with power can lead to both very good and very bad things. They have teachers—the same people who created super powers. How will that help?

Program 13 has time travel, super villains, action, adventure, and weird characters galore. Your support helps bring all of this to life.

Your support will help me get the equipment that I need to create this oysom (awesome) comic and also makes you a co-creator of sorts. I'm really eager to bring these stories to life and get them into everyone's hands. These are characters I've been developing in one form or another for years. 


This is like the pre-production part of making a movie. When Volume One is completed, I'll be launching another campaign to help pay for printing costs, but you'll have been part of the pre-production. Without the required equipment, it would be impossible to move forward with the project. 


Risks & Challenges

Something could happen and for whatever reason the book may not get produced, despite my best efforts—that is a Risk. The Challenge is to prevent that by being nearly finished with the first sub-arc in Volume One, before launching this campaign. I've already completed a lot of work and that's why I'm able to offer perks. I've already got a lot of work put into this; I'll be doing my best to see this thru. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support our project with money, but if you can spread the word about the project; use Indiegogo's share tools, and be a general spokesperson for the campaign. Such efforts are tremendously helpful and you’ll be a personal hero of mine. 



In fact, whoever has the most referrals that result in monetary contributions will receive everything in the $75 perk. To qualify, make sure the person making the order mentions you by name. For example, they should write, "I was referred to this project by (first and last name, and your email)". That way I'll know that their contribution came from you. I think this is a pretty great offer that means you have a chance of getting the $75 perk without spending $75!

Now go, spread the good word!

story:
ENG - ITA

Se vuoi LEGGERE IN ITALIANO clicca QUI

ENG

Hello everyone, my name is Ilaria and Canvas is my project, my secret wish.
Canvas is an artbook with a story, a "silent book" as I usually call it, a graphic novel full of illustrations that through them it will take you to discover what true passions really are.

First of all I want to ask you something: how passion can influence our life? Changing, shaping and filling them up? What happens when a certain hobby is a hobby no more but it becomes something different, a passion so big to become alive itself?!
This is Canvas.
A story told by pictures to discover how passions can affect people's life, both in a negative or positive way.

This is the story of Alessandro, a child like any other, with a deep love for drawing. His strong emotion, growing more and more, becomes real. His passion for drawing at last comes alive as a little girl! She will make him face many adventures and deal with many different kinds of feelings.

The graphic novel I want to create will be about 72-pages, full-colored book with an hardcover. 

My drawing style features a strong Japanese influence (which is evident :D) and the colors of the illustrations play an important role with the expression of the main character's feelings troughout the entire story.



A special GIFT for everybody

In order to fullfill my dream I also designed and developed an application: CANVAS TUTOR - that you can already find online!
I decided to make it available for free so that everybody can increase their skills and follow their passion.
Canvas Tutor is an Android app useful to anyone who delights in drawing, it offers daily exercises to improve their skills in various disciplines such as anatomy, perspective, inking, coloring and character design. You can share your work through the gallery and check your progress with drawing.

In addition, for those who have supported this campaign helping me to achieve the goal, I will provide a code that you can enter in the app to get extra exclusive content!


Why an artbook is associated with an app?
It is easy to explain, I am a member of a team that develops indie apps, Pimentoso, which moslty works on Android games. In addition to this I work as a teacher at the European Academy of Manga, so I thought it would be great to combine these two activities: developing mobile applications and teaching, all by encouraging and sharing as much as possible my passion for drawing . I hope that it will help all drawing lovers novice. I highly recommend you let me know, and I look forward to your feedback!


What you can buy

(List update, stay tuned!)

The artbook, the silent book: "Canvas - follow your passion"



The color postcard + PSD File of one illustration with all the levels to discover all the realization steps



The limited edition t-shirt created in collaboration with Kingyo Sukui!

The sketchbook with custom cover!

An original colored illustration!


Perk composition

I have created a diversified offer as much as possible to meet all potential needs and curiosity: here you can find perks that includes from the artbook to postcards, from personalized sketches to private lessons.
Have a good choice! :D

(The Perk Shipment will be done in Decembre 2016) 

How funds will be used

The goal to make Canvas happen is set to € 6.500,00 and this amount will be used as follows:

How this project is born and why crowdfunding

The idea for this project came after having a hard time for different reasons specifically related to self-esteem and need for economic independence, and because of that I thought about quitting my passion, and so stop drawing. From this period came this story.
Despite I was still doubtful and reluctant, I received from Linda Cavallini and Emanuele Tenderini of Tatai Lab the offer to create something for them.
Being supported and helped by serious people who has already had experiece with crowdfunding with successful other projects such as Lumina, has given me the motivation that I need to throw myself into this adventure, and I can not thank them enough for this.


Who is Ilaria?

I was born in Florence and passion for drawing was already in my blood: when I was a child I used to spend many hours watching my grandfather painting, so by having his example in front of my eyes, I found myself spending all day drawing "Ibbi" ("children", in my five years baby language), before passing to my "kittens" period.

In Middle School years, despite my Italian teacher desperately wanted me to attend humanities-based High School, my idea was very clear about it: after my graduation exams I joined the Art School in Lucca.

During those years I got familiar with manga and Japanese drawing style, and my wish for the future changed from "When I grow up I wanna draw!" to "When I grow up I will be a comic artist!"

For this reason, once graduated I enrolled for the International School of Comics in Florence; there, alongside with my classmates we got into the magical world of self-produced fanzines, publishing "GATTAI!", our collection of pure manga-style comics. The fanzine helped me to find my first real job into the comics field: I became a teacher at the European Academy of manga, At the same time I was working as a demonstrator for Pentel and Copic Italy, as graphic designer for mobile games and as illustrator for a documentary film produced by Sky television, dedicated to the tragedy of Fukushima and the nuclear energy issue.




How you can help to make Canvas happen

You can help me in this adventure supporting the project, choosing one of the perks or just by sharing this Indiegogo page on several social network:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ilariamotokoart

Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlueberriesHell/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/motokosu/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/BlueberriesHell/

Webpage: http://www.motoko-su.com/canvas



In collaboration with


ITA - DESCRIZIONE IN ITALIANO
Ciao a tutti, mi chiamo Ilaria e Canvas è il mio progetto, il mio sogno nel cassetto.

Canvas è un artbook con una storia, ovvero un silent book, un racconto totalmente grafico e illustrato che tramite le immagini vi porterà alla scoperta delle vere passioni.

Voglio subito domandarvi una cosa: fino a che punto le passioni possono influenzare le nostre vite? Trasformarle, modellarle e renderle piene? Cosa accade quando un hobby non rimane più solamente tale ma diventa qualcosa di più, una passione che si ingrandisce a dismisura fino a diventare essa stessa vivente?!
Questo è Canvas.
Una storia narrata per immagini alla scoperta di come le passioni influenzino la vita delle persone, sia in negativo, che in positivo.

La storia è quella di Alessandro, un bambino come tanti, con un profondo amore per il disegno. Il suo sentimento così forte, crescendo sempre più, si materializzerà. La sua passione per il disegno prenderà corpo e vita a tutti gli effetti diventando una bambina! Sarà proprio lei a fargli affrontare mille avventure e a farlo confrontare con le emozioni più diverse.

Il volume che voglio realizzare è di 72 pagine con copertina rigida cartonata, interamente a colori.

Il mio stile di disegno (come è chiaramente evidente :D) ha dei forti tratti nipponici e i colori delle illustrazioni hanno l’importante compito di esprimere i sentimenti del protagonista durante tutto il corso della storia.

Un regalo speciale per tutti

Per dare maggiore completezza a questo mio sogno ho ideato e sviluppato un'applicazione: CANVAS TUTOR - che trovate già online!
Fin da subito ho deciso di renderla disponibile gratuitamente a tutti per poter coltivare al meglio la propria passione.
Canvas Tutor infatti è un’app per android utile a chiunque si diletti nel disegno proponendo esercizi giornalieri per migliorare le proprie abilità in varie discipline come l’anatomia, la prospettiva, l’inchiostrazione, la colorazione e il character design. Potete condividere i vostri lavori e verificare attraverso la gallery i vostri progressi con il disegno.

Inoltre, per chi avrà sostenuto questa campagna permettendo il raggiungimento del traguardo metterò a disposizione un codice da inserire nell'app per avere un contenuto extra in esclusiva!

Perché un artbook è associato a un'app?

Molto semplice, faccio parte di un team indie di sviluppo app, Pimentoso, che fino ad adesso si è occupato per la gran parte, di giochi android. Inoltre, lavorando per molto tempo come insegnante presso l’Accademia Europea di Manga ho pensato di unire queste due attività, ovvero quella dell’insegnamento e quella dello sviluppo di applicazioni mobile, il tutto incentivando e condividendo il più possibile la mia passione per il disegno. Spero proprio che possa aiutare tutti gli appassionati di disegno alle prime armi. Mi raccomando fatemi sapere, attendo i vostri feedback!


Cosa potete comprare

(Lista in aggiornamento!)

L'artbook, il silent book: "Canvas - follow your passion"


 
La cartolina stampata a colori + il file PSD dell'illustrazione con tutti i livelli aperti per conoscere i vari step di realizzazione.



La t-shirt in edizione limitata creata in collaborazione con Kingyo Sukui!

Lo sketchbook con la copertina personalizzata!

Una illustrazione originale a colori!


Messaggio speciale per le fumetterie

Sei una fumetteria interessata a Canvas?
Qua sotto (e nella colonna di destra) trovi, nella lista dei perk, anche un pacchetto apposito per i punti vendita. Si chiama: PERK RESELLER ed è composto da 5 copie del volume di Canvas e 5 cartoline!



Lista dei perk

Per soddisfare al meglio le possibili necessità e curiosità di tutti ho creato una serie di perk il più variegati possibili dove potrete trovare dall'artbook alle cartoline, da sketch personalizzati a lezioni private.
Buona scelta! :D

(Le spedizione dei Perk verranno effettuate a Dicembre 2016)

Come verranno usati i fondi

Il traguardo per poter realizzare  questo mio progetto è stato fissato a 6.500 questa somma verrà così ripartita:


Come nasce il progetto e il perché del crowdfunding

L'idea per realizzare questo progetto è arrivata dopo aver passato un periodo molto difficile per me nel quale, per diversi problemi legati soprattutto ad autostima e necessità di un'indipendenza economica, avevo pensato di abbandonare la mia passione, e di smettere quindi di disegnare. Proprio da qui è nata l'idea di questa storia.
Seppur ancora dubbiosa e titubante, mi è arrivata in seguito la proposta da Linda Cavallini ed Emanuele Tenderini, di TataiLab, di realizzare qualcosa per loro. Sapere di essere appoggiata ed aiutata da persone serie che avevano già sperimentato il crowdfunding con altri progetti come Lumina mi ha dato la convinzione che mi serviva a buttarmi a capofitto in questa avventura, e non finirò mai di ringraziarli.




Chi è Ilaria?

Sono nata a Firenze con la passione per il disegno nel sangue: fin da piccola rimanevo ore e ore a osservare mio nonno dipingere. Così, con il suo esempio negli occhi, mi son ritrovata a passare intere giornate a disegnare “ibbi” (bambini, nella mia lingua da bimba di 5 anni), passando successivamente al mio periodo “gattini”.
Alle medie, nonostante la mia insegnante di italiano volesse con tutte le sue forze che io frequentassi il liceo classico, avevo già le idee molto chiare, e dopo l’esame di terza media mi iscrissi al liceo artistico di Lucca.
Durante quegli anni conobbi i manga e lo stile giapponese, e il mio desiderio per il futuro si trasformò da “da grande disegnerò!” a “da grande diventerò una fumettista!”.
Per questo, una volta diplomata, mi iscrissi alla scuola internazionale di comics di Firenze. Insieme alle mie compagne di classe ci buttammo nel magico mondo delle fanzine autoprodotte, pubblicando “GATTAI!”, la nostra raccolta di fumetti in puro stile manga. La fanzine mi portò a trovare il mio primo vero lavoro nell’ambito del fumetto, ovvero l’insegnante presso l’Accademia europea di manga. Contemporaneamente ho lavorato come dimostratrice per Pentel e Copic italia, come grafica per giochi mobile e come illustratrice per un film documentario prodotto da Sky dedicato alla tragedia di Fukushima e alla questione dell’energia nucleare. 



Come puoi aiutare Canvas a diventare reale

Puoi aiutarmi in questa impresa supportando il progetto scegliendo uno dei perk sopra indicati o anche solamente condividendo questa pagina Indiegogo sui diversi social network:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ilariamotokoart

Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlueberriesHell/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/motokosu/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/BlueberriesHell/

Webpage: http://www.motoko-su.com/canvas


In collaborazione con:
story_txt:
ENG - ITA

Se vuoi LEGGERE IN ITALIANO clicca QUI


ENG

Hello everyone, my name is Ilaria and Canvas is my project, my secret wish.Canvas is an artbook with a story, a "silent book" as I usually call it, a graphic novel full of illustrations that through them it will take you to discover what true passions really are.


First of all I want to ask you something: how passion can influence our life? Changing, shaping and filling them up? What happens when a certain hobby is a hobby no more but it becomes something different, a passion so big to become alive itself?!This is Canvas.A story told by pictures to discover how passions can affect people's life, both in a negative or positive way.


This is the story of Alessandro, a child like any other, with a deep love for drawing. His strong emotion, growing more and more, becomes real. His passion for drawing at last comes alive as a little girl! She will make him face many adventures and deal with many different kinds of feelings.



The graphic novel I want to create will be about 72-pages, full-colored book with an hardcover. My drawing style features a strong Japanese influence (which is evident :D) and the colors of the illustrations play an important role with the expression of the main character's feelings troughout the entire story.



A special GIFT for everybody
In order to fullfill my dream I also designed and developed an application: CANVAS TUTOR - that you can already find online!I decided to make it available for free so that everybody can increase their skills and follow their passion.Canvas Tutor is an Android app useful to anyone who delights in drawing, it offers daily exercises to improve their skills in various disciplines such as anatomy, perspective, inking, coloring and character design. You can share your work through the gallery and check your progress with drawing.
In addition, for those who have supported this campaign helping me to achieve the goal, I will provide a code that you can enter in the app to get extra exclusive content!



Why an artbook is associated with an app?It is easy to explain, I am a member of a team that develops indie apps, Pimentoso, which moslty works on Android games. In addition to this I work as a teacher at the European Academy of Manga, so I thought it would be great to combine these two activities: developing mobile applications and teaching, all by encouraging and sharing as much as possible my passion for drawing . I hope that it will help all drawing lovers novice. I highly recommend you let me know, and I look forward to your feedback!

story:
Edit: Nov 27th

We still have 12 days to go so you can still support and pre-order the book! Based on how the contributions go in the next 2 days, I'll come up with ideas for extras in the packages or stretch goals.
----------

Grey is... is an ongoing slice-of-life series, about two guys; Black (boy in white) and White (boy in black). It started in November 2010 and is +500 pages long so far, and counting.

About the comic:


Grey is... have a great supportive audience. I feel very blessed every day. It has been featured on deviantART, has over 1500 readers on MangaMagazine.net, hard copies of Vol1 is almost out of stock and it's being translated and published in Spain starting this year.

It means a lot to me and the readers if this goal was fully funded. Since I started and realized I'm committed to this job, I decided that I want to make a living solely as an indie manga artist and thankfully, my supportive parents stood by my side at the beginning of Grey is... and it got bigger with the support and faith the readers put in the story and me.

My father helped me print the first two books and from here on, I want to actually self-publish the rest of the books and I'm glad to see all these crowdfunding websites that pushed the webcomics community and indie artists, in general, to get bigger.

greyismanga.com || tumblr || Online Store

Page Samples:


Grey is the conflict and the balance between the heart and mind in the human soul. Black and White are similar yet so so different and they represent the heart and the mind respectively. Grey is... deals with intense themes like child abuse, self-harm and suicide but it's also about the ways to overcome these obstacles; friendship, love, peace within self and courage to welcome change.
 

About the creator:

I'm Diana Abbadi, mostly known by my pen name dee Juusan, a 27 years old Jordanian manga artist. This year I was one of the Winner Runner ups in the Silent Manga Audition hosted by the Japanese Monthly Comic Zenon Magazine.

My career as a Manga Artist (I mostly go by Manga Artist because manga is the term we use here) started with Grey is... in 2010. It was originally a one shot test to see if this medium is my thing and 3 years later, all I want to do is draw stories 24/7

I fell in love with stories even before I learned how to read, back when I was a kid and stories were read and explained by teachers in school. Since then, I knew I wanted to be a storyteller, whether it's novels, comics, poems, prose, animation, or film.
And when my love for art grew with my age, choices got fewer and fewer and I realized after graduation college that telling stories as comics is my thing.

Read a bit more about me || deviantART || twitter

THE BOOK:


$4000 is 2800JD (Jordanian Dinars).

75% of the goal will cover the costs to print 500 copies of the book.

The rest will go for: A5 prints + Packaging and shipping costs (Shipped Worldwide using Registered Air Mail) + all fees for 3rd parties in the campaign (Credit Card and Indiegogo)

$500 + $1000 perks will get an exclusive t-shirt


Update: November 10th 2013

2 Perks have been added for those who want to contribute but are not Grey is... readers:

1. Original Artwork

2. 2 hour Art session (for lessons, critiques, art talk or all)

A5 Prints Preview:

(To check other merchandise rewards descriptions, please visit the online store)
(Logbooks will most probably be bought through MangaMagazine.net Marketplace. will be ordered and paid for by me and would arrive separately from your package)

The book will happen.

So, you may have noticed that this campaign is using Flexible Funding, which means I am getting the money raised whether it'd reached the goal or not.

What will happen to the money?

The people that contributed in the campaign will get the book as agreed. And whatever money I raise, I'll use to print the book with the same quality as the last two.

My plan would be, in case the goal wasn't reached, is to print less copies (200 instead of 500) and use any money I get from the online store, the local stores (selling vol1+2), commissions or selling original art to have the book ready in January 2014 to ship as promised.
So, you don't have to worry. The book will happen. I just wish I wouldn't need to go to extreme measures for it and hope the campaign would be fully funded.

Thank you!


If you're new to Grey is... Why Fund?

Volume 3 deals mostly about change and self-harm, whether it was physically, emotionally, consciously or subconsciously. As most storytellers, I have a message I want to share, a vision I want to see come true, issues I want to shine the light on, in hopes someone will be influenced to change or make a change.

Even if it was one or two people...

I was blessed to receive these messages the past year and now I'm aiming for higher. I want more people to acknowledge this matter and put an end to it.

At last...

You can always help by spreading the work around the web via the social networks. That would be greatly appreciated!

Grey is... have a great supportive audience. I feel very blessed every day. It has been featured on deviantART, has over 1500 readers on MangaMagazine.net, hard copies of Vol1 is almost out of stock and it's being translated and published in Spain starting this year.

It means a lot to me and the readers if this goal was fully funded. Since I started and realized I'm committed to this job, I decided that I want to make a living solely as an indie manga artist and thankfully, my supportive parents stood by my side at the beginning of Grey is... and it got bigger with the support and faith the readers put in the story and me.

My father helped me print the first two books and from here on, I want to actually self-publish the rest of the books and I'm glad to see all these crowdfunding websites that pushed the webcomics community and indie artists, in general, to get bigger.
greyismanga.com || tumblr || Online StorePage Samples:

Grey is the conflict and the balance between the heart and mind in the human soul. Black and White are similar yet so so different and they represent the heart and the mind respectively. Grey is... deals with intense themes like child abuse, self-harm and suicide but it's also about the ways to overcome these obstacles; friendship, love, peace within self and courage to welcome change. 
About the creator:I'm Diana Abbadi, mostly known by my pen name dee Juusan, a 27 years old Jordanian manga artist. This year I was one of the Winner Runner ups in the Silent Manga Audition hosted by the Japanese Monthly Comic Zenon Magazine.My career as a Manga Artist (I mostly go by Manga Artist because manga is the term we use here) started with Grey is... in 2010. It was originally a one shot test to see if this medium is my thing and 3 years later, all I want to do is draw stories 24/7I fell in love with stories even before I learned how to read, back when I was a kid and stories were read and explained by teachers in school. Since then, I knew I wanted to be a storyteller, whether it's novels, comics, poems, prose, animation, or film.And when my love for art grew with my age, choices got fewer and fewer and I realized after graduation college that telling stories as comics is my thing.Read a bit more about me || deviantART || twitter
THE BOOK:






$4000 is 2800JD (Jordanian Dinars).
75% of the goal will cover the costs to print 500 copies of the book. 
The rest will go for: A5 prints + Packaging and shipping costs (Shipped Worldwide using Registered Air Mail) + all fees for 3rd parties in the campaign (Credit Card and Indiegogo)



$500 + $1000 perks will get an exclusive t-shirt





Update: November 10th 20132 Perks have been added for those who want to contribute but are not Grey is... readers:
1. Original Artwork

2. 2 hour Art session (for lessons, critiques, art talk or all)

A5 Prints Preview:
(To check other merchandise rewards descriptions, please visit the online store)(Logbooks will most probably be bought through MangaMagazine.net Marketplace. will be ordered and paid for by me and would arrive separately from your package)

The book will happen.
So, you may have noticed that this campaign is using Flexible Funding, which means I am getting the money raised whether it'd reached the goal or not.
What will happen to the money? 
The people that contributed in the campaign will get the book as agreed. And whatever money I raise, I'll use to print the book with the same quality as the last two. My plan would be, in case the goal wasn't reached, is to print less copies (200 instead of 500) and use any money I get from the online store, the local stores (selling vol1+2), commissions or selling original art to have the book ready in January 2014 to ship as promised.

So, you don't have to worry.
The book will happen. I just wish I wouldn't need to go to extreme measures for it and hope the campaign would be fully funded.
Thank you!
If you're new to Grey is... Why Fund?Volume 3 deals mostly about change and self-harm, whether it was physically, emotionally, consciously or subconsciously. As most storytellers, I have a message I want to share, a vision I want to see come true, issues I want to shine the light on, in hopes someone will be influenced to change or make a change. Even if it was one or two people...
I was blessed to receive these messages the past year and now I'm aiming for higher. I want more people to acknowledge this matter and put an end to it.
At last...
You can always help by spreading the work around the web via the social networks. That would be greatly appreciated!
