story:
Who - we are?

DPD&Y! is the production and creative team behind the new web graphic novel, The Soul of a Hero.  This new, community-funded web graphic novel will redefine readers’ experience with comics. Created to provide fans what they been looking for and missing…heroic, villainous, tormented and innocent characters, eye-popping art, gripping stories, and real-time interaction with comic creators, The Soul of a Hero hearkens back to the Golden Age of comics where stories mattered while blazing new territory with 21st century technology through the dynamic feedback loop.

The Soul of a Hero reminds us why we fell in love with comics in the first place and takes us to a place we’ve never been. The Soul of a Hero creative team has partnered with Red Handed Studios to produce this long-overdue epic.  Red Handed Studios, a small, established independent publisher, is the creator of award winning graphic novel FallenJustice and the ongoing web comic series, DynaGirl.

The Soul of a Hero is team DPD&Y!’s first collaborative effort. This fan -driven project expands the ever-growing super hero universe created by Red Handed Studios.

DPD&Y! comprises of  creative amateur comic and graphic novel creators who have a strong belief that comics should be fun, informative and above all else fan supported.  Each member of the team has already worked on independent comic projects that have been published. The team members are big fans of 70’s-ploitation, action movies, comics, and super heroes.

        For more on DPD&Y! please see our press release.

 

What - we need?

In order to adequately produce this web graphic novel to its full creative vision, DPD&Y! requires $3500 seed money. These funds will cover the operating and production costs associated with creating the comic, including maintaining the website (so the graphic novel can be read for free), marketing collateral and for small stipends for the artists who produce the work.

 

Where - you can see and get the comic?

You can view the web graphic novel at anytime by visiting its web site www.thesoulofahero.com . There you will also see the project unfold with special online posters and concept art. Once a particular chapter is completed, It will be available for purchase at the online comic store in print or digital format as single issues. Fans will also be able to purchase the complete collector’s edition once the entire web graphic novel is completed.  Shhhh don’t mention the collectors edition to anyone, it’s gonna have all kinds of cool special never seen before stuff in it.

 

When -  is the comic coming out?

The Soul of a Hero is in production. The plan is to post a page a week of the graphic novel until completion. The story is planned to cover chapter issues and each will be available to read FOR FREE on the comic’s website. Don’t worry this ain’t like other projects that sound all cool but never come out.

The projected web publishing date in Late November 2013

 

Why - we need your help?

We are amateur comic enthusiasts who enjoy creating indie-comics. Note the wording “amateur comic enthusiast.” We are all professional artists and writers but amateur here means that we don’t get paid to do this, nor do we have a defined budget. We need your help to make this project become a reality!  The Soul of a Hero is our first collaboration and we are passionately enthusiastic to see it become a success and gain a strong fan base!

 

How - is this different?

We want you to partner with us so that you can be that fan base! And in partnering with us we want to reward you with some of the awesome perks listed! All the perks are exclusive to the Soul of a Hero Web graphic novel. As a supporter of this campaign you are entitled to exclusive benefits and gifts for future projects. If you are a comic buff fan-boy or fan-girl and want to get in on a new and cool comic genre universe, DPD&Y! and Red Handed studios is ready to deliver.

So by supporting The Soul of a Hero you are essentially giving a donation that gives back!

 

What - is next?

That is simple...DONATE! Help us accomplish our dream of bringing The Soul of a Hero to life with our donation. The comic is gonna be awesome, the perks are gonna be awesome, we are awesome and you are awesome... so what is stopping you? DONATE TODAY!

 

You diggin? Right on! Let’s get to the donating so we can get to sending you the perks and finishing the project!

 

here are some samples of the perks!

 

 

How the Contribution Perks Work

 

This campaign’s purpose is for fans to help take ownership in the project. We feel the best way to honor and thank you is to offer perks for your donation. Donations are not consider sales, we see them as gifts from the bottom of your heart to us so that we can make this dream a reality. We want you to get the best value for your donation, when donate at one level you get ALL the perks at the level below it.*  So get your credit cards, and pay pal accounts in order and MAKE THAT DONATION!

 

*The “51 Soul Power,” and “Now That’s Funky” perks are unique in that we have limited numbers. These donors will get their perks as well as the perks listed below but we might have to make some adjustments. But you are all intelligent people out there and can understand the logistics behind this.

 

Unlocks

 

Here are our special gifts to our campaign donors ! Once the campaign reaches the listed funding amount we will add the following perks to your donation FREE! This is our gift to you our future fans, current friends and of course beloved family!



$500 SOAH desktop wallpaper image (digital download)

 

$1000 vote for “turning point” story arc.

 

$1500 Signed numbered special edition collectors print

 

$2000 Special Edition preview (digital download)

 

$2500 Soul of a Hero Karate Headband  (yup sent in the mail to you!)

 

$3500 The Soul of a Hero Chonicles: The Prospect (digital download)

 

OVER BUDGET! Super secret special perk with a kung fu grip!  hint: Special Print illustrated by top tier professional comic artists.

story:
Meet the Brothers From Another Planet (BFAP): Tarik Davis, Don P. Hooper, and C. LeMar McLean. 

They’re kind of like The Three Musketeers, or like Kirk, Spock and Bones or maybe Jordan, Pippen and Rodman. Point being that no matter what, it’s one for all and all for one.

Since 2013, Davis (center), Hooper (right), and McLean (left) have been getting together for a regular podcast on race, culture, entertainment in America. In April 2015 they founded Comedy People’s Time (CPT).

CPT is a live improv show committed to presenting a diverse array of performers – for each show, Davis, Hooper, and McLean are joined by Ashley Nichole Black (The Second City, Black History X), Jenny Hagel (The Second City, Big Gay Sketch Show), Daisy Rosario (Latino USA, The Moth), and Amber Ruffin (Late Night with Seth Myers, Drunk History) . Past CPT Guest Artists include Kate Chamuris (Rosehill, Breakfast in Bed), Mitra Jourhari (Three Busy Debras), Lauren Van Kurin (iO West, The Annoyance), Rachel Miller (The Second City), Jamie Rivera (The Magnet Theater, The Second City), and Holly Walker (The Nightly Show, The Second City).

BFAP’s work doesn’t end with the founding of CPT, individually and collectively they produce videos, web comics and web series, other podcasts and another regular live show, Ego Trippin’, at the Experimental Comedy Gallery where they present scripted character sketches.

CPT performances consistently sell out in New York City, audience response could not be more positive, and the cast is headed to the Netherlands to perform in the 21st edition of the IMPRO Amsterdam festival at the end of January.

Currently Davis, Hooper and McLean do all of this with the money they make as teachers, coaches, voiceover artists, and commercial actors. This, combined with the lack of space and attention paid to people of color in the entertainment industry are two of the very real challenges that BFAP face on the regular.

Donations to this campaign will help cover travel expenses, and seed upcoming CPT performances, as well as other exciting projects in store for 2016. No amount is too large or too small, and spreading the word is greatly appreciated. 

#BrothersFromAnotherPlanet
#BFAP
#ComedyPeoplesTime
#CPT

story:
Hi my name is Michael Daniels, the creator of The Venomous Five. I was very adamant about telling this particular story of women’s empowerment of all ages by bringing strong black female characters to the forefront.  The traditional way of men telling women stories is over.  The creation of The Venomous Five is a new wave of consciousness in story telling.

With your help of donating to this project we can bring these characters to life.  So we thank you in advance for your support.

Getting the word out to the masses to support this project!  We have publishers interested in distributing this project, but want to see the first issue! To produce this graphic novel is very costly, so we really need your support to reach our goal.  If we are unable to achieve our goal we won’t be able to bring this fascinated story to the masses.

Please share this with friends and family!

story:
The Night Is Our Victory Painted Comic

My Story

Hey there! I am Brandon Anthony Riggins, an independent fantasy illustrator in Columbus, Ohio. I write and illustrate my own original stories, and am just beginning my career in the industry. I began my work with a facebook page, Illustrator Of Fantasies, in March of 2012, and moved to an actual website blog at www.brandonanthonyrigginsiof.com. I even manage my own online store at www.iofstore.storenvy.com.

This year, 2013, has seen me incredibly busy as I've joined an art group, and continued developing new projects, and exhibiting my work. However, it's been a slow yearand while I've been busy producing my work, and building my name as an artist, I haven't been able to make much head-way in gaining sales. Lack of sales from my other finished projects means that this project, and ones like it, take weeks longer to produce than they should, and also that I miss out on major shows and conventions since I'm unable to provide samples of the work. Missing out on shows and conventions costs more than actually attending them, because it means I'm missing out on meeting potential fans and customers, collaborators, even employers, as well as earning an income.

This is my first publicationand I'm really excited about it. I want to give it the best measure of reach I can, and to do that, I need to have copies printed. I would love to have copies of the book on-hand to fulfill orders online and in stores. Further, there are a couple local shows and artist events happening this summer where I can showcase the book.


The Project

One night, during a wild stroke of inspiration, I sat at my computer and began writing the words that would become one of my favorite short stories, The Night Is Our Victory. Clocking in at just seven paragraphs, it told the story of an ambush happening in a forest at night. After sharing it with my friends, I mused about the idea of illustrating it.

The story tells the tale of a group of humans in a night forest who are ambushed by the forest-dwelling people there for gathering up bits of their home (fallen branches and things) to use as firewood on a cold evening. The sylf, the forest people, find them and, after dealing with them, leave the bodies to be reclaimed by the forest and its Fey inhabitants.

Over the span of two weeks, I sat at my drawing table, drawing each image and painting it. The final images were painted on 12 x 16, 140# Canson watercolor paper using Dr PhMartens watercolor inks.

I made a mock-up of the final book for my own visual aid purpose, and researched printing costs and formats. I spent another week putting everything together into its final form. All the pages are formatted, the story is printed at the bottom of each page, and the covers are complete.

Now, it's time to print. The book is complete and simply waits for the funds to be printed. A successfully completed campaign means the following:

  • 100 copies of the book, ready to fulfill orders and store placement
  • An ISBN and barcode, necessary for store placement
  • Promotional prints for shows and events

I can print all the books I need, and get an ISBN and barcode. The printed books will be sent to a local store to carry and contributers to the campaign, and shown to other local comic shops and retailers for store placement. I will also have them available in my online shop and for upcoming shows and events.


My Thanks, Your Rewards

Everyone who helps me out with this receives my eternal gratitude. This isn't just about printing a comic book, it's helping me achieve a dream! Further, I have these rewards, tokens of my gratitude for your contributions:

  • $10 - A signed copy of the printed book, with a personal message of thanks from me, to you!

  • $20 - A signed copy of the book, but also a print of the front cover! The print is 12 x 16 on 80# semi-gloss cover paper.

  • $50 - A signed copy of the book, and all seven images of the story as prints.

Even if I don't reach my full goal, any money I do earn would go towards getting the book printed and into the hands of people who will love it. But by contributing to this small project now, you do the good work of helping an artist maintain crucial independence to continue to tell original stories with original art.

Please take the time to share this with your friends and family through Twitter, Facebook, and any other social media platform you use to share information. Even if you can not donate to this campaign, this project can only be successful with art lovers taking the opportunity to share it with others.

story:
안녕하세요 Seoul 2150입니다. 우리 만화 프러젝트 관심 있고 도움 주고 싶으면 이페이지로 기부 할 수 있어요. 오른쪽 "select a perk" 하면 기부 만들고 포상 받아요. 아니면 마음대로 "contribute now"도 가능돼요. 기부 많이 받으면 만화 많이 만들 수 있어요.  EBS 뉴스G 비디오 여기 볼 수 있어요. 감사삽니다!

Overview 개요

The world of Seoul 2150 is dark, dangerous but familiar. It's a world full of people. People never change. They are driven by desire. driven to survive, to get by. When androids were introduced into society, they made in the image of their creators. They also want to survive, they have desires.  Some don't want them to survive.

Seoul 2150의 세계는 어둡고 위험하지만 친근하기도 합니다. 수 많은 사람들로 가득 차있죠. 사람들은 절대 변하지 않는답니다. 살아가기 위해서, 도태되지 않기 위해 그들은 욕망에 따라 행동합니다. 안드로이드가 사회에 처음 소개되었을 때, 그들을 만들어낸 사람들의 생각과 완벽하게 부합했습니다. 안드로이드들 또한 살아남길 원했고 욕망을 좇았습니다. 몇몇 사람들은 그들이 죽길 바랬지만요.

Seoul 2150 is a story about competing desires. A desire to search. A desire to control. A desire to live. A desire to destroy.  These desires will be set against a futuristic vision of Seoul, South Korea in the year 2150 but will be little different from the desires we see in today's world.

Seoul 2150은 욕망을 좇아가고 채워가는 스토리를 보여줍니다. 무언가 찾고자 하는 욕망. 무언가 조종하고 싶은 욕망. 살고 싶다는 욕망. 파괴하고 싶다는 욕망. 이러한 욕망들은 미래 2150년의 서울 속에 만연하지만, 오늘날 우리들의 세상에 존재하는 욕망과는 조금 다릅니다.

So what exactly is it?

그렇다면 Seoul 2150는 정확히 무엇일까요?

Seoul 2150 is a comic that is trying to stretch the mould a little bit. The images in the comic are created through a mix of traditional photography, composition, and some digital illustration. Unlike other comics that use photography in the level of composition and editing done to each photo is much more extensive. Backgrounds are assembled from many pieces, and extensive editing is done to the individuals in the images from retouching to illustration as things like the android parts are added to the characters.

Seoul 2150은 일반 만화와는 조금 다른 작품입니다. Seoul 2150은 사진 촬영과 편집 그리고 디지털 일루젼을 통해 만들어지기 때문입니다. 단순히 여러 장의 사진을 엮어 만든 기존의 만화와는 달리, Seoul 2150은 더욱 섬세하고 정교한 사진 편집 작업을 거쳐 완성됩니다. 작품 속의 배경들은 수많은 사진 조각들을 엮어 만들어지고, 고도의 일러스트레이션 리터칭 작업을 통해 등장인물들을 더욱 생생한 안드로이드처럼 보이도록 합니다.

For this reason Seoul 2150 looks to stand apart from traditional photo comics and webcomics as well. The comic will be produced in a traditional western comic book style of around 30 pages with a cover and splash page. Funds permitting we will do limited runs of hard copies for each issue. In the beginning this comic will run in Korean and English, but other languages are being looked at as well. 

따라서 Seoul 2150은 기존의 사진을 엮어 만든 만화와 웹툰과는 다르다고 볼 수 있습니다.  또한, Seoul 2150은 일반적인 서양의 만화 스타일을 따르기 때문에, 매 커버는 30페이지 분량이며 스플래시 페이지를 포함합니다. 재정적인 한계가 있는 관계로, 한정된 수량만을 출판할 예정입니다. 비록 지금은 한국어와 영어로만 작품이 소개되지만, 이후에는 더 많은 외국어로 번역될 예정입니다.


Who are we? 우리는 누굴까요?

We are Posinoir Comics, a group of many people who have given our time and effort to producing the the first demo issue which will be available to read in both Korean and English.

많은 사람들이 모여 수 많은 시간과 노력을 쏟아 첫 번째 데모 작품을 한국어와 영어로 소개하기 위해 모인 ‘Posinoir Comics’ 그룹입니다.

Matthew Cross is a photographer, editor, writer, and digital illustrator. He conceived of the idea about a year ago after testing different kinds of shooting styles and editing in the studio and managed to convince everyone else that this was worth a shot.

크로스매튜는 사진작가이며 에디터인 동시에 디지털 일러스트레이터입니다. 스튜디오에서 다양한 스타일의 사진 촬영과 편집작업을 하던 그는 Seoul 2150을 제작해야겠다는 생각을 떠올리게 되었고, 이는 다른 사람들의 두터운 공감대를 형성하였습니다. 그리하여 본격적인 작품 제작에 돌입하게 되었습니다.

Kristine Lee is a text book translator by day and, hopefully, about to lead the way in bringing the noir style to the Korean language. While noir themes exist in many Korean films, the speech and narrative style wasn't so easy to replicate. Kristine was able to make the story flow and keep its nuances during translation.

Kristine Lee는 번역가입니다. 수 많은 한국영화 속에서 느와르 장르가 소개되었지만, 그 말투와 문체는 정통 느와르 스타일을 따라가기엔 조금 무리가 있습니다. Kristine은 Seoul 2150을 번역하며 스토리 전개를 매끄럽게 전개하며 동시에, 느와르만의 뉘앙스를 생생하게 전달했습니다.

We are backed by a host of individuals willing to stand in funny positions or do somersaults while jumping off large wooden blocks onto mattresses over and over just to get a shot. From the main characters to the extras, everyone is ready to do their best. 

Seoul 2150 제작에 수 많은 사람들이 자발적으로 참여하였습니다. 참여자들은 나무 상자에서 미리 준비된 매트리스 위로 여러 차례 뛰어내리는 등 완벽한 사진을 촬영하기 위해 노력했습니다. 주인공과 엑스트라 모두 최고의 작품을 만들기 위해 고군분투 했습니다.


What We Need & What You Get

Seoul2150이 필요한 것과 여러분이 얻는 것

What do we need? We need money of course. We need money to pay for things like equipment, studio and production costs, models, advertising, printing of the comic, and all the things associated with getting a sustainable business off the ground.
Specifically we are intending to use the money for:
  • A new editing computer, way more of everything to speed up and improve work flow
  • A new camera to produce larger and higher quality images to aid in creating better panels
  • New props and costumes.
  • Compensation for models and staff.
  • Online advertising to help raise brand awareness
  • Digital assets like backgrounds or 3D models that will be used in composition.
저희가 필요한 것이 과연 무엇일까요? 물론 돈이겠죠. 장비, 제작 비용, 모델, 광고, 출판 등 Seoul 2150을 여러분께 소개시키기 위해 필요한 모든 것들을 갖추기 위한 자금이 필요합니다. 제작 비용에 대해 더욱 자세하게 말씀 드리자면,
  • 작업을 더욱 효율적으로 빠르게 진행할 수 있는 새로운 에디팅 컴퓨터
  • 더욱 뛰어난 패널을 만드는 데 있어 핵심인 크고 생생한 이미지를 담아낼 수 있는 카메라
  • 새로운 도구와 의상
  • 모델과 스텝들에게 제공될 상금
  • 작품을 알리기 위한 온라인 광고 비용
  • 만화 속 구성으로 쓰일 3D 모델이나 배경화면 작업에 투입될 디지털 에셋들
What do you get? You will get regular issues of Seoul 2150 so long as we have the funds and interest to keep making them. We hope to turn this in to a very long term project and story.
그렇다면 여러분은 무엇을 얻게 될까요? 재정적인 여유와 다른 조건들이 유지되는 한, 정기적으로 발행되는 Seoul 2150을 구독하실 수 있습니다.그리고 저희들은 이 프로젝트가 장기적인 작업이 되길 바랍니다.

You also can read the full 20 page demo comic right now in Korean or English.

지금 20페이지 분량의 Seoul 2150 데모 버전을 읽어보실 수 있습니다.

Read the English version here

한국어 만화 여기 다운해요


The Impact 영향력

What are you really going to do by donating? By donating you're going to help further a genre. When this project was first conceived, some wrote it off as a little crazy. Photographers from time to time will do up a handful photos from a shoot in a comic style, the idea of doing an entire book this way was written off as simply unfeasible. We think we've shown them wrong. Our demo issue covered a wide variety of situations from action, to dialog and from humans to death dealing security drones. Some panels are mostly photography and others are entirely digital illustration. We've shown that it is more than possible for even a small team to produce this.
여러분이 Seoul 2150을 위해 기부한다는 것은 무엇을 의미할까요? 새로운 장르를 개발시키는데 기여한다는 것을 의미합니다.  Seoul 2150 프로젝트를 구상했을 때, 몇몇의 사람들은 매우 회의적이었습니다. 사진작가들이 종종 코믹스타일의 사진을 찍기는 하지만, 사진들을 엮어 만화로 출판한다는 아이디어 자체를 비현실적으로 보았습니다. 그러나 우리는 그들이 틀렸다는 것을 입증했습니다. 저희들이 소개한 데모버전은 다양한 상황을 생동감 있게 전하는 액션과 대화, 무인정찰기와 관련된 죽음과 인간으로 구성되어있습니다.몇몇의 패널들은 주로 사진으로 만들어졌으며, 때로는 모두 디지털 일러스트레이션만으로 완성되기도 했습니다. 저희들은 이러한 작품을 작은 팀들이 만들 수 있다는 것을 입증했습니다.

Funding will allow us not only to continue the project, but improve it as well. Through funding we will be able to buy better props and costumes, get more people involved, and through time we will be able to explore and improve the narrative process and the quality and style of the editing. We're certainly not as good as we want to be.
재정적인 지원이 있다면 이 프로젝트를 계속 진행할 수 있을 뿐만 아니라 질을 향상시킬 수 있을 것입니다. 즉, 더욱 많은 장비와 의상을 구비하고, 더욱 많은 사람들이 동참할 수 있을 것이며, 더욱 흥미로운 스토리와 훌륭한 퀄리티의 에디팅을 선보일 수 있을 것이라 생각합니다. 그러나 충분한 자금이 없는 지금은 저희들이 목표하는 뛰어난 작품을 선보일 수 없는 상황입니다.

We are also hoping to explore some aspects of Korea within the context of the story. We are hoping to include some Korean traditional areas, treasures, assets, culture and incorporate things like lesser known weapon based Korean martial arts in to the comic.
Seoul 2150을 선보임으로써, 저희들은 스토리에 한국적인 요소를 담고자 합니다.

한국의 전통적인 장소들, 국보, 자산, 무형자산들을 선보여 더욱 널리 알리고자 합니다.

Risks & Challenges 위험 & 도전

Luckily with a focused project like this, the risks are lower. The biggest risk we run into may be scheduling issues, or things like that. So long as the pictures have been shot the comic will come out. There are only a couple of points of failure in getting this from concept to a finished edition, shooting the images, editing the images and translating the text. Barring major illness, nothing should interfere with that part of the process.
다행스럽게도 이렇게 심혈을 기울인 프로젝트의 위험부담은 작습니다. 그러나 저희가 생각하는 가장 큰 위험요소는 발행일을 맞추지 못하는 상황입니다. 하지만 이 문제는 사진 촬영 작업이 지연되지 않는 한, 해결될 것입니다. 뿐만 아니라 성공을 장담할 수 없는 또 다른 요인들이 존재하기도 합니다. Seoul 2150을 완성작으로 만드는 것, 사진을 찍고 이미지를 편집하는 것 그리고 만화를 번역하는 것이 어려울 수도 있습니다. 그러나 가장 큰 문제점들을 해결할 수 있는 방안을 마련한다면, 그 어떤 것도 Seoul 2150의 성공의 걸림돌이 되지 않을 것입니다.

The challenge we face is finding our audience. Seoul 2150 is something we believe in and while it might not be for everyone, we hope getting it out there will allow us to start sharing it with others and build up a community of fans.
저희들에게 도전이란, Seoul 2150을 좋아할 많은 독자를 보유하는 것입니다. Seoul 2150은 개성이 뚜렷한 작품이기에 모든 독자들이 좋아할 것 이라 생각하지 않지만, 작품을 대중에게 선보임으로써 이를 함께 공유하고 팬덤을 만든다면 정말 좋을 것 같습니다.


Other Ways You Can Help

2150 프로젝트를 도울 수 있는 다른 방법들

If you can't donate, help us spread the word. If you're in Seoul or Korea and you have a special talent that you'd like to donate to the project, like a make-up artist, or if you are a prop maker or costume designer, and want to donate some time or a project or two to this project to help improve it, we'd certainly be up for that. If you think that this comic might be interesting in your native language and you would be interested in having a go at a translation, we could entertain that as well.
만약 프로젝트를 위해 기부하기 어려운 상황이라면, 홍보에 동참해주세요. 또한 여러분이 서울이나 한국에 거주하고 있고 특별한 재능이 있다면, 저희 프로젝트를 위해 그 재능을 기부해주시면 큰 힘이 될 것 같습니다. 만약 여러분이 메이크업 아티스트이거나, 소품장비나 의상을 제작할 수 있거나, 시간을 투자해서 저희 프로젝트에 참여할 수 있다면, 더욱 퀄리티 있는 Seoul 2150을 만드는데 동참해주세요. 또한 이 프로젝트에 흥미를 느껴 모국어로 번역하고 싶다거나 번역업무에 흥미가 있다면, 저희 프로젝트에 동참하여 경험을 쌓는 것 자체가 여러분에게 색다른 경험이 될 것입니다.

합니다.For this reason Seoul 2150 looks to stand apart from traditional photo comics and webcomics as well. The comic will be produced in a traditional western comic book style of around 30 pages with a cover and splash page. Funds permitting we will do limited runs of hard copies for each issue. In the beginning this comic will run in Korean and English, but other languages are being looked at as well.  따라서 Seoul 2150은 기존의 사진을 엮어 만든 만화와 웹툰과는 다르다고 볼 수 있습니다.  또한, Seoul 2150은 일반적인 서양의 만화 스타일을 따르기 때문에, 매 커버는 30페이지 분량이며 스플래시 페이지를 포함합니다. 재정적인 한계가 있는 관계로, 한정된 수량만을 출판할 예정입니다. 비록 지금은 한국어와 영어로만
작품이 소개되지만, 이후에는 더 많은
외국어로 번역될 예정입니다. 



Who are we? 우리는 누굴까요?


We are Posinoir Comics, a group of many people who have given our time and effort to producing the the first demo issue which will be available to read in both Korean and English. 
많은 사람들이 모여 수 많은
시간과 노력을 쏟아 첫 번째 데모 작품을 한국어와 영어로 소개하기 위해 모인 ‘Posinoir Comics’ 그룹입니다.
Matthew Cross is a photographer, editor, writer, and digital illustrator. He conceived of the idea about a year ago after testing different kinds of shooting styles and editing in the studio and managed to convince everyone else that this was worth a shot. 크로스매튜는 사진작가이며 에디터인 동시에 디지털 일러스트레이터입니다. 스튜디오에서 다양한 스타일의 사진 촬영과 편집작업을 하던 그는 Seoul 2150을 제작해야겠다는 생각을 떠올리게 되었고, 이는 다른 사람들의 두터운 공감대를 형성하였습니다. 그리하여 본격적인 작품 제작에 돌입하게 되었습니다. 
Kristine Lee is a text book translator by day and, hopefully, about to lead the way in bringing the noir style to the Korean language. While noir themes exist in many Korean films, the speech and narrative style wasn't so easy to replicate. Kristine was able to make the story flow and keep its nuances during translation. Kristine Lee는 번역가입니다. 수 많은 한국영화 속에서 느와르 장르가 소개되었지만, 그 말투와 문체는 정통 느와르 스타일을 따라가기엔 조금 무리가 있습니다. Kristine은 Seoul 2150을 번역하며 스토리 전개를 매끄럽게 전개하며 동시에, 느와르만의 뉘앙스를 생생하게 전달했습니다.
We are backed by a host of individuals willing to stand in funny positions or do somersaults while jumping off large wooden blocks onto mattresses over and over just to get a shot. From the main characters to the extras, everyone is ready to do their best. 

Seoul 2150 제작에 수 많은 사람들이 자발적으로 참여하였습니다. 참여자들은 나무
상자에서 미리 준비된 매트리스 위로 여러 차례 뛰어내리는 등 완벽한 사진을 촬영하기 위해 노력했습니다. 주인공과 엑스트라 모두 최고의 작품을 만들기 위해 고군분투 했습니다. 


  What We Need & What You Get
Seoul2150이 필요한 것과 여러분이 얻는 것
What do we need? We need money of course. We need money to pay for things like equipment, studio and production costs, models, advertising, printing of the comic, and all the things associated with getting a sustainable business off the ground. Specifically we are intending to use the money for:
A new editing computer, way more of everything to speed up and improve work flow

A new camera to produce larger and higher quality images to aid in creating better panels
New props and costumes. 

Compensation for models and staff. 

Online advertising to help raise brand awareness
Digital assets like backgrounds or 3D models that will be used in composition.

저희가 필요한 것이 과연 무엇일까요? 물론 돈이겠죠. 장비, 제작 비용, 모델,
광고, 출판 등 Seoul 2150을 여러분께 소개시키기 위해 필요한 모든 것들을 갖추기 위한 자금이 필요합니다. 제작 비용에 대해 더욱 자세하게 말씀 드리자면,

작업을 더욱 효율적으로 빠르게 진행할 수 있는 새로운 에디팅 컴퓨터
더욱 뛰어난 패널을 만드는 데 있어 핵심인 크고 생생한 이미지를
     담아낼 수 있는 카메라
새로운 도구와 의상
모델과 스텝들에게 제공될 상금
작품을 알리기 위한 온라인 광고 비용
만화 속 구성으로 쓰일 3D 모델이나 배경화면 작업에 투입될 디지털 에셋들



What do you get? You will get regular issues of Seoul 2150 so long as we have the funds and interest to keep making them. We hope to turn this in to a very long term project and story.그렇다면 여러분은 무엇을 얻게 될까요? 재정적인 여유와 다른 조건들이 유지되는 한, 정기적으로 발행되는 Seoul 2150을 구독하실 수 있습니다.그리고 저희들은 이 프로젝트가 장기적인 작업이 되길 바랍니다.
You also can read the full 20 page demo comic right now in Korean or English.
지금 20페이지 분량의 Seoul 2150 데모 버전을 읽어보실 수 있습니다.

Read the English version here

한국어 만화 여기 다운해요


  The Impact 영향력

What are you really going to do by donating? By donating you're going to help further a genre. When this project was first conceived, some wrote it off as a little crazy. Photographers from time to time will do up a handful photos from a shoot in a comic style, the idea of doing an entire book this way was written off as simply unfeasible. We think we've shown them wrong. Our demo issue covered a wide variety of situations from action, to dialog and from humans to death dealing security drones. Some panels are mostly photography and others are entirely digital illustration. We've shown that it is more than possible for even a small team to produce this. 여러분이 Seoul 2150을 위해 기부한다는 것은 무엇을 의미할까요? 새로운 장르를 개발시키는데 기여한다는 것을 의미합니다.  Seoul 2150 프로젝트를 구상했을 때, 몇몇의 사람들은 매우 회의적이었습니다. 사진작가들이 종종 코믹스타일의 사진을 찍기는 하지만, 사진들을 엮어 만화로 출판한다는 아이디어 자체를 비현실적으로 보았습니다.
그러나 우리는 그들이 틀렸다는 것을 입증했습니다. 저희들이 소개한 데모버전은 다양한 상황을 생동감 있게 전하는 액션과 대화, 무인정찰기와 관련된 죽음과 인간으로 구성되어있습니다.몇몇의 패널들은 주로 사진으로 만들어졌으며, 때로는 모두 디지털 일러스트레이션만으로 완성되기도 했습니다.
저희들은 이러한 작품을 작은 팀들이 만들 수 있다는 것을 입증했습니다. 
Funding will allow us not only to continue the project, but improve it as well. Through funding we will be able to buy better props and costumes, get more people involved, and through time we will be able to explore and improve the narrative process and the quality and style of the editing. We're certainly not as good as we want to be. 재정적인 지원이 있다면 이 프로젝트를 계속 진행할 수 있을 뿐만 아니라 질을 향상시킬 수 있을
것입니다. 즉, 더욱 많은 장비와 의상을 구비하고, 더욱 많은 사람들이 동참할 수 있을 것이며, 더욱 흥미로운 스토리와 훌륭한 퀄리티의 에디팅을
선보일 수 있을 것이라 생각합니다. 그러나 충분한 자금이 없는 지금은 저희들이 목표하는 뛰어난 작품을 선보일 수 없는 상황입니다.
We are also hoping to explore some aspects of Korea within the context of the story. We are hoping to include some Korean traditional areas, treasures, assets, culture and incorporate things like lesser known weapon based Korean martial arts in to the comic.Seoul 2150을 선보임으로써, 저희들은 스토리에 한국적인 요소를 담고자 합니다.
한국의 전통적인 장소들, 국보, 자산,
무형자산들을 선보여 더욱 널리 알리고자 합니다.

  Risks & Challenges 위험 & 도전
Luckily with a focused project like this, the risks are lower. The biggest risk we run into may be scheduling issues, or things like that. So long as the pictures have been shot the comic will come out. There are only a couple of points of failure in getting this from concept to a finished edition, shooting the images, editing the images and translating the text. Barring major illness, nothing should interfere with that part of the process. 다행스럽게도 이렇게 심혈을 기울인 프로젝트의 위험부담은 작습니다. 그러나 저희가 생각하는 가장 큰 위험요소는 발행일을 맞추지 못하는 상황입니다. 하지만 이 문제는 사진 촬영 작업이 지연되지 않는 한, 해결될 것입니다. 뿐만 아니라 성공을 장담할 수 없는 또 다른 요인들이 존재하기도 합니다. Seoul 2150을 완성작으로 만드는 것, 사진을 찍고 이미지를 편집하는 것 그리고 만화를 번역하는 것이 어려울
수도 있습니다. 그러나 가장 큰 문제점들을 해결할 수 있는 방안을 마련한다면, 그 어떤 것도 Seoul 2150의 성공의 걸림돌이 되지 않을 것입니다.
The challenge we face is finding our audience. Seoul 2150 is something we believe in and while it might not be for everyone, we hope getting it out there will allow us to start sharing it with others and build up a community of fans. 저희들에게 도전이란, Seoul 2150을 좋아할 많은 독자를 보유하는
것입니다. Seoul 2150은 개성이 뚜렷한 작품이기에 모든 독자들이 좋아할 것 이라 생각하지 않지만, 작품을 대중에게 선보임으로써 이를 함께 공유하고 팬덤을 만든다면
정말 좋을 것 같습니다.


  Other Ways You Can Help 

2150 프로젝트를 도울 수 있는 다른 방법들If you can't donate, help us spread the word. If you're in Seoul or Korea and you have a special talent that you'd like to donate to the project, like a make-up artist, or if you are a prop maker or costume designer, and want to donate some time or a project or two to this project to help improve it, we'd certainly be up for that. If you think that this comic might be interesting in your native language and you would be interested in having a go at a translation, we could entertain that as well. 만약 프로젝트를 위해 기부하기 어려운 상황이라면, 홍보에 동참해주세요. 또한 여러분이 서울이나 한국에 거주하고 있고 특별한 재능이 있다면, 저희 프로젝트를 위해 그 재능을 기부해주시면 큰 힘이 될 것 같습니다.
만약 여러분이 메이크업 아티스트이거나, 소품장비나 의상을 제작할 수 있거나,
시간을 투자해서 저희 프로젝트에 참여할 수 있다면, 더욱 퀄리티 있는 Seoul 2150을 만드는데 동참해주세요. 또한 이 프로젝트에 흥미를
느껴 모국어로 번역하고 싶다거나 번역업무에 흥미가 있다면, 저희 프로젝트에 동참하여 경험을 쌓는 것 자체가 여러분에게 색다른 경험이 될 것입니다.

story:
Wait! You're finally doing a Booty collection? What took so long?

Yes! The oft-discussed never-yet-published Booty collection is finally happening!

 My name's Anne and I'm an artist based in Western MA. I started an autobio comic in 1995 called booty to document my day-to-day life after finishing college, going to work in the woods for a little while, and then on to graduate school. And then back to that little college in the woods to work, and then on to life as a working professional (well, sort of) and so on. 20 years later, my drawing's gotten a lot better (thankfully) but the book's still kind of crabby. Differently crabby, I swear!

The collection's going to include some of the really not-great comics reaching back to the beginning of booty as well as pieces I've done for anthologies like the Trees & Hills collections, Not My Small Diary, CROQ, and a bunch of other projects here and there over the years. The chance to finally get them all in the same place after 20 years is kind of awesome. 


What's with the title?

Well, when I first named the comic way way back in 1995, "booty" pretty much made me laugh anytime I said it. Turns out it still does. 

What I Need & What You Get

Otherwise known as the money stuff...

I'm printing with Lulu.com because of their flexible publication options and because they did a great job with What You Don't Get. My goal is to do a signed and numbered first printing of between 150 and 200 books, to have stock to bring to various shows and distribution networks and also to get the books to my backers. Each book costs about $6 to produce -- about $900 to about $1200 depending on final page counts (around 128 digest-size pages is my projection; we're at a page count of 117 without any new material) and total final copies.

$350 of this campaign covers the cost of the lengthy and tedious process of converting the 100+ drawn pages into a digital format. In the interest of finishing in a timely fashion, I'm getting some help from a fellow artist on this one, because I want to support another working artist as part of this project.

The last $400 of this proposal covers the assorted shipping costs of getting books to me and then getting the books to you (postage costs about $3 per copy in the US, and international is $12! Ooof!) and various other expenses (mailers, promotional material, sample copies, fundraising fees, etc.) associated with printing a long form book and crowdsourcing the funding.


I'm also using a little of the last of the What You Don't Get money to cover some of the expenses of this book, so this campaign is a little less expensive than the previous run.

Perks!

Everyone loves perks. I wanted to do a combination of cool things and essential things -- so the perks are both practical and quirky.

What if...

My goal is to finish this book no matter what happens with the fundraising. So if I don't hit my minimum goal, there will still be something in your mailbox. I'm using this crowdfunding plan as a way to get the collection done; that accountability is a major part of why I chose the flexible funding option rather than the fixed all-or-nothing funding option.

The Impact

The guts of the book are done. I'm going to add some new material here and there, and add in some explanations, but it's also going to include stuff that hasn't really seen daylight since, uh, 1997 or so...

Other Ways You Can Help!

Even if you can't donate, you can still help. Sharing the link among your social networks to get the word out is incredibly helpful.  I'll update this site with sketches and news as the project moves forward so you can stay in touch and watch how it goes -- and maybe see some of those not-great comics from way-back...

(there's a bunch in the gallery. go have a look!)

thanks, folks.

Anne

story:
Come aboard on our next adventure!  We're using Indiegogo for pre-orders of Issue #2 as well as for some wonderful Wolverton merch!

 

 

In turn of the century London, Jack Wolverton, gentleman thief, specializes in stealing the arcane, the accursed and the occultic. With war about to break out, only he can stop the world’s most powerful artifacts (The Monkey’s Paw, The Hope Diamond and the Portrait of Dorian Gray) from falling into the wrong hands!

Wolverton, Thief of Impossible Objects is a fresh but familiar take on a beloved literary trope, the Gentleman Thief. We've seen his likes before: Raffles, Arsene Lupin, The Saint, Catwoman, Gambit and Cary Grant in To Catch a Thief.

 

 

The twist is Jack Wolverton, aka the Black Cat, specializes in stealing only magical items. The twist to the twist is that he really, really hates magic, relying only on his wit and the science supplied to him by H.G. Wells.

Set in Edwardian London, the natty Wolverton is suave, sophisticated and well bred. His banter, like his tailoring, is impeccable. We certainly hope there's room for a Noel Coward super hero in a world gone Deadpool!

 

 

In the next installment, oh good and faithful reader, you'll be introduced to gadget gadfly, H.G. Wells, learn more about the absolutely ancient order of The Golden Dawn, and lay your peepers on Inspector Munroe of Scotland Yard, Wolverton's romantic foil for the irresistible Isabelle's attention

 

 

"This beautiful, action-packed book demonstrates the versatility of comic book storytelling." -- Geek The News

"Wolverton: Thief of Impossible Objects #1 is a fun and energetic read. Jack Wolverton is a charming protagonist, the premise is entertaining, and the art is fantastic." -- Bleeding Cool

"Stark and Garrett’s story is excellent. It’s fast, it’s fun, it’s engaging, and the action is great." -- Comic Bastards

 

 

"Dauntless Durham-style cliffhangers enacted against cinematic vistas in a tale of a gentleman thief. Wit and style abound. Hopefully this will become a continuing saga. "-- The Best Comics of 2017 List, The Comics Journal

"Beautifully rendered locations and rollicking action panels frame this stylish post Victorian escapade. Reminiscent of such movie greats as Errol Flynn, our droll hero is a thief... and WHAT A THIEF! Kudos, guys, you've brought the 'gentleman thief' back into vogue and with a vengeance!”-- Emil Ferris, Author of My Favorite Things is Monsters

"Only the épée is missing. Wolverton relies upon stealth, wit, and cunning, wise-cracking all the while. " -- Word Comicbook Review

“Enter the realm of adventurers and draw a line from Indiana Jones to The Escapist. Good. Now go squarely in the middle and mark a big, fat X. That's the precise location where you'll find Wolverton, a fun, funny, raucous new comic. Just remember that X doesn't mark the end of this journey, but the beginning.”-- Van Jensen, Writer for DC’s The Flash and Green Lantern Corps

"Fresh, funny and exciting. These are comic pages that insist on being turned.” -- Michael Tisserand, author of Krazy: George Herriman, a Life in Black and White

 

 

  OUR WRITERS, MICHAEL AND TERRELL

 

Michael Stark and Terrell T. Garrett are just two guys south of the Atlanta airport (now know as Hillbilly Hollywood) who’ve consumed way too many comic books, wrestling matches, monster movie marathons, ultra-violent video games and tawdry-covered paperbacks.

Together, they've written a half dozen insanely-expensive-to-produce screenplays that they hope to one day reverse engineer into more comic books, including a pot head version of The Day of The Triffids and the rollicking misadventures of Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show in Victorian London! The screenplay of Wolverton got the duo on both the prestigious Hollywood Hit List and The Young and Hungry List.

 

Michael Stark (the elder of the duo) played in various 1980s NYC punk and garage bands, wrote for the national music magazine, Request, and later optioned a few original screenplays to Disney and Universal. He now owns a bookstore in the shadows of Pinewood Studios, specializing in rare horror and science fiction. He's currently shopping around a horror comedy TV pilot, Avenue C Exorcist.

Terrell T. Garrett is a former video game designer and eSports champion. He has short stories published in the Georgia State Review and The Ankeny Briefcase. His solo script, Twitch, brought him to Sundance two years ago and he's currency adapting the Alistair MacLean novel, Fear is the Key for the big screen. He's also working on his first novel!

 

OUR NEW ARTIST, JACKIE LEWIS

Jackie Lewis is a comic book creator from Atlanta. Growing up, she spent most of her time drawing monsters and building forts in the woods. Now, she's thrilled that she gets to draw both of those things professionally. Jackie's published works include The Lion of Rora, Play Ball and Merry Men for Oni Press. She is a former professor of Sequential Art at the renowned SCAD University.

 

 

OUR COVER ARTIST, DEREK RODENBECK

This has been an exciting year for our brother-in-arms, Derek. He has gone back to University and is a proud, new dad. So, unfortunately, he couldn't stay a full-time member of Team Wolverton. Derek will, however, draw us another knockout cover.

 

 

 

WOLVERTON POSTCARD SET

 

EXCLUSIVE WOLVERTON PRINTS

 

 

Risks and challenges

 

The risks seem very limited.  We reached our goal already. These pre-orders are just gravy! 

Of course, pirates could attack our slow boat across the High China Seas. So, let's all pray there won't be pirates!

We'll be using Kraken to print 3,000 copies of our full-cover, 28-page comic book. 600 copies will be airmailed to us for rewards distribution, promotion, direct sales and distribution to our local Atlanta area shoppes.
story_txt:
Come aboard on our next adventure!  We're using Indiegogo for pre-orders of Issue #2 as well as for some wonderful Wolverton merch!
 

 
In turn of the century London, Jack Wolverton, gentleman thief, specializes in stealing the arcane, the accursed and the occultic. With war about to break out, only he can stop the world’s most powerful artifacts (The Monkey’s Paw, The Hope Diamond and the Portrait of Dorian Gray) from falling into the wrong hands!
Wolverton, Thief of Impossible Objects is a fresh but familiar take on a beloved literary trope, the Gentleman Thief. We've seen his likes before: Raffles, Arsene Lupin, The Saint, Catwoman, Gambit and Cary Grant in To Catch a Thief.
 

 
The twist is Jack Wolverton, aka the Black Cat, specializes in stealing only magical items. The twist to the twist is that he really, really hates magic, relying only on his wit and the science supplied to him by H.G. Wells.
Set in Edwardian London, the natty Wolverton is suave, sophisticated and well bred. His banter, like his tailoring, is impeccable. We certainly hope there's room for a Noel Coward super hero in a world gone Deadpool!
 

 
In the next installment, oh good and faithful reader, you'll be introduced to gadget gadfly, H.G. Wells, learn more about the absolutely ancient order of The Golden Dawn, and lay your peepers on Inspector Munroe of Scotland Yard, Wolverton's romantic foil for the irresistible Isabelle's attention
 

 
"This beautiful, action-packed book demonstrates the versatility of comic book storytelling." -- Geek The News
"Wolverton: Thief of Impossible Objects #1 is a fun and energetic read. Jack Wolverton is a charming protagonist, the premise is entertaining, and the art is fantastic." -- Bleeding Cool
"Stark and Garrett’s story is excellent. It’s fast, it’s fun, it’s engaging, and the action is great." -- Comic Bastards
 
 
"Dauntless Durham-style cliffhangers enacted against cinematic vistas in a tale of a gentleman thief. Wit and style abound. Hopefully this will become a continuing saga. "-- The Best Comics of 2017 List, The Comics Journal
"Beautifully rendered locations and rollicking action panels frame this stylish post Victorian escapade. Reminiscent of such movie greats as Errol Flynn, our droll hero is a thief... and WHAT A THIEF! Kudos, guys, you've brought the 'gentleman thief' back into vogue and with a vengeance!”-- Emil Ferris, Author of My Favorite Things is Monsters
"Only the épée is missing. Wolverton relies upon stealth, wit, and cunning, wise-cracking all the while. " -- Word Comicbook Review

“Enter the realm of adventurers and draw a line from Indiana Jones to The Escapist. Good. Now go squarely in the middle and mark a big, fat X. That's the precise location where you'll find Wolverton, a fun, funny, raucous new comic. Just remember that X doesn't mark the end of this journey, but the beginning.”-- Van Jensen, Writer for DC’s The Flash and Green Lantern Corps
"Fresh, funny and exciting. These are comic pages that insist on being turned.” -- Michael Tisserand, author of Krazy: George Herriman, a Life in Black and White
 

 
  OUR WRITERS, MICHAEL AND TERRELL

 
Michael Stark and Terrell T. Garrett are just two guys south of the Atlanta airport (now know as Hillbilly Hollywood) who’ve consumed way too many comic books, wrestling matches, monster movie marathons, ultra-violent video games and tawdry-covered paperbacks.
Together, they've written a half dozen insanely-expensive-to-produce screenplays that they hope to one day reverse engineer into more comic books, including a pot head version of The Day of The Triffids and the rollicking misadventures of Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show in Victorian London! The screenplay of Wolverton got the duo on both the prestigious Hollywood Hit List and The Young and Hungry List.
 

Michael Stark (the elder of the duo) played in various 1980s NYC punk and garage bands, wrote for the national music magazine, Request, and later optioned a few original screenplays to Disney and Universal. He now owns a bookstore in the shadows of Pinewood Studios, specializing in rare horror and science fiction. He's currently shopping around a horror comedy TV pilot, Avenue C Exorcist.
Terrell T. Garrett is a former video game designer and eSports champion. He has short stories published in the Georgia State Review and The Ankeny Briefcase. His solo script, Twitch, brought him to Sundance two years ago and he's currency adapting the Alistair MacLean novel, Fear is the Key for the big screen. He's also working on his first novel!
 
OUR NEW ARTIST, JACKIE LEWIS
Jackie Lewis is a comic book creator from Atlanta. Growing up, she spent most of her time drawing monsters and building forts in the woods. Now, she's thrilled that she gets to draw both of those things professionally. Jackie's published works include The Lion of Rora, Play Ball and Merry Men for Oni Press. She is a former professor of Sequential Art at the renowned SCAD University.
 

 
OUR COVER ARTIST, DEREK RODENBECK
This has been an exciting year for our brother-in-arms, Derek. He has gone back to University and is a proud, new dad. So, unfortunately, he couldn't stay a full-time member of Team Wolverton. Derek will, however, draw us another knockout cover.
 

 

 
WOLVERTON POSTCARD SET
 
EXCLUSIVE WOLVERTON PRINTS
 

 
Risks and challenges
 
The risks seem very limited.  We reached our goal already. These pre-orders are just gravy! 
Of course, pirates could attack our slow boat across the High China Seas. So, let's all pray there won't be pirates!
We'll be using Kraken to print 3,000 copies of our full-cover, 28-page comic book. 600 copies will be airmailed to us for rewards distribution, promotion, direct sales and distribution to our local Atlanta area shoppes.

story:
Hello!


Hello, my name is Bec, thank you for taking a look at my fundraiser! I am an aspiring comic artist, and would love to get my career off the ground with my latest comic 'Succubitch'.

 

About Succubitch


Succubitch is a comic about Mel, a Succubus that enjoys nothing more than luring out male victims from local strip clubs, and everything seems to be going well, until a rag tag group of angels show up in town and try to steal her work at the club. A scrap over who dances the pole turns into something much more serious. (NOTE: There wont be any explicit content in the first issue of the comic, this means no explicit sexual activity, it will be suggested but at least in the first issue or two there will be no explicit adult content, bar a bit of blood of course). 

The first issue I'm hoping will be about 30-40 pages long, and will include Mel, the group of angels (Lolly (Miranda), Sugar (Rebecca) and Candycane (the name's a mystery!)) and a series of male victims who all fall for their tricks and charms!

Depending on how much funding I get, I can either have Succbitch printed in monochrome (similar to the sexy as hell Mel on the pole you cans ee) or B&W (which will still be impressive but I personally prefer monochrome). The cover will be in colour if I get enough funding.

 

About the author/illustrator

My name's Bec, and I've had a love for art since I was young. I've come a long way from my zombie obsession at eight years old, and I have made a lot of progress with my art, and I'm confident a career in comic art is definitely a path I would like to take.

Succubitch will be my first physically printed comic if funding goes well, though I can't work on it full-time just yet. There's a preview of the comic in the image gallery if you'd like to take a peek.

 

Thanks for looking, and I hope you like the perks!

 

NOTE: Some extra information about the 'add your character' perks:

Characters must be humanoid, no furry characters (anthro or feral animals), werewolf is acceptable.

Characters must NOT be copyrighted! I will check.

You must provide a reference of your character. Detailed decriptions are fine, but do not blame me if the character does not look as perfect as you were imagining it if all I have to base the character on is words.

Your character can be another succubus/incubus/angel, but this wont grant them a huge part in the story.

No immortality or ridiculously overpowered abilities will be included. Also unless specified you would rather not, the character will most likely die after their feature is over.

Roles can be discussed. 

 

Dog tag

story:
Campaign Overview

FOR ADULTS ONLY

Smashed Comics is a comedy comic magazine, which is inspired by "gross-out" animation shows (late 1990's/early 2000's) and comics like Mad Magazine and Pyton Magazine (Norway).

It's be filled with pages of a lot of jokes.

     

    NEW COVER ART:

    After some thoughts and noticing some issues with the original cover we decided to redo parts of the cover. The New Cover will be the one that all the copies of Smashed Comics comes in.

     

    Most of the comic is Drawn by me, Franz, but we also got a couple of wonderful artist contributing on it, such as:

    • SemajZ - @_SemajZ_
    • Geneva - @art__garbage
    • Lord Byron

     

      On to the next comic:

      The NOBODIES (NObdYS) is a comedy comic about a group of nobodies who decides they want to make a comic together. Yeah, it's a little bit meta. Since making comics costs money and they are a cast of silly characters, their journey takes alot of strange turns to make comic.

      Will they Succeed or will they give up?  

      Cover art by: Jelloster (@Droopyeyeballs)

      This comic started back in 2019 as a collaboration between me and 2 of my friends and quickly became a passion project for me and because of Patreon and my supporters there, they made it possible to make it into a thing for a while. However a lot of changes happened so we completely rewrote the entire thing and changed styles.

       

      Early redesign from late 2018

       

      Drawn by: Franz L.

      Written by: Franz L, TheKillingJokha and Disky Fringo.

      Additional help from: Lord Byron.

       

       

      NEW PERK:

       

      SHAKES CALENDAR:

      Based on a character made by me and TheKillingJokha. A calendar of Shakes The Hobo is something a lot of people has been asking for over the last year and a half.


       

       

      What Do You Get From Pledging?

       

      STRETCH GOALS!

      • 10`000 NOK (934 USD): Everyone gets a Free Copy of Lord Byrons one-shot book: Terry Tuffcunt!

      NEXT:

      • 16312 NOK (1'500 USD): I'll sign the ALL of Copies of Smashed Comics.

      • 21750 NOK (2'000 USD): Additional 2 Pages on Smashed Comics!

       

      ... AND MORE STRECH GOAL WILL BE ADDED AS WE GO!

       

       

       

      Just trying to be realistic with my goals

        

       

      You Want More Perks?

      Send me suggestions either on Twitter or in one of my live-streams on YouTube and we'll see what we can do!

       

      Not Quite Your Cup of Tea, But You Want To Help?

      That's fine, but what you could do is share the campaign around on social media, tell people you think would like these comic. Anything to spread the word would help so much.

      I genuinely am thankful for each and every one of you who took your time to reading this campaign, all I ever wanted was to give people a chance to read my silly comics. 

       

      You Got Questions For Me?

      Tweet them @NoFinalBlackout on Twitter

story:
AGGIORNAMENTO: Con il raggiungimento del 100%, tutti i sostenitori fino al termine della campagna otterranno in aggiunta: 1 ADESIVO CON NINO, 1 SPILLETTA CON IL LOGO DI CAPITAN NAPOLI E IL FUMETTO DOLLSHELL! 
 

RITORNA CAPITAN NAPOLI! 
Nino, alle prese con i suoi superpoteri ha ancora voglia di vendetta, ma da solo il suo piano non può funzionare. Chi saranno i suoi alleati per la guerra che si sta per scatenare a Napoli? Vecchie conoscenze e nuovi ostacoli attendono il ragazzo dai pugni tellurici che dovrà, ancora una volta, fare i conti con il suo passato.

Il volume 2 di Capitan Napoli “Conseguenze” (80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, a colori) è edito da Remer Comics, casa editrice veneziana che pubblica l’etichetta dedicati ai supereroi italiani “Capitani Italiani”. Questo nuovo volume è stato realizzato da autori professionisti che fin dall’inizio hanno creduto in questa adrenalinica storia di supereroi e villain napoletani.

Ecco tutto il team completo:
Sceneggiatura: Antonio Sepe
Disegni: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite), Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions), Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology), Vincenzo Carratù (Dynamite, American Mithology), Raffaele Ricciardi (Big Punch Studio).
Colori: Adele Matera, Alessandra Baccaglini, Francesca Carotenuto, Arianna Consonni
Lettering: Antonio Esposito (Rw Lion, Behemoth Comics)




 

#EROINSIEME

Questa è la nostra prima campagna crowdfunding e, visto il periodo particolare che stiamo vivendo, abbiamo voluto darle un nome: #eroinsieme!
In questo ultimo anno siamo stati tutti messi a dura prova da un nemico invisibile che ci ha colpiti alle spalle senza preavviso e senza riserve. Ma non possiamo e non dobbiamo fermarci!
Noi, come tanti artisti di ogni campo e genere, stiamo cercando di rialzarci. Insieme all'Italia tutta.
Con #eroinsieme vogliamo voltare pagina e proprio dietro questa nuova pagina c'è il seguito di un eroe, che, come tante altre storie, il momento storico in cui viviamo ha bloccato. Ma ora è il momento di far venire fuori la sua storia, la storia di ogni eroe e possiamo farlo solo tutti noi. Insieme!
Infatti, grazie al tuo sostegno il secondo volume potrà vedere la luce e continuare a raccontare la storia Nino e di una Napoli in subbuglio, teatro di scontri tra forze del bene e del male.
E non solo!

Sostenere questo progetto significa non solo poter proseguire il percorso editoriale di Capitan Napoli e sostenere il mercato dell’editoria italiana indipendente duramente colpita dalla crisi, ma anche dare un aiuto concreto a realtà che hanno sofferto ancor di più questo periodo di emergenza sanitaria e conseguente isolamento, realtà in cui un abbraccio può fare veramente la differenza.
Così abbiamo deciso che una parte del ricavato verrà devoluta alla cooperativa sociale "Hope”, una casa famiglia costruita per dare aiuto a tanti ragazzi abbandonati dalle proprie famiglie. Anche per questo #eroinsieme ci sembra più di un semplice crowdfunding.

Potrai sostenere la campagna scegliendo tra tanti diversi perk che abbiamo pensato per accontentare davvero tutti pensando a cosa vi sarebbe piaciuto trovare in una fiera del fumetto! Potete vedere tutti i perk con i dettagli sia qui a lato che più sotto.

Sappiamo che non tutti potranno supportare la stampa di questo secondo volume contribuendo con denaro. In questo caso, potrai sostenere questo progetto anche solo condividendo questa campagna con i tuoi amici e altri fan appassionati di fumetti via e-mail, o Twitter, Instagram, Facebook o qualsiasi altrosocial media che possa aiutarci a spargere la voce il più possibile. Insieme trasformeremo Capitan Napoli Vol. 2 in realtà!

Ed eccoci ai dodici perk di questa campagna!
Qui sotto potrete trovare tutte le informazioni e i dettagli.
IMPORTANTE: tutti i costi non includono 5€ di spese di spedizioni. Le spedizioni sono solo per l'Italia.
Come vedrete, abbiamo voluto proporre diverse combinazioni non solo per chi è già fan di Capitan Napoli ma anche per chi desidera iniziare ad avventurarsi nella Napoli di Nino e dei suoi alleati. E soprattutto vorremmo darvi tutto quello che avreste potuto trovare al nostro stand in una fiera del fumetto!
Questo non toglie che ci rivedremo appena sarà possibile per una chiaccherata di persona e una birra in compagnia!

Perk #1 include solo Capitan Napoli vol.2 - "Conseguenze" 
[80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore]
Sceneggiatura: Antonio Sepe | Disegni: Pasquale Qualano, Claudio Avella, Vincenzo Carratù, Alessandro Miracolo, Raffaele Ricciardi | Cover: Vincenzo Federici | Colori: Adele Matera, Alessandra Baccaglini, Francesca Carotenuto, Arianna Consonni

Perk #2 - FAN PACK include Capitan Napoli Vol.2 
+ "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani. Gli eventi accaduti tra Venezia, Palermo e Napoli stanno sconvolgendo l’Italia intera. Mentre a Firenze è esplosa un’epidemia, a Roma si decide il futuro del N.I.S.A. e non solo... Un nuovo punto di partenza per iniziare a leggere le storie dei supereroi made in Italy dei CAPITANI ITALIANI. [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];
+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": Napoli, un futuro non troppo lontano. Pasquale De Andrea ha vinto le elezioni regionali, il suo dominio arriva fino ai palazzi della politica. O’Mast, come lo hanno soprannominato a Napoli, ha invaso e “contaminato” tutta la città con i suoi giochi di potere e il suo traffico illecito di rifiuti tossici. Chi salverà la città partenopea? Napoli ha bisogno del suo supereroe, ha bisogno di CAPITAN NAPOLI!
[80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore].

Perk #3 include Capitan Napoli Vol. 2
+ 1 Tazza "CLAN PIZZA" in ceramica bianca da 330 ml con una grafica esclusiva, appositamente realizzata per questa campagna. Fare colazione con questa tazza vi farà sentire subito dei NINJA!

Perk #4 FAN MUG PACK include Capitan Napoli Vol. 2
+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];
+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];
+ 1 Tazza "CLAN PIZZA" in ceramica bianca da 330 ml con una grafica esclusiva, appositamente realizzata per questa campagna. Fare colazione con questa tazza vi farà sentire subito dei NINJA!

Perk #5 include Capitan Napoli 2
+ Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite). Si tratta di una stampa su pannello accoppiato composto da superfici in alluminio bianco e un nucleo in politielene nero. Il materiale è rigido e resistente agli agenti atmosferici. La durata in esterno è di 3 anni ed illimitata in spazi interni!

Perk #5 - FAN SKETCH PACK include Capitan Napoli 2
+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];
+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];
+ 1 Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite). Si tratta di una stampa su pannello accoppiato composto da superfici in alluminio bianco e un nucleo in politielene nero. Il materiale è rigido e resistente agli agenti atmosferici. La durata in esterno è di 3 anni ed illimitata in spazi interni!

Perk #7 include Capitan Napoli 2
+ 1 T-shirt "NINO" a tiratura limitata dedicata a Nino e al suo caschetto da battaglia. La maglietta è in cotone 100% (ipoallergenico, resistente agli strappi e facilmente lavabile a mano o in lavatrice), il colore è blu navy ed è disponibile in due modelli: Uomo e Donna nelle taglie: S, M, L, XL, XL). Inoltre, è possibile avere la versione della maglietta per bambini (nelle taglie 3/4 anni, 5/6 anni, 7/8 anni, 9/11 anni, 12/14 anni), selezionando il perk "VOL.2 + T-SHIRT "NINO" (bambino)!

Perk #8 - FAN TEE PACK include Capitan Napoli 2
+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];
+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];
+ 1 T-shirt "NINO" a tiratura limitata dedicata a Nino e al suo caschetto da battaglia. La maglietta è in cotone 100% (ipoallergenico, resistente agli strappi e facilmente lavabile a mano o in lavatrice), il colore è blu navy ed è disponibile in due modelli: Uomo e Donna nelle taglie: S, M, L, XL, XL). Inoltre, è possibile avere la versione della maglietta per bambini (nelle taglie 3/4 anni, 5/6 anni, 7/8 anni, 9/11 anni, 12/14 anni), selezionando il perk "FAN TEE PACK (bambino)!

Perk #9 include Capitan Napoli 2 
+ 1 sketch di un personaggio di Capitan Napoli in A5 realizzato da uno dei seguenti artisti: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite)/ Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions)/ Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology)/ Vincenzo Carratù ( Dynamite, American Mithology)! 
N.B.: lo sketch sarà casuale, non è possibile scegliere l'autore.
*Tutte le immagini sono inserite a scopo illustrativo.

+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];
+ 1 Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite);
+ 1 sketch di un personaggio di Capitan Napoli in A5 di uno dei seguenti artisti: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite)/ Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions)/ Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology)/ Vincenzo Carratù ( Dynamite, American Mithology);
+ IL TUO CAMEO IN CAPITAN NAPOLI VOL.3!!

Perk #12 - FAN HERO PACK include Capitan Napoli 2
+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];
+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];
+ 1 Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite);
+ 1 sketch di un personaggio di Capitan Napoliin A5 di uno dei seguenti artisti: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite)/ Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions)/ Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology)/ Vincenzo Carratù ( Dynamite, American Mithology);
+1 Tazza bianca "CLAN PIZZA" in ceramica da 330 ml con una grafica esclusiva appositamente realizzata per questa campagna;
+ 1 T-shirt "NINO" a tiratura limitata dedicata a Nino e al suo caschetto da battaglia. La maglietta è in cotone 100%, il colore è blu navy nei modelli Uomo, Donna e Bambino;
+ IL TUO CAMEO IN CAPITAN NAPOLI VOL.3!!

 

Abbiamo indiviuato quattro step per questa campagna e grazie al vostro sostegno al 75% e al 100% della raccolta fondi tutti, ma proprio tutti, avranno una ricompensa! E anche oltre al 100% ci saranno delle fantastiche sorprese!!
Ovviamente vi terremo aggiornati frequentemente sull'andamento della campagna sui nostri social (Facebook e Intagram). INSIEME SAREMO TUTTI EROI!
story_txt: AGGIORNAMENTO: Con il raggiungimento del 100%, tutti i sostenitori fino al termine della campagna otterranno in aggiunta: 1 ADESIVO CON NINO, 1 SPILLETTA CON IL LOGO DI CAPITAN NAPOLI E IL FUMETTO DOLLSHELL!  RITORNA CAPITAN NAPOLI! Nino, alle prese con i suoi superpoteri ha ancora voglia di vendetta, ma da solo il suo piano non può funzionare. Chi saranno i suoi alleati per la guerra che si sta per scatenare a Napoli? Vecchie conoscenze e nuovi ostacoli attendono il ragazzo dai pugni tellurici che dovrà, ancora una volta, fare i conti con il suo passato.Il volume 2 di Capitan Napoli “Conseguenze” (80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, a colori) è edito da Remer Comics, casa editrice veneziana che pubblica l’etichetta dedicati ai supereroi italiani “Capitani Italiani”. Questo nuovo volume è stato realizzato da autori professionisti che fin dall’inizio hanno creduto in questa adrenalinica storia di supereroi e villain napoletani.Ecco tutto il team completo:Sceneggiatura: Antonio SepeDisegni: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite), Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions), Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology), Vincenzo Carratù (Dynamite, American Mithology), Raffaele Ricciardi (Big Punch Studio).Colori: Adele Matera, Alessandra Baccaglini, Francesca Carotenuto, Arianna ConsonniLettering: Antonio Esposito (Rw Lion, Behemoth Comics) #EROINSIEMEQuesta è la nostra prima campagna crowdfunding e, visto il periodo particolare che stiamo vivendo, abbiamo voluto darle un nome: #eroinsieme!In questo ultimo anno siamo stati tutti messi a dura prova da un nemico invisibile che ci ha colpiti alle spalle senza preavviso e senza riserve. Ma non possiamo e non dobbiamo fermarci!Noi, come tanti artisti di ogni campo e genere, stiamo cercando di rialzarci. Insieme all'Italia tutta.Con #eroinsieme vogliamo voltare pagina e proprio dietro questa nuova pagina c'è il seguito di un eroe, che, come tante altre storie, il momento storico in cui viviamo ha bloccato. Ma ora è il momento di far venire fuori la sua storia, la storia di ogni eroe e possiamo farlo solo tutti noi. Insieme!Infatti, grazie al tuo sostegno il secondo volume potrà vedere la luce e continuare a raccontare la storia Nino e di una Napoli in subbuglio, teatro di scontri tra forze del bene e del male.E non solo!Sostenere questo progetto significa non solo poter proseguire il percorso editoriale di Capitan Napoli e sostenere il mercato dell’editoria italiana indipendente duramente colpita dalla crisi, ma anche dare un aiuto concreto a realtà che hanno sofferto ancor di più questo periodo di emergenza sanitaria e conseguente isolamento, realtà in cui un abbraccio può fare veramente la differenza.Così abbiamo deciso che una parte del ricavato verrà devoluta alla cooperativa sociale "Hope”, una casa famiglia costruita per dare aiuto a tanti ragazzi abbandonati dalle proprie famiglie. Anche per questo #eroinsieme ci sembra più di un semplice crowdfunding.Potrai sostenere la campagna scegliendo tra tanti diversi perk che abbiamo pensato per accontentare davvero tutti pensando a cosa vi sarebbe piaciuto trovare in una fiera del fumetto! Potete vedere tutti i perk con i dettagli sia qui a lato che più sotto.Sappiamo che non tutti potranno supportare la stampa di questo secondo volume contribuendo con denaro. In questo caso, potrai sostenere questo progetto anche solo condividendo questa campagna con i tuoi amici e altri fan appassionati di fumetti via e-mail, o Twitter, Instagram, Facebook o qualsiasi altrosocial media che possa aiutarci a spargere la voce il più possibile. Insieme trasformeremo Capitan Napoli Vol. 2 in realtà!Ed eccoci ai dodici perk di questa campagna!Qui sotto potrete trovare tutte le informazioni e i dettagli.IMPORTANTE: tutti i costi non includono 5€ di spese di spedizioni. Le spedizioni sono solo per l'Italia.Come vedrete, abbiamo voluto proporre diverse combinazioni non solo per chi è già fan di Capitan Napoli ma anche per chi desidera iniziare ad avventurarsi nella Napoli di Nino e dei suoi alleati. E soprattutto vorremmo darvi tutto quello che avreste potuto trovare al nostro stand in una fiera del fumetto!Questo non toglie che ci rivedremo appena sarà possibile per una chiaccherata di persona e una birra in compagnia!Perk #1 include solo Capitan Napoli vol.2 - "Conseguenze" [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore]Sceneggiatura: Antonio Sepe | Disegni: Pasquale Qualano, Claudio Avella, Vincenzo Carratù, Alessandro Miracolo, Raffaele Ricciardi | Cover: Vincenzo Federici | Colori: Adele Matera, Alessandra Baccaglini, Francesca Carotenuto, Arianna ConsonniPerk #2 - FAN PACK include Capitan Napoli Vol.2 + "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani. Gli eventi accaduti tra Venezia, Palermo e Napoli stanno sconvolgendo l’Italia intera. Mentre a Firenze è esplosa un’epidemia, a Roma si decide il futuro del N.I.S.A. e non solo... Un nuovo punto di partenza per iniziare a leggere le storie dei supereroi made in Italy dei CAPITANI ITALIANI. [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": Napoli, un futuro non troppo lontano. Pasquale De Andrea ha vinto le elezioni regionali, il suo dominio arriva fino ai palazzi della politica. O’Mast, come lo hanno soprannominato a Napoli, ha invaso e “contaminato” tutta la città con i suoi giochi di potere e il suo traffico illecito di rifiuti tossici. Chi salverà la città partenopea? Napoli ha bisogno del suo supereroe, ha bisogno di CAPITAN NAPOLI![80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore].Perk #3 include Capitan Napoli Vol. 2+ 1 Tazza "CLAN PIZZA" in ceramica bianca da 330 ml con una grafica esclusiva, appositamente realizzata per questa campagna. Fare colazione con questa tazza vi farà sentire subito dei NINJA!Perk #4 FAN MUG PACK include Capitan Napoli Vol. 2+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];+ 1 Tazza "CLAN PIZZA" in ceramica bianca da 330 ml con una grafica esclusiva, appositamente realizzata per questa campagna. Fare colazione con questa tazza vi farà sentire subito dei NINJA!Perk #5 include Capitan Napoli 2+ Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite). Si tratta di una stampa su pannello accoppiato composto da superfici in alluminio bianco e un nucleo in politielene nero. Il materiale è rigido e resistente agli agenti atmosferici. La durata in esterno è di 3 anni ed illimitata in spazi interni!Perk #5 - FAN SKETCH PACK include Capitan Napoli 2+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];+ 1 Stampa in A4 in alluminio bianco in alta definizione autografata da Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite). Si tratta di una stampa su pannello accoppiato composto da superfici in alluminio bianco e un nucleo in politielene nero. Il materiale è rigido e resistente agli agenti atmosferici. La durata in esterno è di 3 anni ed illimitata in spazi interni!Perk #7 include Capitan Napoli 2+ 1 T-shirt "NINO" a tiratura limitata dedicata a Nino e al suo caschetto da battaglia. La maglietta è in cotone 100% (ipoallergenico, resistente agli strappi e facilmente lavabile a mano o in lavatrice), il colore è blu navy ed è disponibile in due modelli: Uomo e Donna nelle taglie: S, M, L, XL, XL). Inoltre, è possibile avere la versione della maglietta per bambini (nelle taglie 3/4 anni, 5/6 anni, 7/8 anni, 9/11 anni, 12/14 anni), selezionando il perk "VOL.2 + T-SHIRT "NINO" (bambino)!Perk #8 - FAN TEE PACK include Capitan Napoli 2+ Albo "Universo": Il punto di partenza per inziare a leggere tutti gli albi dei Capitani Italiani [32 pagine, Spillato, colore];+ Capitan Napoli Vol. 1 - "Curre curre guagliò": il primo capitolo della storia di Nino, alias Capitan Napoli! [80 pagine, cartonato, f.to 16,8×24 cm, colore];+ 1 T-shirt "NINO" a tiratura limitata dedicata a Nino e al suo caschetto da battaglia. La maglietta è in cotone 100% (ipoallergenico, resistente agli strappi e facilmente lavabile a mano o in lavatrice), il colore è blu navy ed è disponibile in due modelli: Uomo e Donna nelle taglie: S, M, L, XL, XL). Inoltre, è possibile avere la versione della maglietta per bambini (nelle taglie 3/4 anni, 5/6 anni, 7/8 anni, 9/11 anni, 12/14 anni), selezionando il perk "FAN TEE PACK (bambino)!Perk #9 include Capitan Napoli 2 + 1 sketch di un personaggio di Capitan Napoli in A5 realizzato da uno dei seguenti artisti: Pasquale Qualano (Dc, Marvel, Dynamite)/ Vincenzo "Viska" Federici (Dynamite, Dark Horse, Editions Reflexions)/ Alessandro Miracolo (Dark Horse, Dynamite, American Mithology)/ Vincenzo Carratù ( Dynamite, American Mithology)! N.B.: lo sketch sarà casuale, non è possibile scegliere l'autore.*Tutte le immagini sono inserite a scopo illustrativo. Perk #10 - story:
My Goal

To revive my webcomic; Airsoft Life of Terdz, and continue the rest of the story from the episode where I have stopped. 

Please check out my comics at: http://airsoftcomics.blogspot.com

My Story

Hi! My name is Ryan Subong and I am from the Iloilo City, Philippines. I am a father, a teacher, a programmer, an artist, and an Airsoft player.

My interest on reading online comics has led me to make my own Airsoft based webcomic: Airsoft Life of Terdz, and it became quite popular among the online community of Airsoft.

I started making it around year 2010 and posted it on my original website AirsoftComics.com. Because I became so busy with my other projects (the one that pays me), I only made 15 episodes for a few months before I decided to stop. The pressure of my job was so tight at that time that I forgot to renew my ownership of my website and I lost it to some domain scavengers.

I temporarily posted my existing comics to http://airsoftcomics.blogspot.com last 2011 just to keep it alive. Despite of not making new comics anymore, I am still receiving requests and questions if when I could continue the next episodes.

You see, I really like to make more episodes but my current situation has no room for it. The success of this campaign will change all that.

(P.S. I took me two years before I was able to get AirsofComics.com back) 


Contribution Breakdown

The only way for me to focus on making these comics is for me to replace my website development jobs. I can only give it up if I could swap it with something that requires somewhat the same amount work and nearly produce same amount of funds.

If you're going think deeply about it, a commitment of making 50 WEEKLY COMIC EPISODES for a WHOLE YEAR is actually a pretty serious job that demands hundreds of hours of accumulated work. 

I think I placed my current goal way too high, so I present to you below my revised Campaign Mid-Goals which is I believe very reasonable enough. There is no need to reach $3,900 to make this campaign successful and I will keep my promises for those who availed the perks. The number of comics and the frequency of release will however be proportional to the number of sponsors and advertisers committed.

My Campaign Mid-Goals



I used to draw my comics using the very old software Corel Draw 11 (2002) and I already lost my copy when my previous laptop gave up years ago. Though I still have my back-up template files, I need a new Corel Draw software so I don't have to re-learn how to draw my next comics on a free open-source drawing tools.

Here is what I am about to buy for $379.95 (plus $29.99 and $5.99 shipping to Asia)...

  www.amazon.com - Corel Draw 6x

I am currently hosting AirsoftComics.com on a shared hosting plan. While my hosting account does a decent job on a low traffic website, its performance suffers a lot when multiple viewers tries to access my site the same time. There were complains that my comics sometimes loads very slowly. 


 To solve this performance problem, I am also planning to transfer my web account and file on a VPS (Virtual Private Server) which is more powerful and efficient when it comes to hosting websites. This will cost me $480 a year (plus $120 for a $10/month Cpanel subscription)...

www.fastnext.com - VPS Hosting


What do you get from this?

  • First of all, you get to enjoy the rest of the webcomic weekly for the whole year of 2014. That is 50 comic episodes to look forward to.
  • Second, since this is a website that will draw thousand of online visitors, I will give you the privilege to be recognized as a sponsor and an advertiser. If you have a business or an organization that benefits from web exposure, then a link from my webcomic to your target site can really help you with that. Check out my perks at the right, and the related Webcomic Site Layout below. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread my campaign. The more people who knows about it, the greater the chance that this will succeed.

Thank you for reading all the way down here!!!
