story:
FIEND 24pg preview here: http://fiendcomic.blogspot.com/p/comic-issue-1.html

Fiend Character design sketch. I will polish this up soon.

The Story:

Not just a Horror story. Fiend is unique in that there are larger social messages in the guise of a horror story. It explores addiction, PTSD, and the human condition in a way not typical to the horror genre. When there is blood and guts in this story there can also be deeper meanings as well. Those who typically don't like Horror may like this book and those that do, will find what they're looking for and more in the new "Fiend."

Synopsis (for the entire series including books still to come)

Drake finds himself restrained when he wakes from his self imposed drug induced state. Nothing has been able to keep him from his chemical obsession. Today is no different. He runs from the past that haunts him but today everything is catching up. A booby trapped syringe is injected into his veins. Soon he will find that addiction has a cure. Forced into sobriety, Drake must now face the horrible events that sent him down the path of addiction. He must remember those who did unspeakable things to him. They are criminals and evil men. The injection has another effect. There's a horrible beast growing inside him and it possesses the keys to Drakes fixation. “It” wants control and it knows how to get it. It taunts Drake with "another way." Drake is given a taste but in an unconscious state the monster takes over. Drake's body takes the form of the monstrosity living within. When Drake reawakens he is returned to his human self but finds there's a heavy price for his new fix. Now he must decide if he will let the monster kill to get his high. He decides those responsible for his torment wont be true victims at all. Drake begins using his adversaries to replace the drugs that once got him high and for the same effect. When the haunting memories that he once numbed away, begin to permanently fade away as though they never even happened to him, will he still have the desire to use at all? Drake believes he has found his own cure for his addiction and nothing can stop him from obtaining it.

 

ABOUT ME:

My name is Lucas Wade. I've worked a long time to reach the day when I could share the stories I need to tell, but just when I thought the stars had aligned for me the unthinkable happened. A large part of every book that I had worked on for over 10 years was taken from me in a burglary. From what I can piece together from the information I've received, It's very likely that the art was all burned to hide the evidence. Either way I was told by the court system that apart from a small sketchbook that was recovered, I wouldn't be getting anymore back.

Imagine your dream being ripped away from you. Every time you put the pencil to paper, something deep in your gut tightens up in a visceral response because all you can think about is all that lost time and effort. You can't stop thinking about strangers going through all of your things and just taking whatever they want as they destroy anything they don't. Helping me by supporting this project would mean the world. If everything happens for a reason than you are here reading this for some reason right? Maybe it's to help set things right! Please contribute in anyway you can.


Where the Money goes:

  • If I raise less than $500 then the money will be spent on paper, ink, brushes, and supplies. I did all the writing, art, and lettering myself. If I raise enough money, some will go to a professional letterer to look over the existing job and either tell me to fix things or give me approval.

  • If I reach my goal of $500.00 then the money will be used to make sure the books are ready for print and see if a professional letterer would like to add anything to my books. The money will also go to help print promotional Items for conventions and any fees associated. I think this is nice because you have a chance to get additional items for free from the money you already spent if you go to these conventions.

  • If I exceed the goal of $500.00 then I would like to enlist the help of other artists for some pin-ups to help me replace those from the burglary. Any money beyond that will be saved to go towards the printing of the first single issue. Printing typically exceeds $1000 for a single issue. If I receive more than that then the second, third and Volume 1 are next in line for printing. :)

 

Thanks for the Help!

With so much going against me, you can't possible know how much I appreciate Indiegogo and all the people here for supporting my project. Your help gives me a chance to really turn things around. One reason why I created several books before I released them is so people could know how dedicated I am to this project and its success. I hope you'll join me in it.

Hey, If your “Po” that doesn't mean you can't contribute by spreading the word.

If you want to find out more about my situation and keep up to date about all things Fiend... Follow me on Twitter, Deviant Art and the Fiend blog.... If you found out about this project from Indiegogo first than type Indiegogo in your first message to me.

Thanks,

Lucas Wade

Twitter: @FiendComic

DeviantArt: http://fiendart.deviantart.com/

Blogger: http://fiendcomic.blogspot.com/

Preview: http://fiendcomic.blogspot.com/p/comic-issue-1.html

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!!!
story_txt:
FIEND 24pg preview here: http://fiendcomic.blogspot.com/p/comic-issue-1.html






Fiend Character design sketch. I will polish this up soon.

The Story:
Not just a Horror story. Fiend is unique in that there are larger social messages in the guise of a horror story. It explores addiction, PTSD, and the human condition in a way not typical to the horror genre. When there is blood and guts in this story there can also be deeper meanings as well. Those who typically don't like Horror may like this book and those that do, will find what they're looking for and more in the new "Fiend."
Synopsis (for the entire series including books still to come)
Drake finds himself restrained when he wakes from his self imposed drug induced state. Nothing has been able to keep him from his chemical obsession. Today is no different. He runs from the past that haunts him but today everything is catching up. A booby trapped syringe is injected into his veins. Soon he will find that addiction has a cure. Forced into sobriety, Drake must now face the horrible events that sent him down the path of addiction. He must remember those who did unspeakable things to him. They are criminals and evil men. The injection has another effect. There's a horrible beast growing inside him and it possesses the keys to Drakes fixation. “It” wants control and it knows how to get it. It taunts Drake with "another way." Drake is given a taste but in an unconscious state the monster takes over. Drake's body takes the form of the monstrosity living within. When Drake reawakens he is returned to his human self but finds there's a heavy price for his new fix. Now he must decide if he will let the monster kill to get his high. He decides those responsible for his torment wont be true victims at all. Drake begins using his adversaries to replace the drugs that once got him high and for the same effect. When the haunting memories that he once numbed away, begin to permanently fade away as though they never even happened to him, will he still have the desire to use at all? Drake believes he has found his own cure for his addiction and nothing can stop him from obtaining it.
 
ABOUT ME:
My name is Lucas Wade. I've worked a long time to reach the day when I could share the stories I need to tell, but just when I thought the stars had aligned for me the unthinkable happened. A large part of every book that I had worked on for over 10 years was taken from me in a burglary. From what I can piece together from the information I've received, It's very likely that the art was all burned to hide the evidence. Either way I was told by the court system that apart from a small sketchbook that was recovered, I wouldn't be getting anymore back.
Imagine your dream being ripped away from you. Every time you put the pencil to paper, something deep in your gut tightens up in a visceral response because all you can think about is all that lost time and effort. You can't stop thinking about strangers going through all of your things and just taking whatever they want as they destroy anything they don't. Helping me by supporting this project would mean the world. If everything happens for a reason than you are here reading this for some reason right? Maybe it's to help set things right! Please contribute in anyway you can.

Where the Money goes:


If I raise less than $500 then the money will be spent on paper, ink, brushes, and supplies. I did all the writing, art, and lettering myself. If I raise enough money, some will go to a professional letterer to look over the existing job and either tell me to fix things or give me approval.


If I reach my goal of $500.00 then the money will be used to make sure the books are ready for print and see if a professional letterer would like to add anything to my books. The money will also go to help print promotional Items for conventions and any fees associated. I think this is nice because you have a chance to get additional items for free from the money you already spent if you go to these conventions.


If I exceed the goal of $500.00 then I would like to enlist the help of other artists for some pin-ups to help me replace those from the burglary. Any money beyond that will be saved to go towards the printing of the first single issue. Printing typically exceeds $1000 for a single issue. If I receive more than that then the second, third and Volume 1 are next in line for printing. :)

 
Thanks for the Help!
With so much going against me, you can't possible know how much I appreciate Indiegogo and all the people here for supporting my project. Your help gives me a chance to really turn things around. One reason why I created several books before I released them is so people could know how dedicated I am to this project and its success. I hope you'll join me in it.
Hey, If your “Po” that doesn't mean you can't contribute by spreading the word.
If you want to find out more about my situation and keep up to date about all things Fiend... Follow me on Twitter, Deviant Art and the Fiend blog.... If you found out about this project from Indiegogo first than type Indiegogo in your first message to me.
Thanks,
Lucas Wade

story:
“Brimstone and The Borderhounds” will be launching on October 31st, 2010… As many people know, it takes A LOT to have a comic book published! This includes time, effort and serious dedication; which is what EVERY member of our team has proven time and time again! We here on the Borderhounds Creative Team are looking to take this title to the next level! In order to do this, we are seeking assistance in raising revenue in order to create a phenomenal visual experience for our appearances at the major comic book conventions! Visibility is key and we need to be noticed. We are certainly not looking for a handout or contributions; we are just looking to raise the money by utilizing pre-sales of the comic book and advertising! As you will notice… for every different level of support, you receive something in return.

For those of you looking to just “help out” – We wholeheartedly appreciate it and your deed will not be overlooked! As always thank you all SO much for your support!!!

For a complete OVERVIEW of “Brimstone and The Borderhounds” Please visit us here: http://www.theborderhounds.com/overview.html or for more information, please visit our Official Website at: http://www.theborderhounds.com

 

**It has come to our attention that people are confused on how to purchase the comic here... Please notice the "FUND OUR PROJECT" button on the right hand side of the screen. Next, you can choose which package you would like to order. Finally, as you scroll down that page you will enter all of your personal information in order to complete the purchase! Thank you again for your support!!!

story:
“There is a lot to like here” – Dwayne McDuffie (founder of Milestone Media and legendary comic book and animation writer)

“One of the very best online comics” – Ren Hayes (Genxorcist, Cain and various other webcomics)

A dark city in need of a hero…

…a young man with the power to be that hero!

Stealth is a new hero for a new millennium, a throwback to the days when every kid had a favorite superhero but with the right flavor to appeal to a new generation of readers! Published online as a webcomic since 2001, this funding project aims to expand the reach of the character through a small trading card set and an original graphic novel.Written by 2012 Glyph Comics Award nominee Robert Jeffrey, the Stealth graphic novel will present the full official Stealth origin story and will be a treat for both old comic fans as well as new ones!
 
This campaign represents a second round of funding for this project. While the initial round was ultimately unsuccessful, enough funds were raised to make initial payments to the creators so that work can proceed and the project can move forward.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise at least $5000 to cover artist fees for the trading card set, payment for the graphic novel's creative team, basic printing costs for both projects and other related supplies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute any money, the best way you can help out is by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your comic loving friends or at the local comic shop. Every little bit helps!

story:
Our loss is your gain. Get in on your last chance to own a copy of the first print run of Flying Fortress Remastered. Due to printing and shipping errors, we had a handful of books that we held back because of small problems such as damaged corners or dented spines. Mostly minor cosmetic issues.

Get your copy of Flying Fortress Remastered for 28% off its original campaign pricing. There is a limited number of books available. When they're gone, they're gone for good.

Flying Fortress REMASTERED is a 228+ page graphic novel featuring the entire story of eight issues. This softcover book will be wrapped in a BEAUTIFUL new cover with colors by Kyle Ritter. Updated designs, lettering, and art changes make this book a must-have!

 

 

So what does this "Battle Damage" look like?

Here are a few examples of what to expect with these "battle damaged" editions. Minor cosmetic issues, bent corners or dented spines. Nothing major, but enough to consider them imperfect.

 

The Team

Flying Fortress was created, written, and self-published between 2011-2017. Art and writing by Eric Weathers, & Andy Moore, with story help in the initial couple of issues by Andrew Walker.

Eric Weathers has helped bring to life many indie comics including Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift, Red Rooster, Earthworm Jim, Downcast, Brutas the Badass, Monster M.D., Allegiance Arts, Cyberfrog, and The Expendables

story:
Believed Behavior is a Chicago-based, small press alternative comics publisher that started back in 2013. It started as a newsprint anthology featuring some of the best cartoonists from the Chicago underground scene such as Edie Fake, Jeremy Tinder, Anya Davidson, and Andy Burkholder. From the beginning Believed Behavior has been dedicated to supporting the vibrant alternative and art comics scene in Chicago while slowly branching out to support like-minded cartoonists outside the area such as Sophia Foster-Dimino, Michael Deforge, and Lale Westvind.

These anthologies produced work that was both published and notably mentioned in the 2015 Best American Comics series and recently Believed Behavior has started to focus on publishing smaller Risograph zines by individual cartoonists such as Krystal DiFronzo and Danielle Chenette.

What’s New For 2017

Believed Behavior is excited to announce that we will be releasing new zines by 4 amazing Chicago cartoonists: Kevin Budnik, Andy Burkholder, Margot Ferrick, and Marieke Mcclendon.

Each zine is approximately 5” x 5”, 24 pages long, and printed in 2-color Risograph by Perfectly Acceptable Press.

First up we have a new comic by 2016 Ignatz Award nominee Kevin Budnik. Kevin’s comics explore the small joys and struggles of daily life through witty personal narratives. Kevin’s new comic for Believed Behavior is a story of the lost dreams and insecurities of childhood.

We will also be releasing the third chapter in Andy Burkholder's Believed Behavior-exclusive series of love letters. "Pretty Smart”, the first part in the series, was included in The Best American Comics 2015, followed by "Thinking of You”. In the latest chapter, "Einstein", the unrequited narrator morphs into a parrot-speaking lover. "Einstein" might be Burkholder's strongest narrative in this series about longing, obsession, and the difficulty finding words to explain one's love.

We are also excited to be releasing a brand new comic by Margot Ferrick (formerly known as Sarah Ferrick). Margot is known for her expressive and poetic narrative style through past works published by 2D Cloud and Sonatina. Her upcoming zine with Believed Behavior takes her trademark style in a more playful and anthropomorphic direction.

Lastly, we are excited to be releasing a brand new comic by cartoonist and illustrator Marieke McClendon. Mariekee works in a wide range of styles, often abstract and exploratory and other times revealing her absurd sense of humor. Her new comic for Believed Behavior is a stunning meditative collage narrative.

Why We Need Your Help

We’re really excited to share these books with you in the coming year. In order to make it happen we need your help to cover printing costs, artist payments, and additional support to keep Believed Behavior running.

In return for your support we have all kinds of cool rewards including: A package covering all 4 Risograph-printed zines for 2017, DRM-free PDF versions of the 2017-released zines, enamel pins and risograph prints designed by artists from the 2017 line-up, and back issues from the Believed Behavior catalog.

Thanks for checking out all the exciting stuff Believed Behavior has planned for 2017. We hope we can count on your support to make these amazing books by 4 of Chicago’s most talented cartoonists a reality.

story:
Legendary Media

Legendary Media is a gaming organization, home to top players in Halo that pushes the limits of Microsoft's entertainment platforms.

Our company supports the growth of social media and live streaming surrounding the Halo and Xbox Live communities.

Help us turn an idea into reality.

Over 60 million people visit Twitch every month.

  • Gamers have been meeting each other and making friends while playing Halo for over a decade.  Help us make sure those connections to develop and grow!
  • Our main objective is to increase the visibility of the Halo channels on Twitch and the many networks that have struggled to grow over the years.
  • If you like to stream Halo but aren't getting the viewership that you hoped for, support us and we will support you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Legendary Media is always  open to new connections and feedback.

  • Let us know if you have ideas that help us improve the community.
  • Support us by sharing our links with your freinds.

Thanks!

Thanks!

story:
The Story:

Stiff is an aspiring rapper ignorant to the ways of magic trying to make it big by any means necessary. A strange nerd boy named Weeze brings Stiff and two other rappers named Bed Bug and Dark Shorty into a magical forest in a plot to rap battle them into submission and obtain The Staff of Swag, a hip hop artifact that makes its wielder into the ultimate rapper. Stiff teams up with Bed Bug and Dark Shorty against Weeze and together they drop a rhyme so epic it destroys the staff and catapults their careers forward into superstardom.


Donations Contribute to:

- Building Rap Arena Set

- Costumes

- Props

- VFX

- Original songs and soundtrack

- Great sound team

- Marketing

story:
Our Story

Radio Comix is a small-press comic publisher that was formed in 1997 to publish anthropomorphic, independent and American manga comics. For the last fifteen years, we have continued to publish our mainstay anthologies Furrlough and Genus, as well as dozens of other comics and graphic novels. The company was formed by two people, Elin Winkler (me) and Pat Duke, with assistance from Will Allison and Christina "Smudge" Hanson. Though Pat departed in 2007, Will and Christina stayed on and the company has continued publishing as a threesome. Everything needed to run the business is done by Elin, Will and Christina- editing, book layout, website design and maintenence, mail order, invoicing, promotion, bookkeeping, etc. We all work day jobs and do Radio Comix work in our off time, because we are passionate about the comics and graphic novels we produce. Never an enormous financial success, we've always kept the company running on a shoestring budget, rolling any money made into the next round of published books. The last few years in particular have been increasingly difficult, what with the loss of indie distributors Cold Cut Distribution and Haven Distribution- we moved quite a lot of backstock through both those channels, and now are left with only Diamond Comics to distribute our titles to the wider market. We're making inroads in self-distribution, but it's a slow, incredibly time-consuming process. We have always operated on a razor-thin margin, and that is why we are currently in such a financial bind.

 

Our Trouble

I stated in the previous paragraph that the three people at Radio Comix do everything there- well, everything except the business taxes. Due to a horrible oversight on the part of our (now former) accountant, we now owe a staggering amount of back taxes. The total is truly shocking, and when I first discovered it, I was ill for days. I've been working for three months with a new accountant to get everything that wasn't filed taken care of, but filing does not equal paying and now not only do these freshly filed taxes have to be paid, but there are penalties due to the late filing. I'm a firm believer in filing and paying all my taxes, and finding out I was behind was my worst nightmare come true. I have been working with the IRS to come up with a payment plan, but if we could get a large lump sum together to pay in at one time, it would be an enormous help!

Not only would a lump sum for the IRS help me sleep again at night, it would also go a long way towards helping our company continue operations. I have spent the last fifteen years of my life pouring all my energy, time and yes, even my personal money into Radio Comix, just to keep publishing. When the comic industry had tough times, I went out and got retail day jobs or took on freelance work to keep everything going. I would be devastated if I had to declare bankruptcy over this tax issue, especially since we've weathered so many ups and downs in the industry thus far. Also, our many, many talented artists would lose their publisher- artists like Shon Howell, Joe Rosales, Christina "Smudge" Hanson, Will Allison, Matix, Mark Moore, DAQ, Zel, Terrie Smith, Heather Bruton, Diana Harlan-Stein, Phil "Poinko" Gibson, Steve Gallacci and many more! I have always only published artists whose work I believed in and whose work I personally enjoyed. I firmly believe all our artists, though they aren't mainstream in the slightest, deserve to have the wider exposure professional comic publishing can offer them. It has always been my greatest joy when a new reader discovers one of our artists and falls in love with their work. And, it has always kept me going despite the hard times, knowing that there are readers out there who believe in our crazy dream enough to buy one of our books.

 

The Difficulty in Asking for Help

I understand that Radio Comix isn't a mainstream comic company. We're not even the traditional sort of high brow indie comic company. We publish anthropomorphics and American manga, which one could argue aren't the coolest things in cool town. But we have incredibly loyal, incredibly supportive fans who recognize that our books are made for the pure love of making them. These are the stories all of us here are compelled to tell, and thanks to Radio Comix, we have a platform to continue telling them whether it be via print or via our webcomics site.

Many other anthropomorphic publishers and artists have gone through the fan community, begging for help whenever they have had the slightest upset. I always swore I would never, ever be that person and thus far, I have never asked our fans for help. However, this is the day that has finally made me crack; the thought of losing this company that I have worked so hard on and that I have poured all my passion for comics into is a fate I can't stomach. So, please, if you can, help. Any little bit is welcome.

 

What This Money Will Go For

Straight up, 100% of any money raised via this campaign will go directly to the IRS. It's not an exciting or glamorous thing to pay for, but keeping the IRS paid and happy means Radio Comix can keep operating. That means we can keep publishing comics and graphic novels, keep our websites up and running, keep selling at conventions. We're asking for $4000. The actual amount we owe to the IRS is much, much higher than that, but I would not feel comfortable asking for more than the amount I've asked for. Heck, I'm not even really comfortable asking for this amount! If we don't reach our goal, whatever amount we raise will be applied to our tax debt anyway. If we exceed our goal, whatever amount we raise will be applied to the tax debt! None of this money will be used for anything other than paying off the IRS- it's my number one goal in life now to get that debt paid off so I can keep my company going for another fifteen years, or at least until there's no such thing as comic books anymore.

A friend suggested that I reveal the full amount the IRS wants from us (back taxes, penalties and interest), in the interest of transparency. That total is $40K. I would never expect such a huge amount to be crowd-funded, and would never presume to ask for the full amount. But, should we go over our goal, by any amount, we would just be that much closer to paying off this debt.

Things Are Tough All Over

I understand things are tight for just about everyone these days. If you can't contribute and wish you could, by all means, get the word out about our campaign! Share this campaign with your friends! Use Twitter, Facebook, Livejournal, FurAffinity, DeviantArt, whatever you've got. Like I said before, every little bit helps and boosting the signal definitely counts as helping!

Everything needed to run the business is done by Elin, Will and Christina- editing, book layout, website design and maintenence, mail order, invoicing, promotion, bookkeeping, etc. We all work day jobs and do Radio Comix work in our off time, because we are passionate about the comics and graphic novels we produce. Never an enormous financial success, we've always kept the company running on a shoestring budget, rolling any money made into the next round of published books. The last few years in particular have been increasingly difficult, what with the loss of indie distributors Cold Cut Distribution and Haven Distribution- we moved quite a lot of backstock through both those channels, and now are left with only Diamond Comics to distribute our titles to the wider market. We're making inroads in self-distribution, but it's a slow, incredibly time-consuming process. We have always operated on a razor-thin margin, and that is why we are currently in such a financial bind.
 
Our Trouble
I stated in the previous paragraph that the three people at Radio Comix do everything there- well, everything except the business taxes. Due to a horrible oversight on the part of our (now former) accountant, we now owe a staggering amount of back taxes. The total is truly shocking, and when I first discovered it, I was ill for days. I've been working for three months with a new accountant to get everything that wasn't filed taken care of, but filing does not equal paying and now not only do these freshly filed taxes have to be paid, but there are penalties due to the late filing. I'm a firm believer in filing and paying all my taxes, and finding out I was behind was my worst nightmare come true. I have been working with the IRS to come up with a payment plan, but if we could get a large lump sum together to pay in at one time, it would be an enormous help!
Not only would a lump sum for the IRS help me sleep again at night, it would also go a long way towards helping our company continue operations. I have spent the last fifteen years of my life pouring all my energy, time and yes, even my personal money into Radio Comix, just to keep publishing. When the comic industry had tough times, I went out and got retail day jobs or took on freelance work to keep everything going. I would be devastated if I had to declare bankruptcy over this tax issue, especially since we've weathered so many ups and downs in the industry thus far. Also, our many, many talented artists would lose their publisher- artists like Shon Howell, Joe Rosales, Christina "Smudge" Hanson, Will Allison, Matix, Mark Moore, DAQ, Zel, Terrie Smith, Heather Bruton, Diana Harlan-Stein, Phil "Poinko" Gibson, Steve Gallacci and many more! I have always only published artists whose work I believed in and whose work I personally enjoyed. I firmly believe all our artists, though they aren't mainstream in the slightest, deserve to have the wider exposure professional comic publishing can offer them. It has always been my greatest joy when a new reader discovers one of our artists and falls in love with their work. And, it has always kept me going despite the hard times, knowing that there are readers out there who believe in our crazy dream enough to buy one of our books.
 
The Difficulty in Asking for Help
I understand that Radio Comix isn't a mainstream comic company. We're not even the traditional sort of high brow indie comic company. We publish anthropomorphics and American manga, which one could argue aren't the coolest things in cool town. But we have incredibly loyal, incredibly supportive fans who recognize that our books are made for the pure love of making them. These are the stories all of us here are compelled to tell, and thanks to Radio Comix, we have a platform to continue telling them whether it be via print or via our webcomics site.
Many other anthropomorphic publishers and artists have gone through the fan community, begging for help whenever they have had the slightest upset. I always swore I would never, ever be that person and thus far, I have never asked our fans for help. However, this is the day that has finally made me crack; the thought of losing this company that I have worked so hard on and that I have poured all my passion for comics into is a fate I can't stomach. So, please, if you can, help. Any little bit is welcome.
 
What This Money Will Go For
Straight up, 100% of any money raised via this campaign will go directly to the IRS. It's not an exciting or glamorous thing to pay for, but keeping the IRS paid and happy means Radio Comix can keep operating. That means we can keep publishing comics and graphic novels, keep our websites up and running, keep selling at conventions. We're asking for $4000. The actual amount we owe to the IRS is much, much higher than that, but I would not feel comfortable asking for more than the amount I've asked for. Heck, I'm not even really comfortable asking for this amount! If we don't reach our goal, whatever amount we raise will be applied to our tax debt anyway. If we exceed our goal, whatever amount we raise will be applied to the tax debt! None of this money will be used for anything other than paying off the IRS- it's my number one goal in life now to get that debt paid off so I can keep my company going for another fifteen years, or at least until there's no such thing as comic books anymore.
A friend suggested that I reveal the full amount the IRS wants from us (back taxes, penalties and interest), in the interest of transparency. That total is $40K. I would never expect such a huge amount to be crowd-funded, and would never presume to ask for the full amount. But, should we go over our goal, by any amount, we would just be that much closer to paying off this debt.

Things Are Tough All Over
I understand things are tight for just about everyone these days. If you can't contribute and wish you could, by all means, get the word out about our campaign! Share this campaign with your friends! Use Twitter, Facebook, Livejournal, FurAffinity, DeviantArt, whatever you've got. Like I said before, every little bit helps and boosting the signal definitely counts as helping!

story:
I'm Richard Jones, a final year university student in the UK. The past seven years of my life have been spent studying photography alongside editorial and graphic design.
These years of building my technical capability and knowledge have given me the perfect skill set to bring my ideas to life.


Twenty eighty-three is a comic series set in a post apocalyptic wasteland in the year 2083. A world where society has fallen to nuclear war, governments are powerless and subcultures reign supreme. The comic follows main protagonist Soaka as he embarks on a mission to rebuild his 'lab' after being torn from his past life and into this stark, harsh reality.

Contributors are needed to make this idea a reality, funding is needed for printing, marketing and distribution and that's where you come in. You can help me take this comic from my computer's desktop and into the real world.


What's needed?

I'm asking for a total of $1000

200 x First issue                                             - $517.50
50   x Limited edition Micro issue                    - $129.37
1     x Domain name                                        - $39.99
1     x Web hosting                                          - $59.99
1     x Silver signature pen                               -$6
1     x Social Network Advertising Campaign - $247.15


Any donations are welcome and every contributor will receive a special thanks in the credits!

A world where society has fallen to nuclear war, governments are powerless and subcultures reign supreme. The comic follows main protagonist Soaka as he embarks on a mission to rebuild his 'lab' after being torn from his past life and into this stark, harsh reality.Contributors are needed to make this idea a reality, funding is needed for printing, marketing and distribution and that's where you come in. story:
Greetings Poprikans, and comic book fans alike, my name is Darryl Mansel, and I have a story to tell.

Before we get into that, a little about me. I love comics. It's one of the purest forms of storytelling there is. The creative team doesn't have the same budgetary constraints that, say, television and film producers do. The only limit is the imagination, and I firmly believe that imagination is something an alarming number of adults severely lack. At some point life becomes work, bills, family, Little Timmy's soccer game, and back to work on Monday. Adults stuck in the everyday struggle don't dare to dream anymore. Comic books, and the stories within, are that escape into the wondrous; they make us feel young again. They can make you weep at the death of a beloved character or whoop in delight as the hero conquers his or her greatest conflict. If you can marry the right writer with the right artist, you can create a story that will resonate with the reader long after the final page has been turned. 

That's where I come in.

Like I said, I have a story to tell. It's been rattling around in the old junk drawer I call a brain since 2013. Much like your junk drawer at home contains all sorts of oddities - paperclips, thumbtacks, an old Phillips head screwdriver, a few discarded packets of salsa from Taco Bell - my brain has held random scenes from this story that's been slowly building in my head over the years. I believe a comic book is the best way for me to spin this story, Rumplestiltskin style, and hopefully when it's all said and done you'll be holding an issue of literary gold at the end.

I'm no artist, however, so my campaign is this: I need you guys and gals to help me raise funds to commission an artist to pencil and ink (and hopefully letter) the cover and the first six pages of issue one of my comic book, Pineville. The plan is to take those seven pages and submit them to various comic book companies (Image, IDW, Dark Horse, Oni Press, Boom, Avatar, etc) in hopes of getting picked up to tell the story. Clear out that old junk drawer, if you will. Your contributions whether only $1 or $100 is the difference between me delivering this story in the only medium it deserves, or keeping that drawer cluttered with mere ideas.

I've already picked out and contacted an artist, Jordi Pérez*, over in Spain and he's all ready to put pencil to page and work like the Madman Spaniard he is. Only problem is, he likes money. He's charging $70/page to pencil and ink (and if we can't find anyone to letter it, he'll do it for free). Like I said, we plan on doing six pages, plus the cover. So with that right there, we're looking at $490. If we can find a decent letterer, we can bring him/her on for about $30/page. That puts us at $670, with a little bit of room to spare. We might be able to use that room to hire a better letterer or coax a few more pages out of Jordi.

I have a few perks lined up for you guys to whet your donation appetites! Check these bad boys out:

  • A $20 donation gets a handwritten Thank You card from Yours Truly, accompanied by a character description and background info. But let's be honest, you have enough cards from your parents and grandparents piling up you don't know what to do with. So you probably want to kick it up to:
  • A $50 donation gets your name all up in the story! That's right, if you put $50 in the pot, there will be a character in my story with your name. Don't get mad if something happens to that character. I'm merely a vessel.
  • A $100 donation will get not only your name but a character with your name and likeness in the book! THAT'S RIGHT, YOU COULD BE ALL UP IN MY STORY, DOING AWESOME SHIT LIKE GETTING INTO SHOOTOUTS AND TAKING OUT BAD GUYS! Unless you end up being a bad guy, which is pretty cool too, because don't they usually get all the monologues?
  • Lastly, a toss in of $150 or more will get you all that, plus I'll ring you up on the horn and let you in on the entire arc of volume one of the story.  
You can't deny it wouldn't be cool to pick up an issue in your local comic book store a few months down the road, flip open a page, point, and tell the guy next to you "yeah...that's me."
All jokes aside, the site says I'm asking for $800. What I'm really asking for is for you guys to give me a chance to get this story out of my head. If you can't donate, that's cool too and I totally understand; Presidents Day is coming up and everyone could use a sweet new mattress. But those that can't contribute monetarily can still put the word out: share this with your buddies on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, hell even the assholes over at Reddit. Because when Cooper Fourney got locked up in Pineville Penitentiary, he figured he'd do his time, get out, and set about his bloody revenge. 
Nothing could've been further from the truth.
Pineville isn't exactly on the level, aside from the fact that it houses murderers,  maniacs, and madmen. Things are happening in the pen - secret things - that only a handful know about, and in order for Cooper to make it out of there alive he's going to have to become one of the madmen.
At the same time Cooper is fighting to keep his asshole in check, Cassandra Adams is living an exhausting double life, helping to take care of a dying grandfather while holding a secret she dare not let slip.
Welcome to Pineville, where not even the strong survive.

*wanna check out Jordi's work and get a feel for his style? Check out his page on DeviantArt: http://jortrives.deviantart.com/gallery/2371292...

story:
Hi, my name's Max Ink and I make comics.  

Earlier this year, I collaborated with artist Liz Valasco to create a very special comic, Super Zombie Girl. 

A few weeks ago, I plunked down a few hundred bucks to print up 200 copies of SZG, anticipating that I'd make back my cost in short order. Such has yet to be the case...and my rent is due.

So, I'm running this very brief campaign with the hope that I'll raise enough money by selling enough comics--both SZG and Blink comics--and get my life back in the black. 

Here's the rundown of what I'm offering in this short & sweet campaign*


All the books are printed up and ready and waiting for shipping!

*If you want to mix-and-match which Blink comics you get, contact me and I'll be happy to oblige.

story:
Let Me Explain -- No, There Is Too Much. Let Me Sum Up.

My name is Matt Nelson, and I've been drawing comics pretty much ever since I could pick up a pencil. When webcomics came onto the scene, I started putting my stuff online, first with a Transformers parody comic called Super Deformers, and then with a comic about students at a Lutheran college called Pewsitters. I eventually went as far as I could with those comics, but never lost my love for the artform.

In the last couple of years, I've started getting back into the comics scene, and that brings me to Catbeard the Pirate.

Catbeard is something that combines my love of cats and adventure comics, and with Catbeard, I try to put forth the fun that I think a lot of comics lack these days. It's high seas fantasy with an incredibly silly twist, and it's a comic that really brings me a lot of pleasure to write and draw.

Your contribution is pretty awesome to me for one simple reason: it gets you my finished first volume of Catbeard, and it makes it available to others. I love it when people read and enjoy my comic! It's a huge rush, and it makes me want to do more so they can read more.

Sure, there's lots of other things that are great about supporting independent comics and their creators, but there are other people who can explain that better. Right now I just love doing this comic, and I'd love for you to have a copy.

My Loot Is Your Loot

Here's where your money goes:

Printing and shipping the books, and creating any extra material incentives. Really, that's it! The book is done, the printer has all the files, I just need to fund a print run so I can have some books for comic conventions, and some stock for the website so folks can order in the future. While I'd love to finance it all personally, my cat eats a LOT (okay, so do I... Geez, I need to get out of this art chair!)

If I don't meet my goal, I'll still print my books - I'll just have to curtail my order sharply. But wouldn't it feel great to help way more people read about a pirate with a cat on his face? Sure it would!

If I exceed my goal, I'll print more books, and maybe buy a tiny bit of ad space in a few strategic places. Gotta spread that pirate comic goodness around!

I'm asking for a small amount because I figure it's realistic. Heck, all I'd need is roughly 67 people at the $15 donation amount to make my goal! Odds are, YOU know 67 people who might want a fun comic!

Message In A Bottle

Got any questions that I haven't answered here? Drop me a line! I'm at
 
mattwnelson(at)gmail(dot)com

All That Glitters Isn't Gold

Can't afford to contribute because your own loot has been heavily plundered lately? No problem! Spread the word and that'll help as well! Just share this link on your site, blog, twitter, tumblr, (insert social networking site here).
 
indiegogo.com/catbeardbookone
 
Thanks so much for reading!
 
-Matt Nelson
 

My Links

http://www.catbeardthepirate.com

http://twitter.com/#!/mattwnelson

mattwnelson.tumblr.com

story:
Hi, I'm Jason Brubaker and this is my new COMPLETE comic called Sithrah.

I've worked as a professional Storyboard Artist, Animator and Visual Development Artist in Hollywood for 20 years on movies like Blade, Pitch Black, and the Kung Fu Panda Trilogy. In 2015 I quit my coveted and cushy job at Dreamworks Animation to pursue self-publishing my own graphic novels and I've been doing it ever since. My first graphic novel series is called reMIND and it won a few awards. 

Sithrah 5 - 176 pages

Sithrah 6 - 208 pages 

Sithrah is a project very close to my heart. It is a journey about "the Leap of Faith" of a little girl who travels in and out of the spirit world to try to find her missing father. It is heavily inspired by my love for Miyazaki's movies but with a western worldview. 

For this final campaign, I am printing the last 2 books in the series. The artwork is complete and pretty much ready for the printer. The last 2 books contain a total of 380 full color pages.

Best of all, the final book is not scheduled to be released until the end of 2020 and so only backers will be able to read the full story without having to wait for the release date. If this campaign does really well and we sell out of copies, you will be the ONLY PEOPLE who will have copies of Sithrah 5 and 6. 

The only reason I am able to print these high quality books is because of you. You guys have come through for each campaign and made it possible for my crazy stories to get published. You are my financiers, friends, editors, collaborators, inspiration, motivation, mentors and marketing partners. I could not have done any of this without you. You have changed and blessed my life in so many ways on this 5 year journey to complete Sithrah and I cannot thank you enough for helping me get these books made and onto coffee tables around the world.

50% off of my entire back catalogue.

Indiegogo exclusive! I am slashing the prices on all my old books for this campaign. This will be the cheapest price that you will be able to purchase Sithrah or reMIND. That means that you can get the entire Sithrah 6-book hardcover set for as low as $99. 

Get Sithrah 6 a YEAR before anyone else!

The release dates for each book is spaced out by a year for retailer orders and Amazon orders. That means that only you will be able to read the final Sithrah book a year and a half before it's release date and 6 months early for Sithrah 5.

And if we sell all of the print run in this campaign then it means that you will be the ONLY ones who have a copy and I not release it in stores or on Amazon. Why would I limit the print run? Because the previous books only had a print run of 2500 copies and in order to print more copies of Sithrah 5 & 6, I would also have to reprint Sithrah 4, 3 and 2. And since I don't have that kind of money laying around I will not be reprinting those older books again.

Win Exclusive Gifts

You are my marketing experts! I need your help in spreading the word to all your friends and family and in return I will give you exclusive gifts and rewards. Watch the video below to see just how easy it will be to get something unique from this campaign like a sticker, art print or original inked page from the books.

Book Specs.

Sithrah 1: Kingdom of the Air -  96 pages

Sithrah 2: Propositions - 160 pages

Sithrah 3: The Symbol - 188 pages

Sithrah 4: The Deep - 176 pages

Sithrah 5: Light City - 176 pages (NEW)

 Sithrah 6: The End - 208 pages (NEW)

Only 500 copies of the new books have a signed and a numbered collectors bookplate.

Art Contest - Get Your Art Printed in the Book!

Just like my past publications, I want to include some guest art in the back of the printed books. And so… ART CONTEST!!! Submit your art while the campaign is active to get a chance at getting it published in the gallery of Sithrah: Book 5 or 6. Send me your amazing artistic version of the Sithrah characters to be printed in the book... FOREVER! If you make it into the book, you will be credited with your art. 

The page dimensions are 6.75 inches (wide) x 10.5 inches (tall). Please make sure all art is 300dpi when scanned. The deadline for submission is the end of the campaign. Please send all submissions to CoffeeTableComics@gmail.com for consideration. I'll pick the final winner(s) for the book. :)

Add-Ons

I will be offering Add-ons when you take the survey after the campaign is finished. You will then have the option to add single books to your order as well as copies of reMIND and other books of mine at a discounted price. Because there are already so many books and options with this campaign I decided to keep the Add-Ons separate. But not to worry, you will have the option of adding things to your order prior to shipping.

Timeframe

The books are pretty much ready to go to the printer. I'll be preparing the files in InDesign while the campaign is active. The moment the campaign is finished I will deliver the files to the printer. The printing schedule will be about 2 months and so you will get your books before Christmas. International orders might take a little longer. 

Why so Much Money?

I've been making beautiful hardcover graphic novels for 10 years now. Sithrah: Books 1 - 4 have already been printed with high quality cloth bindings, foil stamped covers and thick delicious paper. Yes, I said delicious. 

To wrap up this series, I am trying to print the final two books at the same time. It usually costs about $12,000 to $15,000 to print just one book like this, and not only am I printing two books, I plan to make a collectors slipcase as well. The shipping costs have been anywhere between $8000 to $30,000 on my past campings and so that is why my funding goal is $45,000. If I don't reach this goal then you will be refunded and the books will not go to print. But I am confident that we can easily make this happen.

Win Inked Pages and Prints!

For this campaign I'll be rewarding anyone who helps me sell books! Yep, if you make one sale then you will be qualified to receive a new Sithrah Sticker with your order. $200 in sales will get you an exclusive signed print, and $500 in sales will be qualified to get an original inked page from Sithrah. The highest seller will also win this original inked 11x17 Sithrah art. Make sure you login to Indiegogo and use the share buttons so I can track your sales. You can also track your progress yourself when you login. See the video below for more details on how to win more perks!

Here's a link to a dropbox folder with art that you can use when sharing if you want: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/8jqpj5xfm5ylr3z/AAB0jIch62rb0gtzrDu56m0qa?dl=0

You guys are my marketing campaign! Thank you so much for helping me get Sithrah off the ground and out in the world. I love you all!

Jason

Risks & Challenges

I've launched 6 successful crowdfunding campaigns over the years, raised and fulfilled nearly $400,000 in orders. I am very familiar with the whole process and what it takes to make and deliver on a big or small campaign.
story_txt:
Hi, I'm Jason Brubaker and this is my new COMPLETE comic called Sithrah.
I've worked as a professional Storyboard Artist, Animator and Visual Development Artist in Hollywood for 20 years on movies like Blade, Pitch Black, and the Kung Fu Panda Trilogy. In 2015 I quit my coveted and cushy job at Dreamworks Animation to pursue self-publishing my own graphic novels and I've been doing it ever since. My first graphic novel series is called reMIND and it won a few awards. 
Sithrah 5 - 176 pages
Sithrah 6 - 208 pages 
Sithrah is a project very close to my heart. It is a journey about "the Leap of Faith" of a little girl who travels in and out of the spirit world to try to find her missing father. It is heavily inspired by my love for Miyazaki's movies but with a western worldview. 
For this final campaign, I am printing the last 2 books in the series. The artwork is complete and pretty much ready for the printer. The last 2 books contain a total of 380 full color pages.
Best of all, the final book is not scheduled to be released until the end of 2020 and so only backers will be able to read the full story without having to wait for the release date. If this campaign does really well and we sell out of copies, you will be the ONLY PEOPLE who will have copies of Sithrah 5 and 6. 

The only reason I am able to print these high quality books is because of you. You guys have come through for each campaign and made it possible for my crazy stories to get published. You are my financiers, friends, editors, collaborators, inspiration, motivation, mentors and marketing partners. I could not have done any of this without you. You have changed and blessed my life in so many ways on this 5 year journey to complete Sithrah and I cannot thank you enough for helping me get these books made and onto coffee tables around the world.


50% off of my entire back catalogue.
Indiegogo exclusive! I am slashing the prices on all my old books for this campaign. This will be the cheapest price that you will be able to purchase Sithrah or reMIND. That means that you can get the entire Sithrah 6-book hardcover set for as low as $99. 
Get Sithrah 6 a YEAR before anyone else!
The release dates for each book is spaced out by a year for retailer orders and Amazon orders. That means that only you will be able to read the final Sithrah book a year and a half before it's release date and 6 months early for Sithrah 5.
And if we sell all of the print run in this campaign then it means that you will be the ONLY ones who have a copy and I not release it in stores or on Amazon. Why would I limit the print run? Because the previous books only had a print run of 2500 copies and in order to print more copies of Sithrah 5 & 6, I would also have to reprint Sithrah 4, 3 and 2. And since I don't have that kind of money laying around I will not be reprinting those older books again.
Win Exclusive Gifts
You are my marketing experts! I need your help in spreading the word to all your friends and family and in return I will give you exclusive gifts and rewards. Watch the video below to see just how easy it will be to get something unique from this campaign like a sticker, art print or original inked page from the books.

Book Specs.
Sithrah 1: Kingdom of the Air -  96 pages
Sithrah 2: Propositions - 160 pages
Sithrah 3: The Symbol - 188 pages
Sithrah 4: The Deep - 176 pages
Sithrah 5: Light City - 176 pages (NEW)
 Sithrah 6: The End - 208 pages (NEW)
Only 500 copies of the new books have a signed and a numbered collectors bookplate.

Art Contest - Get Your Art Printed in the Book!
Just like my past publications, I want to include some guest art in the back of the printed books. And so… ART CONTEST!!! Submit your art while the campaign is active to get a chance at getting it published in the gallery of Sithrah: Book 5 or 6. Send me your amazing artistic version of the Sithrah characters to be printed in the book... FOREVER! If you make it into the book, you will be credited with your art. 

The page dimensions are 6.75 inches (wide) x 10.5 inches (tall). Please make sure all art is 300dpi when scanned. The deadline for submission is the end of the campaign. Please send all submissions to CoffeeTableComics@gmail.com for consideration. I'll pick the final winner(s) for the book. :)
Add-Ons
I will be offering Add-ons when you take the survey after the campaign is finished. You will then have the option to add single books to your order as well as copies of reMIND and other books of mine at a discounted price. Because there are already so many books and options with this campaign I decided to keep the Add-Ons separate. But not to worry, you will have the option of adding things to your order prior to shipping.

The books are pretty much ready to go to the printer. I'll be preparing the files in InDesign while the campaign is active. The moment the campaign is finished I will deliver the files to the printer. The printing schedule will be about 2 months and so you will get your books before Christmas. International orders might take a little longer.

The shipping costs have been anywhere between $8000 to $30,000 on my past campings and so that is why my funding goal is $45,000. If I don't reach this goal then you will be refunded and the books will not go to print. But I am confident that we can easily make this happen.

story:
A new digital graphic novel experiment, colorful, in high resolution, enhanced with a lot of special contents...

 Una nuova e sperimentale Graphic Novel Digitale, completamente a colori, in alta risoluzione e con tantissimi contenuti speciali! 



This is Man Born Again! (Download Episode #0 FREE Preview!)

 Cos'è Man Born Again (Scarica gratis la preview dell'Episodio #0)

THE WILD WEST AS YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN IT BEFORE

Jaxon Cage, a boxer of the Crown, Melanie McHall, an American student, a lawless town and ancient people protecting their land…From the metallic London sky, to the cloudless landscapes of North America, across two continents: powder and bullets, trickeries and treasures, subjugated souls and guardian spirits.

This is the story of the man who would change HISTORY!


 Il selvaggio West, come mai visto prima!

Jaxon Cage (un pugile londinese), Melanie McHall (una studentessa americana), una cittadina senza legge ed un antico popolo che protegge la propria terra...

Dai cieli metallici di Londra, ai paesaggi incontaminati del Nord America: un viaggio che attraversa due continenti. Fra polvere e pallottole, acciaio e sangue, fra Anime soggiogate e Spiriti guardiani...

Questa è la storia dell'uomo che può cambiare la Storia!


How we realize this amazing digital comic?

For which concerns the contents we have drawn upon historical and anthropological sources to be later embedded in a fictional context.


Man Born Again is released in online instalments: just like a TV series! Divided into 3 seasons, each of which will focus on the Italian actor Giuliano Gemma (Jaxon Cage) as the main character, next to many other artists, such as Moses Brings Plenty.


 Come viene sviluppato Man Born Again?

I contenuti e le tematiche affrontate nella storia, prendono spunto da documenti storici ed antropologici, autentici e originali, applicati in un contesto finzionale (fiction).

Man Born Again viene pubblicato in formati digitali, adatti a qualunque ebook reader e qualunque dispositivo digitale.

Proprio come una serie televisiva, il fumetto si divide in tre stagioni, ognuna delle quali vede come protagonista Jaxon Cage, interpretato dal noto attore italiano Giuliano Gemma, accanto a molti altri personaggi, ispirati o interpretati da molti altri artisti, come Moses Brings Plenty.


Why the Western genre needs Man Born Again?

Man Born Again is a comic, yeah we know it. But it isn't JUST a comic.

The story is grounded on historical documents and the spirit of the Lakota Sioux culture permeates all the novel.

Thanks to the expert advice by Dr. Alessandro Martire, president of the Wambli Gleska association we have transported, in our comic, the Lakota culture, without filters! 


Every single pencil's sign means something... will you able to understand all the messages, hidden in the Man Born Again's panels, in the story's events and in the narration? Don't worry, if you need, the spirit of the wolf will guide you ;)

Check "Something about the Comics Experience 4.0" for more details.


 Perché il genere Western ha bisogno di Man Born Again?

Man Born Again è un fumetto, fin qui ci siamo... ma non si tratta SOLO di un fumetto.

La storia si basa su documenti e reperti storici dell'Europa vittoriana e dell'America colonialista.

Grazie alla consulenza del Dr. Alessandro Martire, presidente della Wambli Gleska association abbiamo potuto trasportare in questo fumetto anche la cultura Lakota, senza filtri di alcun genere, per narrare le vicende che sono accadute e quelle che, nel bene o nel male, sarebbero potute accadere.

Ogni singolo tratto di matita ha precisi e definiti significati... sarete in grado di individuare tutti i messaggi nascosti nelle tavole di Man Born Again? Niente paura, se non ci riuscirete, lo Spirito del Lupo vi guiderà alla scoperta di antichi simboli e nuovi significati. 

Why Man Born Again needs you?

Even though Man Born Again is a digital comic, it is expensive realize it, in order to give our readers an innovative product, in line with new technologies.

Since two years ago we have supply our work's costs... but now we want to realize the comic in a better way: more professional, more fast!

So, we have choosen the flexible campaign and we will carry-on anyway. Your help will allow us to do our work in the greater possible manner.

When this campaign will be ended, we'll start work on the episode #2, titled "Death travels by train" and, when it will ready, we'll started another campaign, for the episode #3, and so on!


 Perché Man Born Again ha bisogno di voi?

Sebbene Man Born Again sia un fumetto in digitale, è veramente costoso realizzare un'opera di questa portata, soprattutto se vogliamo garantire ai nostri lettori un prodotto innovativo, sempre in linea con le nuove tecnologie.

Da due anni a questa parte, abbiamo provveduto noi stessi al finanziamento del nostro lavoro, ma ora vogliamo realizzare questo fumetto in maniera più professionale e, soprattutto, più rapida!

Per questo abbiamo scelto il tipo di campagna flexible e continueremo a lavorare indipendentemente dalla cifra raggiunta. Il tuo aiuto è indispensabile per permetterci di lavorare nel modo migliore, rendendo il nostro fumetto la migliore opera digitale in circolazione!

Terminata questa campagna inizieremo a lavorare all'Episodio #2, intitolato "La morte viaggia in treno" e, quando sarà pronto, procederemo ad una nuova campagna di crowd funding per finanziare l'Episodio #3, e così via... 



How we'll spend the funds:

  • 9500$ will used for perks, shipping and indiegogo and paypal fees
  • 500$ for the translation from italian into US english
  • 2000$ will spend in order to create the iPhone and iPad Apps and to make it free to download, without advertisement and with free uploads!
  • 3000$ will used to upkeep our sites and online services and to promote our comic, worldwide and for organization and participation in special events, such as exhibits, fairs, etc...
  •  5000$ will spend in order to reinforce our team and, we hope, to translate Man Born Again in Spanish and Japanese languages! And, maybe, to pay an english speech course :)

This campaign is worldwide, US$ payment are required!

For currency convertion, check this site!


 Come spenderemo i fondi richiesti dalla campagna:

  • 9500$ saranno usati per creare i perks (quello che otterrete in cambio del vostro finanziamento), per le spese di spedizione (sempre a nostro carico!) e per pagare le commissioni a Indiegogo e Paypal.
  • 500$ per le traduzioni.
  • 2000$ saranno utilizzati per creare le APP per iPhone ed iPad e per distribuirle gratuitamente!
  • 3000$ verranno utilizzati per mantenere tutti i nostri servizi online e per operazioni di marketing.
  •  5000$ saranno spesi per ampliare il nostro team, per tradurre il fumetto in altre lingue, fra le quali lo spagnolo e il giapponese e, probabilmente, anche per frequentare un corso di inglese parlato ;)

Questa campagna è valida per tutto il mondo, ma è richiesto il pagamento in $ americani.

Per informazioni sui cambi euro/dollaro riferitevi a questo sito!



Some Perks:


DIGITAL COMIC GEEK! (For $10!)
- 3 High Definition Digital Posters (ready for print)
- Leaving Home (Man Born Again OST) in mp3
- ENTIRE Episode #0 in digital format!
Estimated commercial Value: $15 - $20!


ON THE STAGE (Buy Your Role) 50$

Send us your picture and you will appear AS A BACKGROUND ACTOR in one single panel, in one of next episodes


JUST THE COMIC (Italy-Europe-World)


Something about the Comics Experience 4.0

Thanks to the Internet and to our (upcoming) App, you can immerse yourself in the pleasure of reading and living the experience anywhere you want!

You can purchase or receive extra contents such as gifts, including deleted scenes, promotional illustrations, anticipations, video trailers and much more!!! 

Each episode will feature a different soundtrack, created by emerging Artist on the International Scene, to allow you to experience something completely unique.

Some popular faces of the International Movie Stardom have inspired some characters in Man Born Again. The Main Character’s facial features were inspired by Mr. Giuliano Gemma.

The COMICS EXPERIENCE continues here!

Follow my eyes

We’ll show you Hidden Worlds, concealed characters, intriguing mysteries of ancient cultures, signs and symbols along the carved path of ManBornAgain.
