story:
Greetings, my dear fellows. Thank you for taking the time to visit.

Wayside Creations presents Blackgold, a science-fiction animated web comic!

Who We Are

Wayside Creations is a group of extremely talented young filmmakers based out of Los Angeles, California whose only goal is to entertain and have fun while doing it. Though most of Wayside hails from different backgrounds, they have come together as friends, roommates, and co-workers to create blockbuster films and outstanding digital media. Their YouTube page, which details some of their excellent work, can be found here: http://www.youtube.com/user/WaysideCreations


What is Blackgold?

The idea that eventually grew into Blackgold started as nothing more than a single sentence on a piece of notebook paper. It has taken me over a year to develop and nurture that one sentence into an ambitious undertaking that has succeeded in consuming my life. It was initially slated to be a science fiction novel of around one thousand pages, but I soon realized that this story could not be confined to the pages of a book. It would have to be unique, with worlds and creatures the written word cannot do justice. So, I enlisted the help of some of my closest friends and family and came up with the idea of an animated web comic.


Blackgold is presented as Seasons of twelve five to ten minute long episodes, each fully voice-acted and sound designed with limited and stylized animation. The comic itself will be featured on its own website (www.blackgoldcomic.com) and on YouTube. As of now, only Season One is ready, pending additional funding and/or adoption.


The Plot

Blackgold takes place in the far distant future on an alien world called Marratt, where human beings co-exist with a race of reptilian humanoids called "rygar." The humans have carved out a slice of existence on the continent Jenowa, while the rygar remain in the same place they have been in for thousands of years: the island nation of Rygara. In this world, the humans are much like their earthbound ancestors, while the rygar are a strict, militaristic culture with a polytheistic system of beliefs and a theocratic system of government. Color plays an important part of their culture: gold is considered all that is good, while black is considered the hue of death.

Sixty-two years ago, a black rygar was born in the capital city of Rygara, a megalopolis called T'Ali. Believing the child to be a demon, he was exiled to Jenowa, forever banished before he was a week old. Now, the black rygar has grown up into a strapping young man named Ky'Tal Tsune. For fifteen of those years, he has been an assassin, driven by a powerful subconscious force he calls "The Drive" and a desire to know more about his missing past. Opposing him is the corrupt and malevolent ruler of Rygara, Zetar, the man who put him where he is and who will stop at nothing to ensure Ky'Tal meets his end before his own dark secret can be revealed.


It is a story full of action, intrigue, back-stabbing, suspense, and colorful characters.


What We Need & What You Get

Such a project is not an easy undertaking. This is where the funding comes in. I am going to not only need webspace to distribute the comic, but also money to pay my very dedicated and talented crew with. They have put their own sweat and blood into this to develop it, and they deserve to be rewarded for their time and effort. But most of all, the money will help me develop the story beyond what's written into something perhaps far greater. Friends we may be, but we can't afford to keep doing this for free. The $1,500 I'm asking for during this campaign will pay Mr. Finfrock for his time, as well as my entire cast for the time and effort they will be putting into this project in order to bring it to life. Even if we don't make our goal, we're still going to move forward with our project. Every little bit helps, in that regard.


What are we offering for your generous contributions? Take a gander below:


If you offer $5, you will receive a unique sticker of Blackgold's stylized logo, along with our heartfelt thanks.


If you offer $15, you'll receive the digital line art of one of Blackgold's characters, which will be signed by the artist and the voice actor portraying the character, as well as a Blackgold sticker. Your art will be printed on high-quality card stock and will be ready for framing.


If you offer $30, you'll receive everything listed above along with a frame for your drawing. The selected voice actor will also record a special thank-you message specifically for you. You will also be granted an appearance in the comic as a background character!


If you offer $50, you will receive everything already mentioned, except now your drawing will be a full-color digital print that will be signed by the creator, the artist, and the voice actor portraying the character.


If you offer $100, you will receive a heartfelt thank you video from the creators of the comic, recorded specifically for you, as well as a framed digital print of the two main characters, plus the line art of a character of your choice. This is all on top of what you've already seen listed above!


If you offer $200, you will receive everything already mentioned, along with a two-of-a-kind poster of the entire Blackgold cast of characters, signed by the entire team. You will also be rewarded with a walk-on role in the comic! We will discuss the specifics with you via e-mail when the time comes. This particular perk only has two slots, so get them before they're gone!


All of our perks will be sent at the end of the campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends and neighbors about this exciting project using Indie Go Go's own sharing tools along with Facebook, Twitter, or whatever social media you have access to. The more people that see this, the better chance we have of making our goal.
story_txt:
Greetings, my dear fellows. Thank you for taking the time to visit. Wayside Creations presents Blackgold, a science-fiction animated web comic!Who We Are
Wayside Creations is a group of extremely talented young filmmakers based out of Los Angeles, California whose only goal is to entertain and have fun while doing it. Though most of Wayside hails from different backgrounds, they have come together as friends, roommates, and co-workers to create blockbuster films and outstanding digital media. Their YouTube page, which details some of their excellent work, can be found here: http://www.youtube.com/user/WaysideCreations
What is Blackgold?

The idea that eventually grew into Blackgold started as nothing more 
than a single sentence on a piece of notebook paper. It has taken me 
over a year to develop and nurture that one sentence into an ambitious 
undertaking that has succeeded in consuming my life. It was initially slated to 
be a science fiction novel of around one thousand pages, but I soon realized that this story could 
not be confined to the pages of a book. It would have to be unique, with
 worlds and creatures the written word cannot do justice. So, I enlisted the help of 
some of my closest friends and family and came up with the idea of an 
animated web comic.

Blackgold is presented as Seasons of twelve five to ten minute long episodes, each fully voice-acted and sound designed with limited and stylized animation. The comic itself will be featured on its own website (www.blackgoldcomic.com) and on YouTube. As of now, only Season One is ready, pending additional funding and/or adoption.


The Plot

Blackgold takes place in the far distant future on an alien world 
called  Marratt, where human beings co-exist with a race of reptilian 
humanoids called "rygar." The humans have carved out a slice of 
existence on the continent Jenowa, while the rygar remain in the same 
place they have been in for thousands of years: the island nation of 
Rygara. In this world, the humans are much like their earthbound 
ancestors, while the rygar are a strict, militaristic culture with a 
polytheistic system of beliefs and a theocratic system of government. 
Color plays an important part of their culture: gold is considered all 
that is good, while black is considered the hue of death.
Sixty-two years ago, a black rygar was born in the capital city of Rygara, a megalopolis called T'Ali. Believing the child to be a demon, he was exiled to Jenowa, 
forever banished before he was a week old. Now, the black rygar has 
grown up into a strapping young man named Ky'Tal Tsune. For fifteen of 
those years, he has been an assassin, driven by a powerful subconscious 
force he calls "The Drive" and a desire to know more about his missing 
past. Opposing him is the corrupt and malevolent ruler of Rygara, Zetar,
 the man who put him where he is and who will stop at nothing to ensure Ky'Tal meets his end before his own 
dark secret can be revealed.

It is a story full of action, intrigue, back-stabbing, suspense, and colorful characters.


What We Need & What You Get
Such a project is not an easy undertaking. This is where the funding 
comes in. I am going to not only need webspace to distribute the comic, 
but also money to pay my very dedicated and talented crew with. They 
have put their own sweat and blood into this to develop it, and they 
deserve to be rewarded for their time and effort. But most of all, the 
money will help me develop the story beyond what's written into 
something perhaps far greater. Friends we may be, but we can't afford to keep doing this for free. The $1,500 I'm asking for during this campaign will pay Mr. Finfrock for his time, as well as my entire cast for the time and effort they will be putting into this project in order to bring it to life. Even if we don't make our goal, we're still going to move forward with our project. Every little bit helps, in that regard.

What are we offering for your generous contributions? Take a gander below:

If you offer $5, you will receive a unique sticker of Blackgold's stylized logo, along with our heartfelt thanks.

If you offer $15, you'll receive the digital line art of one of Blackgold's characters, which will be signed by the artist and the voice actor portraying the character, as well as a Blackgold sticker. Your art will be printed on high-quality card stock and will be ready for framing.

If you offer $30, you'll receive everything listed above along with a frame for your drawing. The selected voice actor will also record a special thank-you message specifically for you. You will also be granted an appearance in the comic as a background character!

If you offer $50, you will receive everything already mentioned, except now your drawing will be a full-color digital print that will be signed by the creator, the artist, and the voice actor portraying the character.

If you offer $100, you will receive a heartfelt thank you video from the creators of the comic, recorded specifically for you, as well as a framed digital print of the two main characters, plus the line art of a character of your choice. This is all on top of what you've already seen listed above!

If you offer $200, you will receive everything already mentioned, along with a two-of-a-kind poster of the entire Blackgold cast of characters, signed by the entire team. You will also be rewarded with a walk-on role in the comic! We will discuss the specifics with you via e-mail when the time comes. This particular perk only has two slots, so get them before they're gone!

All of our perks will be sent at the end of the campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends and neighbors about this exciting project using Indie Go Go's own sharing tools along with Facebook, Twitter, or whatever social media you have access to. The more people that see this, the better chance we have of making our goal.

story:
*STRETCH GOAL UPDATE*

 

Reached:

a. Naked Samurai Included.

b. Inspirational Postcard

c. "Bounder" Business card.

d. Stickers

e. Donal Delay Pinup

f. Robozan Included in the Sketchbook.

g. Nosferatu included in the Sketchbook.

 

Not Reached yet:

h. (reached at 15k) Foreign Agent Included in the Sketchbook.

i. (reached at 18k) Comission Artists in the community!

 

The Broad Pitch

In the Universe of Earthbound there are 13 Sponsors across the galaxy.  They recruit the greatest contenders on each planet and submit two every four years to the GGPT, Galactic Grande Prix Tournament. They hold a draft every year for an exclusivity contract, so other Sponsors won't compete for the same contenders.  But once you draft a contender, you still have to go out and recruit them.  A subclass of warriors emerged to make a living specifically on the task of recruitment, known as headhunters.  Even headhunters are often compelled to do their job by blackmail and threats of punishment.  Freedom is not guaranteed, even Free Will is not guaranteed. 

Spaceman and Julia are sent to Earth to recruit the Sirens of Violence, four deadly warriors hiding out. Whoever recruits more of the four shall earn their freedom.  In the case of a tie, Wiz Kid, their ex-teammate who happens to be stranded on Earth, will be the tie breaker.  Wiz Kid was recently drafted by the 13th Sponsor.  He is a very late draft pick but he's also a Dark Horse, one Handler in the 13th ward has a mysterious high stakes bet on him.

The big idea that everyone likes behind this story is the R-types.  The R-types are weapons that jack the targets free will.  Headhunters use them to recruit Contenders.  But the Sirens are extremely deadly.  Spaceman and Julia will have to recruit other warriors on Earth first, enlist their help, and then go at the Sirens.  It plays out in really fun ways, for example later in the story (this isn't a big spoiler i promise) one of the headhunters needs a car to get somewhere fast, so they stop the nearest car that approaches and shoot the driver.  It happens to be a soccer mom.  So a soccer mom is on their team for the rest of the story at that point, driving them around like a badass.  One could also shoot cops, hell you could shoot the President but you might have to shoot some other targets first.  It's a fun concept.  The different strategies Spaceman and Julia utilize is telling of their character.  Just how the R-types work is slowly revealed through the story. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hey, I'm Narwhal

  I'm very passionate about indie comic books and hope to make a living writing and drawing them soon.  I've floated on the outskirts of the industry for years now, some pro work here and there.  Earthbound is a great way to introduce my style to the world.  It's been three years in the making, and the process of writing goes back further, into my twenties.  I'm always trying to master story structure more and more.  Earthbound represents my attempt to be really efficient, every scene is multi-tasking and building on the whole.  I want it to feel brisk and compelling as you read it, and I can't wait to share.

Earthbound's greatest influence is the movie Battle Royale (2001) by Kinju Fukusaku.  In Battle Royale, the players are all set up quickly and the meat of the movie is just this deadly game-scenario playing out.  The Strategy Is The Story, I like to say.  Stories like this allow you to focus on the characters, alliances, friendships, romance, heartbreak, betrayals, sacrifice, tragedy, and levity during moments of repose, as opposed to the plot.  The plot is these things.

 

Free Will: Truth or Dare

A big theme in Earthbound: BTBOE is Free Will.  I've heard from some smart people that Free Will doesn't actually exist.  But we have this concept of losing it, as shown throughout popular media: The Borg, for example.  How could we lose it if it wasn't a thing in the first place.  Throughout Earthbound every character is fighting for their own Free Will with their life.

Earthbound is intended for ages 16 and up.  I dare you to read it if you're 15!

 

Impact

Narwhal Comics is looking for 4000k as a campaign goal to fund a limited edition signed print run, and top ramen.  The funding will also help continue the story.

I did everything on this comic, writing, art, coloring, lettering, layout.  I had some help with editing (Thanks Avid!).  It is a true indie comic.  I hope it stands out and reinforces the fact that the modern indie comics movement is really special.

I've crowdfunded in the past but this is the project I'm the most excited about, a full graphic novel.

Personally, the goal for me is to transition to doing this more and more, and away from my day job.  I slice meats at the local Fred Meyer for the upper echelon of society, the meat-buyer, the elites gotta have their salty meats.  They send out personal shoppers with chihuahua service dogs to fetch them their precious salty meats.  All the time they hide behind an iron curtain of anonymity.  Who are these mysterious elites who need daily salty meats sliced?  And entire infrastructure exists underneath them to ensure they get the salty meats.  We mustn't have a meatless elite class, no sir.  I'm a pillar of society.  Somebodies gotta do it, but I'd rather be drawing comics.  If I'm good enough, then I deserve to, that is my goal, and I present to you Earthbound: BTBOE.

 

 

 

Exclusive to this campaign is discounted pen and ink, and digital art commissions.  Highly recommended (good value and quality).  Examples below.

 

 

 

Thanks for having a look!

Exclusive to this campaign is discounted pen and ink, and digital art commissions.  Highly recommended (good value and quality).  Examples below.


 

 

 
Thanks for having a look!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

What's this about?

DICE (Durham Indie Comics Expo) is a FREE local show in Durham, NC on Nov. 8 (7-9pm gallery show) and Nov 9 (11-7 festival/presentations/panels) meant to support local cartoonists and other independent artists. Our goal is to put on a full day of panels, presentations, merch and fun, plus a full-on gallery show featuring the best of local talent! My name is Eric Knisley. I've been making cartoons and comics my whole life--it's basically all I'm good at.

DICE will be Nov 8 (pm) and 9 (all day) at SUPERGRAPHIC, 601 Ramseur St., Durham, NC (map).

This campaign will allow me and my partners Rob Clough and Bill Fick to realize a long-standing dream: a local indie show. Your contributions will help us realize that dream, but not just for the three of us; we're hoping to provide a forum for the Research Triangle's burgeoning arts community to meet and greet, to network, to learn.

We're asking for funding, because we want to make this show free and open to all.

Here's how we'll use the money we raise

1. Pay for publicity and materials costs. This will include the paper we print our posters on, hardware to hang art for the gallery show, and printing costs.

2. Pay for lodging and travel costs for some of our guests.

3. Pay for all the necessary incidentals that add up--wine for the gallery show, name badges for the festival, rented AV equipment for presentations and so on.

We've got some great perks to reward your for helping us, too! We're offering original art, comics by local art heroes, limited-edition posters and more! We're working on getting tee shirts as a premium reward--watch this space.

If we don't make our full goal, we'll use the funds we do receive to pay for as much of the show as possible, and work on a plan for next year's show. Because this is just the first of many DICE shows, that we're sure of!

We deeply appreciate whatever you can donate, but if you can't, please help us by spreading the word. We want this thing well-attended, so tell your pals about it, and look for us on FaceBook, Twitter and everywhere else we can think of. Thank you very much!

story:
Strange News from Another World

This is a multimedia project that began in 2010 with the publication of the graphic novel, Strangest story ever told

(http://www.wix.com/brothersun/alternative--media-products-2) 

The books are based on the original story by Rey King and illustrated by Rey and members of Cosmic Brain Trust the artist network created by Rey in 1980.

Our current project, Strange News from Another World, is book 2.

 Strange News from Another World will present innovative cartooning and computer graphics combined with a unique story to present concepts and ideas focused on the social and spiritual evolution of human society in the 21st century and beyond. The visual and conceptual feast includes; human evolution/ revolution, bizarre characters, UFOs, conspiracies, weird science, forbidden knowledge, the healing arts and lots of eye candy!
 Most of the artists that helped me put this book together are stuggleing to survive as independent artists. They need your support.
Book two will be a print-on-demand publication. This means that only pre-ordered books will be available. so please show your support and help us reach our $3,000.00 goal  

This book will also include a companion DVD as part of the deluxe media package (see preview:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dOnKt2y-6AQ ) The book will feature all new stories and art by well known cartoonists and illustrators such as; Vaughn and Mark Bode (Cobalt 60), Larry Todd (Dr. Atomic), Mark Roland (New Age illustrator) and others.

 

 

The Impact

Strange News from Another World will present innovative computer graphics combined with unique alternative press cartooning to present concepts and ideas  focused on the social and spiritual evolution of human society in the 21st century. Often when new or controversial ideas are presented to corporations and investors, they are rejected not for lack of merit or  commercial potential, but for political or personal agendas. We are pleased to announce that this project will not be abandoned for lack of financial backing. We have secured distribution with Diamond distributors. 

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost for the last book was $12,756.00 for 5,000 books plus promotional postcards. We will print books by demand this time in units of  1000 to get books out ASAP.

Therefore our goal is to raise a modest $3,000 to finance the first print run. We will do whatever necessary to get the books out! However, with your support the books will be made available much sooner. We offer some fun perks to inspire you.

story:
Micro Mob the drawing

The Mob is an A3 drawing made in six weeks during July and August this year. Over 1,400 people showed their support for people coping with cancer on Twitter and I created a tiny individual toon character for each person. The character holds up the Twitter name of each Mobster. The goal was to fill the A3 page - we did that easily.

Stephen Fry, Ricky Gervais, Jonathan Ross, plus over 30 other well known people are in there too. Here is our story and a more complete list of names
 http://davekirkwoodstudio.wordpress.com/2013/07/30/micro-flash-mob/

We now have over £9,500 in the bank which more than covers print, fulfilment, P&P, photography etc and gives us 1,000s to donate already. Our aim is to sell every print and booklet and the artwork within the next 60 days.

The original drawing will be on show at this year's International Comic Arts Festival.

#ComicBookArt_V_Cancer

At the end of 2011 Issy's courageous battle (the 15 yr old daughter of a good friend diagnosed with cancer of the spine) inspired the 3hundredand65 project where I tried to teach myself to draw in a year by making a comic book on Twitter one day at a time one tweet at a time http://story.3hundredand65.co.uk/  Last year I fell in love with comic book/graphic novel art. So far 3hundredand65 and the Mob have made over £25,000 with book sales and the auction still to come in 2014 all through drawings whose heart belongs to comics.

Issy chose our three charities: Teenage Cancer Trust, Cyclists Fighting Cancer and When you Wish Upon a Star

During the making of the mob I lost someone very special to me and the world lost Jon Brookes. I dedicate Micro Mob to Cath and Jon, you can dedicate your print to anyone you choose - the mob is for everybody coping with cancer.



The Limited Edition Prints

A2 on 170 gsm G F Smith paper and printed by four colour litho The prints are a life sized copy of the drawing. I have taken great pains to capture every detail of the original using an archival photographer and one of the best printers in Europe who have worked with me rigorously proofing and adjusting the artwork. The prints look stunning.

They come in thick postal tubes. Each one includes a Story of The Mob booklet.


The Story of The Mob Booklet

A 16 page booklet that includes

  • The story of the Mob. Written by Dom Conlon
  • The A4Mob - a spread drawn by leading comic book artists - you'll only see these drawings here. This is a collectors' item.
  • Competition - a detail from the mob for you to colour in pencil and enter in to win a box of pencils from @derwentpencils worth £196

The picture shown here is the A4Mob in process. We aim to fill it before going to print.

REMEMBER: We've already done this:

Stephen Fry, Ricky Gervais, Jonathan Ross, plus over 30 other well known people are in there too. Here is our story and a more complete list of names http://davekirkwoodstudio.wordpress.com/2013/07/30/micro-flash-mob/
We now have over £9,500 in the bank which more than covers print, fulfilment, P&P, photography etc and gives us 1,000s to donate already. Our aim is to sell every print and booklet and the artwork within the next 60 days.
The original drawing will be on show at this year's International Comic Arts Festival.
#ComicBookArt_V_Cancer
At the end of 2011 Issy's courageous battle (the 15 yr old daughter of a good friend diagnosed with cancer of the spine) inspired the 3hundredand65 project where I tried to teach myself to draw in a year by making a comic book on Twitter one day at a time one tweet at a time http://story.3hundredand65.co.uk/  Last year I fell in love with comic book/graphic novel art. So far 3hundredand65 and the Mob have made over £25,000 with book sales and the auction still to come in 2014 all through drawings whose heart belongs to comics.

Issy chose our three charities: Teenage Cancer Trust, Cyclists Fighting Cancer and When you Wish Upon a Star
During the making of the mob I lost someone very special to me and the world lost Jon Brookes. I dedicate Micro Mob to Cath and Jon, you can dedicate your print to anyone you choose - the mob is for everybody coping with cancer.



The Limited Edition Prints
A2 on 170 gsm G F Smith paper and printed by four colour litho The prints are a life sized copy of the drawing. I have taken great pains to capture every detail of the original using an archival photographer and one of the best printers in Europe who have worked with me rigorously proofing and adjusting the artwork. The prints look stunning.
They come in thick postal tubes. Each one includes a Story of The Mob booklet.




The Story of The Mob Booklet
A 16 page booklet that includes



The story of the Mob. Written by Dom Conlon


The A4Mob - a spread drawn by leading comic book artists - you'll only see these drawings here. This is a collectors' item.


Competition - a detail from the mob for you to colour in pencil and enter in to win a box of pencils from @derwentpencils worth £196


The picture shown here is the A4Mob in process. We aim to fill it before going to print.

REMEMBER: We've already done this:

story:
Hey guys, This campaign is sadly over, however we have another one running to continue our goal of bringing this amazing comic to life.  So please check it out and the new fun perks.

igg.me/at/IWasMyselfForHalloween

Short Summary

The creative team of I Was Myself For Halloween is enlisting the help of our fans to tell the story of Peponaugh C. Fool'sfire though a comic book. 

This elaborate story is dark and disturbing yet beautiful and compelling. It takes place in the early 1900's and continues in present day.   

The comic itself is sent in present day New York. It follows Peponaugh C. Fool'sfire as well as other unique and intricate characters in a world where Halloween is forbade due to several gruesome unsolved murders.

This is our stepping stone to invite you to follow him into a world where Halloween is year round. 


Our ultimate goal is to create a series of graphic novels, movies, a band and a theatrical horror opera.

What We Need & What You Get 

Our Goal is $5,000.   Funds are required to employ a former DC/Marvel artist and current IDW Productions Inker to render 22-26 pages of drawings to bring our comic book to life.  We will also need to cover printing physical color copies of the comic and shipping fees.  Anything received over and above our goal will go towards merchandise.

*Update*

         Ladies and Gentlemen Let us present our Covers! We decided to have a variant cover. 

       


*Update*

Here are two choices for the posters, one from each of our artists, Nick Nestor and RJ Gonzalez.  If you chose the perk with the signed poster, it will be signed by the artist as well as the creator.  

  By Nick Nestor,  freelance illustrator          

By RJ Gonzalez,  former DC/Marvel & current IDW artist


*Update*

The hoodie option.


*update*
The Custom Peponaugh Shoes.



Meet The Team
All About Me's were dictated by phone and mail by the person and typed up by Leah

The Creator

 Photography by Jenner Photography

Hello,
I'm R.S.  SHESTO, The Creator of IWMFH.

Genisis:

Ever since I had basic motor skills, I aspired to create. I always challenged my level of creativity, From drawing my very first comicbook when I was 6, to fronting my first band when I was 16. 

 

                                                 Drawings from first comic Fill

My Mother was my main support system, having encouraged me to sing, write poetry, and model. She took me on my first tour and even funded my projects.

Trials & tribulations:

In 2008, she lost her battle with leukemia... It damn near killed me as well and I became selfish, reckless, and irresponsible. Following many personal and family crises, I went on emotional professional hiatus. I lost every friend I ever had and became the proverbial man in the box with my every creative endeavor. last year I was bedridden unless i had obligations to fulfill. My Father was diagnosed with a rare and terminal form of cancer in mid August of 2013. My depression worsened, I became more bitter and morbidly defeated.

Resurrection:

When I finally accepted the fact that I was going to lose my Father, I remembered how valiantly my Mother fought to simply take another breath. I was Hellbent on enjoying every millisecond I had left with my Father and continuing to be artistic. Now resurrecting a corpse is a process and anything but glamorous. so I began by writing songs, studying, working out, laughing, etc.

Creation:

On October 31st of 2012,

I wrote a story where Halloween was celebrated year-round but was ironically forbade. Fortunately I put it on the side for more developement.

On October 31st of 2013.

I created a character inspired by my favorite comic book characters and band mascots. This character would become Peponaugh Cavatus Fool'sfire.

The creative process was nearly a 2 year long search for perfect artist to bring Peponaugh to life. All i had was my concept, a written description and some rough character sketches.

I began developing IWMFH 6 months ago and I only had a brief back story for Peponaugh.

Then I was approached by an indie movie maker and my Father encouraged me to write a screenplay. This was the push I needed to begin writing Peponaugh's elaborate origins. Before I knew it, I had an entire world of characters, each with their own unique names and identities.

Soon after, I enlisted the help of my friend and co-writer Gayle Tomasello. I was utterly amazed by how well she could see my vision.  It's as if she reads my mind.

We began writing in the 1900's part of the story but recently decided to open with the present.

 1920's Peponaugh

Interpretation:

Due to the fact that I do not have Internet access, it was very difficult to find the right artists. However, I was fortunate enough to have found a piece of Nick Nestor's work and my friend and editor Leah Cardimona contacted him. Nick helped us bring Peponaugh, Flora, The Jackal Lantern and our logos to life, word for word from my written description. For months now, he has worked steadily with us as our character concept artist and illustrator and consultant. 

                   

                         

            The trials before getting the final illustration by Nick

 We recently somehow managed to find RJ Gonzalez. Gonzalez has done work for DC, Marvel and currently is employed as an inker for IDW Publishing. His interpretation of characters, while different are equally as impressive and accurate. 

Nick and RJ have the patience of saints considering a lot of communication is by mail and phone. It is truly an honor to have both of these phenomenal artists involved with IWMFH.

Aggregation:

IWMFH is comprised of a diverse group of consultants from the United States to Athens, Greece. Lead By myself, our editor- Leah Cardimona and our project coordinator- Stephanie Spike Drewa, we have already exceeded our own expectations.

Conclusion:
IIWMFH is by no means "just a comic."

It has so many artistic aspects, from comics to music, movies to theatre.

I sold most of my musical equipment and personal belongings for chump change to get this project started.

It was something I told myself I would never do because of sentimental value and music having been my main passion since I was young. However, sometimes we wake up from one dream to live another. This is the most elaborate, exciting and Innovative project I've ever been involved in.. And despite the struggles, I am certain this project will be ridiculously lucrative franchise by as soon as next year.

Please, allow us to tell the elaborately compelling, beautiful yet disturbing story of I Was Myself For Halloween. Every contribution will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks for your time and ultimately for your support.

Writer

I'm Gayle Tomasello, I'm one of the writers for I Was Myself For Halloween.

I was first inspired to write by my sister when I was a teenager. My first scribblings were quite deplorable, but hey, we've all got to start somewhere. 

When I am writing, I'm inspired by the wind around me, the trees, the green grass, thunderstorms and candlelight. They put me in a place where I can delve deep inside myself and reach for thoughts and ideas that wouldn't necessarily occur to me. I sit at my desk with a pen in my hand and blank pages before me, trying to conjure up characters and events that truly capture the imagination. 

Writing for this project has been very satisfying creatively. I'm working with so many people with extraordinary talents. It's a rare gift to be able to create something so astounding, so mesmerizing and so rich in detail. 

This has been one of the most creative times in my life. I feel very privileged to be writing for this project with my long time friend, R.S. Shesto. We work very well together and have a strong mutual respect for each other's opinions and ideas. Our creative flow meshes together well and we have written some of the best writing I have ever done. I'm extremely proud of the work everyone has done for I Was Myself For Halloween. 

Project Coordinator 

Friends call me Spike. I enjoy sunsets, long walks on the beach, and poking dead things with a stick. I also drive recklessly and run with 

scissors.  I'm working hard to follow my dreams....um....except the one where I am at school in just my underwear...

Cosmetologist, artist and collector of dead things.  I have a multitude of interests and love to learn new things.  I got started with IWMFH by pure chance, have been making connections on social media, and lending creative advice.

I truly believe this will be something big, and am looking forward to seeing all of the facets of this project take shape.

Editor

 Photography by Jenner Photography

Hello, I'm Leah. 

Art is my life. I photograph the world as I see it, to show others the way it could be seen as I freeze moments in time. I swim with the fish, and dance in storms. I'm a dreamer, who works with others that build their world out of dreams and nightmares. I help to manifest these creations into the waking world. 

I'm part editor, part assistant in IWMFH. I do a lot of editing for the project, compiling the videos, putting together banners and other odds and ends. I also help with the communication between consultants, artists and our creator. Through this project, I've met and been working with people of phenomenal talents.

 It has been amazing watching this project grow from an idea, to written words, to images on the page. Seeing R.S. Shesto's vision take life has been an exciting journey and this is just the beginning of the story, there is so much more to be said. 

Artists

Hi! My name is Rubén González. I have worked for Marvel, DC, IDW, among others. I saw the Peponaugh concept and contacted R.S. Shesto. He told me about IWMFH and I found this project absolutely amazing.

R.S. Shesto is a very enthusiastic and passionate person. It's really a pleasure for me to work with him and his team.

IWMFH is a very interesting project! I'm sure that all people will love this story!

Hi, my name is Nick Nestor and I am a freelance illustrator. 

I was contacted by the IWMFH team and I was introduced to this amazing project not so long ago. Ever since I've had the pleasure of working with them on a variety of illustrations and character concepts and fleshing out this intricate world. 

IWMFH is an absolutely breathtaking entity in it's entirety and this first issue of the comic book will be the base upon which all of it will be built. I am so happy to be part of it and i am certain, you, our fans and supporters, will love it!


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, like and share our facebook page www.facebook.com/IWMFH

story:
L'Atelier Auderset - Azvaltya - Le jeu - Nos objectifs - Les Goodies - Zoom sur la BD - Zoom sur le jeu


L'Atelier Auderset présente sa nouvelle BD!

Salut les amis! Et bienvenue sur notre nouvelle campagne 2021. L'Atelier Auderset, c'est qui? Alain Auderset fait de la BD depuis plus de 27 ans. Auto-édité et auto-financé, il a vécu un incroyable parcours qui lui a permis de mettre en place une joyeuse équipe. Aujourd'hui, une petite dizaine d'employés apportent leurs touches à ses projets et forment l'Atelier Auderset.

Alain est un ami de Dieu. Il est pourtant allergique à la religion, n’est à la solde d’aucune église, secte ou mouvement particulier. C’est juste un artiste qui aime son Créateur et les gens. Sa foi est basée sur la Bible. Reportage sur France 2

AZVALTYA, c’est quoi le projet?

C’est la nouvelle saga BD d’Alain Auderset, une histoire à suivre sur plusieurs albums.
Deux tomes sont déjà disponibles sur shop.auderset.com
A.Auderset et son équipe ont quasi terminé le tome 3, reste plus que des finitions et l'IMPRESSION. Et c’est là que vous avez la possibilité de participer à l’aventure avec cette campagne 2021.

 

 

La Bande Annonce

 

 

La création d’un jeu

L’Atelier Auderset a encore repoussé les limites du ouf avec le collector 2021: c’est UN JEU ! Pas l’imitation ou l’amélioration d’un autre jeu déjà existant, mais une création originale.
Pour l’occasion, l’Atelier a engagé Nicolas Poitevin, un créateur de jeu fraîchement sorti d’une école de Paris avec la Licence Pro de Game Design. Ce projet a été pour toute l’équipe de l’Atelier un gros boulot de plusieurs mois, mais un big kiff pour un résultat de qualité.

Une BD d’Azvaltya 3 est comprise avec le jeu, et le tout tient dans une belle boîte.

 

 

Objectif terre à terre

  • But 1 En vous procurant ce collector, vous participez au financement de l’impression de la BD en 2021.
  • But 2 Vous rendez possible la sortie de ce jeu au tout public à un prix abordable en 2022.

 

    Nos différents objectifs

     

    32’000 € (35'000 CHF)

    La BD peut être imprimée

     

    46’000  € (50'000 CHF)

    Des marque-pages sont offerts à tous les participants!  

     

    55'000 € (60’000 CHF)

    Les salaires de tous les gens qui ont bossé sur le jeu sont payés, et des stickers sont offerts à tous les participants!

     

    73’000 € (80'000 CHF)

    Des musiques imaginées exclusivement pour jouer au jeu et lire la BD sont composées pour vous!

     

    91'000 € (100’000 CHF)

    Le jeu peut sortir sur le marché !

    Les goodies

    Des contre-parties et des cadeaux de remerciement à caractères exclusifs seront offerts à chaque participant! Cette année, nous avons imaginé 9 différents pack de contre-parties!

     

    Pack 1 - Lot de 3 cartes postales - 10 €

    Pack 2 - Une BD « Azvaltya 3 » + les cartes postales - 30 €

    Pack 3 - Un tableau + les cartes postales - 80 €

    Pack 4 - Un tableau + la BD + les cartes postales - 100 €

    Pack 5 - Une figurine + la BD + les cartes postales - 150 €

    Pack 6 - Une figurine + le tableau + la BD + les cartes postales - 200 €

    Pack 7 - Le collector (BD incl.) + les cartes postales - 250 €

    Pack 8 - Le collector (BD incl.) + la figurine + le tableau + les cartes postales - 400 €

    Pack 9 - Une soirée fondue avec l’équipe de l’Atelier Auderset + le pack 8, qui inclut tous les goodies - 5'000 €

    Découvrez ci-dessous un aperçu de ce qu’on vous a mijoté!

     

    Lot de 3 cartes postales

    A6 (10,5 x 14,8 cm)

    BD

    « Les Souvenirs d'Azvaltya Tome 3, Les profondeurs »

    Tableau

    20x20 cm, imprimé sur toile

     

    Figurine

    « Azvaltya 2021 » 8 X 9 cm

    (matériaux en cours de recherches)

    Collector 2021

    BD + jeu!

     

    Petit zoom sur La BD

    AZVALTYA c’est quoi l’histoire?

    Ça se déroule dans un monde onirique (on dirait un rêve!). Mais les événements ont un double sens: cette histoire est une parabole qui fait allusion à notre vie intérieure, nos pensées, nos émotions et notre spiritualité.
    Sur sa route, Marcel, (le personnage principal), rencontre amis, potes, amours, mais aussi trahisons et impasses. Ses problèmes sont devenus un fardeau qu’il traîne péniblement derrière lui. Il est paumé dans un monde fantastique, peuplé de fleurs géantes, de montagnes en colère, de monstres et de routes vivantes et psychologiquement instables.

    Marcel se croit seul, mais c’est faux! Car le créateur d’Azvaltya en personne veille sur lui, (un peu comme Dieu pour nous). Et les embûches que permet cette entité sur le chemin de Marcel sont, en fait, des marques d’affection de sa part - même si seul le lecteur s’en rend compte. voir la BA du tome 1

    Dans le Tome 2 , le créateur franchit un cap relationnel en approchant Marcel davantage. Il cherche son cœur et pénètre son âme, pour y attiser la foi et éveiller sa soif d’absolu. Il met Marcel face à lui-même et ses incapacités, pour tenter de le sauver de lui-même.

     

     

    AZVALTYA 3, les profondeurs

    Dans ce nouveau Tome, Marcel se pose enfin les bonnes questions. Mais Jays (un mystérieux pote qu’il a pris en stop), en bon pédagogue, va le laisser trouver les réponses par lui-même, car dans le fonds, Marcel sait déjà, sans savoir.
    C’est ainsi qu’il va à nouveau être confronté au sentiment amoureux. Des monstres seront combattus par des fleurs. Des conceptions vont s'écrouler et Marcel (ainsi que le lecteur) va découvrir une nouvelle dimension aux choses et au sens de la vie.


    AZVALTYA, le but

    Sans négliger le fun et le divertissement, le but est de faire réfléchir. Comme à son habitude, A.Auderset essaye de réveiller le lecteur à des questions existentielles vitales et spirituelles.
    Ce genre d’histoires fantastiques et originales, très en vogue dans le milieu de la BD, permet d’atteindre un grand public avide d'aventures.
    Azvaltya a le don de sensibiliser à la question de notre âme, de nos sentiments contraires et paradoxaux, du sens de nos vies, d’un au-delà, et d’un Créateur bienveillant. Invisible lorsqu’on ne le cherche pas, il nous aime et nous cherche avec passion.

     

    Petit zoom sur le jeu

     

    Pourquoi ce jeu?

    Azvaltya, les anges gardiens
    Toucher les gens sur des questions vitales et spirituelles avec fun et divertissement est un leitmotiv de l’Atelier Auderset.

    En effet, en plus d’un amusement ludique, ce jeu de plateau et de coopération a un but existentiel. Il force le joueur à réfléchir et philosopher sur sa propre vie. Le “pourquoi Dieu permet de telles choses ?” trouve ici une réponse et permet un nouveau point de vue.

     


    Comment ça marche?

    Marcel de la BD doit traverser le plateau, tout comme nous des étapes de la vie. Il avance au gré de ses envies et émotions du moment, sans trop savoir où ça va le mener.
    Le Créateur, qui tient à son bonheur, a nommé des anges: les joueurs. En fins stratèges, ils sont chargés d’arranger des circonstances favorables sur son chemin. Parfois, obligés de le faire passer par des épreuves à court terme, ils lui imposent des détours pour lui éviter de se planter.
    Mais difficile de prévoir l’attitude de Marcel qui… Rââââ quelle prise de tête ! En plus, le temps est limité !!!
    On ne sait pas pour les anges, mais ici, pour les joueurs, c’est tendu, défiant et marrant.
     
    Jeu, rire et sagesse

    Le temps d’une partie, nous avons le point de vue d’en haut. Nous comprenons mieux que certaines épreuves sont bénéfiques. Les pleurs d’aujourd’hui peuvent mener à la joie, et nous laisser porter par nos envies conduire à des situations critiques. On relativise avec philosophie.
    Ici-bas, nous avons une vision limitée des choses...mais heureusement, là-haut, quelqu’un veille sur nous. Soyons à son écoute.

    Contact : christine@auderset.com
story_txt:
L'Atelier Auderset - Azvaltya - Le jeu - Nos objectifs - Les Goodies - Zoom sur la BD - Zoom sur le jeu

L'Atelier Auderset présente sa nouvelle BD!
Salut les amis! Et bienvenue sur notre nouvelle campagne 2021. L'Atelier Auderset, c'est qui? Alain Auderset fait de la BD depuis plus de 27 ans. Auto-édité et auto-financé, il a vécu un incroyable parcours qui lui a permis de mettre en place une joyeuse équipe. Aujourd'hui, une petite dizaine d'employés apportent leurs touches à ses projets et forment l'Atelier Auderset.
Alain est un ami de Dieu. Il est pourtant allergique à la religion, n’est à la solde d’aucune église, secte ou mouvement particulier. C’est juste un artiste qui aime son Créateur et les gens. Sa foi est basée sur la Bible. Reportage sur France 2
AZVALTYA, c’est quoi le projet?
C’est la nouvelle saga BD d’Alain Auderset, une histoire à suivre sur plusieurs albums.Deux tomes sont déjà disponibles sur shop.auderset.comA.Auderset et son équipe ont quasi terminé le tome 3, reste plus que des finitions et l'IMPRESSION. Et c’est là que vous avez la possibilité de participer à l’aventure avec cette campagne 2021.
 
 
La Bande Annonce
 
 
La création d’un jeu
L’Atelier Auderset a encore repoussé les limites du ouf avec le collector 2021: c’est UN JEU ! Pas l’imitation ou l’amélioration d’un autre jeu déjà existant, mais une création originale.Pour l’occasion, l’Atelier a engagé Nicolas Poitevin, un créateur de jeu fraîchement sorti d’une école de Paris avec la Licence Pro de Game Design. Ce projet a été pour toute l’équipe de l’Atelier un gros boulot de plusieurs mois, mais un big kiff pour un résultat de qualité.
Une BD d’Azvaltya 3 est comprise avec le jeu, et le tout tient dans une belle boîte.
 

 
Objectif terre à terre


But 1 En vous procurant ce collector, vous participez au financement de l’impression de la BD en 2021.

But 2 Vous rendez possible la sortie de ce jeu au tout public à un prix abordable en 2022.

 



Nos différents objectifs
 
32’000 € (35'000 CHF) 
La BD peut être imprimée
 
46’000  € (50'000 CHF)
Des marque-pages sont offerts à tous les participants!  
 
55'000 € (60’000 CHF) 
Les salaires de tous les gens qui ont bossé sur le jeu sont payés, et des stickers sont offerts à tous les participants!
 
73’000 € (80'000 CHF)
Des musiques imaginées exclusivement pour jouer au jeu et lire la BD sont composées pour vous!
 
91'000 € (100’000 CHF)
Le jeu peut sortir sur le marché !

Les goodies
Des contre-parties et des cadeaux de remerciement à caractères exclusifs seront offerts à chaque participant! Cette année, nous avons imaginé 9 différents pack de contre-parties!
 
Pack 1  - Lot de 3 cartes postales - 10 €
Pack 2 - Une BD « Azvaltya 3 » + les cartes postales - 30 €
Pack 3 - Un tableau + les cartes postales - 80 €
Pack 4 - Un tableau + la BD + les cartes postales - 100 € 
Pack 5 - Une figurine + la BD + les cartes postales - 150 €
Pack 6 - Une figurine + le tableau + la BD + les cartes postales - 200 €
Pack 7 - Le collector (BD incl.) + les cartes postales - 250 €
Pack 8 - Le collector (BD incl.) + la figurine + le tableau + les cartes postales - 400 €
Pack 9 - Une soirée fondue avec l’équipe de l’Atelier Auderset + le pack 8, qui inclut tous les goodies - 5'000 €
Découvrez ci-dessous un aperçu de ce qu’on vous a mijoté!
 
Lot de 3 cartes postales 
A6 (10,5 x 14,8 cm)

BD 
« Les Souvenirs d'Azvaltya Tome 3, Les profondeurs »

Tableau 
20x20 cm, imprimé sur toile Figurine 
« Azvaltya 2021 » 8 X 9 cm 
(matériaux en cours de recherches)

Collector 2021
BD + jeu!
 


Petit zoom sur La BD
AZVALTYA c’est quoi l’histoire?
Ça se déroule dans un monde onirique (on dirait un rêve!). Mais les événements ont un double sens: cette histoire est une parabole qui fait allusion à notre vie intérieure, nos pensées, nos émotions et notre spiritualité.Sur sa route, Marcel, (le personnage principal), rencontre amis, potes, amours, mais aussi trahisons et impasses. Ses problèmes sont devenus un fardeau qu’il traîne péniblement derrière lui. Il est paumé dans un monde fantastique, peuplé de fleurs géantes, de montagnes en colère, de monstres et de routes vivantes et psychologiquement instables.
Marcel se croit seul, mais c’est faux! Car le créateur d’Azvaltya en personne veille sur lui, (un peu comme Dieu pour nous). Et les embûches que permet cette entité sur le chemin de Marcel sont, en fait, des marques d’affection de sa part - même si seul le lecteur s’en rend compte. voir la BA du tome 1
Dans le Tome 2 , le créateur franchit un cap relationnel en approchant Marcel davantage. Il cherche son cœur et pénètre son âme, pour y attiser la foi et éveiller sa soif d’absolu. Il met Marcel face à lui-même et ses incapacités, pour tenter de le sauver de lui-même.
 

 
AZVALTYA 3, les profondeurs
Dans ce nouveau Tome, Marcel se pose enfin les bonnes questions. Mais Jays (un mystérieux pote qu’il a pris en stop), en bon pédagogue, va le laisser trouver les réponses par lui-même, car dans le fonds, Marcel sait déjà, sans savoir.C’est ainsi qu’il va à nouveau être confronté au sentiment amoureux. Des monstres seront combattus par des fleurs. Des conceptions vont s'écrouler et Marcel (ainsi que le lecteur) va découvrir une nouvelle dimension aux choses et au sens de la vie.
AZVALTYA, le but
Sans négliger le fun et le divertissement, le but est de faire réfléchir. Comme à son habitude, A.Auderset essaye de réveiller le lecteur à des questions existentielles vitales et spirituelles.Ce genre d’histoires fantastiques et originales, très en vogue dans le milieu de la BD, permet d’atteindre un grand public avide d'aventures.Azvaltya a le don de sensibiliser à la question de notre âme, de nos sentiments contraires et paradoxaux, du sens de nos vies, d’un au-delà, et d’un Créateur bienveillant. Invisible lorsqu’on ne le cherche pas, il nous aime et nous cherche avec passion.
 
Petit zoom sur le jeu
 
Pourquoi ce jeu?
Azvaltya, les anges gardiensToucher les gens sur des questions vitales et spirituelles avec fun et divertissement est un leitmotiv de l’Atelier Auderset.
En effet, en plus d’un amusement ludique, ce jeu de plateau et de coopération a un but existentiel. Il force le joueur à réfléchir et philosopher sur sa propre vie. Le “pourquoi Dieu permet de telles choses ?” trouve ici une réponse et permet un nouveau point de vue.
 

Comment ça marche?
Marcel de la BD doit traverser le plateau, tout comme nous des étapes de la vie. Il avance au gré de ses envies et émotions du moment, sans trop savoir où ça va le mener.Le Créateur, qui tient à son bonheur, a nommé des anges: les joueurs. En fins stratèges, ils sont chargés d’arranger des circonstances favorables sur son chemin. Parfois, obligés de le faire passer par des épreuves à court terme, ils lui imposent des détours pour lui éviter de se planter.Mais difficile de prévoir l’attitude de Marcel qui… Rââââ quelle prise de tête ! En plus, le temps est limité !!!On ne sait pas pour les anges, mais ici, pour les joueurs, c’est tendu, défiant et marrant. Jeu, rire et sagesse
Le temps d’une partie, nous avons le point de vue d’en haut. Nous comprenons mieux que certaines épreuves sont bénéfiques. Les pleurs d’aujourd’hui peuvent mener à la joie, et nous laisser porter par nos envies conduire à des situations critiques. On relativise avec philosophie.Ici-bas, nous avons une vision limitée des choses...mais heureusement, là-haut, quelqu’un veille sur nous. Soyons à son écoute.

Contact : christine@auderset.com

story:
You can still support the festival!

Even though this campaign has ended we will continue to donations at kenoshacartoonfest.com - perks still available are challenge coins, signed programs, and ads in our program book!


KENOSHA FESTIVAL OF CARTOONING!

Festival website: kenoshacartoonfest.com

KFOC 2015 – September 17, 18, 19

The Kenosha Festival of Cartooning is a 3 day festival, in Kenosha Wisconsin. There are live presentations, workshops, comic art on display, panel discussions, and community outreach by some of the nation's top cartoonists. 

Successful crowd funding of our previous festivals has allowed us to keep all our events FREE AND OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. This allows us not simply to entertain rabid comics fans but to create them - thanks to YOU our wonderful backers!

Our AWESOME guest speakers for 2015 are: 


Mark Tatulli of Lio, Heart of the City, Desmond Puckett, Emmy Award Winning Illustrator 


Bill Morrison – Art Director: Futurama, Co-Founder of Bongo Comics, Simpsons and Disney Illustrator, Roswell Little Green Man


Jan Eliot - Stone Soup 


Darrin Bell - Candorville and Rudy Park as well as Nationally Syndicated Editorial Cartoons 

 

Mark Anderson - Andertoons 


Ed Steckley –  MAD and CRACKED: Advertising Illustrator 

Our moderator will again be the amazing Tom Racine of Tall Tale Radio.


We are again offering a specially designed, limited edition, challenge coin a limited number of which is still available at kenoshacartoonfest.com for a $50 donation.

All rewards will be signed and therefore delivered after the conclusion of the festival.

BE SURE TO CLICK ON THE GALLERY TAB FOR PHOTOS OF PREVIOUS FESTIVALS AND IMAGES OF some of the 2015-16 BACKER REWARDS.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! I am a 17 year old in high school, and making this comic is my passion. I've been making my own comics for years now, but haven't ever published them. This is my first attempt at publishing a webcomic and updating it steadily. I don't have any money to spend on the hosting fees, however, and need donations to make it the first year. 

ThunderHead is an adventure comic about a girl with extraordinary powers finding herself and her friend stuck in a world of ordinary things, and their race to get home before someone gets hurt. It's like Alice in Wonderland, except in this case Alice is the magical one, and she falls through the rabbit hole into the boring world beyond. 

If you want to have a look at my comic so far, here is the website: www.thunderheadcomic.com

What We Need & What You Get

I need to have enough money to steadily pay for hosting services, software, and sketchbooks (which I use to sketch out the comic and its special pages). All of these together can cost up to $1000, if I buy quality materials. The money that you donate will help me cover those costs.

As far as perks go, there are several options:

  •  the first 2 people to donate $10 or more will receive a sketch commission of a character of their choice. 
  • The first person to donate $25 or more will receive a lineart print of a character of their choice. 
  • The first person to donate $50 or more will get a commission of anything  valuing $50 or less from my commissions page on my blog. 
  • The first person to donate $100 or more will receive a commission of anything on my commissions page. 

If you claim a perk, please email me at epiphanyontoast@gmail.com and tell me! It's hard to get in contact if you don't have an indiegogo account. 

If I don't reach my goal (which was actually supposed to be $300, not $1000), I'm still going to use as much as I can towards paying the hosting fees. 

The Impact

Creating comics and telling stories is my job. In fact, its my mission in life. If I can't spend my time entertaining people with my hard work, I don't know what else I can do to make a difference in this world. I want to inspire others to tell their own stories, as well. Comics and literature have a power to connect people and introduce ideas. I want to be a part of that. And to do that, I need as much help and support as I can from you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's fine. You can spread the word by sharing this through social networking sites listed below. Any help makes a difference.
