story:
SUCCESS!

GOOD game, minions of Captain, good game >:-]

The campaign is over and with your help we raised over £12,000 for the greater glory of Captainia and the ruination of Snippy. We can't express how thankful we are for the support, and how excited we are to now be able to finish off all of these things and ship your rewards to you.

We've moved to In Demand phase, so you can still pre-order a reduced number of items, including the Snippy book, I, ANNET, Auditory Assistance Remastered and the EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE all for a limited time.

Bear in mind that these pre-orders won't contain stickers or a pin badge, nor will the post-deadline EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE contain a Manilla Ticket. These additions were for the campaign only! Just so you know!

Everything that follows was part of the original campaign pitch. We'll see you in an update soon!

--

STRETCH GOALS!

Thanks and salutations to all of you who have backed our campaign and helped us to ensure that all of our dreams and Snippy's nightmares will come true. Let's talk about next-level funding!

DONE! STRETCH GOAL 1: 125%

Access all the benefits of being Snippy, such as:

  • Being alive.
  • <ERROR>
  • <ERROR>

When we reach this goal this product will be automatically added to the order of everyone who has obtained an ARTEFACT perk or higher.

STRETCH GOAL 2:  150%

If we reach 150% funded we'll unlock a reward tier that will get you a tshirt to wear in your director's chair, just like Engie. Look seriously sci-fi with your glow-in-the-dark details :3

Once the perk is unlocked you'll be able to claim it just like any other perk, and you don't need to cancel your current reward to get it!

We're very close to the end now, so if we reach this stretch goal we'll endeavour to make tshirts available to whoever wants one after the campaign ends. Watch this space!

NEW REWARDS

We've also unlocked a number of new rewards for you to claim, which are a bit different from what we've had before. These are the *limited* mounted prints of the four main characters and a top-tier perk which contains everything from DIRECTORATE TOURIST but also one of two exclusive original sketches by artist Lyndon White! Check them out on the sidebar or down below.

 

100% REACHED!

You know you're onto a winner when Captain throws you a party! We made it, gang. Now we can do the thing!

We've still got a couple of weeks to go so if you're on the fence, know that we are guaranteed to go ahead as of right now! Fill your boots! Stretch goals on their way but for now, we need to sleep :3

 

WHO IS CHARLES SNIPPY?

He's the most hapless person you could ever meet, yet he just got promoted. The problem with Snippy is that he's Unconnectable, a member of the one per cent of all humans on Earth who can't connect to the giant Neural Network that serves humanity (and sometimes their pets), so just being noticed enough to get a new job is a major success for him. Naturally, he needs a little extra help to get him through his training.

 

DESCRIBE THE ARTEFACT TO ME!

The artefact is Snippy's GOOD Directorate employee handbook. A manual, if you will, and a 100+ page guide to the specifics of his new job as a Dead Zone Tour Guide. It was written for him by ANNET, an artificial super-intelligence and search engine, to teach him all about his job and how to better himself as a citizen of Eureka, the vast mega-city and centre of civilisation on a ruined planet Earth. It is a humorous microcosm of Snippy's life in the pre-apocalyptic world, before he met Captain and co., and is full of interesting facts, glossy pictures, informative diagrams and patronising comments from an AI who doesn't *quite* understand the human condition.

If you've seen us at comic cons recently, you may have been introduced to the book via one of the demos we had printed as an introduction to the concept, which was comb-bound. The final product will be perfect bound and very high quality, much like the Romantically Apocalyptic books 1 and 2.

Here are some of the book's contents in a handy, easy-to-follow format:

THIS THING IS PART OF ROMANTICALLY APOCALYPTIC?

Imagine it as a discovery from within the universe of Romantically Apocalyptic. A piece of future history cast off by its owner in the wasteland and rediscovered by a time-travelling archaeologist. The world of Snippy and his workplace, the GOOD Directorate, is so rich and entertaining that we felt it important to replicate this artefact for all to read and enjoy.

 

WHAT IS I, ANNET?

A collection of short stories set in the Romantically Apocalyptic universe that focuses on the interactions between human and machine in the world of the pre-apocalypse, put together with love by everyone's favourite artificial intelligence, ANNET. You'll find everything from her personal thoughts and feelings to poetry, plays, prose and heart-warming tales of courageous drones struggling to succeed in a world of organics.

Includes 50+ pages of brand-new story and illustration content not available on the comic website. Written by Clarissa Cook, illustrated by Lyndon White, Rachel Smith and Luke Horsman.

 

WHAT IS AUDITORY ASSISTANCE REMASTERED?

A 21-track companion album to Romantically Apocalyptic (not O Captein! My Captein!) The music is a mixture of atmospheric digital, guitars, vocals and effects, telling a variety of little stories that add to the scale and hilarity of the GOOD Directorate as an overbearing-but-friendly, monolithic mega-corporation (one track is used as background for the video above). We have remixed every track, and want to get it mastered professionally to achieve top quality. Then we will make the newly remastered tracks available both digitally and in a swanky new physical double CD version!

NOTE:

This isn't O Captein! My Captein!, which we released as part of our 2012 campaign. It's newer, and bigger.

NOTE 2:

If you previously purchased the Auditory Assistance digital album from our Bandcamp store, don't worry, we know who you are, and will make sure you receive a jolly discount off the digital version of Auditory Assistance Remastered.

 

IS IT, LIKE, FINISHED?

It's, like, 90% finished. We're putting the final polish on the designs of both the Tour Guide book and I, ANNET, editing all the words and waiting for the last few illustration commissions to float in. The music has been complete for quite some time, but we have spent the last few months going over each individual track, and the album as a whole, to use the techniques and skills we've improved over the years to make them really shine. We also have comprehensive quotes for most of the stages of publication including printing, fulfilment, audio mastering, etc.

 

IMAGINE I PLEDGED SOME CREDITS: DO I GET ANYTHING?

Depending on the size of your pledge, we're offering to deliver a plethora of different things from simple and accessible digital files, through signed books, to Super Special Deluxe Crunchy Welcome Packs full of things we think will delight and entertain you. Also, everything in between. Let's go through them:

£6: DIRECT-TO-BRAIN DOWNLOAD

£12: WISH YOU WERE HERE

£18: FUN-SIZE SPECIALS

£25-35: ARTEFACTS

£35: EXHIBITS (SOLO) - NEW!

£40: SPECIAL CRUNCHY SKETCHES - NEW!

£53: ARTEFACT SPECIALS

£75: ARTEFACT ALLIANCE

£100: EXHIBIT GALLERY - NEW!

£100: WRITER'S DELIGHT

£125: EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE

£250: DIRECTORATE TOURIST

 

WHY IS THIS MONEY NECESSARY?

You might have seen us at various conventions, but don't mistake us for a giant international corporation: we are a tiny outfit based in Ontario and the UK and, while our ambitions are huge, our cash reserves are not. We're certain you know about the principle of economy of scale, so let's just say our scale is tiny. If we're going to make this exciting new thingy come to life, we need a little help from you, our esteemed fans. So if you like what you've seen, heard and read so far, please consider pledging a few of your hard-earned credits and we will endeavour make it very worth your while.

HOW WILL MY CREDITS BE USED?

Your credits will go directly towards manufacturing and shipping your perks. Our initial goal is not designed to deliver any profit to us, only to take care of the issues of economy of scale (see above!). If we exceed our goal, our plans are flexible enough to handle the extra scale we could then achieve, and left-over funds can be reinvested in current and future projects. Some elements (like audio mastering) are fixed, and others are directly related to the volume of items required.

 

WHAT IF IT ALL GOES BUM?

Actually, that's really unlikely. We have relevant experience of launching, running, completing and fulfilling campaigns like this going back to 2012. We made mistakes at first, but over time we have become very good at what we do, and we're confident that we won't let you down. We also have ongoing cashflow from conventions and online sales that can, if necessary, provide a temporary cushion to get us through any financial difficulties.

Any delays or hardships are most likely to come from printing and manufacturing partners, or from illness or injury (for instance, if an illustrator's eyeballs popped out). If anything like this happened, which would be beyond anyone's control, we'd bring you regular updates to keep you informed as we work to resolve them.

At this stage we're legally obliged by Paypal's terms to advise you that, while we will do our absolute best to deliver on all our promises, we can't guarantee perks will be delivered. We have to say this to satisfy our legal requirements, and it has no bearing on our intention to ship you your perks!

 

WHO, WHAT AND WHEN IS ROMANTICALLY APOCALYPTIC?

Romantically Apocalyptic is a webcomic begun in 2009 by Vitaly S. Alexius. It contains crafty and dark humour, a tense, dramatic story arc, and a small crew of apocalypse survivors with complex, interwoven relationships with each other and the end of the world. The art style is a combination of high-resolution photo-manipulation and cinematic digital painting. It is totally free to view online at www.rom.ac and if you like it, please consider coming back to support us. :)

Follow the adventures of Captain and Snippy on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and via a comic convention near you!
story_txt:
SUCCESS!GOOD game, minions of Captain, good game >:-]The campaign is over and with your help we raised over £12,000 for the greater glory of Captainia and the ruination of Snippy. We can't express how thankful we are for the support, and how excited we are to now be able to finish off all of these things and ship your rewards to you.We've moved to In Demand phase, so you can still pre-order a reduced number of items, including the Snippy book, I, ANNET, Auditory Assistance Remastered and the EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE all for a limited time.Bear in mind that these pre-orders won't contain stickers or a pin badge, nor will the post-deadline EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE contain a Manilla Ticket. These additions were for the campaign only! Just so you know!Everything that follows was part of the original campaign pitch. We'll see you in an update soon!--STRETCH GOALS!Thanks and salutations to all of you who have backed our campaign and helped us to ensure that all of our dreams and Snippy's nightmares will come true. Let's talk about next-level funding!DONE! STRETCH GOAL 1: 125%Access all the benefits of being Snippy, such as:
Being alive.
<ERROR>
<ERROR>
When we reach this goal this product will be automatically added to the order of everyone who has obtained an ARTEFACT perk or higher.STRETCH GOAL 2:  150%If we reach 150% funded we'll unlock a reward tier that will get you a tshirt to wear in your director's chair, just like Engie. Look seriously sci-fi with your glow-in-the-dark details :3Once the perk is unlocked you'll be able to claim it just like any other perk, and you don't need to cancel your current reward to get it!We're very close to the end now, so if we reach this stretch goal we'll endeavour to make tshirts available to whoever wants one after the campaign ends. Watch this space!NEW REWARDSWe've also unlocked a number of new rewards for you to claim, which are a bit different from what we've had before. These are the *limited* mounted prints of the four main characters and a top-tier perk which contains everything from DIRECTORATE TOURIST but also one of two exclusive original sketches by artist Lyndon White! Check them out on the sidebar or down below. 100% REACHED!You know you're onto a winner when Captain throws you a party! We made it, gang. Now we can do the thing!We've still got a couple of weeks to go so if you're on the fence, know that we are guaranteed to go ahead as of right now! Fill your boots! Stretch goals on their way but for now, we need to sleep :3 WHO IS CHARLES SNIPPY?He's the most hapless person you could ever meet, yet he just got promoted. The problem with Snippy is that he's Unconnectable, a member of the one per cent of all humans on Earth who can't connect to the giant Neural Network that serves humanity (and sometimes their pets), so just being noticed enough to get a new job is a major success for him. Naturally, he needs a little extra help to get him through his training. DESCRIBE THE ARTEFACT TO ME!The artefact is Snippy's GOOD Directorate employee handbook. A manual, if you will, and a 100+ page guide to the specifics of his new job as a Dead Zone Tour Guide. It was written for him by ANNET, an artificial super-intelligence and search engine, to teach him all about his job and how to better himself as a citizen of Eureka, the vast mega-city and centre of civilisation on a ruined planet Earth. It is a humorous microcosm of Snippy's life in the pre-apocalyptic world, before he met Captain and co., and is full of interesting facts, glossy pictures, informative diagrams and patronising comments from an AI who doesn't *quite* understand the human condition.If you've seen us at comic cons recently, you may have been introduced to the book via one of the demos we had printed as an introduction to the concept, which was comb-bound. The final product will be perfect bound and very high quality, much like the Romantically Apocalyptic books 1 and 2.Here are some of the book's contents in a handy, easy-to-follow format:THIS THING IS PART OF ROMANTICALLY APOCALYPTIC?Imagine it as a discovery from within the universe of Romantically Apocalyptic. A piece of future history cast off by its owner in the wasteland and rediscovered by a time-travelling archaeologist. The world of Snippy and his workplace, the GOOD Directorate, is so rich and entertaining that we felt it important to replicate this artefact for all to read and enjoy. WHAT IS I, ANNET?A collection of short stories set in the Romantically Apocalyptic universe that focuses on the interactions between human and machine in the world of the pre-apocalypse, put together with love by everyone's favourite artificial intelligence, ANNET. You'll find everything from her personal thoughts and feelings to poetry, plays, prose and heart-warming tales of courageous drones struggling to succeed in a world of organics.Includes 50+ pages of brand-new story and illustration content not available on the comic website. Written by Clarissa Cook, illustrated by Lyndon White, Rachel Smith and Luke Horsman. WHAT IS AUDITORY ASSISTANCE REMASTERED?A 21-track companion album to Romantically Apocalyptic (not O Captein! My Captein!) The music is a mixture of atmospheric digital, guitars, vocals and effects, telling a variety of little stories that add to the scale and hilarity of the GOOD Directorate as an overbearing-but-friendly, monolithic mega-corporation (one track is used as background for the video above). We have remixed every track, and want to get it mastered professionally to achieve top quality. Then we will make the newly remastered tracks available both digitally and in a swanky new physical double CD version!NOTE:This isn't O Captein! My Captein!, which we released as part of our 2012 campaign. It's newer, and bigger.NOTE 2:If you previously purchased the Auditory Assistance digital album from our Bandcamp store, don't worry, we know who you are, and will make sure you receive a jolly discount off the digital version of Auditory Assistance Remastered. IS IT, LIKE, FINISHED?It's, like, 90% finished. We're putting the final polish on the designs of both the Tour Guide book and I, ANNET, editing all the words and waiting for the last few illustration commissions to float in. The music has been complete for quite some time, but we have spent the last few months going over each individual track, and the album as a whole, to use the techniques and skills we've improved over the years to make them really shine. We also have comprehensive quotes for most of the stages of publication including printing, fulfilment, audio mastering, etc. IMAGINE I PLEDGED SOME CREDITS: DO I GET ANYTHING?Depending on the size of your pledge, we're offering to deliver a plethora of different things from simple and accessible digital files, through signed books, to Super Special Deluxe Crunchy Welcome Packs full of things we think will delight and entertain you. Also, everything in between. Let's go through them:£6: DIRECT-TO-BRAIN DOWNLOAD£12: WISH YOU WERE HERE£18: FUN-SIZE SPECIALS£25-35: ARTEFACTS£35: EXHIBITS (SOLO) - NEW!£40: SPECIAL CRUNCHY SKETCHES - NEW!£53: ARTEFACT SPECIALS£75: ARTEFACT ALLIANCE£100: EXHIBIT GALLERY - NEW!£100: WRITER'S DELIGHT£125: EMPLOYEE WELCOME PACKAGE£250: DIRECTORATE TOURIST WHY IS THIS MONEY NECESSARY?You might have seen us at various conventions, but don't mistake us for a giant international corporation: we are a tiny outfit based in Ontario and the UK and, while our ambitions are huge, our cash reserves are not. We're certain you know about the principle of economy of scale, so let's just say our scale is tiny. If we're going to make this exciting new thingy come to life, we need a little help from you, our esteemed fans. So if you like what you've seen, heard and read so far, please consider pledging a few of your hard-earned credits and we will endeavour make it very worth your while.HOW WILL MY CREDITS BE USED?Your credits will go directly towards manufacturing and shipping your perks. Our initial goal is not designed to deliver any profit to us, only to take care of the issues of economy of scale (see above!). If we exceed our goal, our plans are flexible enough to handle the extra scale we could then achieve, and left-over funds can be reinvested in current and future projects. Some elements (like audio mastering) are fixed, and others are directly related to the volume of items required. WHAT IF IT ALL GOES BUM?Actually, that's really unlikely. We have relevant experience of launching, running, completing and fulfilling campaigns like this going back to 2012. We made mistakes at first, but over time we have become very good at what we do, and we're confident that we won't let you down. We also have ongoing cashflow from conventions and online sales that can, if necessary, provide a temporary cushion to get us through any financial difficulties.Any delays or hardships are most likely to come from printing and manufacturing partners, or from illness or injury (for instance, if an illustrator's eyeballs popped out). If anything like this happened, which would be beyond anyone's control, we'd bring you regular updates to keep you informed as we work to resolve them.At this stage we're legally obliged by Paypal's terms to advise you that, while we will do our absolute best to deliver on all our promises, we can't guarantee perks will be delivered. We have to say this to satisfy our legal requirements, and it has no bearing on our intention to ship you your perks! WHO, WHAT AND WHEN IS ROMANTICALLY APOCALYPTIC?Romantically Apocalyptic is a webcomic begun in 2009 by Vitaly S. Alexius. It contains crafty and dark humour, a tense, dramatic story arc, and a small crew of apocalypse survivors with complex, interwoven relationships with each other and the end of the world. The art style is a combination of high-resolution photo-manipulation and cinematic digital painting. It is totally free to view online at www.rom.ac and if you like it, please consider coming back to support us. :)Follow the adventures of Captain and Snippy on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and via a comic convention near you!

story:
This book includes 3 fun fantasy stories:

Goblins at College

Dank and Sophie were students at Fitch's Academy for Young Assassins. Dank always struggled with the practical aspects of the course, but he wasn’t always great with the book-learning, either. How did he get his grades up and what gave him the passion to do it?

How do you make that poison again?

Bog the Orc

Bog might be a giant, beefy orc with decent mutton chops, but he never quite fit in. What kind of orc leaves his tribe and strikes out alone in this wild and dangerous world? This short comic reveals all. 

It's... complicated.

Stop the Dragon

Dank, Bog and Sonya the Wizard arrive in a small town, hounded by a terrible menace: a greedy, fire-breathing dragon! They'd rather avoid a fight, but they are quickly drawn into the town's nightmare. They'll need to work together to defeat a foe more powerful than any of them have faced before! 

After a long journey, you need some R&R!

 

The three stories in this comic are based around the characters found in my graphic novel, Sneaky Goblins. What’s that you say-- you haven’t read it yet? Don’t worry about it, you can enjoy the book even without reading the original. Besides, every pledge level AU$15 and up gets a PDF of the original graphic novel.  

So whether you’re a die-hard Sneaky Goblins fan, or you’re checking out my comics for the first time, I hope you have as much fun reading this comic as I did making it.

Bog vows to spread the good name of orc-kind.

Here's what they're saying about my first Kickstarter project, the original Sneaky Goblins graphic novel:

Sneaky Goblins is a delightfully fast and funny fantasy adventure. It’s packed with incredible creatures, lovable underdog characters, and it transforms all the familiar Lord of the Rings-style quest tropes into something really fresh and engaging.

-Lucas Testro, The Radioactive Lounge podcast, Ep 109. 

This comic excels in the character design. The design for Dank and Bog passes the silhouette test, they’re interesting characters to look at. The set-up, the character design, the world-building- it’s all there. You should definitely go check out Sneaky Goblins, it’s a really fun comic! 

-Jason Sigler, Digital Strips Podcast, Ep 517.

Rene Pfitzner has struck a good mix of comical, cartoony, and character, and forced it all in a blender with the resulting magical mixture being Sneaky Goblins. 

Karl Smith, www.fullpriceforlatepizza.com

 

But it's not just for grown-ups! Did you know kids love Sneaky Goblins too?! 

Some beaut shots sent in by proud parents all over the world!

 

Hi! I'm René: creator, writer and artist of Sneaky Goblins at College. 

 I was a character animator at Disneytoon Studios and a storyboard artist at Southern Star Entertainment. I'm also a compulsive comic creator! I've chipped in to a number of different comic anthologies and webcomics. 

Some of the films, TV and magazines I've worked on.

I've always loved drawing and telling stories. Making this book was a labor of love, and I hope that comes through as you read it. 

So why did I write Sneaky Goblins at College?

Every one of these stories has a special meaning for me, and each is built around a theme that goes to the heart of who I am and where I've come from...

Goblins at College 

Have you ever had a passion and then lost it somewhere along the way? When I worked in an animation studio, I was super-motivated to progress to the department that would give me the greatest capacity for expression and the best use of my skills. Trouble was, once I got there, I discovered the new role was a massive step up! The work became overwhelming and I quickly lost the drive to rise to the challenge. I wish I had someone like Sophie to drag me through the difficulty and help me remember what I loved about animation in the first place.

Bog the Orc is a story about an outsider. Even though I'm part of the majority Anglo culture here in my native Australia, growing up I always felt a bit on the outside. When I was a child in the 80s, it wasn't cool to like drawing or comics or video games. Being an introvert didn't help either. Bog eventually has to leave his home, but now he has a chance to step out and be the orc he was meant to be!

A rare sighting of young René at the beach.

Stop the Dragon is a good old fantasy Dungeons and Dragons- style fantasy romp, but the character I most identify with is the elderly priest who just wants some peace and security for his monastery. Priests in the fantasy genre are often portrayed as self-serving and manipulative. For once I wanted a man of the cloth who was straight down the line: no machinations, no ulterior motive: just straight -up concerned for the safety of the town. 

If you'd like to know more about what makes me tick as a creator, here's a short video documentary about me and my work:

 

Over the past year, I've been making and posting the pages of this comic on my weekly webcomic: www.tolcraft.com. Now the three stories are complete, and it's time to print the book! With your help, I'd love to make this book a reality, and get it into the hands of readers like you.

  • 40 pages plus cover  
  • full colour  
  • Perfect bound 
  • Cover: 105lbs (It'll feel sturdier than your average floppy comic book)
  • Interior paper: 70lbs
  • Size: 6.625 x 10.25in. (Standard Image book size)

Every page of the comic starts out here: drawing the panels in pencil!

The amount raised on Indiegogo will all go to funding an offset print run of 1000 copies of the comic. Copies of the comic left over after the campaign will be stock that I can sell at comic conventions, libraries and book shops.

I've come to Indiegogo to help get this book into as many hands as possible, and I'd love your support to bring it to life.

Let's have a peek inside!

Want more? Get a sample PDF of the comic here: www.tolcraft.com/free

What will the funds be used for? 

I'm here on Indiegogo to help bring this book to print and get it out to all of my wonderful supporters! I'm not trying to make money or reimburse myself for any of the time I spent making the comic itself. 

The whole amount raised will go back into printing the book, and  shipping it out safely to you.

You should have your books by the end of November 2019 at the latest. 

I will be sending the final book files to to the printer in the first week of July. Printing will take a couple of months- at the most. I also want to have a buffer just in case there is a delay at any stage.

After successfully running two crowdfunding campaigns, I have a good understanding of the demands and potential pitfalls involved in this kind of project. 
The comic is totally finished - it's ready to go to press! 
The biggest risk is an unforeseen delay in printing and shipping out to me in Melbourne, Australia. That's why I've built in a buffer in the delivery schedule.

I'll be packing and shipping the books from Melbourne, Australia.

Thanks so much for checking out my campaign. I'm really excited about getting this book to print and I'd love for you to be involved. Please lock in your copy now.

Cheers,

-René

story:
Thank you so much for your interest and time!

Previously I have written short little songlets that have become house favorites. ("A Giraffe's Funeral", "I Love Meat", etc) Not only have they become frequently requested, but many of you have asked for more songs! More! More music! More! More, more, more!! I mean damn! I feel you:)

 I went to work right away, and began this project. 

Additionally, I have brought on three incredibly talented artists/musicians, to help me put together some delicious jams!

*Alyssa VanGorder, director/singer (WWW.ALYSSAVANGORDER.COM) 

*Connie Saltzman, singer, ukulele & guitar (WWW.CONNIESALTZMAN.COM)

*Latisha Di Venuto, singer/rapper (WWW.LATISHDIVENUTO.COM)

 

PERFORMANCES:

WED May 31st @7pm & SAT June 3rd @7pm

The Laurie Beechman Theatre

407 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036

For Tickets: http://www.westbankcafe.com/laurie-beechman-the...

story:
GEP's Story

GEP was born in the early hours of a working week, to the parents of insomnia and creative freedom. It weighed a healthy ∞ imagination. Its first word was “gaga”.


Most creative people, who are not self-employed, feel the longing for creative freedom at one point in their careers. That feeling kept me up at night until I decided to put pen to paper and start GEP.


What is GEP?

GEP (Gojo Entertainment Presents) is an anthology comic book series. Each issue contains one or more short stories. The stories are all fiction and include action, adventure, sci-fi, horror, fantasy, crime, drama and super heroes.

GEP aims to keep readers entertained through the use of interesting, unique, creative and exciting stories, and excellent and varied art. It strives for continuous, good quality.


Issue 1

Issue 1 contains 3 short stories, which I wrote and illustrated. The stories are available to read on GEP's website, and can also be purchased in digital and printed form.


Issue 2 (or “I can't do this alone”)

If only one person contributes to a creative project then it will be creatively limited. The first issue had good stories, but the art was lacking. So I decided to work with good artists, while I focus on writing. I started saving up money to hire artists for issue 2. And I am glad I did! It has been a great pleasure working with such talented artists.

7 stories have been completed for issue 2, all of which are available to read on GEP's website. Only 1 more story left to complete for issue 2. Almost there.

The digital version of issue 2 will be available at the end of February, and the printed version will be available by the end of March 2011.


Issue 3 and GEP TPB Volume 1

I have started planning stories for issue 3, and will start on the scripts within the next week. The illustrations for each script will start as soon as I have enough funds to hire artists.

I am hoping issue 3 will be completed by the end of April 2011. The digital version will be available first, and the printed version about 4 weeks after that.

GEP TPB (trade paperback) Volume 1 will contain issue 1, 2 and 3. The TPB will be available in print about 2 weeks after issue 3 is available in print.


Why do you need $2700?

This is based on the amount of $2100 which I spent to produce issue 2, plus extra to cover printing and shipping perks to funders, plus the 4% fee for IndieGoGo and the 3.9% fee for Paypal.


How will the money be used?

The money will primarily be used to hire artists for issue 3, and to print and ship perks to funders.


What if you don't meet your $2700 goal?

I will take the same road I took for issue 2, by saving up money. But this time it will take much longer, as my monthly expenses have increased. Any funding received will be greatly appreciated, and it will make the journey easier.


What if you make more than $2700?

The extra funds will contribute to future issues, starting with issue 4.


What's the comic like?

It is awesome, filled with brilliant art and unique and creative ideas! It will get even better with each issue. But do not just take my biased opinion, judge for yourself by reading the 7 completed stories for issue 2 on GEP's website.


How else can we help?

Please spread the word by directing people to this page. Share the link by posting it on Facebook, forums, Twitter and email.


Are you doing this alone?

No, at the moment my roles are writer and editor. A total of 11 artists have worked on issue 2. Eventually I will hire other writers and editors, and publish creator owned content. But first GEP needs to obtain financial success and popularity before it can be a benefit to creators who want to publish their works in it.

And of course, there are also the funders of GEP.

THANK YOU!


Here are links to the 7 completed stories for issue 2:
Icky Fable
Widow Maker
Kung Fu Season
Vigilante Sagas: Enter Elise
Monster Buddy
Sensory
Copper Thieves


PS: If you contribute, you may email me a photo of yourself (or your pets or collection of toys) holding or standing next to a sign which reads “I supported GEP on IndieGoGo!”. (Or “We supported GEP on IndieGoGo!”). I will post the photos in the gallery and on GEP's website. Please keep the photos safe for all ages.


Updates

GEP issue 2 is available in digital format.
Grab a copy from GEP's website:
http://www.gep-comic.com/v1/?page_id=113
Or from DriveThruComics where you can also check out other great comics:
http://comics.drivethrustuff.com/index.php?manufacturers_id=3566


The first short story for issue 3 is complete "Gojo Horror: Heirloom".
Read it here: http://www.gep-comic.com/v1/?p=509



GEP issue 2 is available in print!

Order a copy from IndyPlanet for $3.99 USD.
http://www.indyplanet.com/index.php?id=5004

If you are a retailer, please order copies from ComicsMonkey.
http://www.comicsmonkey.com/index.php?id=5004

A big THANK YOU to everyone who was involved in issue 2!

Also a great THANK YOU to the people at Ka-Blam for their great service and for making the printed version a reality.
story_txt:
GEP's Story
GEP was born in the early hours of a working week, to the parents of insomnia and creative freedom. It weighed a healthy ∞ imagination. Its first word was “gaga”.
Most creative people, who are not self-employed, feel the longing for creative freedom at one point in their careers. That feeling kept me up at night until I decided to put pen to paper and start GEP.


What is GEP?
GEP (Gojo Entertainment Presents) is an anthology comic book series. Each issue contains one or more short stories. The stories are all fiction and include action, adventure, sci-fi, horror, fantasy, crime, drama and super heroes.GEP aims to keep readers entertained through the use of interesting, unique, creative and exciting stories, and excellent and varied art. It strives for continuous, good quality.


Issue 1
Issue 1 contains 3 short stories, which I wrote and illustrated. The stories are available to read on GEP's website, and can also be purchased in digital and printed form.


Issue 2 (or “I can't do this alone”)
If only one person contributes to a creative project then it will be creatively limited. The first issue had good stories, but the art was lacking. So I decided to work with good artists, while I focus on writing. I started saving up money to hire artists for issue 2. And I am glad I did! It has been a great pleasure working with such talented artists.7 stories have been completed for issue 2, all of which are available to read on GEP's website. Only 1 more story left to complete for issue 2. Almost there.The digital version of issue 2 will be available at the end of February, and the printed version will be available by the end of March 2011.

Issue 3 and GEP TPB Volume 1I have started planning stories for issue 3, and will start on the scripts within the next week. The illustrations for each script will start as soon as I have enough funds to hire artists.I am hoping issue 3 will be completed by the end of April 2011. The digital version will be available first, and the printed version about 4 weeks after that.GEP TPB (trade paperback) Volume 1 will contain issue 1, 2 and 3. The TPB will be available in print about 2 weeks after issue 3 is available in print.Why do you need $2700?This is based on the amount of $2100 which I spent to produce issue 2, plus extra to cover printing and shipping perks to funders, plus the 4% fee for IndieGoGo and the 3.9% fee for Paypal.How will the money be used?The money will primarily be used to hire artists for issue 3, and to print and ship perks to funders.What if you don't meet your $2700 goal?I will take the same road I took for issue 2, by saving up money. But this time it will take much longer, as my monthly expenses have increased. Any funding received will be greatly appreciated, and it will make the journey easier.What if you make more than $2700?The extra funds will contribute to future issues, starting with issue 4.What's the comic like?It is awesome, filled with brilliant art and unique and creative ideas! It will get even better with each issue. But do not just take my biased opinion, judge for yourself by reading the 7 completed stories for issue 2 on GEP's website.How else can we help?Please spread the word by directing people to this page. Share the link by posting it on Facebook, forums, Twitter and email.Are you doing this alone?No, at the moment my roles are writer and editor. A total of 11 artists have worked on issue 2. Eventually I will hire other writers and editors, and publish creator owned content. But first GEP needs to obtain financial success and popularity before it can be a benefit to creators who want to publish their works in it.And of course, there are also the funders of GEP.THANK YOU!Here are links to the 7 completed stories for issue 2:Icky FableWidow MakerKung Fu SeasonVigilante Sagas: Enter EliseMonster BuddySensoryCopper ThievesPS: If you contribute, you may email me a photo of yourself (or your pets or collection of toys) holding or standing next to a sign which reads “I supported GEP on IndieGoGo!”. (Or “We supported GEP on IndieGoGo!”). I will post the photos in the gallery and on GEP's website. Please keep the photos safe for all ages.UpdatesGEP issue 2 is available in digital format.Grab a copy from GEP's website:http://www.gep-comic.com/v1/?page_id=113Or from DriveThruComics where you can also check out other great comics:http://comics.drivethrustuff.com/index.php?manufacturers_id=3566The first short story for issue 3 is complete "Gojo Horror: Heirloom".Read it here: http://www.gep-comic.com/v1/?p=509GEP issue 2 is available in print!Order a copy from IndyPlanet for $3.99 USD.http://www.indyplanet.com/index.php?id=5004If you are a retailer, please order copies from ComicsMonkey.http://www.comicsmonkey.com/index.php?id=5004A big THANK YOU to everyone who was involved in issue 2!Also a great THANK YOU to the people at Ka-Blam for their great service and for making the printed version a reality.

story:
Hi, my name is Joshua Field. Some of my earliest memories as a child were dreaming up some fantastical worlds with heroes and villains, magic and supernatural powers, spaceships and alien planets. I have always wanted to create my very own universe to share with others. Over the past seven years or so I have begun development of that universe. I call it: Titans and Gods.

When I was sixteen I was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. Then at eighteen I started working as a salesman in a department store. Over the next couple of years of working it became harder for me to walk and even to stand. So I went to Full Sail for computer animation, but I had to leave due to the problems in my life. After having to leave college, the overwhelming realization that a regular job or schooling was not going to work out for me, struck me hard. Between my medical and educational restrictions it seemed as though I had nothing I could do.

I looked back on my childhood and all the crazy and fantastic worlds I would spend days working on. Drawing since I was three, building with LEGOs, playing video games, watching movies, and playing superhero with my friends, I realized my imagination was my greatest asset. So I set to work on taking all of my favorite ideas and figuring out how my new universe was going to function.


As I looked at my inspirations like MARVEL, DC, J.R.R. Tolkien, Star Trek, Bent Weeks, and so many other people and worlds that I fell in love with, I found, or better stated didn’t find a single full page traditional art graphic novel series. Books here and there, but most of the graphic art community is done in line art and word bubbles. As much as I do enjoy this, as I am currently following INHUMAN, I have a strong passion for variety in art. A passion I would enjoy sharing with you through Titans and Gods.


About three years ago I asked Joshua Lucas and Rebekah Randall, friends of mine, to join me in making our first traditional art, graphic novel. Joshua, a wonderful storyteller, Rebekah, a talented traditional artist, and I have been hard at work. Our big goal is to make our own company and write and draw many stories to reveal the whole universe of Titans and Gods.


The plan is to start by showing how the First Titans came to the planet Naissance from the heavens above. This will be done in a three book series called: The Age of the Titans. The first book, Rise of a King, is what we are asking for your help to launch. Rise of a King will be set in a medieval fantasy theme. In later story arcs I plan to pass through time into a Steampunk theme and then into a Sci-fi theme. This will be done through the telling of later stories and new characters in the years to come.


Before we can even begin to work on too much of that, we need your help to get our first book on paper and in stores. We are trying to raise $40,000. This money will go toward printing and developing Rise of a King. Other expenses will include the making of the promotion products such as T-shirts, posters, and stickers. We look forward to you joining us by donating to help us realize our dream. Please spread the word by posting our website: TitansAndGod.com on FaceBook, Twitter, Redit, and other social media sites. Thank you for your donations and getting the word out. 

Sincerely,

Joshua Field

Creator

P.S. You can read the beginning of Robert Light's story Rise of a King at:

www.TitansAndGods.com

story:
Cerebus No. 1, the 1977 original as it was intended to be seen!

"I have waited 43 years to see Cerebus No. 1 the way it was supposed to look. Thanks to Sean Michael Robinson and The Waverly Press that wait is now over." - Dave Sim, 2020 

In December 1977, Deni Loubert published Cerebus No.1, Dave Sim's comic book that followed the adventures of a short-tempered, barbarian Aardvark. Originally conceived as a parody of Barry Windsor-Smith's masterfully illustrated Conan the Barbarian (which was a big hit for Marvel Comics in the 1970's), Sim quickly found his own voice as a storyteller and illustrator, developing elaborate story-arcs which would span dozens of issues. The 1980's saw the popularity of Cerebus explode, igniting a revolution among self-motivated artists and storytellers who were looking for ways to go it alone. Dave Sim helped pave the way for countless other self-publishers of the day, including Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Bob Burden's Flaming Carrot, and Jeff Smith's Bone to name a few... Along the way, Cerebus cemented its place as one of the most intelligently written, entertaining, and influential comic books of all time! The original Cerebus No.1 was printed on newsprint paper and after 43 years, most of the few examples that have survived are typically found in lower grades. This new edition is presented with beautifully remastered art, prepared by master digital restoration artist Sean Michael Robinson, for stunning crystal clarity! 

Due to the popularity of Cerebus, original 1977 copies of the first issue now command thousands of dollars, putting them out of reach for most collectors. 

 

THE CEREBUS PERKS!

Cerebus No. 1 available in 4 editions with remastered art...

1. RED - Standard 24 page edition, just like the 1977 original!

2. GOLD - Expanded 48 page edition with Cerebus Archive rarities!

3. PLATINUM - Deluxe Expanded 48 page edition signed & numbered by Dave Sim!

4. PROMOTIONAL - Expanded 48 page promotional edition! This version features a graphic front cover with the project bio on the back cover, bound outside of a gold cover 48 page expanded edition. It's a double cover!

The RED, GOLD and PLATINUM editions each come with its own trading card. Get the bundle of all 4, save $10 and receive a bonus trading card!

BONUS PACK - Consists of 3 additional Trading Cards, Bookmark, 11x17" Poster, Cloisonné pin, 5x7" Postcard, 16 page Sketchbook, 3" Sticker, and The Secret History of the Counterfeit Cerebus No. 1 Comic! These 10 Cerebus items are being produced exclusively for this project!

 

​"OSLO" TRADING CARD - A box of Cerebus trading card prototype samples were sent to Dave in Canada. Somehow the box ended up in Oslo, Norway where it disappeared. Nearly 2 months later it re-appeared at Dave's doorstep. Dave has had signed, numbered and marked each trading card "OSLO." These are only available here for the duration of this campaign!

 

 

ORIGINAL CEREBUS ART - Dave Sim stopped offering original Cerebus art to collectors years ago. Just for this campaign, you can get an original Dave Sim Cerebus drawing on the cover of the Cerebus Sketchbook! These will likely be his only Cerebus drawings produced in 2020.

 

BE A PART OF COMIC BOOK HISTORY!

Dave Sim's Cerebus radically changed the comic-book landscape forever, helping clear the way for a new generation of self-publishers to find their own success! These editions of Cerebus No. 1, and all the extras that we are producing will not be widely distributed through any comic shops or other retail outlets. This is your last chance to pick up the first issue of this classic series as Dave Sim originally intended in 1977, along with a trove of rarities produced exclusively for this project!

Risks & Challenges

We are finalizing and proofing the final designs, and just about ready for production. Our primary risk is the Covid-19 pandemic. As long as supply chains and postal systems stay operational, we do not anticipate any delays in production and delivery. We will closely monitor events and keep our backers updated.

story:
I've animated on some of the most unique films of the 1970s & 1980s and want to share some of my drawings and behind the scene experiences with you!

Here is the front cover and some sample interior pages:

 

 

 

I’ve been a classical 2D pencil-on-paper animator for 45 years. I’ve always enjoyed capturing quirky personalities with my pencil; and now I want to share some of my favorite character drawings by presenting more than 80 of them in a large-sized 80 page 8.3 x 11.7 inch landscape portfolio...

...but I need your help to get the funding to lay out and print the book.

The following are more samples of the sketches I'll include:

  • I animated the first appearance of Boba Fett in the Star Wars Holiday Special.

  • I animated on the cult classic feature ROCK & RULE...

The characters I focused on were:

  • Cindy the Rollerskating Disco Princess, 
  • Officer Quadhole,
  •  Mylar the Club Owner.

  • AND one of my favorite projects I animated was the always entertaining four BATMAN ZELLERS commercials.

https://youtu.be/ow2DKynQXeQ

My drawings are not just from the past...they are also my present day projects. Such as Snuffy & Zoey's ToyBox Adventures, which is a great way of introducing young kids to the joys of reading comics!

  • Check out my YouTube channel John the Animator Guy!  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2Jkh1TsKDUBhR3Wa5a3o_g

These are just some of the projects that are included in my portfolio.

Please check out the various pledge levels, which on the top tier I'm offering a personally drawn rough sketch of Boba Fett, in my Star Wars Holiday Special style.

So, thank you for checking out my Kickstarter, and please share this with your friends.

Hope you have a great day!

Risks and challenges

All the images have been gathered! All that needs to be done is for me to polish up some narrative text that goes along with them and put the material into an InDesign layout, and send it to the printer Mixam.

story:
UPDATE [07-30-20]: STICKERS!

Here's what the stickers included with orders will look like! 

UPDATE [07-04-20]: BONUS! 

**All tiers now come with these BONUS ITEMS! **

PENG! Action Sports Adventures! 

"PENG!" is the sound a kickball makes when it is kicked! "PENG!" is also the name of your new favorite sports-themed action graphic novel! 


Created by Corey "Reyyy" Lewis, creator of "Sharknife", "Sun Bakery" and "Seedless" graphic novels-- contributor to companies like Marvel, Capcom & Nickelodeon on franchises such as X-Men, Street Fighter and Avatar: The Last Airbender! 

PENG! Action Sports Adventures is a collection of THREE "fringe sports" action adventures featuring the Foot Knux team! One story about Kickball, another about Hackey Sack, and a final story about BREAKDANCING! All connected thru a tour of the Foot Knux world-class SPORTS SCHOOL, The All-World School of Sportsmanship! 

It's new comic book manga-influenced hyper kinetic energy personified on paper! 


And these aren't regular sports stories-- oh no-- These are "Martial Arts Encrusted Sports Fables" featuring incredible special moves,  supernatural biter beings, luchador bears, talking shadows, super sentai breakdancers that transform into JETS and MORE! 

"Comics are a delicate balance of story, art, character, action, friendship, passion, courage, dumb jokes, and of course, extremely big sound effects. PENG! gives you all of those things and thus it is a perfect comic."

- Bryan Lee O'Malley (Scott Pilgrim, Seconds) 

 

PENG is unlike anything you've experienced before! Trust! 

Special Items!

Along with the included BONUS ITEMS, the different PERK TIERS come with these SPECIAL ITEMS! 

Enamel Pins! (1.5") 

"PENG!" Teams lineup photo print! 

^PENG! 6x8" Team lineup photo print! Signed by Corey Lewis & individually numbered. 

Stickers!

+ + + + +

If you're looking for something truly unique to add to your comic book collection or just something completely fun to read; PENG! is the book for you! 

+ + + + + 

Funding & Challenges

Good news! PENG, the book, is ALREADY COMPLETE! That's right, the book is already done & at the printers as we speak! The book is being published by Oni Press. 

This campaign is created as an alternative to the now-cancelled conventions & planned book release events for PENG! This campaign is a way for fans to pre-order the book through the author, as well as get signatures and special items we would've had at conventions! The funding here is to cover the costs of the special items and additional copies of the book! 

I currently run & operate my own storefront Coastalvania, which has received and shipped over 800 orders over the last year! All shipped & fulfilled by my team and I! 

My team and I will be dedicated to getting the books in your hands, along with all special items! And since the book is already complete, the wait will not be long!

We hope you join us on this Action Sports Adventure! See you in the pages, pal! 

+ + + + + 

Other Ways to Help

Feel free to share awareness of PENG! The most unique SPORTS-THEMED comic you're likely to find!

story:
Who or what is Chief Rocka?

CHIEF ROCKA is an indie comic book by Tom Syverson and Ben Marlowe. This is the first issue of a planned six-issue mini series, and it's the product of nearly a decade of close friendship and collaboration. 

We came up with the idea for this comic when we were both just a few months out of college. At the time, we both faced a situation that has become a cliché for the Millennial generation: that volatile cocktail of career anxiety, student debt, and general aimlessness. We spent our shared quarter-life crisis trying to stay afloat, and channeled all our energy into conceiving this very project.

Ten years later, we see this story as a metaphor for our own struggles, and we think that many others will see themselves in it too.

Who do you two think you are?

 

Tom is a freelance writer living in Brooklyn. Briefly, for a time, he was a corporate lawyer type too, until he decided to take another path. Nowadays, he writes about politics and culture for outlets like Paste Magazine, Quartz, and Splice Today.

Ben is an international award-winning animator and artist living and working in Los Angeles. He's been featured in numerous competitive and curated shows, festivals, and galleries around the world. Lately, much of his work has been for NPR's Snap Judgment and Stones Throw Records.

 

 

How 'bout you make me an offer I can't refuse?

On our first campaign, we're excited to offer up the first issue of the series. It's 22 pages of madness, ideas, and Ben's delicious art.

This is your chance to get in on the ground floor with a one-of-a-kind moment in graphic storytelling: the first appearance of CHIEF ROCKA, that lovable two-bit occult hustler!

We're asking for funding for two reasons:

(1) to fund the printing, shipping, and promotional costs of producing hard-copy comics, stickers, and posters - $1,500

(2) to fund and support the artistic labor necessary to illustrate the second issue - $3,500

The central item is a high-quality printing of our very first issue. We've seen the publisher's proof, and we can report that it's a gorgeous and glossy product. For those interested in supporting the campaign a bit more, we're also offering additional perks including posters, stickers, and for the true connoisseur, original artwork on canvas by Ben Marlowe.

What on Earth possessed you to do this?

We're asking for help funding this project because being a freelance artist isn't easy. Over the past 10 years, Ben has built a freelance career doing animations, printmaking, and music videos for a wide range of clients. Ben depends on his freelance income to buy food and a roof over his head each month. Every project counts.

When it comes to his real passion—drawing this comic book—the work is incredibly labor intensive and time consuming. Financially, it'll be impossible for him to spend the time and energy necessary to complete the next issue (let alone the full mini-series) unless he can justify turning down some freelance gigs in the meantime.

We're looking for support from people who love comics with a unique voice, and who want to see this project reach its full potential. We have a big story to tell here and hope the world is ready for it!

 

Is there any risk or downside to throwing in with Chief Rocka?

Nope! Every page of the first issue is already complete, and we just need to send a check to the printer. The same goes for the additional perks we're offering (the stickers and poster), except for the original artwork by Ben. He hasn't physically carried out that project yet, although he does have some devilish ideas. Additionally, Ben likes to communicate with a client before beginning on commissions. So, if you're seriously interested in purchasing original artwork from Ben, please feel free to contact us to discuss.

If there's any risk at all, it relates to whether or not you'll ever get the chance to read all six issues of what we have planned. Tom has the whole saga outlined, and we promise that there is a wild, complex, and heartrending story to come. But we can only tell that story if the interest is there.

We want this campaign to fund the second issue, and the next campaign will fund the third, and so on. Whether or not we can afford to complete the eventual mini-series—to tell the full story of Chief Rocka's rise, his fall, and his unlikely comeback—depends entirely on the response we get here.

But the first issue, a wild and satisfying story in its own right, is guaranteed. And we think you're going to love it.

I'm Onboard! What Else Can I Do?

Please, please, please share with your friends, cohorts, enemies, and most of all, anyone who likes weird comics!
story_txt:
Who or what is Chief Rocka?
CHIEF ROCKA is an indie comic book by Tom Syverson and Ben Marlowe. This is the first issue of a planned six-issue mini series, and it's the product of nearly a decade of close friendship and collaboration. 
We came up with the idea for this comic when we were both just a few months out of college. At the time, we both faced a situation that has become a cliché for the Millennial generation: that volatile cocktail of career anxiety, student debt, and general aimlessness. We spent our shared quarter-life crisis trying to stay afloat, and channeled all our energy into conceiving this very project.
Ten years later, we see this story as a metaphor for our own struggles, and we think that many others will see themselves in it too.

Who do you two think you are?
 
Tom is a freelance writer living in Brooklyn. Briefly, for a time, he was a corporate lawyer type too, until he decided to take another path. Nowadays, he writes about politics and culture for outlets like Paste Magazine, Quartz, and Splice Today.
Ben is an international award-winning animator and artist living and working in Los Angeles. He's been featured in numerous competitive and curated shows, festivals, and galleries around the world. Lately, much of his work has been for NPR's Snap Judgment and Stones Throw Records.
 

 

How 'bout you make me an offer I can't refuse?
On our first campaign, we're excited to offer up the first issue of the series. It's 22 pages of madness, ideas, and Ben's delicious art.

Tom has the whole saga outlined, and we promise that there is a wild, complex, and heartrending story to come. But we can only tell that story if the interest is there.

story:
Hello,

We are the creators of Jasper's Starlight Tavern... the last pub on the edge of the universe. The Tavern is a FREE Online Web-comic posted for all you Scifi fans. 

We are NOW offering the chance to get this series IN PRINT!

My name is Bob Salley... Jason Sparich and I came up with The Tavern as a place for ALL Scifi fans and characters to intermingle. We've had a predator looking to take out a bartender wielding a wine opener and a face hugger... well, face hugging our bus-boy.

We really love this web-comic and we want to keep it up and running, so we're offering you a chance for an exclusive Printed & Signed Copy of the series as well as some other rewards (T-Shirts, Signed Mike Deathray Prints, Beer Steins and the chance to see yourself as a bar fly in one of our strips).

T-Shirts

Volume One (Signed)


Volume One AND Deliverance Book One


Beer Stein

The Bar Fly (Cameo)


We have a great artistic team behind this creation. 

Juan Calle's amazing skills bringing our words to life is a joy for us to see each week... but it would'nt pop off the page without Don Mathias on the colors.

You backing will help us keep the strip going and possibly more frequent... the funds would go directly to the Art Team AND the printing of the rewards you select. Plain and Simple!

There really are no Risks here... we'll keep doing what we're doing, but you can be a part of keeping the Tavern Open for business and get your fingers in on the magic.

story:
TRESE is written by Budjette Tan and illustrated by Kajo Baldisimo. This comic book is our love letter to Philippine mythology, the city of Manila and all the supernatural stories we heard growing up a metropolis where people embrace new technology along with old beliefs and magical practices.

Since 2005, TRESE has been published and distributed in the Philippines. While we feel lucky and thankful for all the readers who’ve picked up our books, we’ve always dreamed for TRESE to reach more readers in foreign shores.

 

With your help, we target to have the funds to print a new edition of TRESE Issue 1 (with updated art and bonus content), and be able to ship it to readers around the world. The funds we generate will also allow Kajo to devote more time to illustrating the pages.

 

 

For this Indiegogo campaign, we will release TRESE Occult Case #1, “At the Intersection of Balete Drive and 13th Street”. This 32-page comic book will have updated artwork by Kajo and comes with bonus pages, featuring journal entries that explain all the creatures that appear in the story. 

If you love murder mysteries mixed with magic and mythology, then please help us fund TRESE.

GOALS

USD $4,013 is our target goal. This amount will cover paying for the printing and shipping of the comic book (along with the other perks). 

If we exceed our goals, funds will go to the production of TRESE Occult Case #2! 

REWARDS

Supporting our comic book means you’ll get a copy of our story! You can either get a digital copy or the printed version, which will be signed by Kajo.

Higher perks get you an additional copy of the comic book with a variant cover, also drawn by Kajo.

And lastly, if you support us via our most premium perk, we will ship to you one of the original interior pages. So, only 20 people will be able available of this perk.

story:
Help Me Upgrade My Tablet!

I'm the creator of Legend of the Ztarr, a new manga series about a young girl in a swords-and-sandals sci-fi universe. My work aims to promote science and critical thinking through art and storytelling. I'm a TED Fellow and public speaker, giving talks on how art can promote science and skepticism.

My current drawing tablet is 6 years old, large, heavy, and on its last legs. My goal is to upgrade to the very portable Cintiq Companion, shipping by Wacom this October.

This upgrade would be HUGE to me, as the majority of my drawing is done digitally, with a Wacom Cintiq 21UX, purchased in 2006. The Cintiq Campanion takes this giant essential piece of drawing equipment and packages it in a 14" Windows 8 tablet.

The Cintiq Companion starts at $1999 for the 256GB model. The 512GB model is $2499. I plan on ordering the smaller model.


This will revolutionize my ability to work and draw, no matter where I am. I will no longer be attached to my ~50lb massive old model.

Get Art in Return!

As thanks to my donors, I'm offering a variety of drawings and art pieces, to show my gratitude for supporting my work to produce entertaining storytelling that promote science role models and the value in critical thinking.

story:
I am Emilio Rodriguez and the way I look at it, I have been granted a privilege -- the privilege of telling a very special story about an individual who is thrust into amazing circumstances and decides to do the right thing, not for glory or any personal reward.  In fact, he figures no one will ever thank him for it.  However, that is not important.  He himself is aware of the proper course of conduct and that is enough.  Drex'igar (or Drex) is the kind of individual I hope to be. 

Members of a warrior race find themselves on Earth after a horrible accident, and in addition, find themselves imbued with awesome powers.  Some of them decide the Earth is a perfect place for their people to re-populate and take over as their home.  Drex is the one individual among them who decides the people of Earth deserve to have their own planet and make their own way through the universe.  For want of a better term, kick-ass action ensues and all Hell breaks loose. 

Contributors will help pay for the costs of producing the book (penciler, inker, colorer and letterer), as well as the printing costs, which come out to around $5000.  We hope to have the first issue ready to debut at the upcoming NY Comic Con, which will take place October 9-12, 2014.  There are few risks and challenges as we have all published before and are used to the rigors involved.   

Unique perks include special original prints by top professional artists such as Mike Lilly and Ian Dorian so far, with others to be announced, as well as the opportunity to be a part of the story.   

The studio that will publish Dauntless is Tres Calaveras Studios, which has already published the book Sara Rising, which was the subject of an earlier Indiegogo campaign.  For the 2014 NY Comic Con, the second and third issues of Sara Rising will also be ready, so Tres Calaveras will be well-fortified at the Con.

Emilio Rodriguez, the creator and writer, is a licensed practicing attorney in New York, as well as a college professor.  In terms of comics, his story is very typical.  After falling in love with comics as a child, he wrote and drew comics throughout his adolescence.  Early loves include the Carmine Infantino early Flash stories, Miller's run on Daredevil, Stan's run on X-Men, and many others.  As is the case usually (and unfortunately), he spent some time away from comics during his college and post-graduate years.  A failed collaboration with a friend stoked the fires of creativity inside him and now he plans to write until he has no more stories to tell, which he hopes won't be for a very long time to come.

Ed Watson, the penciler and the lead designer, is a graduate of the Delaware College of Art and, most especially, the Joe Kubert School of Cartoon & Graphic Art.  In Ed's own words: "From a very young age cartoons and movies of the Sci-Fi and Fantasy genres inspired me. Every Saturday morning while still in my P.J.'s, I'd sit in front of the TV watching all my favorite shows. Early on I had decided that I would become an artist. At that time it was the animation field that had held my interest. At about the sixth grade a friend had turned me onto cartooning, and that is a love affair that has lasted to this day." 

Alex Rivera is a freelance graphic inker who has worked in the industry for over ten years.   In Alex's own words: "When I work I try to enhance the penciler's work by using a variety of line thicknesses and textures to create the illusion of space, and enhance texture and form. I'm inspired by the great works of George Freeman, Dick Giordano, Terry Austin, Joe Kubert,  and Bernie Wrightson to name a few, because of their techniques and their quality of lines."

Wilson Ramos, Jr. is one of those rare individuals that can do everything there is to do on a comic page, except work the presses (and he can probably do that as well).  On our book he is the colorist, letterer and is responsible for post-production.  His body of work includes work for Marvel, DC, Random House and many indie publishers.  Now he primarily does work for Red Anvil comics and self-publishes under the banner Section 8 Comics.  He also does web comics called @the8spot and The Hook Up.  Also draws sketch cards.  And when he can, he sleeps. 

So please help the get the word about this book.  And most importantly, embark on this journey with us and encounter these special characters.

story:
About this project

I'm Julian "Jay" Burton.  I am a filmmaker and story designer and I want to publish a comic that I've been writing for over two years.  I'll need funds to pay my art team for the artwork of the first issue.  Indiegogo is the place to help this project.  Thanks for your incredible support and please consider donating to help this project. 
 
 
About the story:

Salta is a four limited issue action comic that tells the story about archaeologist Guinevere Hinz (Salta) who spent most of her early life assisting and learning the profession from her late grandmother, who was greatly renown in the field.  Guinevere continued to carry on the family trait in honor of her grandmother.

But by an unknown twist of fate, during her field of work, Guinevere stumbles across a mound-like tomb that channels the celestial abilities of the mythical god, Atlas.  During thorough research, Guinevere discovers that dark evil deities from multi dimensions, often in the disguise of humans, have been trying to gain possession of Atlas' powers for ages in an attempt to destroy the universe based off their ultimate evil plans.

After further research, Guinevere discovers that there was no coincidence of her discovery of Atlas' tomb and that she is celestially linked to the powers, giving her a right to posses them, manifesting extra abilities such as time traveling, unnatural strength, astral projection and many more.

 

Realizing the universes are in danger by the deities she harness the powers and takes on the mantle of balancer for both the celestial and terrestrial plains, becoming her alter ego "SALTA."  Spell the name backwards...  ;-) 

 

Why the revamp of female superheroines?

I love storytelling and happen to be a great fanatic of characterization.  Throughout the years I've been waiting anxiously for more strong female heroines.  They're a few in other comic universes that has influenced the thought, but not as many as I would like to see.   

I will like to add to the entourage with a strong character of my own.  With this approach, I would like to contribute more to the famous quote, "Story First."     

 

How will the money be used?

Please help us raise $6,500 to cover the cost of artwork for my creative team.  This include penciling, inking, coloring, lettering, etc.  It will also go toward printing and shipping copies of the comic & rewards to all donors. 

Even if we don't reach our goal, all donors are still guaranteed to get as your reward.  But let's take it to further heights and reach the goal!  :-) 

 

The common question:

For months I've been flooded with the common question,  "will you make this comic a motion picture one day??."   I've tried keeping answers at bay to focus mainly on developing the comic but realize that people know that I am a filmmaker and would like to see the story on screen. 

So to prevent anymore grey hairs the answer is YES!!!  But first thing's first, people need to know the story as a comic!!

I need your help to fund this project so the story of SALTA is on the market. I am beyond excited about the first issue and can't wait to get the story in your hands! :-)

P.S.  Enjoy the promo in the gallery section!  This is just a taste of what's to come!! 

 

If you can't give:

Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, granny's front porch, or whatever way is convenient for you!  Above all, thank you so much for your attention, your support, and your time!

story:
*UPDATE* As a result of our offline funding efforts for this book, if we can reach $4000 on Indiegogo, we will have enough to print the book in colour the way we want! We're almost there!

Our Story

We are the Cloudscape Comics Society, a non-profit organisation dedicated to supporting British Columbia based comic artists and their community. We run weekly gatherings, events, and fundraisers. We offer our 60 members access to a local distribution network, information about and access to printers and other services to support their independent comic endeavours.


Our annual project is to produce an anthology that will highlight some of the best short story work by members of our group. Our latest anthology is 21 Journeys, although the title is subject to change depending on if we can get all our member's work in on time :)


We are asking for help in printing 21 Journeys because it is a 250 page full colour book, an ambitious project that has expanded beyond our current capacity. Every contribution of $25 or more is a pre-order, and you will receive a copy of 21 Journeys along with other goodies. We have outlined the different incentive scales below.


The Impact

We will be able to publish and support more than 22 artists and writers directly contributing to the book. Contributors get copies of the anthology at wholesale, giving them an opportunity to flesh out their inventory and have more books to sell to comic stores, at conventions and on their online stores. Their contribution will also allow them a publishing credit, a crucial necessity to apply for Literary Grants from the Government of Canada and British Columbia.


If we do not reach our fundraising goal, the hard work done by each of the contributors over the last 6 months will be sorely wasted. Our organisation is lucky to have some very talented and dedicated artist and we want to see them flourish!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $7000 that will directly go towards printing 1,000 copies of the book. This is the minimum to print offset, which makes our per unit price competitive and viable for distribution to bookstores and comic shops. If, by some miracle, we reach $8,500, we will be able to print 2,000 copies, doubling our selling power with only $1500 more.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign! Retweet us, post us to your facebook, pass around our videos.

Check out our Ustream: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/the-cloudscape-co...

And our main website: http://www.cloudscapecomics.com

story:
Ben, Joey and I are madly in love with comic books. We teamed up to bring our own story about a group of five teenagers that spiral into the adventure of a lifetime. It’s a fun, loving, treacherous journey these kids go through to find their way back home and I’m sure you will enjoy tagging along for the ride.

The Mini-Series will run through six issues, each with 24 pages and exclusive covers by top illustrators.

Be part of something, help us get our vision out there, we are all hard workers looking for our little corner in this industry and every dollar helps.

We guarantee we will deliver a mini-series produced with the utmost care and passion. Please take the time to review some of our past work at our DeviantArt page http://fcagno.deviantart.com/ which features hundreds of artwork, including those made for an Art Contest we recently held, a tremendous success, and you can also read the entire screenplay available for download at http://www.the-lost-kids.com/Seeking%20Samarkan...

This could be the beginning of something great, it’s all up to you to be a part of it.

Thank you,
Felipe Cagno
Writer/Creator of the Lost Kids

story:
The Revolt movement needs your help!

For those unfamiliar with our company, Revolt Comics is the brainchild of three aficionados. This fantastic team is composed by the phenomenal and artistically powered siblings Alice and Angel Falto Ayala and the creator, our very own wordsmith David G. Hernandez. This trio of comic book buffs came together to create their own company when they discovered that they were blessed with the talent to make wonderful books come to life.

Unfortunately, the manufacturing distribution and promotional cost of comic books is staggeringly high.  To this date Revolt Comics, has published four ongoing titles. The production value of a single 24 page book can reach up to $2,800.00. We have found sponsors to aid our quest.  However, we still need your help to fulfill our goal! We are only asking for $2,500 to reach our main objective which is attending this year's Puerto Rico Comicon and bringing our next titles to you! Our fans! And hopefully to fans from here on the island and those ranging from across the world! We are providing a lot of cool stuff to those who pledge. For more information about our books and characters you can visit the links below. So come with me and join us in the next revolution in Comics. REVOLT!


We need all the help we can get!

Some of you won’t have the monetary means to aid us in our campaign. However, do not fret. That doesn't mean you can't help! Get the word out! Share our campaign anywhere and everywhere with people who you think can and will help. 

This is a visual guide of what you'll be getting once you pledge:




Some of the interior artwork of our comics!

For more previews you can visit our Revolt Comics page at Facebook.

story:
Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren,

mein Name ist Luzius H. Stemeseder und ich befinde mich gerade in einer Berufsvorbereitung des AufBauWerks Nikolsdorf / Schloss Lengberg.

Neben der Vorbereitung auf die zukünftige Arbeitswelt beschäftige ich mich hier gerade damit, meinen Hauptschulabschluss nachzuholen.

Neben diesem Hauptziel arbeite ich sehr engagiert an meinen Comics, da mich diese "Berufung" schon seit meiner Kindheit und Jugendzeit begleitet und ich dadurch meiner Umwelt verschiedenste Einblicke in meine Gedankenwelt gestatte und Sie daran teilhaben lassen möchte.

In meiner Kindheit wurde bei mir eine leichtere Form des Autismus festgestellt, welche als "Asperger Autismus" bezeichnet wird. Dieser Autismus-Typ unterscheidet sich zu anderen durch eine erheblich günstigere Sozialprognose, dennoch begleiten mich verschiedene Einzelsymptome auf meinem Weg.

Im AufBauWerk arbeite ich anhand komplexer Aufgaben und entsprechenden konzeptionellen Rahmenbedingungen an meinem umfänglichen sozialen und beruflichen Einstieg.

Auf diesem Weg ergab sich mit einem meiner Betreuer und dessen Freund (Grafiker) die Idee, meine (Comic-)Geschichte zu veröffentlichen und über Indiegogo zu versuchen, die finanziellen Mittel dafür zu erhalten.

Im Zuge der Projektarbeit entstand neben zwei Kurzfilmen über meine Arbeit die erste druckfertige Version meines Comics und ich hoffe darauf, dass es mit Hilfe von Indiegogo möglich ist, meinen Traum zu realisieren.

Ich bedanke mich schon im Vorfeld recht herzlich für jegliche finanzielle Unterstützung und verbleibe vorab mit freundlichen Grüßen aus der Welt der Luzianer.

Hochachtungsvoll

Luzius H. Stemeseder

story:
The Story

21 Pages of story, 24 altogether. All pages are complete.
All we need is the funding to print.

Damyn, Once a respected and feared soldier for his people. Now just a simple mercenary and monster hunter, so why send him to the abandoned Island of Omrydell? What is Damyn’s history with this mysterious island? Will he survive? All we know is that Damyn always leaves a trail of blood everywhere he goes.

Printed in the USA!

Here are the first 5 pages of this brutal and savage adventure:

 

 

 

 

The Team

Co created by Jakub Šebesta and Dylan Clarke

Artist - Jakub Šebesta

Writer - Dylan Clarke

Letterer - Kassidy Blond

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can share on social media or in real life then you will have all our love.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Stefanie, and for the past few years I've been working in comics. Last year, I did fairly well, selling out of all the editions of my webcomic Lost Nova, and also producing a few smaller, self-contained projects.

What I'd like to print is my ongoing webcomic Lost Nova, a story about two women going on adventures trying to find home in a high fantasy setting. I'm also trying to print Bounty Head, a short comic I wrote about an orc bounty hunter and her giant dog mount. 


What I Need & What You Get

I don't currently have the funds available to print everything as I usually do, mostly because this year I have more books than previous. 

If you pledge, it will help a great deal and you also get copies of the books. If this goes over well I'll be able to print more books, or invest in some merch.

Right now, I'm looking to print about 25 to 30 copies for each Lost Nova book, and 50 books for Bounty Head. Any additional costs go towards shipping and promoting.

The Impact

If you pledge, it'll help cover the cost of printing and shipping, and will help me promote a story I've wanted to tell for years, and create new works.

Risks & Challenges

Right now the biggest concern I have is making sure I can get everything shipped to me by the end of March. It's a pretty tight deadline but I've got everything ready to go, I just need to actually go and get them.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by reading my comic at LostNova.com, or donate to my Patreon. Links on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr are also appreciated!
