story:
Punchline is an ongoing comic book and trade paperback series published by Antarctic Press. Our series is available at many comic book shops through Diamond Comics Distribution. A version of our first issue was offered on Free Comic Book Day in 2019.

In Super-Frenemies, Jessie meets other people that live a super-double life much like hers. She learns the source of her new powers as she makes new friends and enemies. Super-Frenemies collects Punchline #6- #10. Antarctic Press is publishing a version of this trade and if your store carries our book, shop with them. For the people not near a comic book store, this might be your best opportunity to read our comic.

The campaign for Punchline: Super-Frenemies will raise funds to help pay the printing bill for the second collection and to get ahead of the expenses on the next batch of issues. 

We are shipping signed hard covers and signed trade paperback editions of the second collection, Super-Frenemies. This edition will have a cover gallery and sketch book material not included in the Antarctic Press version of the collection. Our version of the book will have a final page count of over 130 pages.

AND... The first Punchline collection told the story of Mel, a costumed hero who had been fired from the job and then forced to train her replacement, Jessie. Some people missed the first crowdfunded collection, so we are re-offering a limited number of physical copies of Blood Sisters which collects Punchline #1- #5. 
 

If you don't have the cash to buy a book, there are ways you can help us fund our project. Sharing via social media is free and always appreciated.

It won't hurt our feelings a bit if you go check out the comics on a free digital distribution site like our partner Graphite. Punchline comic singles are also available on comiXology and Drive Thru Comics.

Risks and challenges

Of the 112 pages scripted, only 7 remain to be penciled and inked. Our last book shipped a little late, but we learned from the experience and have a better schedule this time around.

story:
South Park - Go fund yourself!

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background. - No.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. - No
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. To do nothing!

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution? - You better!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you. - My Pocket
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! - Be excited.
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal. - Your Pocket?

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. - Helping us to do nothing.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). - hmmm.
  • Make it real for people and build trust. - It is REAL! Here have some trust!

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. - Cartman.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges. - Do nothing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. - Yes
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! - No.

And that's all there is to it. - Awesome!

story:
Short Summary

Walking on Broken Glass is an urban fantasy with a sense of humor, about a man (who happens to be a werewolf) with terrible prophetic dreams about losing his morality and doing unspeakable things to the people he loves. Understandably, this isn’t at all what he wants, so he strives every day to make up for his future wrongs. Meanwhile, he has a terrible crush on his gun-toting fashionista secretary and best friend, who is bent on changing his fate altogether.

Meanwhile, monsters are attacking their city, in sneaky and clandestine ways. He and his pack are looking to figure out why they’re here, where they come from, and most of all, how to stop them. It’s about monsters. It’s about magic. It’s about werewolves! And witches! And vampires! (Oh my?)
 
In issue 5, faced with a relationship that's grown closer than she was expecting, Kennedy is faced with sharing her deepest kept secret with the man she loves. Remembering how she came to know all his secrets only reinforces a sense of guilt over her own innate suspicion and dread at Nick's reaction to the one piece of herself she could never share with him before. 
She's left to puzzle over her overactive imagination, as his reaction is hardly what she expected...

WoBG is an urban fantasy comic: action with a sense of humor, a horror story, and a love story all wrapped up in the supernatural. It updates every Sunday with sketch updates every Thursday, and has been serialized online since October, 2010. You can read up to the present chapter at our website.

What We Need & What You Get

Hey there! We're organizing a print run once again -- but this time we're printing more than before! It's time to step it up and focus on production. We're printing the whole of Volume 1 in a single go: that's issues 1 through 4 of Walking on Broken Glass in a single volume. In addition, we're printing issue 5 on its own -- our first full-color issue!

Volume 1 will have over 80 pages of comics, plus bonus comics and content, perfect bound. Issue 5 will be all-color and over 20 pages, plus bonus content, saddle-stitched. Both will be printed through the fabulous, wonderful RA Comics Direct!

We're aiming to print 200 copies of volume 1 and 150 copies of issue 5. Should we go above and beyond our goal of $3150, the extra funds will go back into the company for printing more comics, and promoting Broken Glass. 

Breakdown:

$1800 to print 200 Volume 1's
$690 to print 150 Issue 5's
$300 to ship incentives to folks
$100 to ship the books to us
$200 for Indiegogo fees

But enough about that! What you're interested in is what you get if you donate, right? 

Posters:

Bookmarks:

Charms:

Want some charms with your order? Just add $5 per charm you want!

Pins:

Dicebags:

Artist Edition Sketches:

You can see more sketches from the last print run here and here!

The Impact

This will be our fifth crowdfunding project to date -- and our most ambitious. We've been extremely successful in printing each issue. By supporting this campaign, you'll be supporting a pair of independent creators and their small, independent comic. Not only that, but you'll get some great quality merchandise and quality artwork! How great is that?

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't pledge money, that's totally fine! You can still help us out by spreading the word! Friends, family, Facebook, Twitter, G+, whatever your fancy! 

We'll be holding a raffle at the end from people who spread the word via the various social networks. Just let us know by tagging your tweets with #wobg, telling us via mention @cvilbrandt or @samanthajmathis, commenting on our comic, or sending us links to your posts or blogs at cvilbrandt@greyinkstudios.com, or sjmathis@greyinkstudios.com. Basically, just make sure we're informed! Remember that Indiegogo has sharing buttons built right into the system!

Please note, if you do not get a reply from us that says it's received, poke us. We may have missed it in the CRAZINESS that is running a crowdfunding project. 

Thanks so much for checking out our print run and for all the support! You all rock.

Hey there! We're organizing a print run once again -- but this time we're printing more than before! It's time to step it up and focus on production. We're printing the whole of Volume 1 in a single go: that's issues 1 through 4 of Walking on Broken Glass in a single volume. In addition, we're printing issue 5 on its own -- our first full-color issue!
Volume 1 will have over 80 pages of comics, plus bonus comics and content, perfect bound. Issue 5 will be all-color and over 20 pages, plus bonus content, saddle-stitched. Both will be printed through the fabulous, wonderful RA Comics Direct!
We're aiming to print 200 copies of volume 1 and 150 copies of issue 5. Should we go above and beyond our goal of $3150, the extra funds will go back into the company for printing more comics, and promoting Broken Glass. 
Breakdown:
$1800 to print 200 Volume 1's$690 to print 150 Issue 5's$300 to ship incentives to folks$100 to ship the books to us$200 for Indiegogo fees
But enough about that! What you're interested in is what you get if you donate, right? 
Posters:

Bookmarks:

Charms:

Want some charms with your order? Just add $5 per charm you want!
Pins:

Dicebags:



Artist Edition Sketches:

You can see more sketches from the last print run here and here!
The Impact
This will be our fifth crowdfunding project to date -- and our most ambitious. We've been extremely successful in printing each issue. By supporting this campaign, you'll be supporting a pair of independent creators and their small, independent comic. Not only that, but you'll get some great quality merchandise and quality artwork! How great is that?


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't pledge money, that's totally fine! You can still help us out by spreading the word! Friends, family, Facebook, Twitter, G+, whatever your fancy! 
We'll be holding a raffle at the end from people who spread the word via the various social networks. Just let us know by tagging your tweets with #wobg, telling us via mention @cvilbrandt or @samanthajmathis, commenting on our comic, or sending us links to your posts or blogs at cvilbrandt@greyinkstudios.com, or sjmathis@greyinkstudios.com. Basically, just make sure we're informed! Remember that Indiegogo has sharing buttons built right into the system!
Please note, if you do not get a reply from us that says it's received, poke us. We may have missed it in the CRAZINESS that is running a crowdfunding project. 
Thanks so much for checking out our print run and for all the support! You all rock.

story:
Who am I and what is this?

Hello. My name is Tinet. I've drawn since I could hold a pencil, and since I was little I've made up characters and stories to escape my messed up reality. At 15 I decided I wanted to learn to draw comics for real, and I started to draw "Driftwood". 16 years and 387 pages later, here I am, and here it is.

Driftwood is an epic anarcho-socialist adventure story about parallel universes inhabited by pirates, assassins, love-girls, cossacks, revolutionaries and shamans, and romantic harbour towns in foreign lands that may remind of Communist China and the Soviet Union.
It's a love story. And it's a story about being a second generation immigrant, working class and the child of an alcoholic.
Not least is it a story about growing up. 

The life of 16 year old Willie is dominated by her dad's alcoholism and the mystery with her mother, who was absent all of Willie's life, but has now contacted her again out of the blue and wants to meet her.
Willie's mum arranges a ferry trip for her to come visit her in Norway, but the ferry sinks in the North Sea. Willie is able to save herself on a life raft, and mysterious things start to happen ... She finds herself in a different world, and is rescued by the crew of the sailing ship the Eagle Ray. They drag her along on their crazy adventures, and in the process Willie starts to learn to deal with her problems at home and to dare to choose her own way in her life.

You can read Driftwood online here to see if you like it. (Though for the printed edition I've redone the lettering and translation of the earlier chapters.)

Driftwood is my pet project, but I think it may also be quite valuable for other people. I would have been so happy to discover a comic like this when I was younger (and certainly also now that I'm a bit older).

It's a comic by and for girls, with complex and flawed female characters who deal with women's problems. (It's a bit sad that this is still a relatively unusual thing ...)
And other children of alcoholics have told me that it was a good comic to read, as it deals with these issues in a constructive way that you don't see very often.

And of course, even if you can't directly identify with those aspects, it's an interesting story with plenty of drama, romance and stupid/dark humour! 

Books!

Now that Driftwood is finished, I'm printing it as a book. It was published in Swedish last year. But the English edition is even better. Heh.

Driftwood will be 392 pages, black and white, 17x22 cm.

I've also put together the book Flotsam and Jetsam, with all the side stories, lots of sketches and illustrations from all the 17 years I've been working on Driftwood, and deleted scenes. There are also articles about what influenced me to create the story and the characters, and notes about interesting details such as Eva's mysterious breast expansion between chapters 6 and 7, or how telepathic powers aren't really a supernatural thing in my experience. 

Flotsam and Jetsam will be 204 pages, black and white, 17x22 cm.

Anyways, the actual cost of printing the two books is 2220 €. I have some money put away ... although I put it away in order to cover for medical and other emergencies if such should ever happen to me. But who cares about that when you can print comics!!
However, you can help me with the funds by pre-ordering here.

And more importantly, the number of copies I've planned is limited:
300 copies of "Driftwood" and 100 copies of "Flotsam and Jetsam". So to make sure you get one, you should really pre-order.
And in case hundreds of people should happen to pre-order copies, I can print more books and actually be able to afford it! Win-win!

You can also get both books as digital copies in PDF format. Handy if you don't like to be burdened by too many worldly possessions and don't mind reading books on your computer, or if you're not quite sure if you like it enough to get a printed copy. 

I'm also making T-shirts that will look like this:

"No leashes, no masters" ... I'll post actual photos after I get the test shirts. They'll be printed with Spreadshirt (guaranteed no American Apparel), and available in women's fitted sizes, women's plus sizes, and men's sizes. You can write your preferred size and cut as a note in paypal, or I will contact you about it when it's time to order the shirts.

You also have the exclusive chance to acquire an original page of your choice. I drew it on A3 sized paper. Some of the originals look terrible (adds to the charm, I guess). So I offer you both the actual original and a print if you'd like. First come, first serve ...

Note: In all the perks, shipping is included in the price! (If you live on the other side of the earth but still want my books, don't worry about it, because it's an honour to ship it to you!!!)

If you can't afford to or don't feel like pledging your money ...

... that's okay. V^(oo)^V But you can help immensely just by spreading the word about this campaign!

They'll be printed with Spreadshirt (guaranteed no American Apparel), and available in women's fitted sizes, women's plus sizes, and men's sizes. You can write your preferred size and cut as a note in paypal, or I will contact you about it when it's time to order the shirts.

... that's okay. V^(oo)^V But you can help immensely just by spreading the word about this campaign!

story:
We want to hold a large-scale comic convention in Cedar Rapids, IA. And we want it to be super affordable for everyone to attend.

In February 2015, we held what we're calling a "test event" at NewBo City Market. We called our event NewBo Con. We packed the building with 20 vendors, a boatload of cosplayers, and welcomed more than 3,500 people to our little corner of Iowa. People played games, they bought comics, messed around with toys, posed with pictures, and ... based on the comments we've received ... everyone had a great time.

One of the most striking comments we received after the convention ended (and we were expecting it based on the turnout) was: "You need more room." Every single person that said that was right. We do. So we found it!

After searching the local area for new, larger home for our convention, we are very happy to report that we have secured a location at the Double Tree by Hilton, Cedar Rapids, IA. Here's how we've upgraded the event:

  • We have room for 70 vendors (as opposed to the very tightly-packed 20 we had in 2015). 
  • On top of that, we're adding a dedicated gaming room with 20 gaming tables (and we're working on an awesome gaming schedule to go along with it). 
  • And finally, we're adding a dedicated room for speakers and sessions. 
  • On top of the "official" areas, there will be convenience room with food (prepared by the very talented staff at the Double Tree) and drinks to purchase, There will also be a welcome area leading to the vendor, gaming, and speaker area with seating, restrooms, check-in table, and plenty of room for photo ops with your favorite caped crusader. 

Long story short, running a convention is expensive. We've worked out a great deal with our host venue for 2016, but we still have operating costs. We're going to be able to cover a decent chunk of our costs from the (very small) admission charge we'll have for our event and the vendor space rental fees. 

Our biggest goal is to make sure as many people as possible can afford to attend a convention. There are a lot of conventions out there that cost $30, $40, even up to $60 to attend. That's not realistic for everyone -- especially for people with families. Our general pricing structure is going to look like this:

General Admission: $5 (vendor area only)*
All Access Admission: $10 (vendor area, gaming area, speaker/session area)*
*Kids 12-and-under are absolutely free with a paid admission. Up to three kids under the age of 12 can accompany a paid admission ticket holder.

How we'll use the money raised here:

  • Pay for venue rental fees
  • Event insurance
  • Event advertising
What we won't use the money raised here for:

  • Our staff is not paid -- we're all volunteers. 
  • Pizza
  • Vacations
  • Limited edition Blu-ray copies of the new Avengers movie
Any extra funds that are raised will be used to add extra features to 2016's event or saved for 2017.
So how about it? Will you help Cedar Rapids launch the most affordable, fun-packed convention in the Midwest?

story:
BLESS YER HEART: A Georgia Grown Comedy web-series, is the brain child of four nerds (Sloane Warren, Ryan Dunn, Ronny Mathew, and Jill Hames) who came together with a common goal: to tell a new story about the south that goes beyond what you've seen in films and TV. 
While being equally opportunity offenders, we like to do it charmingly so.  Check out one of our episodes that will make you feel better about your parenting skills.


BLESS YER HEART explores a variety of genres and pays tribute to sketch comedy shows like "Key and Peele" and "Portlandia" with the unique acting styles of "Arrested Development" and "Kentucky Fried Movie".  
For example we went all old school and tapped into the "Silent Era" genre with a modern twist. Take a look for yourself!
Thanks to an angel donor we were able to launch our series this year and skillfully create the first 10 episodes with a budget of just $7,400.00. It was a labor of love for those involved and the only compensation for cast and crew was the meal they got on set. Sometimes that meant feeding a lot of mouths like when we shot this cool musical piece. Go ahead you know you want to...

 Due to the volunteer efforts and dedication of local professionals, we were able to create outstanding shows with a high level of talent and production quality for an average of only $740.00 per episode. 

Don't believe us? Check out some other highlights from our Season One:



Our goal is to raise $15,000 which will be used to:
 
  • Create a second season and beyond of BLESS YER HEART: A Georgia Grown Comedy web-series.
  • Expand our second season by adding 3 more episodes for a total of 12 episodes. 
  • Fund crew, food, equipment, location fees, and pay our lead actors a small stipend for being involved.
  • Take our series to the next level by paying for more sophisticated locations, gaining access to a green screen studio, hiring a full time composer, and pay for post-production editing, colorization, sound engineering, and motion graphics...all the things you would expect from a high quality TV show.
The funds we raise from this campaign will ultimately help us fulfill the dream of being picked up by a major channel along the likes of Comedy Central, Adult Swim, or Netflix.

Your donation will be 100% tax deductible and you could win some amazing prizes including a walk-on role for season two, local Atlanta theater tickets, local spa & beauty treatments, a weekend cabin stay with private pool in Tennessee, and so much more! 

Won't you help us?


Need more info? 

Check out the Official BLESS YER HEART Facebook Page and "Like" us!

story:
Who am I?

Hello all, my name is wOlly McNair and I am the creator, writer, and illustrator of "Legends of the Black Pandas".  I am a  freelance illustrator and designer from Charlotte NC.  I have done concept, design, and illustration for the past 10 years, recently I was selected to contribute art to a project called 21 Draw with a ton of great artist to be publish in October.... but hopefully your here to learn more about my project LEGEND of the BLACK PANDAS.  I hope you enjoyed the Video above and will read on below to learn more about the  story, review some of the art, and learn about the perks and other ways you can support! I appreciate you stopping by.....


The Project.

I am a huge fan of both comic books and anime. I grew up like many enjoying the major comic companies and characters they produce.  As i grew as an artist, I began attempting to submit work to the major three in hopes of getting to work my dream job as an illustrator on these characters.  But the more I worked, the more I realized maybe that wasn't exactly the path.  I began working as a freelancer, things have had their ups and downs, but I have continue to work on various projects and grow my own style.  Overtime I began to dream more about my own projects and the idea of bringing them to life. I also realized as I did comic conventions that many people spoke of things that the industry lacked. Stories they wanted, and characters that could bring a lost energy back to comics.  That's where Legends of the Black Pandas comes in.  I am not saying this fixes all missing gaps, but i am saying that it fills in a few.  This isn't the type of project that would get published by the majors, but it is a project you can proudly stand behind and watch grow and be a part of with the person who actually created it!

I have respect for the other companies, but part of the beauty of crowd funding is freedom and options.  Black Pandas is a chance to bring something a little familiar, yet different back to the forefront in comics. The classic Protagonist who must avenge his, well ...everything.... So here is the story....

Pandas, Giant beast, Samurai, Ninjas, and martial arts!!

Synopsis:

Legend of the Black Pandas: "A world once existed that was balanced and at peace. Ruled by the Lion King Panda, all in his Kingdom enjoyed a peaceful and balanced world.... Until the legend was delivered that two sons would be born unto two kings, the last of the legendary Black Panda bloodline. These sons would decide the fate of all in this land. The first born would have first choice in his path. This choice would either continue balance or disrupt it. Ursus was born first, two hundred years before the son of the Lion King Panda, and raised under the hand of a fallen king who cared only for the wealthy and sought to rid the land of those deemed "unworthy". With this upbringing, Ursus grew to be the hand of destruction and forge forward taking over the Six Kingdoms of Equality. Jai-Den, born two hundred years later, is hidden by monks after the fall of his mighty fathers kingdom. The monks raise him, the last pure blooded of his kind, teaching him the martial arts, magic, understanding of chi energies, and compassion. All an attempt to prepare him for the day when he will have to rise to reclaim the land for the people to restore balance and defeat Ursus. This is the story of where the Legend of the Black Pandas begins."

What I am asking for.

My total goal for this project is $3,000.00. These funds would be used to cover production cost for the project. I am not depending only on this fund raiser to produce the book. I am printing copies of issue 1 out my own pocket to take to conventions, use to promote the project, and continue to produce future issues.  So if the total goal isn't reached, though i hope it is, any funds raised will go towards satisfying perks selected, covering cost for books, posters, bookmarks, and fees to run the campaign that go to Indiegogo and pay pal. Meeting the goal would allow me to produce at least 200 copies each (1,000 total) of the first 5 issues of the series, 11x17 prints, a collected volume 1 soft cover of the first five issues with some extras inside, stickers, bookmarks, and possibly a few other cool extras.  The money raised isn't to pay me for the artwork or cover cost for conventions i attend, but instead to produce the product and help me bring everything to life in the best quality and secure the path to making this project grow. 


The Importance of your support.

The core of any successful project is often the people who support and believe in.  Your contribution is just as important as the story,the characters, the art, the final product itself. Without you reading the book, telling someone about it, or contributing to this campaign... there is no life to the project.  Your support is the most valuable thing to any project of any kind. If you don't like or support something, it doesn't grow.  I truly want to bring something strong, fun, and cool back to comics and a little different. This is a story that as it grows, you can actually give input that helps it grow, and be a part of it from the beginning.  I value you and the energy you bring to the table. Help me to make some major noise with this project, and force the major companies to pay a little attention and give more support to things other than the normal.

What You GET...Perks!!

skate decks


T Shirts and of course comics, art, and so much!!!!

Supporting now gets you early access to behind the scenes stuff like animation footage, advance peeks at future issues, art, new projects and discounts on future products!!



Other Ways You Can Help

I understand everyone doesn't have money to give, and as mentioned above, money isn't the only way to help. Using the many social media outlets and share tools provided by Indiegogo as well as your own emails, and mentions will all help greatly. The greater the word spreads, the stronger the project becomes.  Even if you can't or don't want to give, maybe someone in your circle or network can or will, or knows someone else. So please help in any and every way you can.

This is the story of where the Legend of the Black Pandas begins."

  What I am asking for. 

My total goal for this project is $3,000.00. These funds would be used to cover production cost for the project. I am not depending only on this fund raiser to produce the book. I am printing copies of issue 1 out my own pocket to take to conventions, use to promote the project, and continue to produce future issues.  So if the total goal isn't reached, though i hope it is, any funds raised will go towards satisfying perks selected, covering cost for books, posters, bookmarks, and fees to run the campaign that go to Indiegogo and pay pal. Meeting the goal would allow me to produce at least 200 copies each (1,000 total) of the first 5 issues of the series, 11x17 prints, a collected volume 1 soft cover of the first five issues with some extras inside, stickers, bookmarks, and possibly a few other cool extras.  The money raised isn't to pay me for the artwork or cover cost for conventions i attend, but instead to produce the product and help me bring everything to life in the best quality and secure the path to making this project grow. 


The Importance of your support.The core of any successful project is often the people who support and believe in.  Your contribution is just as important as the story,the characters, the art, the final product itself. Without you reading the book, telling someone about it, or contributing to this campaign... there is no life to the project.  Your support is the most valuable thing to any project of any kind. If you don't like or support something, it doesn't grow.  I truly want to bring something strong, fun, and cool back to comics and a little different. This is a story that as it grows, you can actually give input that helps it grow, and be a part of it from the beginning.  I value you and the energy you bring to the table. Help me to make some major noise with this project, and force the major companies to pay a little attention and give more support to things other than the normal. 
 

What You GET...Perks!!

skate decks





T Shirts and of course comics, art, and so much!!!!


Supporting now gets you early access to behind the scenes stuff like animation footage, advance peeks at future issues, art, new projects and discounts on future products!!

  Other Ways You Can HelpI understand everyone doesn't have money to give, and as mentioned above, money isn't the only way to help. Using the many social media outlets and share tools provided by Indiegogo as well as your own emails, and mentions will all help greatly. The greater the word spreads, the stronger the project becomes.  Even if you can't or don't want to give, maybe someone in your circle or network can or will, or knows someone else. So please help in any and every way you can.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone!

My name is Jon Hughes, and you probably know me best as the founder of an independent comic book publishing imprint called Overground Comics.  If you don't, that's okay, we're pretty small.  While most of my experience in comic books is as a writer, I also enjoy drawing, and I drew quite a few covers for the Overground books  when it was necessary.  During my time as a publisher, I continued to work as a commission artist to help raise money for my comic books, and the result is a lengthy portfolio of sketch covers, a popular collectible in the comic book community.  I've decided to collect my best works into a book in order to, you guessed it, raise some money for my further comic book projects.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise funds for an upcoming project, and so I'm offering this new anthology with some cool perks to go along with it, namely a lot of original art.  I'm doing my best to make these works in the highest quality, to give you all incentive to take part in this.  Remember, even though I'm a writer and editor professionally, I've been drawing my whole life, and I hope to make an impact with this project.  

Here are some images of the sketches that will appear in full size in the book!

 

And here are some full size images of the original covers included in the perks!

 

 

The Impact

Being an independent artist and publisher is a difficult thing.  Long hours often meet with little pay, and the financial ups can be few and far between the downs.  Since getting married a couple of years ago (best day of my life), it's been harder for me to travel as much as I used to, given that my wife and I are raising two wonderful children, so I have to depend more on projects like this in order to reach clients.  If you like my work, contributing to this project can do so much good for me.  Being able to continue my work without sacrificing the time my family needs from me is monumental to me and to them.  

Risks & Challenges

Everyone knows that artists who work on commissions can sometimes be notoriously slow, and I am no exception to that rule sometimes.  I've been known to take my time in delivering, trying to find ways to balance everything.  I am, however, a professional.  I delivered 30 published comic books on time, and for the most part, I do the same with my commissions.  I pledge to do everything possible to deliver every perk of this project on time.   The book is already complete, so there is no waiting on that.  The only work I'll need to complete is any commissions purchased through this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please claim a perk!  If you can't, that's okay too.  You can still help by sharing this project with your friends.

story:
Hey, there! My name is Andres Colmenares, I'm the creator of Wawawiwa comics, an illustration project that started in 2010 and has turned into something that I really love. My comics are inspired by daily objects, food, animals and life. I currently live with my amazing wife and son in Bogota, Colombia. 

Recently we reached 100K followers on Instagram, and we want to take this opportunity to celebrate and also ask for your help to reach a goal we've had in mind for a while. We've been running this small family business for a few years now and we would love to expand to other countries, so all of our friends can find our products easily.

 

To be able to reach our goal, we want to start distributing our products in a few stores located in United States. For this, we've estimated a production of 3500 enamel pins + sticker packs. The total amount we need is US$5514.

There are 7 different designs available. Created in zinc alloy with an average size of 40mm  (1.57 inches).

 

Each pack will contain 5 different vinyl stickers.

These stickers have great outdoor durability. Sizes will go from 1.7 inches to 2.7 inches. One sticker will have holographic details and another one will have mirror effect with metallic background color. Which ones? It's a surprise!

 

In order to buy you must select a "perk". Each perk has a price and contains different products and quantity.

On desktop, you’ll see a list with all available perks on the right hand side of the page. Click on the perk you want, then click the "Get This Perk" button to be redirected to the payment page. If you're on a mobile device, scroll up to see all available perks.

Once you select the quantity of pins you'd like and purchase. We will contact you in around 24-48 hours, via email, to ask which designs you would like to receive when we start shipping everything.

We've set up an estimate shipping date that will give us enough time in case we have any delays or unexpected issues. For this campaign, we've selected "flexible funding", which means that even if we don't reach our goal, you will have your pins and stickers. But, if we don't reach our goal, we won't be able to start expanding our brand for now.

Some of you might not be able to contribute. Hey, we totally understand this. So, if you would like to help and support our project either way, you could do so by just sharing this campaign with your friends and relatives, or anyone that could enjoy these products. In the top right section of this page, you'll find social network sharing tools. We really appreciate all the help we can get.

Thank you all!

- The wawawiwa team

story:
This is it.
This is the finale.

Pipe Dreams will be a 120+, standard size, graphic novel and a 32 page, 5.5x7.75, ashcan.
The ashcan will be filled with previous sketches, some commentary on the things that led us to this point and various other arts that I've done for the series over the years.
The ashcan will also have a sketch cover and every copy will have a hand done sketch and only be available here. I will only make as many copies as get ordered here.
The graphic novel will have the entire new version along with the original version of the story.
Two soldiers banished from the kingdom get summoned home after the princess gets abducted by the vile reptiles the 2 soldiers once drove out of the kingdom.
Their path will be bloody and filled with loss.
With everything that's happened with this project, I've rewritten the ending to be a definite ending. Sadly, canceling the sequel.
But, trust me...
This new ending will pull at all your strings and be more brutal than anything else in the book.

The new cover of the graphic novel:

The full wraparound cover:

This will be cover to the Ashcan:

The ashcan will have a sketch cover stock and every copy will come with a hand done sketch by series creator Johnny Segura 3rd.

The main story will consist of what I worked on for the last campaign PLUS a few new fights that I've come up with between then and now.
You will get a ton of content between the graphic novel and the ashcan if you snag both.

Along with the Graphic Novel and the Ashcan, you can also snag 5x7 and 11x17 prints featuring legacy art from the original run, the one from last year and this campaign.

Quality

This is the last chance for this book to be printed.
The books will be printed on beautiful stock with a nice glossy cover.
The Graphic Novels will look amazing on the shelf next to all your other prized books.
The Ashcans will also be great quality with a custom sketch on each book!



Digital goodies
There's going to be digital wallpapers for you computer and your mobile devices, as well as PDF versions of both the Graphic Novel and the Ashcan.
Plus!
As soon as you back this project, check out the first update and snag some icons that you can use on your various socials and show that you've supported this awesome project!



Shipping
All packages will be shipped Priority via USPS and you will tracking numbers to make sure your books get there safely.
And all 11x17 packs will be shipped flat via USPS Priority.
All US orders should take 3-5 days to get to you.
All foreign orders will take a bit longer depending on your region.


In closing
I just wanted to say thank you.
For those of you who have been there from the beginning of Pipe Dreams, all 10+ years ago.
Or those of who you just found out and think it looks awesome!
I just wanted to say thank you and I love you all.
Thank you for having faith in me and my work.
The next project coming to y'all after this is a toss up between The Murdercorn or The Fencer.
More info on those coming soon! :D
And if you have any questions, feel free to hit me up!
E-mail: JohnnySegura3rd@gmail.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ArtofJohnnyJSeguraIII
Instagram: JohnnySegura3rd
Twitter: JohnnySegura3rd

story:
Love, Retold

Written by Kimchi Cuddles creator Tikva Wolf, Love, Retold is a polyamorous love story in graphic novel form.

The characters are based on people in my actual life so they are reminiscent of Kimchi Cuddles characters.  In addition to signed copies of the books, you can also receive some of the original concept sketches used to create the characters, and the ACTUAL DRAWINGS used to make the book itself!  You should all receive your packages wrapped with lots of love by mid-May. 

About the book:

"Tikva Wolf has witnessed love transcend and evolve beyond the rigid, traditionalist trappings of the fairy-tale romance. Love, Retold is a meditation on love and companionship for people who don't remember feudalism. Each chapter explores Wolf's experiences with loved ones—Wolf's lovers and their lovers. The stories capture key moments in these relationships, and they reflect on the murkier, tenebrous aspects of love, especially—but not exclusively—the non-monogamous kind.

These stories illuminate and revere uncertainty, confronting the realities of mismatched needs and desires with compassion and self-reflection. In a world obsessed with beginnings and endings, this is a book about middles."

Ask Me About Polyamory: The Best of Kimchi Cuddles

"A hilarious and touching comic about polyamory, queer, and genderqueer issues. If your relationships or your gender are unconventional, you’ll find useful advice and plenty of laughs in this compilation of the wildly popular webcomic Kimchi Cuddles.

Quirky, endearing and charmingly (and sometimes painfully) realistic characters, many based on real people, explore polyamory, queer and genderqueer issues. Covering practical matters like time management and serious topics like discrimination, this book unites the best of two years of Kimchi Cuddles comics, organized into a practical and entertaining guide to the real world of alternative relationships. Kimchi Cuddles is a rare mix: fearlessly true to the lives of the people it depicts yet relatable enough to entertain and inform anyone (maybe even your parents).

Dealing with both lighthearted and serious subject matter, it avoids clichés and easy answers, choosing instead to give examples of different schools of thought and show the humanity behind each one. Wolf’s honesty and gift for clear explanation have made Kimchi Cuddles a hit with the most dedicated polyamorists as well as curious newcomers."

About the Artist

Tikva Wolf has been drawing ever since they could hold a crayon, and comes from a long line of love-activists. What they primarily care about in art (and life) is connecting to people, creating dialogue, and spreading awareness. They've always taken delight in making people laugh, and in doing so also unveiling hidden perspectives. They use humor as a way of encouraging others to deeply see themselves and each other. Their work can be found at KimchiCuddles.com and Kimchi on facebook.

Product and Shipping:

Shipping is free within the United States and additional shipping is required overseas. Check specifics on each item. Books are ready to be signed, kissed, and sent to you!

story:
Summary

I joined Scotland's newest daily newspaper, The National, as a freelancer in December 2014. Since then, each week without fail I've created a full-page, satirical comic strip based around whatever political situation happened to unfold. But the coronavirus lockdown has meant shops have closed and people are unable to buy newspapers. As a consequence, The National is functioning with a skeleton staff and is unable to pay freelancers.

It strikes me that now is not the time to stop making fun of politicians, when there is such a glut of incompetence and buffoonery on display, and readers are trapped at home desperate for anything that might raise a smile. So I plan to continue cartooning, publishing the usual Monday strip on my website, gregmoodie.com, for the next three months until we see how the land lies.

At the end of three months, I will gather the cartoons produced and publish them in a one-off National-sized tabloid newspaper called 'The Lockdown Chronicles'.

 

The Deal

In order to do this, I need your help. What I'm asking for is a basic wage for three months and enough to cover the newspaper's production, along with sturdy packaging and postage costs. In return, you will have access to all of the cartoons online and receive a hard copy of 'The Lockdown Chronicles'. All contributors, unless they choose anonymity, will be listed in the paper.

Additional perks include limited edition digital prints of the 'Robert Burns in Lockdown' image and signed hand-painted screenprints of the image, each one unique. These will only be produced to order and will not be available to buy beyond this campaign.

 

For The Collector

This is a most unusual time in our history and it's important that we document it. 'The Lockdown Chronicles', by nature of its sheer oddness, is likely to become a collector's item and a very special record of this period. So let's be a part of history together and make this happen.  

 

Other Help

Please share this campaign widely. Satire and art are both essential for the world's mental health. Thank you for your contribution.

story:
RELOAD THIS PAGE DAILY

Scroll Down: New Updates Are Continually Posted
Tomorrow's Update #7: The Warrior of the Rocks

LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion is a full-color comic series based on W. Scott's LadyStar characters. It tells the story of Jessica Hoshi's Ajan Warriors and the Scribe Arcanist Reina of Kulnas joining forces to defeat the Cryptic Sorcerer Sai Magnen and his legion of fiends in the isolated and treacherous Chaer Badlands.

The first volume in the Venom Legion series LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion #1 is currently the top-rated LadyStar book with an average 4.7-star rating, and on October 16, 2013 was ranked the #7 superhero book on Amazon.com.

LadyStar is a fantasy adventure book series about seven girls who wear magical jewelry that can become powerful weapons. Each of the seven main characters is a warrior with unique powers. Their strength as individual fighters and as a team grows through the series as they meet new challenges and overcome the forces that oppose them. Their mission is to discover the ancient legend of the LadyStar and defend the Realm of Aventar from the Cryptics and their evil minions.

Girls can be heroes, and in the world of LadyStar, they are the heroes. Our stories are different from many others in television, books and movies where the teenage girl characters are often sour, hyper-competitive, angry, jealous and self-destructive. The challenges faced by Jessica and her friends reaffirm the value of teamwork, courage and friendship. As warriors, they rely on their honor to sustain them through hardship and crisis.

LadyStar has been in continuous development for 13 years, and is now featured in a series of 21 novels, novellas and comics on the Kindle e-book platform. This campaign is to fund development of the second issue of the Fury of the Venom Legion comic series.

We are a team of 17 artists, eight voice actors and two writers. We have developed 33 interactive games, including a record-setting hit release on the Steam PC Game Store, 21 e-books including six full-color comic titles, eight audiocasts and a daily animated video series. We have produced, on average, a new commercial product every six weeks for the last five-and-a-half years.

LadyStar is our first commercial project, and our flagship series.

Five years ago, we published the comic that helped launch our business. That comic was LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion Issue #1. It began a series that brought us over 200,000 new readers and helped us build the largest English-language webcomic association in the world with over 115 member sites and 70,000 readers a day.

Now, the same team that brought you LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion is preparing Issue #2. We believe we can top our opening act and we want you to be a part of it!

Bug - Art Director - Bug is one of our studio's most veteran artists. She was the page designer and lead artist on all six of our comic titles, and her work has been featured in dozens of studio projects, from games to official merchandise to animation.

Bug's specialty is epic character design, and she is equally conversant with both western and anime comic styles. One of her primary talents is dramatic page design, and our newest comic is certain to benefit from her creativity. She is the artist and creator of the long-running Tales of Pylea webcomic series.


Animetor - Animation Director - Animetor brings a unique style to Heavy Cat Studios' works. Her skill in hand-drawn linear animation has been the foundation of many successful projects beginning with some of our earliest games and leading right through to our new animated web series.

Her comic work both in her own projects and the studio's have been dramatic successes. Her character design, page design and color style have been crucial to sales and critical acclaim for the LadyStar comic series, and her book covers have become the stuff of studio legend. She is the artist and creator of the Magician's Quest webcomic.


Hortensie - Lead Environments Artist - If we need a place for something magical or mysterious to happen, Hortensie will probably draw it for us. An expert in the arcane art of speedpainting, Hortensie is renowned for her ability to make you look twice at her work to be sure you aren't looking at a photograph.

She will be primarily responsible for mattes, backgrounds and color design in the new comic. Expect something stunning, because all of her studio work so far has been nothing short of "wow" level.


The Crow - Lead Creature Design - If there were an awards category for "nightmare fuel," The Crow would need to build new shelves on a regular basis for his trophies. One of our fastest and most prolific artists, The Crow is capable of combining realistic texture and otherworldly design into illustrations that are in a word "unforgettable."

(His plans for Sai Magnen's "alternate forms" are more than a little unsettling, so prepare yourself before you recklessly dive into this particular comic.)

You might think that girl warriors would face something not-quite-as-scary as other warriors might expect, and you would be wrong. The Crow will see to it that the Ajan Warriors have all manner of beasties to contend with as they journey through the action-packed pages of this comic project.


Chibi - Lead Producer - All great teams need a leader, and Chibi is our most accomplished producer. She has led dozens of projects for our studio, both large and small, and her managerial instincts have been honed to a precise and superior level over the past two years.

Chibi's skills range from color style to inking to original illustration work. She has an appealing style and a huge library of work to draw inspiration from. Chibi is a skilled creative professional and we are looking forward to her contributions during production of our comic project.


W. Scott - Author and Script Writer - W. Scott is the creator of LadyStar and the author of 11 books and four comic titles in the Adventures of Jessica Hoshi series.

Scott is a 17-year veteran of the entertainment industry whose work includes script and character development for comics, games, audiocasts, animation and numerous other book series, including The Zombie Plumbers, Railgranny and Fat Guys on Tricycles with Bazookas

Scott's newest free work is featured at the new LadyStar: The Ajan Champions site.

We're going to write, draw and color a new comic book of either 22, 30 or 40 pages to continue the story of LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion where Issue #1 left off in 2008.

And YOU can be a part of this project! By contributing to our campaign, you are making this comic happen, and in return, we're giving you some of the coolest rewards any comic project has ever made available! Check our perks in the right hand column to see what's available, and be sure to get the limited perks before they disappear!

During this campaign we're going to show you what we have in mind for the second chapter in this exciting series! We have big plans for a comic with monsters, action, magic and thrilling mysteries! We think you're going to be as excited as we are!

WHAT IF I DON'T HAVE A KINDLE?

You can read our comics on nearly any mobile platform: iPad, Surface, Nook, Nexus, Android, iPhone and even Blackberries. You can also read our comics on PCs and Macs. There are free Kindle apps available in the App Store, Google Play and Windows Store, and of course you can read LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion #2 on any Kindle device, especially the color Kindle Fire.

One of our higher level perks includes a free Kindle Fire, so even if you don't have a Kindle, you can get one during our campaign!

WHAT IS THE MONEY GOING TO BE USED FOR?

The funds we raise will be used to pay for the costs of writing, drawing, coloring and lettering the comic pages themselves, and then assembling the e-book version of the comic for distribution on Kindle and other mobile devices. Many people will work on the book, and they will all share in the proceeds of our campaign.

Some funds will be used to pay for fulfillment of perks for our contributors as well.

WHY IS THE GOAL ONLY $500?

We can produce a 22-page full-color comic at a minimum per-page rate (about $23 a page) for $500. But we wanted to give our readers and contributors a chance to decide what we would include in Issue #2, so we plan to put all the other decisions up as stretch goals.

With each stretch goal our per-page rate will go up slightly, until we reach the super-jumbo 40-page comic. We will announce new stretch goals during the campaign.

LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion Issue #1 is 28 pages long.

We're going to update our campaign every day for the next month with new previews, audiocasts, videos, animation, music, color illustrations, page previews, script excerpts, story excerpts and new concept art. We will also be announcing new perks and new stretch goals as they become unlocked!

Every day, we will announce the next day's update with a sneak preview, so be sure to subscribe and follow us. We will produce more new work for this crowdfunding campaign than we will for the comic itself!

So get ready, because the Greatest Fighting Team of Teenage Girls Ever Assembled is once again about to do battle with the Venom Legion, and you're not going to believe what happens next!

Envenomed Reaver - Enemy of the Ajan Warriors

Venom Legion Battleground Concept Paintings

The Ajan Warrior of the Night and Kishi

The Aerie of Ultan Concept Painting

RELOAD THIS PAGE DAILY
Scroll Down: New Updates Are Continually Posted
Tomorrow's Update #7: The Warrior of the Rocks



LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion is a full-color comic series based on W. Scott's LadyStar characters.  It tells the story of Jessica Hoshi's Ajan Warriors and the Scribe Arcanist Reina of Kulnas joining forces to defeat the Cryptic Sorcerer Sai Magnen and his legion of fiends in the isolated and treacherous Chaer Badlands.
The first volume in the Venom Legion series LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion #1 is currently the top-rated LadyStar book with an average 4.7-star rating, and on October 16, 2013 was ranked the #7 superhero book on Amazon.com.
LadyStar is a fantasy adventure book series about seven girls who wear magical jewelry that can become powerful weapons.  Each of the seven main characters is a warrior with unique powers.  Their strength as individual fighters and as a team grows through the series as they meet new challenges and overcome the forces that oppose them.  Their mission is to discover the ancient legend of the LadyStar and defend the Realm of Aventar from the Cryptics and their evil minions.
Girls can be heroes, and in the world of LadyStar, they are the heroes. Our stories are different from many others in television, books and movies where the teenage girl characters are often sour, hyper-competitive, angry, jealous and self-destructive.  The challenges faced by Jessica and her friends reaffirm the value of teamwork, courage and friendship.  As warriors, they rely on their honor to sustain them through hardship and crisis.
LadyStar has been in continuous development for 13 years, and is now featured in a series of 21 novels, novellas and comics on the Kindle e-book platform.  This campaign is to fund development of the second issue of the Fury of the Venom Legion comic series.
We are a team of 17 artists, eight voice actors and two writers.  We have developed 33 interactive games, including a record-setting hit release on the Steam PC Game Store, 21 e-books including six full-color comic titles, eight audiocasts and a daily animated video series.  We have produced, on average, a new commercial product every six weeks for the last five-and-a-half years.
LadyStar is our first commercial project, and our flagship series.
Five years ago, we published the comic that helped launch our business.  That comic was LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion Issue #1. It began a series that brought us over 200,000 new readers and helped us build the largest English-language webcomic association in the world with over 115 member sites and 70,000 readers a day.

One of her primary talents is dramatic page design, and our newest comic is certain to benefit from her creativity.  She is the artist and creator of the long-running Tales of Pylea webcomic series.

story:
The Unforgotten

Who is William Messner-Loebs? (Click to find out--he's amazing!)

William and Nadine Messner-Loebs are wonderful people, and we remember not only the great work they have done within the comic book community but also the types of inspiration, encouragement, and direct help in getting us on our own creative paths.  Were it not for them, I would have lost hope in terms of my own personal desire to create comics and games.  It was for this reason that I asked my friends in Detroit Tradecraft to not only create art and story for this anthology, but also to put out the word in our community that we wanted to help Bill and Nadine. 

This full-color comic book is thirty-six pages of art and story, featuring many of those in our community.  In order of appearance, these are:

  • Tom Orzechowski,
  • Bill Bryan,
  • Brent Bowman,
  • G. Walker Teon,
  • J. R. Mounts,
  • C. Pat Jackson,
  • David Branstetter,
  • Marco Evans,
  • Anthony Zicari and Claudio Sepulveda, and
  • Nick Gibson, Jason Johnson, and Jammie Eric Baird

I mostly handled editing and a few lettering assists.  All profits from sales of these books (after manufacture and shipping, as necessary) will go directly to Bill and Nadine.

What We Need

The goal we set assumes the cost of a print run of 500 books and shipments for the books within the United States, with the profit going directly to Bill and Nadine Messner-Loebs.   The more books we print, however, the lower the cost-per-book goes, and the more we get to give.  Should we miraculously raise enough to help them into a new home by our means alone, any surplus funds will go to Habitat for Humanity, helping to build homes for the homeless.

What You Get

What you get depends on your level of donation to the cause:

  • $3:  A digital version of The Unforgotten
  • $10:  A print copy of The Unforgotten, shipped anywhere in the United States by US First Class service
  • $15:  Two print copies, as above (one for reading, one for collecting!)
  • $20:  A print copy of The Unforgotten, shipped anywhere in the United States by Priority Mail
  • $25:  Two print copies, as above
  • $50:  Two print copies by Priority Mail anywhere in the United States, but with special thanks printed on the back cover of the book.
  • $500:  (One person only), Two print copies by Priority Mail, shipped anywhere in the WORLD (allowing for foreign customs), special thanks printed on the back cover of the book, plus the original cover art done by Bill Bryan!
  • $500:  (One person only--NEW!), Two print copies by Priority Mail, shipped anywhere in teh WORLD (allowing for foreign customs), special thanks printed on the back cover of the book, plus original inked art boards done for "Homeless?" by David Branstetter!

If We Miss Our Goal

If we miss our, everyone still gets their books--we're committed to that.  It just means we don't end up sending nearly as much to Bill and Nadine.

The Impact

In the end, this isn't about us.  This is about William and Nadine Messner-Loebs and helping them find their way back into a place of their own.  This is also about homelessness in general--these are people like us, and most of us are just one bad month from being on the streets, just like them.  This anthology highlights that fact.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge was getting the content together.  I was hoping to get everything together by mid-September (and then later, by mid-October) so that we could hopefully have something for Bill and Nadine in time for Christmas.  Sadly, stories ran past deadline, so we had to start the campaign late.  That said, even with the late timing, every bit of this helps.  The only problem that could be bigger would only be if this proves a bigger success than I could have hoped, which may force a change in layout to accommodate a larger "thank you" page or take up more of my own time in getting these shipped out.  To my mind, this would be a great problem to have.  Still, this isn't my first time making an anthology (or handling mass shipping).  If that happens, I look forward to it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to contribute right now, please share this campaign on social media and just help get the word out to anyone you might know with an interested.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Sarah-Isabelle Tremblay: Creator, illustrator, co-writer

Kendra Henderson: Co-creator and writer

 

We are long-term friends, pursuing different paths, who joined forces to create something together. Sarah is interested in visual narrative and wordless storytelling. Kendra is interested in the power of fiction in meaning making. Together, we want to explore the power of the comic medium. We take inspiration from science fiction, gothic and horror, as well as fairytales.

Our story is about how communication technology affects fundamental human experiences such as loss, love and loyalty. We also aim to look at the increasing role of a.i. technology in our lives and relationships.

It is science fiction as much as it is science fact; social media and our online lives are in the process of shifting our framework for grief and loneliness.  How do we deal with the loss of someone we love when their online presence continues in our lives?

Comic books and graphic novels are well suited to literature of trauma and survivorship.With our project, we hope to open up discussion about the relationship between technology and grief, and, more broadly, the interplay between verbal and visual.

The story is written, the pages have been drawn, and now we need your help with the final stages: coloring, printing and distribution.  You can make our dream a reality by helping with production costs!

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

 

Sarah here, this is the breakdown of where the money goes:

 

~1,500$ _gets us 300 copies of the book

~150$ _goes to colouring materials for the final stages of the book

~1000$ _for everything to go with distribution. This consists of the shipping costs of books to a few different cities, as well as transportation to attend a book launch (or two?) in other cities.

~200$ _is for printing merchandise and promotional material.

~150$ _well, this is just a buffer fund in case of potential unforeseeable problems! If there is no urgent need for this extra money, it will go directly perks or my next comic project :)

 

PERKS

Please check out the perks on the side, there are options of receiving prints of my art for your contributions, as well as physical and digital copies of the book. I am so happy to send you my art for you to enjoy, this is what I live for!

 

IMPACT

 

Increasingly, our lives and experiences are captured, logged, and codified online.  Our online lives can be tailored and edited to create the version of ourselves we wish to present to the world.

With an increase in apps designed to manage our digital legacies and prolong our online presence through social media platforms, we feel a story dealing with our digital imprint is relevant today.

We believe it is important to have these discussions now about human loss in these new cyber-social realities. Our story is also a very human story about family grief which we hope can reach people regardless of their experience with technology.

 

Sarah has produced an illustrated zine (“Fleur Poil”) and a photographic storybook (“Sea Sick Love”) that she has sold at small bookfairs, so this project is the next step.  

 

But WAIT!...THERE’S MORE

 

If you read all of this and are thinking “I like this project and want to support it but I don’t have the money!!!”. This is totally okay, you can share the link for the campaign on social medias. It would help this project ENORMOUSLY! If you share (check the Indie Gogo sharing features) I send you a Virtual Hug!

 

THANK YOU!

*

*

Thank you to the talented Nasuna Stuart-Ulin for the incredible video! 

//..   http://www.nasuna.com  ..\\

story:
Synopsis 

T.I.T.S. is an ongoing comic book series chronicling the adventures of a cosmic cabbie named Blotter, his feline navigator Skitz Skatz, and a disgruntled Seattle PD detective named Starla.  Blotter and Skitz Skatz work for a taxi company called T.I.T.S. that specializes in transporting aliens and other cosmic beings throughout the multiverse.  These travelers are known as Transmigrants.  Blotter and Skitz Skatz come to Earth seeking out a Transmigrant.  However, due to equipment malfunctions, getting into trouble, and being bad at their jobs, the duo wind up botching their mission as they roam the streets of Seattle creating havoc.  Before long they draw the attention of Starla, who unwittingly gets sucked into their chaotic world.  Unbeknownst to this caustic trio, their actions will determine the fate of the entire multiverse!  And if Primordious and his fiendish android Icivious have anything to do with it, that fate will be dire indeed!  What ensues is a hilarious, mind-bending romp that questions the very nature of reality as we know it!

CREATIVE TEAM

David Gunawan-pencils

Eve Amadour-colors

Colton Sorrels & Casey Sorrels-scripts & lettering

Zoran Jankovic-additional art for the credits page

What We Need & What You Get

We have successfully funded two previous crowdfunding campaigns to cover the costs of printing the first three issues.  We are now launching this campaign to try and recover some of the related production costs.  The comics, prints, & other goodies will be ready to ship out once the campaign has concluded.

Risks & Challenges

All three issues are completed so the only foreseeable challenge is getting all of the reward packages in the hands of backers before the end of the year. The comics have been ordered and are en route from China. Once we get them in our hands we will send them out as soon as possible. 

https://www.facebook.com/transmigrantproductions/

http://transmigrantproductions.blogspot.com

http://www.transmigrantproductions.com

REWARDS:

For international backers only: because shipping is so high, we would like to include something extra with each physical item pledge to make the cost a little more worthwhile and the rewards more awesome.  So, for any comic reward tier, you will get a free 11X17 poster.  For any poster reward tier, you will get the next pledge tier level's number of posters.  So for example if you pledge for "T.I.T.S. #1-3 PHYSICAL", you will get a free poster and if you pledge for "2 POSTERS + T.I.T.S. #2 & #3" you will get 3 posters.

  • T.I.T.S. ISSUES #1-3 BUNDLE (Available in both physical & digital formats)

  • "Making Of" T.I.T.S. #1, 2, & 3 PDF's

  • T.I.T.S. LOGO STICKER

  • T.I.T.S. BOOKMARK

  • ICIVIOUS PRINT

  • T.I.T.S. CREW POSTER #1

  • T.I.T.S. CREW POSTER #2

  • T.I.T.S. ISSUE #1 COVER POSTER
  • T.I.T.S. ISSUE #2 COVER POSTER
  • T.I.T.S. ISSUE #3 COVER POSTER

  • ORIGINAL T.I.T.S. CHARACTER SKETCH

story_txt:
Synopsis 
T.I.T.S. is an ongoing comic book series chronicling the adventures of a cosmic cabbie named Blotter, his feline navigator Skitz Skatz, and a disgruntled Seattle PD detective named Starla.  Blotter and Skitz Skatz work for a taxi company called T.I.T.S. that specializes in transporting aliens and other cosmic beings throughout the multiverse.  These travelers are known as Transmigrants.  Blotter and Skitz Skatz come to Earth seeking out a Transmigrant.  However, due to equipment malfunctions, getting into trouble, and being bad at their jobs, the duo wind up botching their mission as they roam the streets of Seattle creating havoc.  Before long they draw the attention of Starla, who unwittingly gets sucked into their chaotic world.  Unbeknownst to this caustic trio, their actions will determine the fate of the entire multiverse!  And if Primordious and his fiendish android Icivious have anything to do with it, that fate will be dire indeed!  What ensues is a hilarious, mind-bending romp that questions the very nature of reality as we know it!

CREATIVE TEAM
David Gunawan-pencils
Eve Amadour-colors
Colton Sorrels & Casey Sorrels-scripts & lettering
Zoran Jankovic-additional art for the credits page


What We Need & What You Get
We have successfully funded two previous crowdfunding campaigns to cover the costs of printing the first three issues.  We are now launching this campaign to try and recover some of the related production costs.  The comics, prints, & other goodies will be ready to ship out once the campaign has concluded.

Risks & Challenges
All three issues are completed so the only foreseeable challenge is getting all of the reward packages in the hands of backers before the end of the year. The comics have been ordered and are en route from China. Once we get them in our hands we will send them out as soon as possible. 


https://www.facebook.com/transmigrantproductions/
http://transmigrantproductions.blogspot.com
http://www.transmigrantproductions.com

story:
Short Summary

Mystery House Comics is a small-press publisher in Boise, Idaho.  Our mission is to bring the tools of self-publishing to potential comics creators and encourage writers and artists to take the first steps in making comics.  6x6 is a great opportunity to give feedback and advice on scripting and layout, to show creators step-by-step how to print and self-publish, and to practice salesmanship and table etiquette at conventions.  MHC also cares about expanding and fostering our local comics community.  The creative teams in each volume have never worked together before and learn to work with someone new while creating a new connection and making a new friend in the community they can count on for advice, recommendations, and future projects.  6x6 is a fun and adventurous project that utilizes the skill and experience of established, published creators, as well as providing a first opportunity for brand new writers and artists.  6x6:FORTUNE is guided by editors Mike Dreher (2-time 6x6 contributor and artist of CAT 5), Elysium Jacks (writer and 2-time 6x6 contributor), Jon Keithley (writer of Shivertown and Editor-in-Chief of Mystery House Comics), and Shanae Lavelle (artist of Shivertown and Art Director of Mystery House Comics)."

What We Need & What You Get

Mystery House Comics will print 200 copies of the comic book to be sold at conventions, events, and in retail locations like Captain Comics of Boise.  Creators are rewarded for their involvement with 10 complimentary issues.  Print costs total around $600 for those 320 copies, plus $244 for variant covers.  We will be throwing the creators a RELEASE PARTY in October to promote the book, and to thank and reward them for their time and effort.  The event will feature a multimedia reading of each comic with professional actors and a chance to chat with all 12 artists and writers, get their signature, and pick their brains about their work and the experience.  The only costs to the event are venue ($400) and refreshments ($150).  We will be holding the event at the El Korah Shriners Hall.  It's a great space and all of the venue fees go to their children's hospital.  It means a lot to dedicate an evening to these talented comic book creators.  Please help us make them feel like the VIPs they are for an evening.

Rewards for contributing to the creation of this comic include: a signed copy of 6x6:FORTUNE, 3 limited edition variant covers, original art by the creators involved, and a seat at the VIP table at our October release party!

In the event we don't reach our goal, what we raise will be put towards printing first and foremost.  This book is an important opportunity for creators of all experience levels to learn and grow, and we think it's one of the projects that really makes our flourishing Idaho comic book scene special.

The Impact

6x6 began in 2014 with our first volume, FERAL, co-published by Corvid Tear Media.  That edition featured work by Erica Crockett, author of Chemicals and The Blood Zodiac series, Albert Asker, Editor-in-Chief of Idaho Comics Group and publisher of Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho, Tarey Potter, whose art makes a return in this year's edition, and included editorial work by Crockett and Joshua Shapel, co-founder of the Boise Library Comic Con.

The anthology was successful enough it returned in 2015 with MOMENTUM featuring Rob Liefeld-protege Jacob Bear, current 6x6 editors Mike Dreher and Elysium Jacks, and Bop Comics founder Randall Kirby.  Every year we're able to improve the process for the creators and to expand our reach and resources one aspect at a time.  In 2016 we were our most ambitious to date with the release of 6x6:PRETEND.  The book featured an incredible roster of writers and artists including Jacob Bear, Joseph Bradshaw, Mike Dreher, Dan Feldmeier, Elysium Jacks, Steve Willhite, and we pulled off the biggest release party yet with a live band and a slideshow timing each comic, panel-by-panel, to music and live performances by professional actors.  

This year we've been able to make additions to the process we've always wanted.  In addition to a Meet and Greet for creators to get to know one another, we're hosting a Script Workshop and a Layout Workshop for writers and artists to sit down with their editors and work through the creative process face-to-face, overcoming obstacles and clarifying communication to ensure the finished product is more collaborative and detailed than ever before.

6x6 is an important part of the Treasure Valley comic book creative culture.  It welcomes new artists and writers and introduces them to the creative partners who can help them make their dreams a reality.  It gives potential creators a chance to take their first drag in the art of making comics, and hopefully they come away addicted and eager for more.  When it's time for their next project they now know two handfuls of artists and writers to lean on for help, advice, and even partnership.  This project is a great chance to get experienced comic book creators who have their own lessons to impart in the room with people who may be able to benefit from their knowledge, and the old dogs can definitely learn a thing or two from new talent with a fresh perspective.  

Other Ways you Can Help!

We realize you have a lot of options when it comes to crowdfunding campaigns.  And comic books.  And crowdfunding campaigns to support comic books.  If you can't help out right now... no worries.  But what you CAN DO is tell everyone you know about this campaign.  This is a passion project for everyone involved and it would mean the world to us if you would TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... greeting cards... WHATEVER!  You can't help 6x6 if you don't know about 6x6, am I right?!  We appreciate the assist.  Thanks.

If we exceed our goal...

What happens if this campaign is so successful we raise more money than we asked for?  We have a plan for that.  The 12 artists and writers involved in the book receive, as payment, 10 complimentary copies of 6x6:FORTUNE.  Any additional funds we raise will go towards more free copies for the creators to reward them for their hard work.  They can use these copies to give to their grandma, to sell at conventions, or to make wrapping paper out of!  The possibilities are endless!
