story:
Hello everyone! Its my pleasure to invite you to this particular indiegogo comic. It has been a long time in the making. Its something that I never thought people would get the chance to see, but here we are! 

 In the tech-heavy city of Bettano, crime is at an all time high. Blood is being stolen and sold on the black market and authorities are powerless to stop it. Some are not too subtle about how they get it either. Two men rise to the forefront. The Rival...the man who has sworn to protect this city and make it safe for the girl he loves. The other...the Tingod, the fearless overlord who has no regard for society and their rules. Their lives will forever intertwine from this point on. And there is Sadie Thomas, the girl who loves the Rival. She begins to play a part in both of their lives. A part she never would've imagined. Rivals all. It begins what will become a psychological journey for all. This book will be the first in a long line of RIVAL books set to go forward.

Rival was a series I did many years ago, and was set very far in the characters life. There was never an origin issue for it. Never a beginning that I was able to share. Finally, we put together RIVAL gold and silver. It wasn't until recently that all production parts and pieces were returned that we were able to complete this edition and finally show the world this hidden gem done by some of the legends of the business. There are 4 stories in this volume, and you'll get know the world of Bettano through each one. This issue is where everything starts for the Rival. I'm very fortunate to have worked with the artists presented here. I'm grateful to have the chance to do right by them. Dare I say it, this issue is a very historic one, not just for Rival, but for comics in general. Its a redemption story, in and out of the book.

Dick Ayers does the full length story here. Dick is most known for his long run on Sgt.Fury, the Golden age Ghost Rider, and tons of other Marvel stories, many as a prolific inker to Jack Kirby. This is one of Dick's last stories before he moved on to draw his autobiography for meccabooks. He didnt miss a step drawing this one. Clear, precise work...beautiful in spots...detailed... Marvel really shudda had him drawing in his later years, and I think part of him wanted to prove he still had it in this one. He definitely did. I will even go so far to say this is one of his finest. What a better way to begin a characters gold and silver age than with a gold and silver age artist. His Rival is heroic, his Tingod is monstrous, and his Sadie...done with such class and emotion, you'll want to jump into this story and try to help her.

George Tuska, also a golden/silver age legend, does the 2nd story and its just as powerfully done as you would expect. George spent almost 10 years drawing Iron Man, but has also drew another black clad hero before...the Black Terror. And yep, we get to sneak a little of him in our issue too. This was one of 4 stories I did with George in my career, and if the plan goes right, youll get to see them all shortly. 

Marco Dileonardo handles the 3rd story as Sadie finds something out about Dillan that calls into question the morality of killing a villain. Brien Cardello(hey that's me!) handles the 4th story. Its a little day in the life bit which gives us some background on the man in the black suit himself. (hey you didnt think I was gonna leave me outta this didja?)

Fred Hembeck joins us for a short history lesson on the characters and creators in a 4 pager and we round out the book with some nifty pinups. Now usually I like showcasing newer talent in the books I do, but when I was putting all this together I thought the boys should have some contemporaries with them. Rounding out the gallery is Joe Sinnott, Gene Colan, Irwin Hasen, Mike Royer, and one more from George Tuska. 

I guess if I was picking a team I did okay. :)

Now it's all about fixing up the story, a twink here and there , and the production work, measuring, scanning... nearly complete. Not often does such a story being solicited here come so close to being finished, but that works in our favor..I like being way ahead of the game. 

I hope you'll join us for this very special book. A comic that combines elements of classic Marvel style and underground storytelling. I hope you'll be as exited to see them tackle Rival as I was, as we present a few tales that have never before been seen to some of their dearest fans. And if you weren't a fan before, I think you will be. Rival finally has his history, and if this goes well, you'll be seeing a lot more of him. Or is it her? Time will tell.

Now let's show off some of our perks:

54% to richard ayers jr, 16% bob tuska, 16 Marco, 5 fred, 9 other

 

recieved the prototype gold cover! we dig it

story:
WHAT IS THAT...THING!?

When a group of grade-schoolers decide to test local legends and summon a rumored demon in the nearby woods, they bite off more than they can chew...but not more than can chew them. Dare to enter the world of TEETHER, the hit horror miniseries by David Hutchison (The Nightmare Before Christmas (inks), Dragon Arms, Mischief & Mayhem, Oz: The Manga)!

Dillon Brown thinks he’s made a friend with new transfer student Lilly Quist. But when the grisly remains of local kids appear, he starts to suspect the new girl has something to do with it. Soon Dillon realizes that an ancient, endless hunger has come to Carol Hill, Indiana in the form of a 10-year-old girl. He and his classmates now have to stop Lilly’s vicious, gore-drenched feast before it’s too late. But the secrets behind Lilly’s rage might just be more terrifying than Lilly herself!

OH! AWESOME! WHAT DO WE GET?

The full story of the 4-issue miniseries is collected here in one heart-pounding, (literally) gut-wrenching volume. The full Teether saga all at once may seem tough to swallow, but just give it a little bit. Once you sink your teeth into this horror masterpiece, you'll chews to finish the whole thing!

David is an incredibly versatile, talented creator, having worked in genres ranging from sword-and-sorcery fantasy to superhero action, steampunk, science fiction, and dark humor. Now he turns his hand to the horror genre, and the results are breathtaking and blood-chilling!

Unfortunately, getting books like this published can be terrifyingly expensive.  Here is a breakdown of our expenses:

Printing: $3200

Shipping: $1100

Fees: $500 (Indiegogo takes their fees off the top)

Handling/Supplies: $400 (We have to pay for boxes and pay people to pack those boxes.)

That does not include cost for sending the large PDF files to all the supporters and other miscellaneous costs.

Those basic expenses total $250.

That cost looks like a killer, but we make it worth your while to support this project so no one has to make a deal with the Devil to get it done!

 

Perks

 

Add-ons

story:
VOLETE PRIMA LEGGERE IL NUMERO 1? NIENTE PAURA! COMPRATELO QUI, NEL PERIODO DEL CROWDFUNDING LO POTETE COMPRARE AL PREZZO SPECIALE DI 15 EURO!
 

Note for English people: unfortunately this campaign is reserved only to Italian people (due to limited budget). In case of overfunding we will evaluate to release an English version and for information write to info@tatailab.com

Menu

Introduzione

I Perks

La storia

I personaggi

Il progetto

Come useremo questi fondi?

Come possiamo aiutare?

 

Introduzione

Ciao a tutti, mi chiamo Chiara e sono qui per presentare il secondo volume di Anima.

1 anno fa a quest'ora abbiamo lanciato la prima campagna di crowdfunding del mio progetto e a Lucca Comics siamo usciti con il primo volume! Siete stati fantastici! La prima tiratura è andata totalmente esaurita e ho ricevuto da tantissimi di voi molte parole di affetto e supporto <3
Ora siamo di nuovo qui, su Indiegogo, per lanciare la campagna per il secondo volume; la storia continua ed è sempre più esplosiva. Siete curiosi di continuare a leggere le avventure di Marco, Anima e tutti gli amici del Borgo? Questa è l'occasione per aiutarci a rendere concreto questo secondo volume!

Ecco a voi...

ANIMA è un fumetto di genere fantastico, ricco di personalità, emozione, colori e follia. 
Stilisticamente riconducibile ai moderni codici orientali, con un segno fresco che strizza l’occhio agli anime e un’impostazione narrativa tanto europea quanto giapponese, Anima è un libro vivace, fresco, pulsante.

 

I Perks

 

LIBRO A LUCCA- Il libro a fumetti di Anima (92 pagine di colori formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) - IL LIBRO E' GIA' PRONTO e lo ritirerai a Lucca Comics allo stand Tatai Lab.

 

LIBRO A CASA- Il libro a fumetti di Anima (92 pagine di colori formato 21 x 29,7 cm - Cartonato) - IL LIBRO E' GIA' PRONTO e ti verrà spedito direttamente a casa.

 

LIBRO + USB - Il Libro + una chiavetta USB 3d raffigurante il personaggio di ANIMA realizzata da Maikii (contenente illustrazioni, disegni, wip e tanto altro) + stampa autografata della cover.

 

LIBRO + PELUCHE - Libro + Peluche a tiratura limitata realizzato da Carinerie by Katy + stampa autografata della cover.

 

LIBRO + CUSTOM A4 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A4 + stampa autografata della cover.

 

LIBRO + CUSTOM A3 - Libro + Commission personalizzata, in B&N in A3 + stampa autografata della cover.

 

ROYALE - Libro + Usb + Peluche + Custom A3 + Stampa autografata della cover.

 

VOLUME 1 + VOLUME 2 - Ti sei perso il primo volume, e li vuoi recuperare entrambi in un colpo solo? Questo è il perk che fa per te! Entrambi i volumi in un unico pacco, a casa tua, o a Lucca Comics 2017.

 

La storia

È passato del tempo dall'arrivo al Borgo e Marco si è finalmente ambientato ritrovando un suo equilibrio, grazie anche ad un nuovo lavoro: l'addetto alle pulizie. Questo però non lo ferma dal voler scoprire di più su di sé e sul come utilizzare il suo potenziale, ma per quanto insista, Anima continua a rifiutarsi di istruirlo. Tutto questo cambierà quando Kim, invogliata da Rama, obbligherà Anima a partecipare ad un torneo di cacciatori che si tiene una volta ogni 7 anni: il torneo Gilgamesh! Ovviamente Marco si unirà all'avventura, scoprendo cosa sia la vita in un mondo al di fuori di Systema ed entrando in contatto con l'arte della Magia. Per quanto tutto sia incredibilmente nuovo e bello non bisogna mai abbassare la guardia: vecchi e nuovi nemici si nascondono nell'ombra...!

 

I personaggi

 

MARCO

“...Meh.” -cit.

Dopo aver abbandonato l’università, Marco lavora come commesso al Suppa Market e conduce una vita noiosa e ripetitiva. É goffo ed impacciato e molto spesso finisce in situazioni imbarazzanti, dalle quali esce sempre con l’amaro in bocca. Da qualche anno la sua personalità ha preso una brutta piega, trasformandolo in una persona apatica e cinica. Qualcosa nell’ombra lo sta lentamente divorando, ma cosa?

 

ANIMA

“Voi umani siete tutti uguali, di continuo a lamentarvi senza fare nulla aspettando un qualcosa che vi salvi e vi sollevi dalle vostre sofferenze. Quando verrà il giorno in cui vi prenderete le vostre maledette responsabilità?” -cit.

Cacciatrice di Demoni caotica e imprevedibile. Anima porta distruzione, disinteressandosi delle conseguenze sugli esseri umani che, anzi, disprezza. A differenza dei suoi colleghi, non mira a distruggere i Demoni, bensì ad ammansirli e farli passare dalla sua parte, garantendole potere e protezione. È impulsiva ed infantile e sebbene le sue doti siano molte, è assolutamente negata a relazionarsi con il prossimo.

 

HORMON

“Non c’è abbastanza zucchero!” -cit.

Dal carattere altezzoso e dispotico, Hormon è una Musa, Demone che vive a stretto contatto con gli esseri umani e che ha sviluppato una personalità ed un ego propri. Trae forza dall’energia che scaturisce dalle persone in preda a forti emozioni e dai quintali di zucchero che ingerisce ogni giorno (preferibilmente sotto forma di marshmellow); è in grado di intervenire sugli stati emotivi altrui dando un improvviso senso di benessere seguito da un boost di energia. Si diverte a giocare con le emozioni delle persone, in particolare stimolandone la libido, dalle quali trae poi nutrimento. Sebbene il suo aspetto sia carino e coccoloso e inciti allo spupazzamento, vi conviene non allungare troppo le mani: morde.

 

RAMA

“Dov’è il divertimento se non c’è sfida?” cit.

Considerato un genio, Rama è un cacciatore di Demoni dalla bravura eccezionale, ma dal carattere impossibile. Accetta solo incarichi se interessanti e/o se pagato profumatamente, non si fa problemi ad abbandonare una missione se la ritiene sotto ai suoi standard di “sfida” e non ha alcun rispetto per le persone che non siano per lui fonte di divertimento.  Seppure i suoi fan (e le sue amanti) siano numerosi, conduce una vita solitaria accompagnato da Hāthī, un pupazzo automa che lui stesso ha creato e che gli funge da segretaria personale. Questa, oltre ad organizzare l’agenda e gestire i contatti, tiene conto di tutte le uscite videoludiche nel periodo lavorativo di Rama, le quali quest’ultimo recupererà richiudendosi in casa per mesi, giocando fino al completismo più estremo.

 

MAMAN

“AHAHAHAHAHAHAH!!!” -cit

Maman è una guaritrice molto famosa e con una lista d’attesa quasi interminabile. Con le sue terapie ha salvato non poche vite, tra cui quelle di personaggi famosi e potenti. Sempre positiva, il suo motto è “la guarigione inizia sempre con una sana risata” e la sua, in particolare, scalda gli animi più tristi. La si può considerare il sindaco del Borgo, luogo incantato e in continua trasformazione, dove vivono molti Demoni e personaggi particolari, tra cui la stessa Anima. Come quest’ultima, anche Maman ha la capacità di legare con i Demoni e uno tra questi è talmente potente da essere la base su cui poggia l’intero Borgo.

 

MOMO & PAPILLON

“Doppio High five dell’amicizia!!!” -cit.

Migliori amiche da sempre, Momo e Papillon appartengono alle due famiglie rivali del Borgo: quella dei Gatti del porto e quella dei Procioni del quartiere commerciale. Momo  ha un carattere dolce e gentile, lavora come cameriera e ragazza delle consegne per il Ramen-ten della madre e quando ha tempo va ad aiutare lo zio al Sushi-ya. Papillon  ha un carattere forte e altruista, lavora al supermercato di famiglia, ma è più il tempo che perde in giro a divertirsi che quello che impegna effettivamente a lavorare. Nonostante le continue lamentele da parte dei parenti, ad entrambe piace trasformarsi in esseri umani perchè lo trovano divertente e comodo. Tutte e due sono le candidate numero uno per succedere al posto di capofamiglia: riusciranno a rappacificare le acque tra i clan?

 

SIRIO

“Cacciatori di Demoni, Streghe, Stregoni, Pirati Spaziali, ne ho abbastanza! Sempre a complicare cose che potrebbero essere semplici! Vivere una vita normale vi è così difficile?” -cit.

Apparentemente scontroso, ma dal cuore d’oro, Sirio lavora presso il Sushi-ya di Sakana-san come apprendista. Non sta mai con le mani in mano e passa il suo tempo libero ad aiutare gli abitanti del Borgo in difficoltà: è praticamente un tuttofare. Non mostra minimamente interesse per le mirabolanti avventure di Anima, anzi, il solo sentirne parlare lo irrita profondamente. Seppure sia abituato a convivere con il surreale, Sirio ama le cose semplici e trova che la vera felicità sia nell’ordinario, assieme alle persone care. È strano che una persona del genere si ritrovi al Borgo, non vi pare? Forse in lui si nasconde molto di più che un semplice apprendista cuoco.

 

​KIM

“Provate anche solo a sfiorare la mia roba e vi troverete rivoltati dentro per fuori. Io vi ho avvertito.” -cit.

Kim è una programmatrice e si occupa di gestire la struttura del Borgo, impedendo che il suo continuo mutare lo porti al collasso. È estremamente schietta e distaccata, ha una pazienza senza pari e riesce a mantenere la calma anche nelle situazioni più difficili. Possiede un repertorio di imprecazioni pressoché immenso che usa a pieno regime quando arriva al limite di sopportazione con determinate persone o quando gioca ai MMORPG. Abita assieme a Maman, Anima ed Hormon nella Prima Casa. La si può considerare il vice sindaco del Borgo.

 

OBLAK & NEBE

“Se voi seguiste le regole, il nostro intervento non sarebbe necessario.” -cit. Oblak

Gemelle estremamente legate, Oblak e Nebe sono state cresciute ed istruite per diventare dei sicari di alto livello. Eseguono sempre ogni missione in modo perfetto, quasi fossero dei robot, e sono estremamente devote al loro superiore. Seppure agiscano sempre in sincrono, chi ha l’iniziativa tra le due è Oblak, che dimostra di avere il carattere che invece a Nebe sembra mancare del tutto. Ultimamente sono sulle tracce di Anima che gli ha procurato non pochi problemi, macchiando il loro curriculum perfetto.

 

ALASTOR

“L’equilibrio è alla base dell’esistenza, va preservato ad ogni costo e per questo importanti scelte devono essere fatte. Se non siete in grado di giudicare, allora io mi farò giudice per voi. Affidate a me le vostre vite.” -cit.

Conosciuta come la “Strega di metallo” Alastor è un eterna guerriera, reputata da molti una semi divinità. Persegue il concetto di giustizia ed equità come nessun altro e non ha pietà per chiunque le sia d’intralcio; alcuni dicono che per il bene di questi ideali abbia gettato via il suo stesso cuore. Appartiene ad un’organizzazione che preserva e protegge la razza umana, ma, seppure riceva ordini, il suo giudizio sul campo di battaglia è del tutto imparziale. Agisce prevalentemente in solitaria, ma da qualche tempo ha un paio di apprendiste ai suoi comandi, le uniche che sono riuscite a sopravvivere al suo metodo disumano.

 

TESLA

“Ah. Ho rotto di nuovo Internet.” -cit

Individuo molto ambiguo, Tesla è una tra le personalità più di spicco nella ricerca sul rapporto Demone/uomo e senza dubbio la più controversa. È stato accusato più volte di tradimento e diffamazione, ma i risultati delle sue ricerche sono così importanti da renderlo praticamente intoccabile. Protetto da una famosa organizzazione, conduce esperimenti sugli esseri umani, alla ricerca della Verità: la chiave che porterà all’evoluzione. Per quanto il suo operato potrebbe far trasparire l’opposto, Tesla ama incredibilmente gli esseri umani e passa molto del suo tempo a interagirvi su Internet: se per caso vi imbattete in grossi dibattiti e fenomeni virali, quasi sicuramente nell’occhio del ciclone c’è lui.

 

Il progetto

Anima affonda le radici estetiche in tutto quello scenario magico che spazia dal mondo dei videogiochi, Kingdom Hearts e Zelda in primis, al mondo dell’animazione: Evangelion, Kill la Kill, Gurren Lagann sono alcuni dei progetti più cari all’autrice. 
Lo stile tipicamente orientale e il gusto per la cultura del Sol Levante sono da sempre stati fonte d’ispirazione: nelle tavole respiriamo la delicatezza e il sapore del maestro Miyazaki ma anche forti rimandi a opere della Gainax come FLCL e Punta al Top 2! Diebuster. 
Molti stimoli anche da produzioni americane come Adventure Time e Steven Universe, dove elementi inverosimili e magia la fanno da padrone.

Anima sarà un albo cartonato a colori, di 92 pagine in formato 21 x 29,7 cm.

 

Un libro coordinato da Tatai Lab, ormai una garanzia di qualità nel mondo delle auto-produzioni targate Crowdfunding.

 

Come useremo questi fondi

Anima e' stato disegnato da Chiara e colorato da Lorenzo durante questi ultimi mesi, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab 
Si tratta di 92 pagine ed e' tutto pronto, dobbiamo solo raccogliere i soldi per stampare e spedire.

I fondi verranno usati nel seguente modo:

€ 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo

€ 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget

€ 1.300 per la spedizione

 

Come posso aiutare?

Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo la pagina Indiegogo sui diversi social network. Segui i nostri account: Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/KnowWhoYouAreAnima 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WhoYouAreAnima 
Instagram: https://instagram.com/animaproject/ 
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/tatailab

Diebuster. Molti stimoli anche da produzioni americane come Adventure Time e Steven Universe, dove elementi inverosimili e magia la fanno da padrone.Anima sarà un albo cartonato a colori, di 92 pagine in formato 21 x 29,7 cm. Un libro coordinato da Tatai Lab, ormai una garanzia di qualità nel mondo delle auto-produzioni targate Crowdfunding. Come useremo questi fondiAnima e' stato disegnato da Chiara e colorato da Lorenzo durante questi ultimi mesi, grazie al supporto del Tatai Lab Si tratta di 92 pagine ed e' tutto pronto, dobbiamo solo raccogliere i soldi per stampare e spedire.I fondi verranno usati nel seguente modo:€ 700 per le tasse e Indiegogo€ 5.000 per la stampa e i gadget€ 1.300 per la spedizione Come posso aiutare?Puoi aiutarci supportando il progetto o anche solamente condividendo la pagina Indiegogo sui diversi social network. Segui i nostri account: Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/KnowWhoYouAreAnima Twitter: https://twitter.com/WhoYouAreAnima Instagram: https://instagram.com/animaproject/ Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/tatailab

story:
What is Dekko Comics?

In order to explain what this product - Dekko Reader - is, you need to first understand the story behind Dekko Comics.

Back in 2016, we launched a crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter to help fund the production and release of the first two issues of Dekko Comics. This was a comic that turned educational information into fun and engaging comic strips, using a technique I had first discovered myself while struggling at school. By presenting the information this way I was able to enjoy my learning experience and retain the information.

Through this, I gained my first academic A!

I shared my story in the hope that people would see the potential in what I wanted to do. I genuinely thought it could provide much-needed support for children with learning difficulties like Dyslexia (which I have), Autism and ADHD. I also thought it could help those who had no specific needs but struggled or had become disengaged.

The response at the time was overwhelming with a number of people expressing how they wished something like this had existed when they were at school. Within a short time, we had surpassed our goal and with the money raised, we were able to fully fund creating and releasing the comics as well as attending some conventions to help boost our small company's image. 

Since that first campaign, we have expanded; hiring office staff and a team of artists and releasing a comic a month. On top of this, we create commissions and do workshops and talks at schools and organisations across the UK. Now we're looking to make the next step with the release of a very special app - 'Dekko Reader'.

What is Dekko Reader?

Dekko Reader is the next logical step for us to take as a company and as a project and will allow us to finally expand our comics into the digital market. This, in turn, will offer us the opportunity to address the issues and points that have been raised about the limitations that there are with hard-copy comic. Features on the app will include the option to add colour overlays to the pages, increase or decrease the complexity of the speech bubbles to match the readers level and add a background colour to the speech bubbles to makes them easier to read for pupils with visual stress.  

All of these options are designed to make the app as accessible as possible and of course, there will be updates in the future to allow for changes, improvements and new options that we have in store or are yet to think of.

The app will be the best way to read your digital copies of Dekko Comics and will be free with the only cost being the purchase of the comics themselves. 

The development of this app does not mean the end of our hard copy comics as we believe that is a very valid form of reading. This is about giving our readers options on how they read our comics and to provide them with greater readability and accessibility when it comes to their experience.

All backers will receive early access to the app as well as the first four copies pre-loaded onto their account so they can start reading as soon as Dekko Reader launches, which we hope will be in late 2019.

What do we need from you?

Our target is £20,000 which will give us enough to fully fund the creation of the app with all of the features that we've mentioned included. We appreciate that this is a large amount but it is a necessary amount for the level of development that we require for the vision we have for this app. We have seen what is possible with your support in the past so we have every faith that together we can achieve this too. 

What this money will allow us to design and build the following functions of the app:

BASIC APP FRAMEWORK: 

App framework (£175)

Sign up/register (£525)

Comic listings (£175)

Integrate purchasing (£700)

Comic document structure (£350)

Comic download (£350)

Comic viewer (£1750)

Preferences (£700)

Back end work (£875)

Testing and revisions (£700)

Design time (£2450) 

Transferring twelve Issues to app (£4200)

Deployment (£350)

TOTAL = £13,300

 

SPECIAL FUNCTIONS:

. £1050 = readers will be able to index and categorise the comics by subjects, issues, characters, or their own personal folders, (ie: “Homework Related”, “Funny”, “My Hardest Subjects”, etc). 

. £350 = allowing audiences to customisable colour their speech bubbles to suit their reading needs or preferences.

. £700 = a function to highlight or colour code certain panels or words that are relevant to the reader’s schoolwork or homework or interest. 

. £4600 = allows readers to switch between an ‘Easy Read’, a ‘Medium Read’ and a ‘Full Read’ to suit their reading level and preference. This also allows them to progress through their reading development as it improves, (if they are a struggling reader, for example). 

TOTAL = £6,700

 

Risks & Challenges

Part of the challenge we'll face is that this is our first step into the digital industry and so we'll be learning as we go. Every new venture has difficulties and we fully expect this to be true for our progression into this new method of presentation. However, we are working with a very experienced app developer who has already been very positive about the project and has laid out in detail the expectations and steps in the process. We believe that with their guidance we can weather the storm that is app development and ensure the best possible final product.

We also have a large amount of our content already available in this format as our creative process is largely done online. This means that there should be minimal delay between the app being released and the current library of Dekko content becoming available to our users.

As well as the app development itself this venture will require us to increase our staff numbers as we continue to expand and create new departments in the company. This can be an intimidating prospect for a small independent business but we believe that we have the necessary systems in place to ensure that this is a smooth process with minimal disruption. In the long run, we expect this expansion to improve the Dekko process and will mean that we'll be able to have a consistent scheduled release date for our monthly subscriptions.

We know how important communication is in these campaigns and we are committed to ensuring that all of our backers are kept informed. With regular updates on our progress both during the campaign and after when the app is actually being developed. If you have any questions about anything at all please don't hesitate to ask - you're part of the Dekko community now and we are always happy to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute any money then fear not, we still need your support with as many likes, shares and comments as you can possibly provide.

To be as updated as possible please keep an eye on our social media pages - we have a twitter page @DekkoComics and a facebook page https://www.facebook.com/dekkocomics/ where we'll have regular updates as well as posts for you like and share with your friends and family.

Every little bit helps us to increase our profile and ensure as many people as possible see our campaign. Without this kind of support we would not have come as far as we have today.

story:
A

Brand New Take on the Zombie Genre
Zombies We're Human Too tells zombie stories about people BEFORE and HOW they became zombies with Austin Janowsky (Iron Man) and Mauricio Campetella (Aspen) brings you the next volume in Zombies We're Human Too!

 

HELP ZOMBIES WE"RE HUMAN TOO COME TO LIFE!
We need your help and support to get the next volume published. Our all-star talent lineup will deliver a AAA product that will captivate, thrill and scare you. With your support,
we can bring these stories and characters to life.


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET!
To ensure we deliver a 100 page AAA product, I’ve recruited some of the best indie Creators in the industry. Making sure we take care of them financially is the biggest priority. Our goal is to raise $500 USD to cover the cost of development. Volume 1 is completed and we will have
backer tiers where you can get Volume 1 and Volume 2!

CAMPAIGN STRETCH GOALS:

1. Goal 1,000 USD raised – Indie Digital Comics Bundle!

2. Goal 2,500 USD raised – Zombified Bookmark

3. Goal 4,500 USD raised – Francesco Laquinta (Action Lab) Print

4. Goal 7,500 USD raised – Everyone gets a limited edition 24 page comic with
Stranger Things 2 actor Joe Davison's story with cover art by Joe's artist John Grosjean.

5-14. Goals 10,000-$15,000 USD raised – Zombie stories will be greyscale colored

 

RISK & CHALLENGES:
With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. Our book is 100% complete so as soon as we receive the funds we will get to printing and fulfillment! We choose November just in cast things happen with the printer and it takes longer than planned to get it to us. We are ready to get this book in your hands!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate comic book fans! Show your support by sharing on Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out!


Thank you for supporting the amazing comic creators that have made Zombies We're Human Too Volume 2 a reality!

story:
A new experience for the Pacific Northwest

Hey there, my name is Michael Anderson and I'm bringing a new convention to the Pacific Northwest.  I've been an avid attendee at conventions here for the past fourteen years.  I've also been active in helping through staffing, volunteering, and promoting these conventions.  

I've been involved with everything from Sci-Fi/Fantasy conventions, to Anime conventions, to Comic convention, and even more specialized conventions.  One thing they all have in common is the community of people who go to enjoy themselves and meet others from their fandoms.

Here in the Northwest there is a wonderful community of people from all fandoms and what I want to bring is an end of the year convention celebrating all of these fandoms.  A pop culture conventions for people to come and have a great time in the safety of our wonderful communities.

Contributions will allow us in our first year to acquire more guests, have more space for fan run panels, and provide a much richer experience for everyone in attendance.  It'll also allow us to do new interesting things with the con such as pod casts and live streams for those who want to enjoy the fun but can't be there in person.

 

Attractions/Guests

We will add to this list as more things are secured but confirmed for Newcon we already have a number of things:

  • A cosplay burlesque hosted by our cosplay guest of honor, Bang Bang Neko (http://bangbangneko.deviantart.com/)
  • An electronic dance featuring many local DJs
  • Costume contest encompasing many different genres
  • More artist, music, and voice guests to be anounced soon!

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we are hoping to reach in contributions is $3000.  We already have our hotel secure, as well as many key guests.  With help of this additional funding we will be dong the following:

  • Purchasing promotional materials such as flyers, banners, and buttons.
  • Secure more guests for the convention.
  • Be able to augment less of our space for vendors and more for fan panels, guest panels, and contests.
  • Secure better equipment such as projectors and sound equipment for our panels, dances, and more.

We wouldn't be asking for money without giving something in return!  Even at the lowest levels of donation we will be offering badges for the con at a rate lower than what it will cost when registration goes live.  We also have perks ranging from artwork by our fabulous artists to life time memberships, even VIP perks!

 

The Impact

The main reason that motivated me, and the others who have come onboard to support this project is simple.  We want to have a celebration for the wonderful pop culture communities that make up not just Portland, but also the Pacific Northwest.

This convention fills a void at the time of the year it is being run.  It also provides a fun and safe place for people to spend their new years.  A place with dances, shows, panels, guests, and more.  Contributing helps bring a new and unique experience and event to the Northwest.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please support our convention by spreading the word.  We appreciate everyone who supports our project, even those who can't do so by contributing.  Please help us make this a super successful first year!

story:
Who I Am

My name is Tim Sevenhuysen. You might know me as the creator of FiftyWordStories.com, the guy behind the Year of Stories (where I post a new short story to my blog for free every Monday), or the author of the sci-fi series Losing Freight on 1889.ca and the superhero-with-a-twist series Special People. Maybe you've seen some of the sketch comedy I worked on with Loading Ready Run between 2008 and 2010.

For years, it's been my dream to be a full-time author. In late 2011 I decided to start actively pursuing that dream. Special People is one of the bigger projects I started up to help me achieve that goal. Special People is a web serial about people with unique and unusual powers and abilities. It’s superpower fiction with a fistful of twists. From a human cell phone to a man who can conjure bacon out of thin air, these are unique, interesting characters, special people with their own special problems…

 

What I'm Doing

I'm hoping to hire an artist and a letterer to create an 8-page, full-colour Special People comic based on my script. The comic will tell the story of the first special person Ian Innis recruits into his fledgling criminal community, from the perspective of that first recruit. The main character will be based on the man whose photo is featured in the Special People site banner:

I'd like to post the comic to the site at a rate of two pages per week during the month of July, 2012.

 

Why I'm Doing It

One of the hardest parts of starting up a new creative project online is building an initial audience, and comics are great for gathering in eyeballs. They're also really accessible and easy to share around. If I can get this comic made, it'll be a fantastic way to draw new people into the world of Special People.

In addition, the comic will establish a stronger visual identity for the franchise and make the "Special People experience" much more immersive and engaging.

On top of all that, having a comic on the site will pave the way for other creative projects in the Special People universe. I'd love to do more, longer comics, put together a series of videos with the help of my friends from Loading Ready Run, and of course keep churning out the fiction (and collecting it into novels and ebooks), but doing all of that will require both money and momentum. Seeing this comic successfully funded would definitely kickstart the rest of these projects!

 

Why You Should Get Involved: The Perks

What would a crowdfunding project be without awesome perks?

There are a bunch of cool ways you can play a direct role in how the comic takes shape. You could get your own face drawn into the comic, write a line of dialogue for one of the characters, commission a Special People short story based on a character you create, or even help create the comic's main character!

For full details on all of the available perks, check the list in the sidebar.

 

What's My Budget?

To make the comic happen the way I want it to, I've set myself a budget of $1000. Here's where the money will go.

 

Art: $100 per page x 8 pages = $800

Cover: $100

Lettering: $12 per page x 8 pages = $96

Total: $996


My friend Jon Lock, an independent comic writer from the UK, has helped me work out these numbers, and I'm hoping to use his contacts to hire an artist and letterer for the project. If his artist and letterer aren't available, I'll use DigitalWebbing.com to find and hire someone else.

If I don't reach my $1000 goal, I'll try to get the comic made using whatever budget I have available. That might mean doing it in black-and-white rather than colour or hiring a less experienced artist.

If I raise more than my goal, I'll put the extra money towards future Special People projects. For example, this might include

  • Video projects
  • A custom designed Special People website
  • Cool Special People merch
  • More comics

 

What You Can Do

There are lots of ways you can help, even if you can't afford to donate to the cause. Share the link to this project on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+, tell your friends. You could even email your grandma if she's a comic fan! IndieGoGo has built in "sharing" tools you can use to get the word out.

The more people know about the project, the better. Thanks!

Why I'm Doing It
One of the hardest parts of starting up a new creative project online is building an initial audience, and comics are great for gathering in eyeballs. They're also really accessible and easy to share around. If I can get this comic made, it'll be a fantastic way to draw new people into the world of Special People.
In addition, the comic will establish a stronger visual identity for the franchise and make the "Special People experience" much more immersive and engaging.
On top of all that, having a comic on the site will pave the way for other creative projects in the Special People universe. I'd love to do more, longer comics, put together a series of videos with the help of my friends from Loading Ready Run, and of course keep churning out the fiction (and collecting it into novels and ebooks), but doing all of that will require both money and momentum. Seeing this comic successfully funded would definitely kickstart the rest of these projects!
 
Why You Should Get Involved: The Perks
What would a crowdfunding project be without awesome perks?
There are a bunch of cool ways you can play a direct role in how the comic takes shape. You could get your own face drawn into the comic, write a line of dialogue for one of the characters, commission a Special People short story based on a character you create, or even help create the comic's main character!
For full details on all of the available perks, check the list in the sidebar.
 


What's My Budget?
To make the comic happen the way I want it to, I've set myself a budget of $1000. Here's where the money will go.
 
Art: $100 per page x 8 pages = $800
Cover: $100
Lettering: $12 per page x 8 pages = $96
Total: $996

My friend Jon Lock, an independent comic writer from the UK, has helped me work out these numbers, and I'm hoping to use his contacts to hire an artist and letterer for the project. If his artist and letterer aren't available, I'll use DigitalWebbing.com to find and hire someone else.
If I don't reach my $1000 goal, I'll try to get the comic made using whatever budget I have available. That might mean doing it in black-and-white rather than colour or hiring a less experienced artist.
If I raise more than my goal, I'll put the extra money towards future Special People projects. For example, this might include

Video projects
A custom designed Special People website
Cool Special People merch
More comics

 


What You Can Do
There are lots of ways you can help, even if you can't afford to donate to the cause. Share the link to this project on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+, tell your friends. You could even email your grandma if she's a comic fan! IndieGoGo has built in "sharing" tools you can use to get the word out.
The more people know about the project, the better. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

A dark comic retelling of the classic Biblical story of death and resurrection. After being unwillingly brought back from purgatory by Jesus, Lazarus becomes immortal.

Lazarus hates living in Biblical times, preferring the cold dark nothingness of purgatory to a world where pork is illegal. He tries to kill himself, but nothing works.

We follow Lazarus to the mid-1990s, where he lives in a dying steel town called Impasse,Pennsylvania. There, Lazarus accidentally discovers his ability to resurrect the dead. With the help of his metalhead roommate and the reanimated corpse of his favorite musician, Lazarus embarks on a mission to force heaven to notice him, so he can finally die. He does this by committing sin after sin, setting his sights on hypocritical religious figures, celebrity cults and anyone who gets in his way.

Each book will be 35-40 pages in black + white with color front and back covers. 

 

FUNDING 


We are trying to raise $3,600 to pay for books one and two of this ongoing graphic novel series. 


Book One is nearly finished, but the artists need to be paid and we need money for promotion and printing. This will total $1,800.

We hope to raise an additional $1,800 to pay for book two. If we reach or exceed our total goal of $3,600, everyone who has donated $10 or more will get a copy of book two in addition to their other incentives**

 

**(will ship early 2013)

ABOUT THE AUTHOR


I've written a few feature screenplays and short films. My first feature, Buck Run made it to the second round of finals in the 2011 Final Draft Big Break Screenwriting Competition. 

This is my first comic book, and I've found the experience very similar to writing for film. I have immensely enjoyed the opportunities for collaboration. Artist Ryan Gutierrez and Colorist Adam Cutrone have done a great job bringing my ideas to life. 

I hope you enjoy The Book of Lazarus. Thanks for reading and thanks for supporting independent comics!

-Dave Hauslein

story:
The Bare Bones:

So, what is this piratey nonsense all about?

Weaponry is a webcomic that uploads free of charge every Monday, found at http://www.otherworldscomics.com/OWC/ as well as on DeviantART and Smackjeeves. It is a Choose Your Own Adventure comic, and a yaoi (or boy's love) tale of adventure, lawlessness and competition on the high seas. The readers are encouraged to voice their two-pennies, debate potential directions the story could go and defend their choices for reactions and pairings based on the canon pages. Then, at the end of every chapter, I offer up three different scenarios - one for each of the three protagonists - and the readers get to choose how they would like the story to continue.

So who am I? My name is Astra Crompton. I'm a working stiff by day, yet by night I write and publish novels, illustrate comics, and do freelance art and craft work. Being able to support myself fully through my art is a dream I'm working hard to fulfill.

Our Chapter One Fundraiser was a success, surpassing our goals and printing a beautiful print volume! You can have a look at it here, as it is a great example of what to expect out of Chapter Two. Like the first chapter, the print version will contain all of the online pages of Chapter Two: A Pirate's Life for Me (36 pages), it will also contain a bonus comic (18 pages), information about the world, bonus illustrations, Crossbones prose vignettes, cast profiles and more!

Not only will your generous donations enable me to print the first run of 100 copies, it will also enable the infrastructure to solidify. How's that exactly? This amount pays for the supplies for the incentives (left overs becoming extra merch) like t-shirts, post cards, prints and other extras. It provides much-needed funding for minor advertising to encourage readership and hopefully increase support for this relatively new comic (by ads on Smackjeeves and Y!Gallery), it also enables the website and Big Cartel sites to continue running smoothly so that everyone can enjoy this story for free.

Weaponry has received glowing compliments from its current readership for its realistic characters, rich colours, compelling writing and delicious character designs. If you already read Weaponry - I thank you. It is your feedback and encouragement that keeps my passion for this project running so high. If you have not yet read the tale, I entreat you to take a moment to read the first chapter and see what it is I'm trying to accomplish first hand. This initial step will set the stage for all the storytelling to come - and I'd love for you to be a part of it!

Your Gold for Me Bounty

Where does the money go?

$2000 is a modest request for a print endeavour, but every dollar is put to work. It enables:

~100 copies to be printed (including shipping from the printer to myself, import and customs duties, and basic shipping costs to send them on to you - if you are in North America)

~The cost of 1 to 2 advertisments on similar webcomics' sites (I'm looking into SmackJeeves and Y!Gallery next)

~The cost for 1 year of web hosting (both my url and web hoster, Big Cartel store website, and Smackjeeves donator account) to increase options and space so that I can offer bigger page display and more goods to you, the reader.

~The cost of the Incentives and merchandise that I hope to offer in the shop and at conventions. (This includes colour prints, t-shirts, post cards, key-chains, the art supplies for unique art and paintings, and one of a kind crafts like plushies and cosplay pieces) plus the cost of using IndieGoGo to facilitate the fundraising.

And for thy generosity ye shall be rewarded!

I've put together some really fun perks for funding this project! Please note that SOME PERKS HAVE OPTIONS! I wanted to offer a choice for those of you who missed out on the first chapter and might want a full bundle! Please read the descriptions of your perk levels so you can pick the best option for you and your budget!  Of course, you can always donate an amount to your own specification, and you can also upgrade your bundle at any time by adding to your donation. Just send me a note or post a comment to let me know what level you want to upgrade to!

Obviously, since I'm the sole creator of this comic, I'm also the only one filling the orders (including drawing the unique art and making your craft prizes) so please have patience as I fill all your orders. I'm looking forward to getting to know you during this fundraiser and will try my best to draw you your favourite characters for incentives and on the livestreams while the fundraiser is happening.

Despite the fact that the goal is on the barebones end of the comic funding spectrum, I understand that thus far, Weaponry's reach is small. I know that many of you are much in the same boat as I am, and your boundless love for my comic does nothing to line your pockets. It is a very real possibility that I will not be able to raise the needed funds. If not, cuts will need to be made - the advertising & website fees will be the first to be culled, as much as doing so will hamstring the future of the comic. I will use every raised dollar to ensure all of the incentives are fullfilled, even if it means I need to continue to raise the funds needed to do so, on my own afterwards.

Conversely, if, by some miracle of the Pastafarian Angels, we EXCEED the targeted goal - my solemn pledge is that every extra dollar will go to buying more copies of the comic to take around to conventions and sell on the online shop. The revenue from their sales will hopefully fuel the other costs this comic incrues to keep it going for Chapter Two and beyond. I'll also be offering bonus art to everyone who has pledged in the form of exclusive wallpapers, gift art, and anything else I can manage to illustrate my overwhelming joy.

Long-Sighted Views

Weaponry began in July of 2011. I had no idea if people would enjoy the story, or my art, but in my close circle, it got such a positive response that I wanted to share it. Since then, its readership has constantly surprised and impressed me with their insightful views, varied opinions and diligent support.
It is for that reason above all others that I have not yet missed an update. My dedication to see this project through is iron-clad, with the willing sacrifice of sleep and other personal projects to ensure the updates go up on time with consistent quality. I treat the comic as a dream job - because I wish that someday it could be my official line of work.
Keeping the audience involved in directing the story prevents me from getting carried away - from planning too far ahead and developing machiavellian plots that I could never possibly execute in my lifetime. We are fuel to each others' fires, and every new reader only builds my enthusiasm.
 
With the increase of reader responses and the introduction of the forums, we have been building a wonderfully supportive, intelligent readership and I feel very blessed to have you all on board. Thank you for all of your brilliant ideas, wonderful fan art and stunning insight into plot directions. I look forward to working with you as this adventure continues!
 

Be on the Lookout!

There are many more ways you can help Weaponry become a success. Whether you are able to contribute your hard-earned treasure to the chest or not, I would wholly appreciate your assistance with the following:

~ Spread the word! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Y!Gallery, DeviantART, Smackjeeves, messageboards, classrooms, chatrooms, forums, blackboards, emails, quill and ink!! Any method at your disposal to share your love and support of Weaponry is the best gift I could receive. Word of mouth advertising is the least expensive yet most effective method out there. If you know anyone you think might like Weaponry - please, encourage them to read the comic, tell them about the fundraiser. This is not only a chance to get Chapter One to print, it's a chance to spread the love of the comic itself.

~ IndieGoGo has a number of helpful tools to make it easy to share this fundraiser at the mere click of a button! You can also embed the Livestream video into any html supporting website or forum you use.

~ I welcome banner exchanges with other webcomics (yaoi or otherwise); I adore fanart (it shares the characters in an accessible fashion and looks great on the website - plus it's a free plug for you!).

~ Keep it fresh! By all of you helping to share all of this, the chances of a wider audience being reached expand exponentially! With your help, we can get this comic its Sea Legs, and the Print Edition will be merely the start of our grande adventure!

 

Thank you all for all your support thus far. It means the Seven Seas to me!

story:
Our Story

Two ambitious girls from different parts of the world, A Texan and a Jew, on a mission:  to build their film production company and be as successful as Steven Spielberg.  A side slitting comedy starring Annabelle Gutman and Johanna Rae.

The Impact

The film demonstrates the steps in creating a business, overcoming obstacles and achieving your dreams.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise capital to complete the film.  Contributors will receive DVDs of the finished project, special thanks credits, contributors of $1,000 or more will receive Executive Producer credits if they wish.

All contributors will be invited to the Red Carpet premiere in Hollywood.  Annabelle and Johanna will be greatly appreciative and grateful to all contributors.


Other Ways You Can Help

Promoting our project by sending this link to different social networks such as FaceBook, MySpace, Twitter, have other friends/family promote as well, word of mouth promotion.
